Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Focused fruit flavors and great structure make this wine delicious and well balanced. It shows ample blackberry, strawberry and light wood-smoke aromas, lush plum, berry and black-pepper flavors and a rich texture supported by firm tannins.
Name: Renwood 2016 Zanini Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Almost bursting with fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine oozes blackberries, blueberries and bittersweet chocolate. A smooth luxurious texture coats the palate, helped by moderate tannins.
Name: Renwood 2016 Special Reserve Grandpère Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Toasty salt-and-pepper aromas precede meaty, gutsy, wild berry and prosciutto flavors in this authentic tasting wine from a vineyard first planted in the 1860s. It is full bodied, moderately tannic, has supportive acidity and a lip-smacking finish.
Name: Noceto 2014 Original Grandpére Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of mint and vanilla in this creamy-textured full-bodied wine are followed by rich fruit and baking-spice flavors and layers of berries, cream and mocha that meld with a smooth mouthfeel.
Name: Renwood 2016 Grand Wren Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich aromas and warm ripe mulled-fruit flavors meet moderate tannins and full body in this big winning wine. It has more structure than usual for the varietal and will pair well with a roast or braise.
Name: Renwood 2016 Jack Rabbit Flat Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Intense ripe fruit flavors meet spicy smoky complexity in this full-bodied, concentrated and well-structured wine. It has a deep blueberry and blackberry core surrounded by hints of black pepper, baking spices and wood smoke that keep it interesting from the first whiff to the lingering finish.
Name: Renwood 2016 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dry wine is fruity, ripe and authentic, as rich strawberry and blackberry flavors flood the palate and peppery, chocolaty accents kick in. It is full bodied but barely tannic, smooth in texture and soft on the finish.
Name: Renwood 2016 Indian Creek Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a powerful, eminently flavorful wine that's dry, full bodied and well structured. It has resounding black-cherry and blackberry flavors, good acidity, firm tannins and a mouthcoating texture.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Estate Reserve Jewel Collection Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a grand wine, showing very concentrated fruit flavors and a firm structure. Deep blackberry, red cherry, clove and cedar fill the aroma and equally vivid flavors coat the palate.
Name: Renwood 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine tastes meaty and feels grippy, as it goes from black-pepper and black-plum aromas to ripe black-cherry flavors shaded by beefy spicy nuances. Moderate tannins bring a welcome grip to the mouthfeel and call for an equally meaty food pairing.
Name: Renwood 2016 Riker Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well balanced and snappy in the mouth, this wine has plenty of fruit flavors offset by grippy tannins and a touch of acidity. It coats the palate nicely buy keeps the taste buds fresh for another bite.
Name: Renwood 2016 Sea of Grapes Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This sleek but powerful wine offers a nose of black cherries and dark chocolate. The rich palate brings pure berry flavors that linger on the luscious finish. Overall, it has a deep saturated color, fragrant aromas and generous fruit flavors.
Name: Zinderella 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a big, bold but well-mannered wine that coats the tongue with rich flavors of plums and berries. Dark chocolate marks the midpalate, while more dark fruit echos on the finish. It is full bodied, layered and deep, benefitting from moderate tannins to balance out its richness.
Name: Counter Punch 2016 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a bold, dry wine that smells like black pepper and turned earth, tastes fruity but not overripe and has a nice firm structure of moderate tannins and fruit acidity. It's great to find a full-bodied Zin with this appealing sense of balance.
Name: Grady Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine from a unique little appellation has a wonderful, concentrated fruit character that light oak spices accentuate, while a lightly tannic texture helps the mouthfeel. It has great balance and a long lingering finish.
Name: Renwood 2016 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big and brawny but well balanced, this full-bodied wine is a blend of selected lots. It combines roasted, meaty aromas with ripe blueberry, chocolate and black-pepper flavors. A firm structure gives it good heft on the palate, too.
Name: Starr 2014 Phil's Selection Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big and balanced, this full-bodied wine from possibly the oldest Zinfandel vineyard in California blends tasty berry aromas with rich and spicy fruit flavors, moderate tannins and a good mouthfilling texture. It was fermented in a concrete egg-shaped container and aged in 10% new French oak.
Name: Andis 2015 Original Grandpére Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Showing the more elegant side of the grape, this is floral and delicate on the nose, with a core of red plum and forest berry aromas. While the palate is light in profile, there's wonderful tension to the acidity and structure to the tannins, building a frame for the crushed cherry and plum flavors. Pressed violet and delicate, peppery spice linger on the finish.
Name: Coppi 2015 Senatore Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This is a vibrant Primitivo that sees time in glass-lined cement tanks, highlighting the delightfully fresh profile of the grape. Bright red berries, mentholated herbs, violets and spice frame the nose and palate, while zesty acidity and a firm grip of fine-grained tannins give it support.
Name: Rivera 2016 Triusco  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Integrated aromas of dark cherry coulis, blackberry, cracked pepper and violet carry the nose. Flavors of fleshy thick-skinned berries meet a slick of tangy granite on the palate, with juicy acidity and pulverized yet enveloping tannins propping it up.
Name: Vespa 2016 Il Rosso dei Vespa  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A dense nose of black cherry coulis and plum meets highlights of earth and violet. There's good energy to the palate, with ripe, juicy plum and blackberry flavors propelled along a tangy current of crushed stone. There's a firm hug of tannins from start to finish.
Name: Feudo Croce 2016 Imperio LXXIV  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This supple medium-bodied offering from an international brand is a terrific value. It supports pure ripe fruit flavors on a velvety texture of light tannins and mild acidity. It tastes focused, feels balanced and leaves you wanting another sip.
Name: Rubus 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, containing 15% Merlot, is unapologetically oaky, but the oakiness is well integrated with ripe berry and black-cherry flavors. It starts with aromas of cedar, pencil shavings and toast, segues to spicy, almost floral flavors and an oak-spice accent lingers on the finish.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Peacock Patch Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This massive style of Primitivo offers dense black plum and blackberry on the nose, with shades of baking spice and violet. There's a rich density of thick-skinned black fruit on the full-bodied palate, propped up by shots of tart cranberry and bracing tannins. Drink from 2023.
Name: Gianfranco Fino 2016 Es Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: High-toned aromas of spiced raspberry and cherry mingle with a mix of mentholated herbs and violets. The medium-bodied palate is smooth and velvety in feel, supported by tangy acidity and luscious red berry and plum flavors that extend to the lingering, savory finish.
Name: Amastuola 2012 Centosassi Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit-forward aromas pop, with notes of raspberry jam, cranberry, herb and mint. Sweet, ripe, full-bodied fruit flavors follow and lead to a warm finish. It's a cold weather warmer if ever there was one and a lot of wine for the money.
Name: City Limits 2016 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This is a bright, enjoyable wine that displays lots of racy raspberry and strawberry tones on the nose and palate, with a shading of sweet barrel spice in the background. It's firmly medium in weight, with soft tannins and firm acidity that help extend a tangy mineral core. Drink now.
Name: Coppi 2015 Don Antonio Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a fun, fruity wine with all the exuberant qualities of the varietal. Fresh raspberry and red-cherry aromas lead to ripe, almost jammy raspberry and blackberry flavors while full body and a just-slightly grippy texture add to the mouthfeel.
Name: Renwood 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A bright nose of red cherry and plum is met with a coating of baking spice and game. This is a light, zesty style of the grape with juicy red fruit flavors that are enveloped in a sheen of sweet spice. Drink now.
Name: Schola Sarmenti 2016 Critèra Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-throttle wine has a deep dark color, heady oak, smoke and cedar aromas, extra-ripe fruit flavors and a full body. It has just enough tannin for a little grip and to focus the generous black-fruit flavors.
Designation: Naci Ocevi Black Label Nasi Ocevi Vineyard
Name: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Naci Ocevi Black Label Nasi Ocevi Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a big and well-made Zinfandel, good for those who love the unabashedly ripe yet not cloying style. Aromas of smoked strawberry, red currant and cranberry syrup lead into a palate that is plush with strawberry sorbet and chalky tannins.
Name: Opolo 2017 Mountain Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fruity, ripe and soft, this wine is chock-full of expressive, jammy, berry and plum flavors, has mild tannins and low acidity. It feels easy and soothing on the palate.
Name: Renwood 2016 Special Reserve Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is quite focused on the loamy soil aspects, but there is also a fruity touch of black cherry. The tannins are well polished on the palate, allowing the black-plum, nutmeg and clove flavors to take center stage.
Name: Sextant 2016 Wheelhouse Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, ripe and spicy wine shows plenty of blackberry and black pepper in the aromas and flavors, while filling the mouth with a broad, soft texture.
Name: Andis 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Zesty aromas of spicy red berries and plums mix with gentle pink peppercorn and Mediterranean herbs on the nose. There's a pleasing richness to the thick-skinned berry flavors on the palate, yet tangy granite, slicks of acidity and bracing tannins offer a fine counterbalance.
Name: Botromagno 2016 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fire-roasted strawberries, hickory, soft clove and baking-spice aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The smoky aspects carry to the juicy and ripe palate, where roasted cherries and berries are spiced by vanilla and framed with noticeable tannins.
Name: Opolo 2017 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a good amount of fruit to this wine, but accents of spice and herb bringing a pleasing balance. It's juicy in feel but well textured, with proper tannins offering support while a tangy mineral vein cleans it all up.
Name: Rivera 2017 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Dried-fruit aromas and rich sweet-seeming fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine an almost syrupy character, while very soft acidity and low tannins contribute to the wine's unctuous style.
Name: Vezer Family Vineyard 2014 Zinfandel (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This red wine has the classic wild berry and briar character of the varietal, along with a veneer of baking spices and cream that sweetens its flavors. It is full bodied, light in tannins and soft in terms of acidity.
Name: Cosentino 2017 Cigar Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Ripe aromas of raspberry and blackberry are dotted with black pepper and violet on the nose of this accessible red. There's a solid feel to the medium-bodied palate, with a thick-skinned berry flavor that meets more spice and earth tones. Sandy tannins offer support while racy acidity maintains verve.
Name: Vespa 2017 Il Bruno dei Vespa Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a good, approachable, weekday wine that offers plenty of fresh raspberry and blackberry flavors, a full body but a rather soft tannic texture.
Name: Andis 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Medium-ruby in color with an opaque core, this wine is reticent in aromas of thick-skinned black berries, rubber and baking spice. The medium-bodied palate offers honed acidity and pulverized tannins that give support to ripe, bouncy flavors of blackberry and dark cherry. Vanilla marks the short finish.
Name: Masso Antico 2015 Da Uve Leggermente Appassito Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of strawberry and black plum trend toward syrup but are lifted with purple-flower aromas. The violet-like palate is pleasant but really thick and nearly sweet.
Name: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has a flinty, earthy aroma, spicy woody flavors and a hint of black pepper. Juicy raspberry and blackberry flavors reside at the core.
Name: McManis 2017 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This organic Primitivo offers a spice-driven nose of sweet tobacco leaf and peppercorn, with enticing berry scents at the core. It's light and zesty in feel, with loads of tart berry flavors on the palate and a tangy mineral vein. Drink now for immediate enjoyment.
Name: Amastuola 2015 Organic Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a good grippy wine that's moderate in fruit flavor, medium to full bodied and has a lightly tannic mouthfeel. With plum, raspberry and sweet-oak aromas and flavors it's nicely rich on the palate.
Name: Renwood 2016 BBQ Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry and roasted aromas of hickory and cherry wood show on the nose of this bottling. It's quite juicy and ripe on the jammy palate, but there is strong spice to level the fruit.
Name: Twisted Paso 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A strong oak perfume leads to intensely floral, oaky flavors and a core of fruit-concentrate in this full-bodied wine. It is flashy, extroverted and spicy.
Name: Cline 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This ripe and oaky wine starts with plummy, sweet and spicy aromas, then floods the palate with ripe flavors of dried plums and sweet cherries. It is full bodied but soft in texture.
Name: Ironstone 2016 Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Broad aromas of raspberry and cranberry meld with floral highlights in this approachable Primitivo. It's light in feel, with a juicy texture and fruity nature that makes this easy to like. Chalky tannins and tangy acidity offer good balance to all that fruit.
Name: Poggio Anima 2017 Lilith Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's an opaque, inky core to this wine that starts off with jammy plum and raspberry aromas, mixing with a sheen of iodine and spice. Initially, it's thick in feel on the palate, with flavors of prune, raisin and dried leaves, yet superracy acidity and bracing tannins roll across to clean it up.
Name: Gianfranco Fino 2016 Se Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Showing a bit of age on the nose, this wine offers a condensed aroma of blackberry paste, anise and game. Medium-grained tannins and tangy acidity frame a dried berry flavor, with a gamy spice note pervading through the finish.
Name: Vespa 2015 Raccontami  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: An aroma of smoked meat leads to very ripe, almost-sweet fruit flavors and plenty of oaky cedary cinnamony elements that give it a syrupy impression.
Name: Rombauer 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of condensed strawberry jam, prune and dried leaves lead to the medium- to full-bodied palate. It's ripe and thick in feel, with desperate shots of acidity alongside finely grained but copious tannins.
Name: Madia 2012 Eleghènze Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine has a touch of matchstick on first whiff, and brings a combo of fruit, spice and flint aromas followed by straightforward fruit and light oak notes. Medium body and light tannins complete the picture.
Name: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Fairly ripe and extracted aromas of blackberry jam, caramel sauce and coffee syrup show on the nose of this bottling. It is superripe and jammy and cooked on the palate, which is thick, extracted and fairly tannic.
Name: Paris Valley Road 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas and flavors of orange peel, herbs and crushed blackberry meld with a leafy undertone in this wine. There's a thick feel to the palate, with tannins that build from start to finish.
Name: Forte Incanto 2017 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of grilled berries, charred meat and a splash of orange zest mark this ripe wine. The medium-bodied palate offers a thick blackberry flavor marked by dried leaves and orange, with disparate shots of zesty acidity and a medium tannic grip.
Name: Apollonio 2013 Terragnolo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Odd aromas of salt and potato chips meld with a ripe berry core. A flavor of thick black-cherry skins has a tart and tannic edge on the palate, giving this a rather harsh profile.
Name: Madia 2013 Femìgghje Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of stewed berries and canned green beans makes for an odd start. This is taut and gripping in feel, with more stewed fruit flavors on the palate that are supported by a mild vein of acidity and rustic tannins.
Name: Amastuola 2015 Lamarossa Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This mature-tasting, high-alcohol wine has a relatively light color with a brownish rim, aromas that are earthy and dusty, and woody earthy flavors without much fruit coming through.
Name: Blue Fox Cellars 2013 Old Vine Bartolomei Brothers Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A decent concentration of raspberry jam, stewed herbs and orange zest forms the nose. This is soft and supple on the palate, with little acidity and tannin to offer support to the jammy red-fruit flavor. A slight char and bitter tannic edge mark the finish.
Name: Cantina Ariano 2016 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sourced from the region's most historic vineyard, this wine starts with aromas of racy boysenberry, exotic black plum and wood smoke. The palate combines flavors of smoke, snappy berries and red currants with a floral aspect.
Name: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a brawny, lushly made wine, rich in dark cherry and blackberry fruit. Lengthy and structured in nature, it takes on broader notes of milk chocolate, vanilla and nutmeg as it evolves on the finish.
Name: Kennedy Family 2014 Vite Centanni Vineyard Estate Grown Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of cranberry, candied strawberry and dried herbs make for a pleasant and interesting nose on this bottling. The palate combines cinnamon and sumac with red plums and more strawberries, going down much with much less drama than the dark espionage-themed label implies.
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Defector Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe and candied strawberry aromas meet with nutmeg on the delicious nose of this bottling. There is a strong acidic tang to the palate, where macerated strawberry flavors feel quite fresh and young. It goes down easy.
Name: McClean 2015 Simone Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted wood, light red fruit and leather aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Leathery tannins frame the sip, where the dark red fruit meets with smoky flavors.
Name: Crū 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry jam aromas are at the fore, followed by notes of spice, ash and cherry. Light, tart, plump-feeling jammy fruit flavors follow. It brings appeal.
Name: Casa Smith 2016 Porcospino Northridge Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Caramel, chocolate and violet paste make for a very ripe aroma set on the nose of this bottling. It's thick on the palate, with heavy blackberry and fudge flavors, framed by firm tannins.
Name: Seven Angels 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extracted aromas of blackberries are both tangy and ripe on the nose of this bottling. There is a balsamic edge to the palate, where tart red fruits dominate.
Name: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Brown Eyed Girl Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant black cherry, star anise and mace make for a fresh but spicy nose on this single-vineyard expression in a new Zinfandel project by the Kathryn Hall wine family. Luscious flavors of blackberry sorbet are wrapped in an earthy structure, with layers of rosemary and roasted beef arising through the sip. The acid-washed finished is laced with pepper.
Name: Baca 2016 Double Dutch Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is complex, concentrated and deep, like an old-vine wine should be. It shows whiffs of dried earth, sage and black pepper in the aroma and hearty flavors that range from savory herbs to potent blackberry and clove. It is full bodied, dry, firmly tannic and has a long lingering finish.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling relies heavily on dry-farmed bush vines planted in 1880, and their unique impact is on full display. Tightly wound blackberry aromas combine with tobacco leaf, loamy soil and dried meat on the nose. Elderflower and elderberry flavors show on the sip, which is firm with chalky tannins, bright with acid and elegantly layered. Drink now–2025.
Name: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An exciting focus helps this wine stand out. It is full bodied, dry and well-concentrated, offering fresh black-cherry and cedar aromas, deep fruit flavors accented by light smoky peppery spices and a nicely firm texture that is moderately tannic. The complexity is partly due to 15% Petite Sirah in the blend, and aging in 35% new American and French oak barrels.
Name: Three 2016 Evangelho Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This deep and concentrated wine seems to have a story to tell. Hints of rosemary and clove accent dark black-cherry and raspberry flavors that layer through the rich texture and seem to accelerate on the finish. It's an unusually expressive and complex Zinfandel that was aged in 37% new French and American barrels, and contains 14% Petite Sirah plus smaller amounts of Carignan and Alicante.
Name: Three 2016 Bigelow Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine tastes alive and fresh, showing an abundance of fruit flavors, fine concentration and very good balance. Strawberry and raspberry notes are supported by deeper blackberry flavors, moderate tannins and good acidity for a grippy mouthfeel.
Name: Bella 2016 Lily Hill Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine from a Zin specialist has soul and spices, combining ripe and rich berry flavors with attractive hints of sage and black pepper. It is full bodied, smooth and lush in texture and offers just a touch of tannin for good structure.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Indian Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is unusually on-point for the varietal and tastes terrific. The cherry and blackberry flavors are nicely focused and the wine has great structure from moderate tannins and good fruit acidity.
Designation: Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bold and spicy, this high-octane wine starts with salt and pepper aromas, and delivers intense black-pepper and black-cherry flavors on a firm palate bolstered by fine-grained tannins. Winemaker Matt Cline included 11% Petite Sirah, 9% Carignan and 2% Black Malvoisie in the blend.
Name: Three 2016 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Extraordinarily deep and resonant in a black fruit flavor, this is a full-bodied wine that has great focus and a moderate layer of tannins to offer grip. Black berry, plum and cherry flavors all contribute to the palate and keep reverberating on the finish.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lots of rocky earth and chaparral scrub aromas meet with mellow black-plum and strawberry fruit on the rustic yet refined nose of this blend of two vineyards. The palate combines peppercorn, elderberry and more dried earth.
Name: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Dos Ranchos Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though predominantly Zinfandel, this field blend from a vineyard planted in 1984 by Dick Sias also includes Primitivo, Aleatico, Alicante Bouschet, Carignan, Grenache and Petite Sirah, and is a great taste of the past. Blackberry, thyme and dried mint aromas drop into a palate of black plum, loamy soil, dried herbs and cocoa. This is full bodied and well layered.
Name: Joullian 2014 Sias Cuvée Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This twist-top blend of various vineyards is an affordable and excellent way to get a taste of what this historic winery is up to. Aromas of black raspberry, turned loam and savory dried meats lead into a tense palate that bursts with berry and is layered with black rock minerality.
Name: Saucelito Canyon 2016 Backroads Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated red-cherry aromas meet with caramel, baking spice and vanilla brioche on the nose of this bottling. Ripe red-fruit flavors are lifted by red licorice and more caramel on the palate, which rides through chunky tannins and finishes on vanilla.
Name: Wilson Creek 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied elevated-alcohol wine offers an enticing salt and pepper aroma followed by meaty wood-smoke accents that complement the underlying blackberry flavors. It matches the grapey fruitiness of the wine with oak accents and a just-firm enough texture.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Big Wood Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The fresh, snappy fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine are almost irrestible. It shows the charming, light and quaffable aspects of the grape that make it a good lunch wine or pre-dinner glass.
Name: The Federalist 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has a concentrated berry and cherry essence that makes it easy to sip and enjoy. A touch of raspberry in the aroma and a hint of baking spices on the palate make it all the more tasty.
Name: Three 2016 Old Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gobs of fruit flavor and a rich, rounded texture make this wine fun to taste and easy to enjoy. It practically oozes blackberry and black cherry flavors, and is supported by mild tannins and a velvety mouthfeel.
Name: Sobon Estate 2016 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine features plummy raisiny aromas and fresh grapey flavors on a smooth, almost soft texture. It's easy to sip and enjoy on its own due to low tannins.
Name: Vino Noceto 2014 OGP Original Grandpere Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is delicious in terms of late-harvested fruit flavors like boysenberry jam and raspberry syrup. It has full body, mild tannins and a mouthcoating texture.
Name: Binz 2015 Fox Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is very fruity and also well-structured, offering generous raspberry and blackberry flavors backed by moderate tannins and good acidity. It's well balanced and appetizing to taste.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Estate Primitivo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripe and lush, this full-bodied wine practically oozes raspberry and sweet cherry flavors. The texture is very smooth and polished too.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2016 Zinfandel (Yolo County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This spicy oaky wine is not quite sweet, but is packed full of strawberry jam, maple syrup and Maraschino cherry flavors that give it an exuberant, fruity personality. It has good fruit acidity and light tannins to add some textural counterpoint to the jamminess.
Name: Precision Wine 2016 Navigator Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: A slight earthy, dusty accent accompanies ripe, raisiny, plummy flavors in this soft-textured and full-bodied wine. It's big, smooth and mouth filling.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2016 Zinfandel (High Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is overtly oaky in aroma and flavor and quite tannic to boot. Yet it has a sense of concentration and creaminess on the midpalate that redeems it for those who like their Zins brawny.
Name: Sebastiani 2016 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This fresh and jammy-tasting wine shows generous red-cherry and strawberry flavors and a soft, non-tannic texture. It's relatively light in mouthfeel, but technically full bodied considering its ripeness.
Name: Precision Wine 2016 The Xtrovert Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe, vaguely plummy and full bodied, this wine tastes rich and feels soft, almost syrupy, on the tongue. It has light tannins and elevated alcohol, which combine for a fat mouthfeel and finish.
Name: Kreck 2016 Del Barba Old Vine Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a good middle-of-the-road wine, with fairly rich fruit flavors and a pleasant broad texture. Mild plum and strawberry notes and soft tannins add to the wine's mellow appeal.
Name: Bookshelf 2016 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Full bodied and jammy tasting, this wine also has a layer of astringency—possibly from the bourbon barrels—so it comes off more dry and puckery than many others. Raspberry and red cherry combine with floral and mineral accents.
Name: The Federalist 2016 Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: The bourbon barrel-aged trend is a weird twist in fine wine circles, and this boozy bottling won't convince many connoisseurs otherwise. Sour black-plum and burned caramel aromas lead into a slightly sweet palate with ripe red fruit and vanilla spice throughout.
Name: Wilson Creek 2016 Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This jammy-tasting wine is very ripe, very smooth, full bodied and almost syrupy in texture. It tastes pruney and raisiny and leaves a sweet impression on the finish.
Name: Crush 8 2017 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine boasts jammy aromas, seemingly sweet flavors of strawberry and red cherry and a rather soft, lazy texture.
Name: Criss Cross 2016 Old Vine Estate Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An earthy meaty element goes along with very ripe grapey raisiny fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine. It is ripe enough to seem slightly sweet and sugary, and has light tannins for a smooth texture.
Name: Riaza 2015 Standard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Savory beef-broth aromas and flavors give this otherwise fat and plummy wine a little edge, while full body and mild tannins make the mouthfeel broad and fairly soft.
Name: Sobon Estate 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A rather sharp raw-oak character pervades the aromas and flavors of this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. The structure and the grip are positives, but underlying berry flavors have a hard time competing with the oakiness.
Name: Sobon Estate 2016 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rose hip, cranberry, vanilla and dried cherry aromas lead to straight down the fairway dried cranberry flavors. It seems a bit nondescript, and the variety is hard to find.
Name: Maragas 2015 Legal Zin Zinfandel (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has an oaky, sweet-pickle aroma, woody flavors that come off as sweet and spicy, and very full body. Underneath all that oak are good black-cherry and blackberry flavors that some will enjoy.
Name: Binz 2015 BinZin Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Strong oaky aromas and flavors practically smother the fruit component in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It smells like cedar and fresh-sawn oak, tastes smoky and peppery and has a firm, drying texture.
Name: Manifesto! 2015 100% Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Generous aromas of wild berry, sage and spice shine through in this fruity, bold and well-balanced wine that was fermented with native yeast. The palate offers tangy raspberry and sour-cherry flavors, firm tannins, lively acidity and, most importantly, an appetizing character that keeps you coming back for more.
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 The Native Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is one of the rare Zinfandels that needs time in the cellar to reach its most enjoyable stage. The concentration and depth of fruit is apparent, but it's currently wound up with tight tannins and bright acidity, needing time to unravel its complexities. Best after 2022.
Name: Bella 2015 Rocks Edge Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is blended from some of the best barrels that the winery made in 2015 from various parts of Sonoma. Gorgeous, plump blackberry aromas meet palate-drenching berry and black-cherry flavors in this dramatically concentrated but smooth-textured wine. It has a great sense of depth and focus due to the perfectly ripened fruit, while staying supple and composed. Best through 2025.
Name: Bella 2015 Barrel 32 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from a mountainous site, this wine is brimming in mineral aspects of volcanic ash and crushed rock. Tangy and expansive on the palate, it offers persistent tones of flowers, ginger and lavender that accent rich baked plum. Enjoy 2021–2031.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hardly a run-of-the-mill wine, this potent liquid exudes tobacco and flint aromas that join with wood smoke, cocoa and blackberry flavors to make it dramatic and spicy. Full body and firm tannins build great structure to pair with indulgent proteins and give it the stuffing to age. Best from 2022.
Name: Easton 2015 Rinaldi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine made in magnums only, this is the owner and winemaker's amusing ode to his own position within his large family, choosing winemaking over grape growing, the choice of all his brothers. It is brightly layered and brooding in berry and spice, with lovely soft grooves of cinnamon, nutmeg and black pepper. The tannins are polished and supportive.
Name: Rockpile 2016 Black Sheep Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a deep, rich and mouth-filling wine from the heart of Zinfandel country in Amador County. It offers an abundance of ripe berries, black pepper and hints of oak spices. It's full bodied, creamy in texture, layered with black fruits and has a soothing, moderately tannic texture. Best through 2024.
Name: Easton 2015 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brambly aromas and wild berry flavors give this wine a classic profile, while a full body and moderate tannins help firm up the texture. Hints of olive and sage offer added complexity.
Name: Bella 2015 Maple Vineyards Annie's Block Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a sloping hillside at 1,000-feet in elevation, this is a beautiful vineyard-designate and ambassador for the variety: shy in fruit at first, which only allows its floral, earthy aspects of ash and rock to shine. Black pepper and leather boost an array of tangy cherry, raspberry and plum that remains tart and fresh.
Name: Joseph Jewell 2015 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With an addition of 5% Petite Sirah, this wine is brooding in a berry fruit tone that mingles with brown sugar, baking spice and coffee. Lifted acidity does a good job reining in the fundamental power and concentration at its core.
Name: Rockpile 2016 Rockpile Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Estate grown, this is a signature wine for the producer. It is named for Biale's father and made from vines planted decades ago. Tangy red fruit, plum and citrus complement a rich and tannic midpalate of powerful density and complexity, seasoned in dried flowers.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Aldo's Vineyard Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big wine is so full of jammy fruit flavors and laced with such firm tannins that it's almost chewy. It has bold ripe fruit aromas like blackberries, rich and concentrated fruit flavors that are deep and focused, and a great structure of tannins and good acidity that make it lip-smacking to taste.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Merill Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From old vines in the heart of the Sonoma Valley, this is an earthy, savory and impeccably structured wine. Lavender, rose and cedar all play a role in contributing complexity and depth to this beautiful wine.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Beautifully inviting in aromas of baked bread and cherry-berry fruitiness, this is a well-integrated, soft and rich wine that delivers plenty of vibrant flavor and complexity. A note of charred oak provides complexity on the finish.
Name: Baca 2016 Tug O' War Maffei Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smooth and supple all the way through, this concentrated and powerful wine nevertheless has great layers of ripe fruit and velvety tannins. Grown at 2,000-feet in elevation, it has black cherry and blackberry that blend with hints of black pepper and toasted oak as the flavors roll across and linger on the palate.
Name: Easton 2015 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A velvety texture based on a wealth of fine-grained tannins sets this high-octane wine apart. That structure supports good ripe fruit flavors and lots of spicy oak accents so the wine is layered and long on the finish.
Designation: Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Old Vine
Name: Jessie's Grove 2014 Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense aromas of black fruit, savory meats and dried flowers provide a complex entry to the nose of this wine, which comes from vines planted in 1880. Buoyant acidity and ample structure uphold the palate, where bright flavors of blackberry and elderberry meet with mocha and anise.
Name: Saucelito Canyon 2015 1880 Old Vine Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is big but balanced as it delivers copious amounts of ripe fruit flavor, full body and tasty accents of black pepper and sage to convey that brambly brushy personality of Zin. Some of that spiciness can be attributed to aging for 20 months in 50% new oak barrels.
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Family Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made mostly from Oak Knoll District fruit, this perennial favorite offers rich tones of mocha, blackberry and cinnamon toast that are balanced by underlying acidity. It's a crowd-pleasing style that strikes a harmonious chord between fruit and structure.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Engaging and nicely oaky but also well structured, this full-bodied wine has dense layers of ripe fruity spicy flavors and almost chewy tannins. It is concentrated, deep and with a lengthy finish. Best after 2022.
Name: Steele 2015 Pacini Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pure, expressive fruit flavors and a supremely polished texture make this full-bodied wine a delight to drink. It practically oozes raspberry and blackberry aromas, and floods the palate with flavors of berries and peppery spice.
Name: Bella 2015 Florence Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a snappy, well-balanced and also concentrated wine that's compelling to drink. Engaging complexity in the aromas leads to equally intriguing and spicy flavors that are well supported by good acidity and firm tannins.
Name: Graziano 2014 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brambly blackberry flavors are seasoned with pungent aromas of cinnamon and nutmeg in this thick, rich and intensely ripe wine. Its power and concentration provide a lushness and roundly fruity approachability that doesn't hinder its lingering, textured complexity.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Rockpile Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a juicy, leathery and layered wine with hearty characteristics of grilled meat, blackberry and black cherry. Bold and full bodied, it retains supportive acidity and is integrated in tannin and oak, showing lasting notes of nutmeg and clove.
Name: Quivira 2016 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big, brawny waves of blackberry and mocha dot the landscape of this full-bodied wine that's tense in structure and thick in rich tannins. An earthy note of forest floor complements the bold fruit and gives depth to the wine.
Name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Century Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grainy, thick and concentrated, this wine offers structure amidst its big-boned richness and ripe flavor. Sizable tannins surround a core of brambly black fruit and toasted oak that lingers on the finish.
Name: Angry Bunch 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Great concentration helps this full-bodied wine stand out. It has intense and ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors, moderate tannins and good length on the finish.
Name: Viaggio 2014 Little Missy Estate Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripe fruit flavors, a firm texture and generous spicy oak make this full-bodied wine a winner. The color is deep and dark, while the bouquet emphasizes blackberry and blueberry aromas that segue to a palate of baking spices and concentrated berries.
Name: Old Ghost 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a heck of a value, well-made, well-integrated and structured. Baked bread and dark-cherry flavors are supported by thick tannin and complementary high-toned acidity, the finish a rich, rewarding end note of dark chocolate and coffee.
Name: Quivira 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This has both high-toned acidity and strong tannins, with corresponding flavors that contrast from cranberry and cherry to vanilla and fresh bread. Along the powerful midpalate are highlights of leather, dried herb and peppery oak.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Valsecchi Vineyard Zinfandel (Carneros)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smooth and creamy yet firm enough for good grip, this is a big but well-balanced wine that offers plenty of ripe berries and plums along with hints of black pepper and sage. Moderate tannins seem to build on the palate and add a good bite to the finish.
Name: Easton 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark cherry and blackberry flavors dominate in this thick, rich and concentrated wine, which is boldly ripe and round in style. Its intensity is additionally defined by strong characteristics of coffee and molasses.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Timber Crest Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine goes for extreme ripeness in the dense jammy saturated blackberry and black-plum flavors, has a broad smooth texture and full body. It's on the verge of sweetness, showing mild tannins and soft acidity, and is seductive for the purity and generosity of the fruit character.
Name: Navarro 2016 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly tart aromas of black fruit meet with turned earth, campfire and incense on the savory nose of this bottling from the Riboli family. Cooked black-currant and olive flavors combine with roasted beef and cocoa on the thick palate.
Name: Opaque 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick rounded richness is supported in pillowy tannin and brimming in brambly blueberry and blackberry. It broods and bristles in grippy texture and earthy elements of dried sage, lavender and crushed rock.
Name: Rockpile 2016 Cemetery Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tight tannins underscore a rocky dusty texture in this big-boned savory wine that is 100% varietal. Spice, leather and red fruit come together seamlessly basked in violet. It has plenty of power and concentration but leaves an elegant lasting impression.
Name: Rockpile 2016 Pritchett Peaks Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine captures a wild brambly character without being tricked up with new oak. Bolstered by 6% Petite Sirah, 3% Syrah and 2% Alicante, it shows raspberry and tea aromas, while the palate brings ample cherry and raspberry flavors and balanced tannins.
Name: Angry Bunch 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A dark color, concentrated flavors and firm tannins make this a deep and impressive wine. It has nicely ripe flavors like blackberries and black cherries, a grippy texture and very full body.
Name: Peltier 2016 Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: With a charred, meaty nose, this wine has a strong tannic profile and thickness of fruit, layering from blueberry to plum. It remains concentrated and thick on the palate through highlights of black pepper, cinnamon and clove.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy black fruit and big oak give this 100% varietal wine a notable opulence around deep layers of mocha, dark chocolate and nutmeg. It is full bodied but not overbearing, showing balanced lushness.
Name: Rockpile 2016 Jack's Cabin Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from estate-grown fruit, this offers notes of smoked oak and charcuterie on top of a soft, rounded expression of red fruit. The mellow tannins meld seamlessly with the flavors.
Name: Kunde 2015 Heritage Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is full bodied and well balanced, easy to enjoy for its wealth of fruit and spice flavors, and also appetizing due to good acidity and moderate tannins.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Goltz Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 11% Petite Sirah, this wine is soft, round and richly layered in strong flavors of baked plum and dark cherry. It balances its ripeness with nuanced aspects of toasted oak, firm tannin and moderate acidity.
Name: Frank Family 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has a high ripeness factor and also a solid structure of fruit acidity and moderate tannins to nicely support the jammy raspberry and blackberry flavors that are so tempting.
Name: Skinner 2015 Six Horse Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Extra-deep and ripe fruit flavors pack this full-bodied wine to bursting, from black cherries in the aroma to floral and grapey notes on the palate. It's full bodied and has moderate tannins for a nice grip in the mouth.
Name: Winery by the Creek 2015 Reserve Delfino Vineyards Primitivo (Fair Play)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very fruity, very ripe and very full bodied, this wine practically oozes a jammy berrylike character from the first whiff to the lingering finish. Dried fruits like fig and raisin dominate the flavors while a rich lush texture coats the tastebuds.
Name: Navarro 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Rich and round with a soft texture, this wine offers a pillowy tannin structure and a leathery backbone of savory flavor. Raspberry and vanilla stand out amidst toasted oak and hints of dusty crushed rock.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Ancient Vine Quaglia Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: High-toned red cherry highlights this soft, rounded and highly ripe wine, which is varietally correct and well representative of the appellation. Dense concentrated fruit is accented in cedar and clove.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 School House Creek Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling offers subtle aromas of red fruits and turned earth. There is decent tannic tension to the palate, where rounded red-fruit and herb flavors meet with an anise spice.
Name: Wilson Creek 2015 Promenance Vineyard Family Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a nicely dry, flavorful and firm-textured wine with a good layer of tannin for structure and moderately ripe berry and black-cherry flavors. The balance and mouthfeel are tailored for the table: this is not a cocktail or dessert wine as many seem to be.
Name: Portalupi 2016 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This non-oaky wine is somehow brawny and pretty at the same time. It offers wonderful cherry-like floral aromas and equally focused bright flavors, along with a definitely dry palate and full body.
Name: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Earthy and brimming in crisp red fruit, this is a floral, somewhat ethereal wine that's powerfully built in ripe plum and licorice that finishes in grippy tannin.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Founding Farmers Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Black olive, truffle and brown sugar underlie this opulently ripe wine, mild in structure and big in tannin. Cherry and berry flavor add to its lush voluptuous nature.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Ancient Vine Crow Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This is an intensely tannic wine from an historic site, richly layered in brown sugar, molasses and cinnamon. The bolder flavors are in contrast to herbal elements of black pepper, clove and cedar.
Name: Vermeil 2015 1908 Block Luvisi Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a generous and fruity wine with attractive black-pepper and wood-smoke accents that add complexity to the plummy, raspberry-like fruit qualities. It's full bodied but smooth and easy to sip.
Name: Angry Bunch 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a smooth relaxed wine that's easy to sip and enjoy without having to fight high alcohol or tight tannins. It has a relatively light color, plenty of plum and sour-cherry flavors and medium to full body.
Name: Easton 2017 Lot 1852 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an intensely jammy, rich, 100% varietal wine that's rich and thick with elements of barbecue, grilled meat and Italian deli. It finishes in vanilla oak and black pepper.
Name: Pedroncelli 2016 Bushnell Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy, soft, round and rich, this wine is fruit forward in blackberry and plum with an underlying hint of brown sugar. It finishes in black pepper and cinnamon.
Name: Kunde 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is tightly wound with plenty of tannic tension, a mountainous expression of menthol and turned earth seasoned in black pepper. Brambly blackberry flavor is accentuated by aspects of dark chocolate and coffee.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Black Sears Vineyard Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is 100% varietal and aged in both new French and American oak. Turned earth and grilled mushroom provide savory contrast to soft jammy layers of cinnamon, plum and blackberry.
Name: Gehricke 2014 Ponzo Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Somewhat delicate on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of kirsch and spice cake to start. It lands softly on the palate, with mouth-coating flavors of strawberry and sharp cinnamon, with a pinch of dried herbs.
Name: Kula 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy and herbal, this full-bodied wine offers a generous helping of tart acidity and wild flavors of brambly berry, red cherry and vanilla bean.
Name: Quivira 2016 Anderson Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe, rich and almost syrupy, this full-flavored wine has dried-fruit flavors like raisins and prunes, a soft broad mouthfeel and very full body.
Name: Wilson Foreigner 2017 Del Barba Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of plummy flavors and a spicy streak of black pepper and smoke running through it from the aroma to the finish. It's smooth in texture, moderately concentrated and is 100% estate grown, very rare for a wine this inexpensive.
Name: Gen5 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an earthy brawny red wine with bold ripe characteristics of leather, espresso and black cherry. It broods intensity and big flavor.
Name: Miro 2016 Reserve Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is very smooth, fruity, ripe and almost sweet in flavor. It has plum and raisin notes, a soft texture, elevated alcohol and low acidity.
Name: GTB 2016 Del Barba Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Heavy oak spices dominate this full-bodied wine giving it plenty of vanilla, cinnamon, wood smoke and black pepper in the aromas and flavors. Beneath the oakiness and firm tannins, the berry flavor that the varietal is known for is rather hidden.
Name: Shannon 2015 Two Bud Block Reserve Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe, almost sweet fruit flavors pour forth from this full-bodied wine, accented by baking spices like vanilla and cinnamon. It feels very smooth and soft in texture.
Name: Cline 2016 Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Nice fruit concentration, a touch of spicy oak and a very clean uncomplicated flavor profile make this smooth and almost-sweet wine easy to quaff and enjoy. It's full bodied, soft and not noticeably tannic.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Baked plum, licorice and lavender aromas and flavors define this jammy wine, which takes on a sweetness of oak. Thick on the midpalate, it has substantial weight from the tannins and powerfully ripe fruit.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Gilsson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny fruit is overwhelmed by smoke and charred oak in this thickly tannic wine that has a jammy core of blackberry and marshmallow flavor.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2014 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and quite cherry-berry in fruity flavor, this wine has mild structure and generous tannin, with a midpalate bursting in earthy oak.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Battaglini Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine has a touch of reduction that makes it hard to fully delve into, a well as a thickly tannic character of ripeness that quietly exudes notions of blackberry and vanilla.
Name: Saddleback 2016 Old Vines Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens gritty in texture and tannin before softening on the midpalate. Black fruit, cedar, dried herb and black pepper combine for a forceful experience of power and serious ripeness.
Name: La Storia 2016 Block 303 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A deep, dark color and deep, dark flavors steal the show in this extra-ripe and extremely spicy wine. Oak is the star, as cedar, clove, vanilla, cinnamon and smoke notes pervade the aromas, flavors and finish.
Name: Carnivor 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Soft-textured and definitely fruity, this easy-going non-oaky wine is charming for its fresh raspberry aromas and red-fruit flavors. The texture is smooth and non-tannic.
Name: Collier Creek 2016 Old Press Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An abundance of sweet-seeming, spicy oak fills the aroma and smothers the fruit flavors in this spice cabinet of a wine. It has lots of vanilla, ginger, nutmeg and maple flavors and full body.
Name: Moss Roxx 2015 Ancient Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a big, juicy and somewhat astringent red, the tannins sizable and intrusive.
Name: Decoy 2016 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is brimming in blackberry and vanilla flavors, with an earthy quality that rides below the intensity of the fruit. The acidity is elusive.
Name: The Federalist 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Strong smoky oaky aromas and flavors pervade this full-bodied wine, nearly covering the plummy, almost-sweet fruit flavors that lie underneath.
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an historic site in the middle of Sonoma Valley, this wine is creamy and viscous with a thicket of vanilla and cherry cordial opening up on the palate. Thick and oaky, it lingers in black pepper and an exotic mineral element that's part crushed rock, part dried herb. This is a beautiful and beguiling example of the variety.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From vines planted in the 19th century, near the town of Occidental, this is a knockout wine, integrated and memorably spicy, and with a dash of white pepper at its core. Baked blueberry and cherry meet cinnamon and chocolate powder around a persistence of underlying freshness and beauty.
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Dutton Ranch Morelli Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Farmed by the grande dame Dorothy Rossi, this wine opens with a touch of matchstick reduction and smoky wood. Rustic, concentrated layers of leather, tobacco and crushed rock provide a savory core of depth and complexity, buoyed by a richness of graham cracker and blackberry jam.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Grande Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a strong but not overripe fruit character on the nose of this bottling from historic vines, with baked strawberry, plums and mulberry as well as a dusting of sweet clove. The palate is more lightly bodied than many Zins of the area and is also full of energy, showing bright and fresh red-fruit flavors and baking spice, eliciting elements not often seen from the grape these days.
Name: Ledge 2016 Dante Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site that sits at 1,600-feet in elevation, this wine is rich, round and ripe, as well as slightly reduced, and tightly wound in its youth. Leather, graphite and diesel wrap around a peppery, exotic core of dark chocolate and brambly blackberry that's ever changing in the glass. Enjoy best 2026–2030.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: From the cooler reaches of the Napa Valley, this historic vineyard site provides an earthy, spice-filled entry of cocoa powder and black pepper, rubbed in dried herb. Rounded and rich in red fruit, it has grip and concentration, a heady ripeness that's balanced by ample acidity.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from a majority of the variety blended with dozens of interplanted varieties that date back to the site's planting in 1890, this impresses in its lovely, lifted aromatics of nutmeg and clove. On the palate, expect blackberry cobbler and plum with an underbelly of balanced ripeness.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Cedar, pencil shavings and toasted oak accent a rich full-bodied core of red-cherry cola and berry in this mountain-grown wine that offers plenty of grip and acid-supported structure. The aromatics are perfumed and the length of the finish impressive in strong tannin.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Stagecoach Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Soft red fruit comes lightly spiced in this vineyard-designate, from a site in the heart of the appellation. It's plush and lush, with plenty of body and weight: a graceful companion for the table.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a great value for a wine of such quality, made with a handful of Petite Sirah that grows in the same field-blended site. Layered and grippy, it shows structured blackberry and mocha flavors around secondary tones of leather and earth.
Name: Buehler 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a tiny production wine for the producer. It's also among the producer's lightest and most delicate. High-toned cherry and strawberry fruit support a floral, herbal entry of beautiful perfume, the texture soft and in balance.
Name: Robert Biale 2016 Falleri Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick dense layers of mocha and baked cherry pie accent a rounded, richly ripe and well-made varietal wine that's full bodied and memorably expressive.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy, smoky and exuberantly fruity on the nose, this wine is smooth and integrated, with rich lush layers of crushed rock, mocha and blackberry that burst on the robust full-bodied palate.
Name: St. Francis 2015 Tres Viejos Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brimming with a sweetness of baked cherry and molasses, this is a soft, rounded and robustly ripe wine that carries its weight well. A touch of structured, high-toned acidity complements the power and outer reaches of excess, allowing the experience on the palate to speak.
Name: St. Francis 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a hearty red, completely characteristic of its rough-hewn, mountain appellation, a study in crushed rock and elusive mineral elements. The fruit is a mix of blackberry and black cherry dipped in chocolate, with seasonings of black and white pepper.
Name: Bruliam 2016 Rocky Ridge Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site first planted in 1915, this is a tiny production of wine that's well worth seeking out. It speaks to old-vine dusty spice and dried sage, its texture softly beguiling and boldly full-bodied. It offers plenty of vigor and power.
Name: Kreck 2016 Teldeschi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: It's hard to argue with the quality and likability of this wine, a grippy, tight and structured showing of dusty mocha and leather. But the ripeness is quite something, an elephant in the bottle that takes over on the palate and should be considered before enjoying.
Name: Cinnabar 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant baked fruit aromas and gingerbread spice make for a powerful entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe and rich with black currant, roasted berry and grilled fig flavors, dusted with ample baking spice, and cut by a slight acidity.
Name: Oso Libre 2014 Nativo Primitivo (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a field blend of mostly Zinfandel with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Alicante Bouschet and other varieties, this wine is surprisingly bright in red and black fruit, and with lifted acidity. Earthy elements of grilled mushroom, cedar and sage add complexity and seasoning.
Name: Parmeson 2015 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Muddled black plums, dark cocoa, loamy soil and Chinese five-spice show on the nose of this always reliable bottling from the southern end of Paso Robles. Rounded and nearly sweet flavors of fig cake and plum show on the broad palate, where acid persists lightly into the finish.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2016 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Velvety thick and pleasantly concentrated, this is a burly, big-boned and richly defined wine. It's also a celebration of blackberry jam that's accented in smoke and leather.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Cherry-berry flavors are seasoned in pleasing accents of cinnamon and vanilla in this rich, highly ripe wine. The tannins are soft and supple, providing simple support without distraction.
Name: Mount Peak 2015 Rattlesnake Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Syrupy black fruit is liqueur-like in consistency and richness, the wine dusty in texture and wrap-around tannin. It has a burly ripeness that dominates in all aspects.
Name: Truett Hurst 2016 Inconspicuous Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 22% Petite Sirah and 2% Carignan in the mix, and the vines averaging more than 95 years in age, this is a memorable wine. Structured and powerful, it boasts flavors of raspberry jam, graham cracker and cinnamon, with integrated tannins that impart richness and length.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is from the Alegria Vineyard, originally planted in 1890 and then partially replanted in 1950. It blends within 10% Alicante, 10% Petite Sirah and 2% of a dozen other varieties found in the field. Burly, dusty tobacco is accented in cedar notes and graphite, with powerful concentration and structure at its core.
Name: Sidebar 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big, lingering tannins give this wine impressive complexity against a framework of tart blackberry, dark cherry and a dusty mix of savory spice. Supple layers of chocolate caramel and mint add more to the story, finishing in an impressive balance of rich fruit and bright acidity.
Designation: DCV7 Estate Wallace Ranch Single Vineyard Series
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV7 Estate Wallace Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 7% Petite Sirah, this tightly tannic wine allows room for a juicy core of fleshy dark-cherry flavor around moderate oak and a mix of dried herb and black pepper. Complex and structured, it shows plenty of potential to age. Enjoy best 2025–2030.
Name: Quivira 2015 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dense, concentrated layers of plum, dark cherry and blackberry intermingle on the brooding palate. Vanilla and cinnamon add seasoning and hints of richness. This is sourced from a site considered somewhat extreme for the appellation, on the back side of Bradford Mountain.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Vogensen Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy aromas of black currant and black cherry are bolstered by tones of vanilla and coffee. It's rich, soft and lush on the sip, with a grippy tannic frame that supports flavors of blackberry syrup and espresso bean. The acidity rises on the finish.
Name: Dunning Vineyards 2015 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty tobacco and thick concentrated tannic structure dominate in this ripe full-bodied wine. Blackberry cobbler comes to mind on the palate, alongside mocha chocolate and brown sugar.
Name: XYZin 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is full bodied and fleshy, with flavors of dried herb, blackberry jam and cinnamon toast. Big tannins and structured acidity balance the bold flavors, giving this a soft, supple richness that's hard to shake.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Somers Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made in conjunction with the top luxury property in Paso Robles, this slightly aged bottling offers chocolaty vanilla-laced and caramel-kissed aromas on the nose, set against the dried blackberry and clove scents. It's thick on the palate, sliding from alpine strawberry flavors into espresso, framed by sandy tannins.
Name: Allegretto 2013 Ayres Family Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty dried herb and tobacco frame a compressed structure of tightly wound tannin and oak in this chewy grippy wine. Black pepper and savory leather override the brambly blackberry and dark cherry with ease, finishing like a cup of strong coffee.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV2 Estate Four Clones Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
