Description: Vibrant aromas of raspberry jam, fruit leather and spice are followed by plush fruit flavors. It's a very enjoyable, spot-on example of the variety.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Woody spices rule on the nose of this bottling, but there are also elements of blackberry jam, thyme and anise. The palate is quite smoky with oak, which frames the dark fruit and baking-spice flavors.
Name: Double Black 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a sweetness of brown sugar underlying jammy black cherry, soft tannin and robust oak. Richly round and approachable, it's a crowd pleaser for fans of a big jammy style.
Name: Joseph Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pungent aromas of candied raspberry meet with rose petal and cinnamon on the fresh, vibrant and somewhat sweet nose of this bottling. There's a sweetness to the palate as well, where candied cherries and red currants make for an easily enjoyable fruit-punch profile.
Name: EOS 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This moderately ripe, affordable wine is fruity in cherry and berry flavors and has a soft rounded structure of unfussy richness.
Name: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reduced and tightly wound, this wine features generous helpings of tannin and oak around juicy brambly blackberry and a component of dried spicy fruit and nut.
Name: Ledson 2015 Estate Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, char, coffee and dried herb are followed by soft red-fruit flavors, with plentiful barrel accents. The variety seems a bit hard to find, especially compared to their entry-level offering from the same vintage.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A sweetness of vanilla is highlighted from the oak in this candied, fleshy and simple wine that finishes in a burst of overripe heat.
Name: Spicy Vines 2015 Zin Master Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Ben Lomond Mountain, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark and dense in color, this bottling from a coastal vineyard shows focused blackberry and cinnamon-laced snickerdoodle aromas on the nose. There is blackberry jam on the tip of the sip but then it grows more intriguing with crushed asphalt and earthy flavors of thyme and sage, all framed by dry polished tannins.
Name: Beauregard 2014 Beauregard Ranch Zinfandel (Ben Lomond Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose of this special anniversary bottling offers a toasted blackberry aroma and a light whiff of lavender oil. The palate is smooth and packed with fresh berries that are slowly consumed by firm tannins and persistent acidity. Very dry and elegant. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 30th Anniversary Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright red-currant aromas meet with earthy tones of composting red and purple flowers on the elegant nose of this bottling. Herbal seasonings of thyme and anise decorate the palate, where elegant amounts of red and purple fruit prove intriguing.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Vortex Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a head-trained block of Zinfandel planted in 1906, this is a great wine even without that history. Elegantly earthy aromas of sage, dried red plums, vanilla brioche and black cherry Popsicle lead into a deep rich sip, where blueberry and tart black-plum skins decorate the creamy palate.
Name: Eden Rift 2016 Dickinson Block Zinfandel (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling offers prominent aromas of boysenberry and blackberry, as well as turned earth and spearmint. Medium bodied and framed by polished tannins and zesty acidity, the palate shows the same berry and mint mix, making for a flavorful and balanced feel.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Bailey Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant and layered aromas of boysenberry, dark strawberry, vanilla and slate show on the nose of this bottling, which is bolstered by 10% Petite Sirah. Penetrating flavors of black currant, black cherry and black plum are lifted by licorice and sweet sage on the palate.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2016 Big Bad Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's great depth and complexity on the nose of this bottling, which offers blackberry, gravel, hot earth, pepper and thyme aromas. It's full on the palate, but the tannins are firm and tight, offering elegant flavors of dense plum, dark chocolate and asphalt. Persistent acidity carries through to the finish.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Willow Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling, which includes 3% Tannat, is very fruit-forward but in a measured way, starting with red-plum jelly and red-cherry candy that benefit from sprinklings of licorice and sagebrush spice. The palate is lush and soft, cut by steadily rising acidity, and showing flavor of dark-red fruit and cinnamon.
Name: Pulchella 2016 Mercenary Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which comes from the historic Santa Cruz Island clone, starts with a very expressive nose that shows roasted strawberry, baking spice and light oak touches. Candied-strawberry and watermelon flavors arise on the palate, set against an elegantly spicy background of star anise and allspice.
Name: Rusack 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of spicy potpourri, violets and juniper ride over a dense bramble-berry core in this invigorating wine. The medium-bodied palate shows wonderful tension and precision, boasting tight red-berry flavors wrapped around graphite and floral tones. Persistent acidity and bolstering yet fine-grained tannins will ensure some longevity in the cellar. Drink now–2022.
Name: Coppi 2011 Senatore Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of roasted coffee, crushed lava rocks, blackberry and blueberry show on the hearty nose of this bottling. Espresso bean and walnut flavors arise on the sip, which picks up an elderberry element and is framed by solid acidity and forgiving tannins.
Name: Amor Fati 2015 Mossfire Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Deep, concentrated aromas of dried hay, licorice and dried cherries jump from the glass. This well-balanced sweet red offers a wealth of fresh and dried red-berry tones against a vibrant backdrop of acidity and integrated, structured tannins. Pair with anything drizzled with chocolate.
Name: Polvanera 2013 21 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's great intensity and levity to the aromas of this wine, with notes of ripe cherry, anise, menthol and Mediterranean herbs. Firmly medium in weight (despite the high listed alcohol), this is well balanced and vibrant in feel. A mix of tart red cherries and freshly ripe blackberries offer loads of depth, with integrated barrel tones and a savory undercurrent adding complexity. This checks all the boxes for fruit expression, complexity, balance and structure.
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2013 Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A yellowish shade of pink, this very restrained, fresh and bright bottling shows steely aromas on the nose alongside tightly woven lemon-rind and Rainier cherry notes. The palate is wrapped in a chalky texture, carrying citrusy flavors as well as touches of red apple, nectarine and, on the finish, a touch of toast.
Designation: Born Like This Calf Canyon Vineyard Dry White
Name: Azios 2017 Born Like This Calf Canyon Vineyard Dry White Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is always a fun taste of Southern California's wine-growing history. Exotic plum and alpine strawberry aromas mix with sweet juniper and herbal cola aromas on the nose. There's a menthol-like spice to the palate, giving depth to the plum jelly core, with tannins rising toward the finish.
Designation: Monga Zin Old Vine Lopez Vineyard
Name: Carol Shelton 2016 Monga Zin Old Vine Lopez Vineyard Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A wealth of aromas start this off: black cherry, violets, blood-orange peel and resinous herbs. Ample in weight yet expertly balanced by a core of juicy acidity and grippy medium-grained tannins, the palate is carried by a fleshy mix of dark berries, red plums and earth. A tart cherry-skin flavor offers grip and intensity on the lingering finish.
Name: Felline 2016  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A mix of fresh cherry, spicy blackberry, anise, clove and cured meat carries the nose. Persistent acidity and a dusting of grippy tannins creates the bones for this wine, with a taut, linear palate that is savory in nature. A bit of ripe red fruit helps broaden out the midpalate, with blackberry skins offering fruity grip on the lingering finish.
Name: Miali 2012 Mater Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine is concentrated on the nose in notes of spicy bramble, sweet spice and resinous herbs. The fresh, vibrant palate boasts loads of energy, with ripe Bing cherry and coconut flavors propelled along a core of tangy granite and fine-grained tannins.
Name: Pietraventosa 2012 Riserva Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is a taste of California's Zinfandel history, coming from a block of heritage clone plantings that were collected from old vineyards around the state. Strawberry sorbet, framboise and hibiscus aromas lead into a crisp, acid-washed palate of red fruit, cinnamon and clove.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 D Block Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-raspberry framboise, smoke, licorice and snapped sagebrush sticks show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is dominated by lovely floral flavors and framed by a chalky structure, offering boysenberry-candy and wild mint elements.
Name: Fighter Pilot Red 2016 Bailey Ranch Dry-Farmed Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black plum, fudge, loamy soil and a hint of purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. The palate is rich while slightly tangy, offering flavors of black-plum pudding, plum skin, shaved chocolate and a hint of sagebrush.
Name: Maddalena 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very jammy and hedonistic on the nose, this bottling shows strawberry preserves, framboise and clove. The palate is somewhat light and goes down easy, with flavors of strawberry jam and tannins that firm up toward the finish.
Name: Felten Cellars 2015 Old Casteel Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sierra Pelona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A pretty mauve in color, this rosé starts with rounded and somewhat ripe aromas of cherry, strawberry and plum on the nose, but with a complex backdrop of wet slate and vanilla pastry. There is zesty acidity to the sip, where the red fruit and stone-fruit flavors are strong but refreshing and clean.
Designation: 27 Angels? Agua Dulce Vineyard Rosé of
Name: Azios 2017 27 Angels? Agua Dulce Vineyard Rosé of Zinfandel (Sierra Pelona Valley)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This boasts earthy tones of woodland berries, black pepper and wild flowers on the nose. It's soft in feel on the medium-bodied palate, with a refreshing line of acidity and fine, chalky tannins that extend the tart cherry-skin finish.
Name: Coppi 2015 Siniscalco Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A vibrant nose of tart cherry, currant, Thai basil and sweet spices make for an interesting start. The well-balanced palate is trimmed by a fine edging of acidity and a mild grip of tannins, with a tart red-fruit flavor and a savory undertone leading the way.
Name: Berselli and Solferino 2016 Signature Collection Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Floral aromas of red and purple petals lead into a juicy red-currant and raspberry streak that's cut by orange rind on the nose of this bottling. There's a hops-like herbal kick to the lighter bodied palate, which gives depth to the dark-red-fruit flavors.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A dense nose of dark cherry and blackberry blends with sandalwood and clove. This is plush in feel yet structured by juicy acidity and fine-grained, gripping tannins. A rich core of dark fruit is firmly integrated with oak tones and carries to a dark plum-skin finish.
Name: Varvaglione 2014 Papale  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bits of earth and barnyard ride over a core of spicy plum on the nose of this Primitivo. It's relatively light on its feet, with mouthwatering acidity and gently gripping tannins supporting a palate of tense, savory red-berry flavors. Enjoy soon.
Name: Miali 2013 Campirossi Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very juicy on the nose, this bottling smells of a black-cherry and pomegranate soda pop with a pinch of dried herbs. There are also lots of poppy qualities to the sip, where tangy plum juice meets with a touch of dried hop flavor.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Especial Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly light in the glass, this bottling shows fresh aromas of sour cherry, dill and marjoram on the simple but likable nose. The palate delivers candied raspberry, cranberry and plum flavors, making a perfect table wine for a variety of foods.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Mustard Creek Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of fresh cherry juice, press violets and peppery spice show nice intensity on the nose. Medium in weight and soft in feel, this is juicy up-front, with a tart, grippy red-fruit finish.
Name: Pietraventosa 2015 Allegoria Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: An enticing mix of bright red cherry, menthol and baking spice immediately engages the nose. Brisk red-berry flavors carry the tense, medium-bodied palate, with a gentle grip of tannins offering support. Its persistent acidity and savory tones make it a welcome addition at the dinner table.
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2015 Lirica  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: There's a great story behind this planting, which comes from grape cuttings that were grown more than 100 years ago on Santa Cruz Island, but the wine still struggles in the island breeze. Light aromas of red cherry and sweet cedar lead into a palate of tangy red fruit, wet soil and wood spice.
Name: Rusack 2015 Santa Catalina Island Vineyards Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite spicy on the nose, this bottling shows myrrh and cedar against rich black plum aromas in the background. That wood spice and cigar box element plays on the palate too, wrapping up the carnation, rose water and soft plum and strawberry flavors, The tannins firm up on the finish.
Name: Midnight 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Relatively mellow on the nose, this bottling shows black-plum jam with hints of smoke, baking spice and crushed gravel aromas. Blackberry and more brown spice show on the palate, which is clean, fresh and easy to quaff.
Name: Holme Estate Cellars 2014 Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Black-plum and kirsch tones meld with sweet barrel aromas. There's heft on the palate with a dense core of dark jammy fruit, yet it's brightened on the midpalate after a burst of acidity. Dark chocolate dusted cherry lingers on the finish.
Name: Varvaglione 2013 Papale  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump and bursting aromas of boysenberry and black currant make for a very fresh if rather fruity entry to the nose of this bottling. It's relatively lightweight on the palate, with fresh strawberries, lilac and violets flavors, framed by delicate tannins and decent acid.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2016 Jackal Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean strawberry-juice aromas meet with light mint cream on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are a bit primary still, with fresh and juicy red-fruit touches with just a touch of tannic framing on a somewhat thin body.
Name: J Wilkes 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked black-raspberry aromas meet with sagebrush and a pinch of pepper on the fresh nose of this bottling. The palate shows slightly sour plum, smoke, wild mint and woody earth flavors.
Name: Pulchella 2015 Mercenary Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely rich aromas of prune and spice cake show on the very extracted nose of this bottling. Thick and gooey flavors of black-currant and blueberry syrup arise on the sip, but there is decent acidity to cut through the ripeness. The finish is laced with vanilla and caramel.
Name: Rockin' R Winery 2012 Jammin Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tones of cherry and slightly charred herbs carry the nose and palate. This is dense at first but turns brighter on the midpalate after a resurgence of acidity, with dense, dark cherry transitioning to lighter strawberry.
Name: Varvaglione 2015 12 e Mezzo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of violets, geraniums and spicy dark cherry carry to the ultraripe, heavy palate of dried cherry and prune. The tannins are a bit thick in feel, yet persistent acidity helps maintain balance come the chocolate-dipped cherry finish.
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2014 Il Madrigale Dolce Naturale  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in both color and aroma, this bottling offers faint scents of framboise, plum and licorice. The palate is full of tart red-plum-skin flavors, and would make a nice table wine for midweek dining.
Name: Proulx 2016 Willow Creek Farm Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which includes 23% Petite Sirah, offers very ripe aromas of tangy black plum, black pepper, wild mint and chocolate on the nose. The palate is a bit overextracted and thick with flavors of dried black currant, raisin and a touch of prune, with savory smoked meat flavors as well.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2016 Territory Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cedar and smoke aromas decorate the tangy black-plum aromas on the nose of this bottling. Tons of wood spice also shows on the palate, including cedar, redwood and pine, set against the dark-red-fruit backdrop.
Name: Martin Ranch 2016 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Matera, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe red cherries, violets, pepper and anise make for an easygoing start. The palate is soft in feel, yet filled out by flavors of juicy red fruit and sweet spice.
Name: Taverna 2015 I Sassi Primitivo (Matera)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A touch reductive even with plenty of time to breathe, this bottling offers ripe blackberry, tar and game aromas on the nose. Dried herbs, more game and sour black fruits show on the palate, which ends on a vanilla-cookie finish.
Name: Ballard Lane 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Zinfandel is crafted in a more underripe style, which is a laudable effort, but falls a bit short. Aromas of tangy plum skin, mulberry and baked tomato lead into a earthy palate of moss, tobacco and tomato leaf.
Name: Écluse 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Nearly opaque ruby in color, this young Primitivo is all about ultraripe fruit expression. Condensed cherry jam tones carry the nose and palate. It's rich in feel yet eased by a bit of acidity, with a dusting of cocoa on the finish.
Name: Felline 2016 Tenuta Pozzopalo Giravolta  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Straightforward tones of punchy red fruits and sweet spice carry this light-bodied wine. It's soft, supple and easy to guzzle, but still has enough structure to maintain balance. Chill down, pop open and enjoy on a hot summer day.
Name: Tormaresca 2016 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of thick dark-cherry sauce, dried hay and cooked herbs start off this wine. The palate is rich in feel yet ultimately balanced by a burst of acidity on the midpalate. Ripe black-cherry and juicy raspberry flavors transition to a mocha close.
Name: Miali 2014 Single Vineyard Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Gushing in aromas of ripe red cherry and sweet baking spices, this is an ultrafruity—almost New World—expression of Primitivo, which is further reinforced by the Zinfandel listing on the bottle. It's plush and soft on the midpalate, with a mild ashy close.
Name: Felline 2015 Sinfarosa  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very pruney aromas kick off this quite over-extracted and overripe bottling. That leads into a palate dominated by raisin flavors as well as a roasted meat touch, while the acidity is persistent.
Name: Crooked Path 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Cooked-down kirsch aromas carry a somewhat metallic, savory edge on the nose. The palate is grating in tannins, with tense acidity and tart red-fruit flavors.
Name: Felline 2013 Dunico  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This estate-grown block-designate is insanely good, soft and spicy in black and white pepper from first sip. Elongated, chalky tannins support bright, fresh acidity and strong, well-defined flavors of leather pouch, crushed rock and cherry. The texture is supple and complex.
Name: Limerick Lane 2016 1910 Block Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a healthy, welcoming intrigue of spice, this estate-grown wine is dusty and leathery in approach and texture, with lovely layers of red licorice and dark cherry. The acidity is interwoven throughout the full-bodied concentration of flavor, with a finishing touch of white pepper.
Name: Limerick Lane 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Effusive fruit aromas and flavors are well matched by complex wood, smoke and black pepper accents. The berry and cherry components taste quite ripe, and the oaky, spicy and gamy characters doesn't overwhelm the fruit. A generous mouthfeel completes the profile.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Amador Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Generously rich and layered, this wine is also lovely in aromas of rose petal and lavender, its texture soft and supple. Dark cherry and red licorice give it fruity savory flavor around a full-bodied ripeness that will please a broad array of palates.
Name: Benovia 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Lust is one of the seven deadly sins, and this tiny-production wine from Michael David is a fitting adjunct to the winery's Seven Deadly Zins offering. Spicy, perfumed oak aromas and equally spicy oak flavors accompany deep tones of black cherry and dark chocolate. The wine has a thick coating of tannins that helps support all the richness and elevated body.
Name: Michael David 2015 Lust Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a rich warm mouth-coating wine that's packed with ripe, almost late-harvest, berry flavors, and that feels smooth and dense on the tongue. It is inviting, layered, concentrated and full bodied, showing moderate tannins and a long finish.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Pilgrim Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy tight-grained oak dominates in this rich and structured red, that is thick in tannin and buoyant brambly black cherry and blackberry. Its full-bodied concentration is rich and layered, supported by a thread of persistent acidity that refreshens.
Name: Limerick Lane 2016 Rocky Knoll Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Delicious and dry, this wine layers blackberry, dark chocolate and cherry flavors throughout the aromas, the flavors and the lingering finish. A minty, cedary oak accent adds complexity and a light layer of tannins keeps the mouthfeel lively and appetizing.
Name: Bella Grace 2014 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big-boned wine aged in American oak is spicy, very ripe and quite full bodied, so it has plenty of impact on the palate. Black pepper, anise and an almost jammy blackberry flavor give it complexity, and a good structure of tannins while acidity give the texture a nice bite.
Name: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: An aroma just like blackberry jam provides an eye-opening start to this rich, lightly sweet and full-bodied wine. The color is extra dark for a Zin and the fruit flavors are extra concentrated. Moderate tannins add a little bite to the texture and keep the wine in balance despite huge fruit flavors and a perception of sweetness.
Name: Pech Merle 2016 Reserve Lot 9 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is nicely dry, firm in texture and offers a very good mix of ripe-to-bursting blackberry and blueberry flavors along with moderate tannins, good acidity and a welcomed sense of freshness despite full body. It will make a hearty pairing with many kinds of beef, pork, and cheese.
Name: Shooting Star 2015 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe and delicious, this wine loads up black cherry, blueberry and milk chocolate while a soothing, soft texture helps coat the palate. It's not a typical dinner-table red wine but it is definitely luxurious and flavorful.
Name: Bookshelf 2015 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dry, well-structured wine has firm tannins and persistent acidity matched by ripe and spicy blackberry and black-cherry flavors. It will shine when served with a roast or chop.
Name: Andis 2015 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A Port-like ripeness in the aroma leads to lush, chocolaty flavors that range from superripe black plums to blueberry syrup. The wine is full bodied, rich and viscous in texture, with mild tannins and soft acidity for balance.
Name: Caricature 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Tantalizing oak and rich fruit flavors vie for attention in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and well-structured wine. It has plenty of concentration with, boysenberry jam aromas, lush fruit and chocolate flavors.
Name: LangeTwins 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated ripe fruit flavors are well matched by spicy oak accents in this full-bodied firmly tannic wine. It has a darker than usual color—a combination of raspberry and black cherry flavors—and a gripping, mouth-filling texture.
Name: Matthew Gibson 2013 Estate Primitivo (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nice and fruity, nice and dry, this full-bodied, pure and concentrated wine offers brilliant black-cherry aromas, delicious cherry and raspberry flavors and a polished texture. It's a fine example of old-vine composure and balance.
Name: Obscurity 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hints of black pepper, clove and cedar waft from the glass, followed by ripe and generous fruit flavors on the palate. This wine is dry, well balanced and has a mouthwatering texture stiffened a bit by light tannins.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Fountaingrove District, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a vineyard planted to three clones of the variety, then blended with 12% Petite Sirah, this sees 18 months in oak, a mix of new American and neutral French. It works in its bramble of wild berry and banana, the body softly layered, rich and sumptuously lush.
Name: Carol Shelton 2015 Peaceland Vineyard Zinfandel (Fountaingrove District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A peppery, herbaceous aroma and savory spicy flavors make this full-bodied wine, grown at high elevation, a bit edgy but full of personality. The flavors, at first, resemble grilled fruit and beef juices, then ripe black plums flow in, complementing a texture that is firm and moderately tannic.
Name: Cedarville 2015 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Silky smooth, this vineyard-designate offers a high-toned streak of acidity within a substantial framework of powerful ripeness. Cherry, blueberry and coffee-cake flavors and aromas play nicely with one another, with a lasting finish of black licorice.
Name: V. Sattui 2014 Quaglia Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a well-balanced, well-structured wine that will be great to have on hand for almost any occasion. It is attractively dry, medium bodied, has hints of oak spice in the aromas, is full of red-cherry and blackberry flavors and has a lightly tannic texture.
Name: Brutocao 2013 Estate Bottled Bliss Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An intensely broad-shouldered red blended with 13% Petite Sirah, this has plenty of power within a full-flavored array of brambly blackberry, cherry and dusty cinnamon. The oak (a blend of French and American) is supportive and integrated.
Name: Carol Shelton 2015 Florence Vineyard Rocky Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Plump and ripe, this fruity exuberant wine was made from vines planted in 1979. It has plenty of vivid raspberry, cherry and raspberry flavors, a lush, almost soft texture and a lingering finish.
Designation: Reserve Spanish Creek Vineyard Old Vine
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Spanish Creek Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Fair Play)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral in lovely ways, this big, bold and broadly expansive wine is hugely structured, with plenty of tannin and strong black-fruit flavor. Good supportive acidity keeps it balanced in the glass.
Name: Novy 2016 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Peppery, meaty and herbal, this wine is well rounded and concentrated in structure, with a lasting note of sandalwood and cedar.
Name: V. Sattui 2014 Black Sears Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This extremely ripe and concentrated wine has aromas and flavors like a Port—almost raisiny, almost sweet—that saturate the taste buds, create a broad mouthfeel and linger nicely on the finish. It is full bodied, not very tannic, and rich in texture.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Spicy, savory elements supplement the generous fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine, giving it more than the usual personality. There are white-pepper, dried basil and blackberry flavors and a smooth, moderately tannic texture.
Name: Weibel Family 2015 Archgate Cellars Reserve Bottling Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is more lean than is typical and has great balance. Good acidity and moderate tannins come to the fore while the fruit flavors are rather crisp ones like raspberry and red cherry. It has light oak spices in the aroma that continue through the flavors and finish.
Name: Brutocao 2014 Estate Bottled Contento Vineyard Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Easy and fruity, this effusive wine is packed with cherry and blackberry flavors, has a smooth, lightly tannic texture and subtle oak spices to add some extra interest. It's dry, full bodied but quaffable.
Name: Paul Dolan 2016 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mature and mellow in taste, this full-bodied wine has a relatively light color, aromas like leather and black tea, and flavors like dried cherries and tamarind. It's an individualistic drink and a good escape from the often sweet and overripe school of Zinfandel.
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An interesting mineral aroma lends a distinct profile to this otherwise full-bodied, dry and moderately tannic wine. It has a good palate-cleansing grip, plus raspberry and mineral flavors and a tangy finish.
Name: Cline 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Blackberry crumble is the star of the show in this expansive fruit-forward red, blended with 11% Petite Sirah, Carignan, Valdiguié and Grand Noir. Aged in American oak, it presents a strong presence of vanilla that finishes sweet.
Name: Elyse 2015 Korte Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: Rich, round and soft, this wine exudes strong aromas and flavors of brown sugar and baked blackberry and plum, with threads of acidity woven through to provide contrast and balance. Blended within are 14% mixed blacks from vineyard.
Name: Elyse 2015 Morisoli Vineyard Zinfandel (Rutherford)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bay leaf and cedar show up on the nose of this wine, which is juicy and brawny on the palate, with a savory edge of black pepper, clove and soy. Structured, it offers power and plenty of fruit-forward flavor.
Name: Kenwood 2014 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is very generous in fruit aromas and flavors, showing ripe and vivid red cherry, strawberry and plum, with light oak shadings and a smooth, almost soft texture. It's charming and easy to drink.
Name: Gnarly Head 2016 Old Vine Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is very generous in fruit aromas and flavors, showing ripe and vivid red cherry, strawberry and plum, with light oak shadings and a smooth, almost soft texture. It's charming and easy to drink.
Name: Gnarly Head 2016 Old Vine Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Nicely dry and well balanced, this is an appetizing medium-bodied wine that offers no-nonsense cherry and berry flavors and a lightly tannic, almost crisp, texture that will be a good palate cleanser.
Name: Bliss 2014 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: On the earthy side of the spectrum, rather than simply fruity, this appealing full-bodied wine has good concentration, a feeling of richness on the palate and a lingering, berrylike finish.
Name: Monte Volpe 2014 Primitivo (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blackberry jam and toast show up on the nose of this intensely ripe, syrupy wine, big in flavor and softness. Chocolate and vanilla swirls play off each other on the rich finish.
Name: V. Sattui 2014 Gilsson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Chocolate mocha and vanilla ride alongside brambly black fruit and leather in this soft, integrated red that's intensely ripe. The finish is dipped in clove and dried herb.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This dry medium-bodied wine has herb and black-pepper aromas and an earthy meaty flavor that would suit a Rhône varietal well. It has a good structure of acidity and moderate tannins.
Name: Hullabaloo 2015 Old Vines Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very ripe, raisiny in flavor and almost sweet, this full-bodied wine oozes blackberry, prune and raisin notes on a soft pillowy texture. It seems appropriate with cheese or chocolate at the end of a meal.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and smooth-textured wine has earthy berry-like aromas, nicely ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors and a good touch of tannin in the mouthfeel.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Estate Vineyard Primitivo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sweet and smoky oak flavors dress up this full-bodied moderately tannic wine and there are enough good blackberry and plum flavors to balance the spiciness.
Name: Mabera 2013 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A spicy oaky character defines this full-bodied and ripe-tasting wine. The aromas resemble strawberry jam and brown sugar and the flavors are rich, fruity, and seem a bit sweet.
Name: Plungerhead 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Full bodied and rustic in personality, this wine has earthy dusty aromas, along with ripe berry and balsamic flavors.
Name: Paris Valley Road 2015 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Meaty and woody, this combines mostly Zin with small amounts of Petite Sirah, Carignan and mixed blacks. Together they offer intensity and ripe blackberry jam and chocolate.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine presents as lean on the palate, and somewhat non-distinct in its mix of eucalyptus and bay leaf aromas and faint flavors of dark plum.
Name: Kenwood 2014 Six Ridges Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An exuberance of cherry blossom and violet greets the nose in this complex, textured wine. The structured palate offers tones of dried herb, brambly blackberry and black pepper, finishing weighty in just enough oak.
Name: Williams Selyem 2016 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the producer's own backyard site, head-trained and planted a century ago, this wine is from the lowest yielding of all their sites. Earthy forest, leather saddle, fennel and a whiff of meatiness highlight a dense brightly layered wine, offering structure that is lifted in red-berry flavor with a spicy tobacco finish.
Name: Hartford Court 2015 Hartford Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Planted more than 100 years ago by her family, this head-trained vineyard is still looked after by Dina. The wine's tart focused acidity zeroes in on candied-cherry and strawberry flavors. Sumptuous and brightly rich, it has undeniable structure and a lasting mineral element of oyster shell and brine.
Name: Hartford Court 2015 Dina's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Named for the way part of the vineyard is planted, the vines trained on a high wire, this is a dense earthy red. (The site is also field planted to Carignane.) Juicy with plenty of acidity on the midpalate, it oozes blackberry, black cherry and white and black pepper, with a lasting hit of texture and freshness.
Name: Hartford Court 2015 Highwire Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Silky smooth, soft and concentrated, this hails from 100-year-old vines in the heart of the appellation. The wine is luscious in strawberry and black-cherry flavors. Expansive and boldly ripe, it has a core of richness that never overwhelms, finding companionship in a wisp of black and white pepper.
Designation: Fanucchi Wood Road Vineyard Old Vine
Name: Hartford Court 2015 Fanucchi Wood Road Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the wilds of the appellation and field blended with nearly 16% Petite Sirah and smaller amounts of Carignane and Alicante Bouschet, this wine is rich in red brambly dusty fruit. Demure on the palate at first, it is soft and structured, with a strong taste of strawberry and white pepper on the finish.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Teldeschi Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blending five of the producer's vineyard-designates, all dry-farmed and old-vine, this is a high-acid red with hearty spice and components of dried herb, cedar and oak. Supple and rich, it's distinctively savory and tart on the midpalate and finish, finishing in a blur of pepper.
Name: Hartford Court 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From head-trained vines planted more than a century ago, then aged in French oak, this is a bold, plum-driven expression of cherry and berry pie seasoned in cinnamon that's structured and exuberantly full bodied. It offers a bright streak of acidity that keeps it succulent in the glass.
Name: Hartford Court 2015 Jolene's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick, elongated tannins rule the day in this mountain-grown wine, textured and grippy with a balance of bright acidity. The fruit is brambly in blackberry with dustings of dried herb, cola and clove that accent it well.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a layered, full-bodied red, thick in baked bread, cherry and vanilla flavors. It has underlying elegance, with balanced acidity and polish tannins that keep it fresh and succulent.
Name: Williams Selyem 2016 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of red-plum jelly and berry syrup are lifted by fresh-plucked thyme and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling, which includes 12% Petite Sirah. The wine leans toward a heavier-bodied style on the palate, where intense blackberry flavors meet with forest herbs and a lively acidity, proving quite complex.
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A strong aromatic element of eucalyptus and bay leaf permeate on the nose of this wine, which settles into a full-figured, lush and textured commingling of coffee, dark chocolate and berry pie, the finish brightened by a tease of acidity.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Old Hill Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 20% Petite Sirah and 1% Primitivo, this is a thick, dense wine that offers smoky char beneath rich, full-bodied red berries and softly integrated oak. The finish has touches of mocha and sweet tobacco.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2016 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is densely packed in soft tannin, its thickness characterized by earthy leather, black pepper and clove. Soy and black licorice follow along for the ride, as the full-bodied richness takes hold on the palate.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Big River Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick, oaky and dense in tannin, this is a highly ripe wine that finds its groove amidst a curtain of baked bread, compost and blackberry bramble. The richness is underlined in mocha chocolate and sweet tobacco.
Name: Hanna 2015 Bismark Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very berrylicious play on Zinfandel, with strong yet elegant berry and currant aromas as well as touches of violet and lavender. Boysenberry syrup powers the palate and is leveled by white-pepper, dried marjoram and mint flavors, set against loamy earth tones that come through strong on the finish.
Name: Proulx 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Berry patch and brown sugar combine for a forceful, sumptuous and richly concentrated expression of the variety, which represents 100% here. Mint and leather abound along a simple structure and texture that's soft and layered.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Dickerson Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows fresh mulberry, red plum, cherry, cinnamon and dried tarragon on the nose, with a bit of dust. The palate offers great herbal qualities that mesh with berry syrup and vanilla on the finish.
Name: Ruby Cellars 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump raspberries meet with wet soil, clay and dried herbs on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are pleasant if simple, with wood spice, more dried herbs and tart berries.
Name: J. Wilkes 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with nearly 19% Petite Sirah, this is a thick and dense wine, fruity and meaty in equal measure, with a jammy richness to its full grasp of blackberry character.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Barricia Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nearly red in color, this wine is robust on the nose in earthy brambly berry that becomes pie-like in richness and girth. The generosity of fruit is laced in lemon zest.
Name: Pedroncelli 2017 Signature Selection Dry Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This includes 25% mixed blacks, all old-vine—a study in compost earthiness and baked blueberry. Full bodied and quite ripe, it has a smokiness to the oak that contrasts against the fruit and dust.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Belloni Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From Winemaker Kirk Venge, this estate wine is sourced from the heart of the appellation. Char, blueberry and layered swathes of dusty chocolate give it richness around a full-bodied palate that's tempered by bright, lingering acidity.
Name: Croix 2015 Wood Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely ripe, rich and seductive, this wine has immense fruit flavors, handsome oak accents and a gorgeous sense of concentration and creaminess on the palate. It layers accents of vanilla, nutmeg and maple between waves of deep blackberry and blueberry, with a long, lingering finish.
Name: Three 2015 Evangelho Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A compelling, concentrated fruit essence lifts this full-bodied wine to a high level of quality and satisfaction. It has a vivid blackberry and blueberry aroma, lush and layered fruit flavors and light spicy oak accents that don't get in the way of the amazing berry character.
Name: Renwood 2015 Riker Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This has distinctive, exotic fruit nuances that begin in the aroma and continue on the palate and through the lingering finish. It seems to blend blueberry, mint and blackberry notes into a rich texture with moderate tannins that make it nicely mouthfilling. Cofermenting with 13% Petite Sirah and 7% Barbera certainly enhanced the structure as well as the flavors.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2016 SHR Field Blend Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dash of spicy oak livens this big, ripe and fruity wine from the aromas through the flavors and on through the finish. Notes of toast, nutmeg and cedar blend seamlessly with raspberry and ripe plum, while firm tannins and full body give it a good sense of weight and structure.
Name: Three 2015 Bigelow Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a classic field blend of 80% Zinfandel and 20% mixed blacks. High-toned flavors of raspberry and cherry dominate the palate, which has a smoothly textured core of dusty clove and leather that accents the fruit well.
Name: Armida 2015 Tina's Block Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Extreme ripeness, good concentration and a firm texture help this full-bodied wine rise well above the pack. It smells and tastes like a blend of raspberry and blackberry syrups, but is refreshingly dry and nicely supported by moderate tannins.
Name: Sol Rouge 2014 Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a gutsy wine with great structure and concentrated flavors from the family that founded Rosenblum winery and know Zinfandel very well. It has attractive aromas of ripe blackberries and blueberries, generous fruit flavors and light spicy oak accents that add complexity. Firm tannins and good acidity give it some grip on the palate and will help it pair well with a juicy steak or chop.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Mariah Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied red cherries, dried lilacs, salt and pepper show on the nose of this solid bottling from the longtime Zinfandel producer. The palate is a pleasing mix of flavors, from Concord grape and vanilla dust to purple flowers and baking spice.
Name: Opolo 2016 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Spicy and full bodied, this wine comes from a vineyard planted in 1881. It is full of ripe fruit flavors, with dashes of black pepper and wood smoke that give it extra dimension. Firm tannins and good acidity keep it well balanced, while blackberry and violet flavors coat the tongue.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2016 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opulent fruit flavors take center stage in this full-bodied, smooth-textured wine. It practically oozes blackberry and boysenberry in the aroma and also delivers lush, rich berry tones on the palate. The mouthfeel is broad, and the finish lingers.
Name: Three 2015 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smoky, charcoal aromas lead to rich, concentrated flavors of blueberry and dark chocolate in this full-bodied, well-structured wine. It has an intensity of black-fruit flavors and a density of fine-grained tannins that is rare for the variety and bodes well for improvement over time. Best after 2023.
Name: Renwood 2015 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A wonderful, deep blackberry-jam aroma and equally expressive fruit flavors on the palate give this wine a lot of enjoyment. This feels full and firm, with tones of blackberry, boysenberry, baking spice and dash of oaky complexity from 35% new barrels.
Name: Wild Thing 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This big but plush wine is deep in color, rich in blackberry aromas and saturated with ripe jammy flavors that spread across the palate and cling to the sides of the mouth. It is full bodied, very concentrated and has a ripeness that leaves a fruity sensation on the finish.
Name: Zinfandelic 2016 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Oregano, thyme and pepper give spice to the plum-jam and raspberry-sorbet aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite rich with ripe fruit at first but then picks up a savory side, showing roast pork in plum sauce flavors along with lavender and rosemary.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nice touches of cedar and earth in the aromas and flavors add complexity to this big but well-balanced wine. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and has a hint of good acidity to keep it fresh and appetizing on the palate.
Name: V. Sattui 2014 Amador Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a structured and robustly built wine from a great site on the southern end of the appellation. Blueberry, red cherry and cedar all stand out, along with a spicy twist of nutmeg that persists on the lengthy finish.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Hendry Vineyard Block 29 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a big wine, full of smoky dark-fruit flavors and supported by firm tannins and a framework of spicy oak. It's nicely dry, has a gripping texture, very full body and complex flavor elements like black pepper, blackberries, beef jus and molasses. Best after 2021.
Name: Trinitas 2015 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh, vivid and well-structured, this intensely fruity wine has great acidity and firm tannins to balance it beautifully. It tastes very focused on raspberry and black cherry, fills the mouth with layers of fruit and has an appetizing bite on the finish.
Name: Black Saint Peter 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This bold and very enjoyable wine goes big on the fresh fruity components while seasoning them with accents of wood smoke and black pepper. It's full bodied, not very tannic and seems to overflow with blackberry and blueberry flavors.
Name: Uvaggio 2016 Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a hugely ripe, robust wine that imparts smoky char, black pepper, clove and cinnamon. Smoothly textured, it is well integrated in terms of oak and power, with plenty of old-vine red-cherry and blackberry character.
Name: Ballentine 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Peppery, smoky aromas lead to ample ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied and rather complex wine. It shows the influence of new oak in the lightly charred aroma and spicy meat accents on the palate.
Name: Klinker Brick 2015 Marisa Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a gutsy, spicy dry wine with intriguing black-pepper aromas, and beefy, lightly smoky flavors backed by plenty of blackberries. It has a firm texture suitable for the biggest proteins.
Name: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Temptation Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Superrich aromas and deep saturated fruit and oak flavors make this extremely-full-bodied wine hard to resist. It has spicy smoky beefy aromas, nearly sweet flavors of dried plums, dates and blackberry jam and a mouth-coating texture that leads to a lingering finish.
Name: Michael David 2015 Earthquake Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Richness and ripeness define this extremely flavorful, full-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It overflows with blackberry jam, milk chocolate and maple syrup flavors while an almost thick texture coats the sides of the mouth.
Name: Mikami Vineyards 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Gorgeous ripe, jammy, berry flavors dominate this full-bodied, smooth-textured wine. It smells like blackberries and black cherries, tastes so rich it's almost sweet, and fills the mouth from cheek to cheek with a chocolate-cherry flavor that lingers on the finish.
Name: Saldo 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an expansively rich and layered wine, full bodied and bright in black cherry and blackberry, and with an underlying goodness of graham cracker crumble.
Name: Folie à Deux 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From dry-farmed old vines, this wine is juicy and expansive in richly concentrated fists of dusty blackberry and toffee. There's a welcome lift of freshness on the back palate that lingers on the finish in tones of clove and dark chocolate.
Name: Armida 2015 Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A swirl of smoke, blackberry paste, lavender, rosemary and sagebrush kick off the nose to this reserve bottling. Dried earth, wild red berries and red flowers show on the palate, which is reminiscent of the wines of old California.
Name: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Borden Ranch, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a well-made, full-flavored and firm-textured wine that offers fresh raspberry and cherry aromas, generous flavors and moderate tannins that give a little grip to the mouthfeel. Good balance and a little restraint in ripeness make it especially appealing.
Name: Neyers 2016 Vista Luna Zinfandel (Borden Ranch)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: The nose of this bottling from an old vineyard in Rancho Cucamonga carries aromas of blackberry jelly on wet slate, with a touch of violets. The palate is rich and flavorful, with more blackberry paste, a dusting of cracked pepper and a warm toast tone, framed by decent acidity.
Designation: Lopez Ranch Old Vine De Ambrogio Block Private Reserve
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Lopez Ranch Old Vine De Ambrogio Block Private Reserve Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A beefy, salt-and-pepper flavor complements the fruit components in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine made from Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. It carries blackberry notes on the palate and a good sense of richness.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Field Blend Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has a profusion of mature spicy jammy flavors fueled by lavish oak and very rich ripe fruit. It starts with cedar, vanilla, and maple aromas and continues on the palate with blackberry and milk chocolate flavors carried by a broad texture. It's quite full bodied and moderately tannic.
Name: Renwood 2015 Sea of Grapes Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sturdy and straightforward, this full-bodied dry wine combines the classic brambly, wild-berry aromas with good fruit flavors and moderate tannins. It's a no-nonsense wine that could be enjoyed often.
Name: Renwood 2015 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied cherries, rustic earth aromas and black pepper show on the nose of this bottling from the Zinfandel veterans. Big dark juicy fruits show on the sip alongside savory oregano and sage, but the overall impression is ripeness bordering on sweetness.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Mustard Creek Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: From a brand that's well known for it's Zinfandel, this is a well-structured, moderately tannic wine that's chock full of ripe berry and plum flavors. It's full-bodied, well concentrated and nicely dry, too, which not all Zins are.
Name: Ravenswood 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied red cherry, crushed hibiscus and rose hips float atop a very intriguing mineral streak of flint and crushed granite on the nose of this bottling, which is dedicated to and features the winery's laborers. Bright berry and fruit-punch flavors lead into rocky earth tones on the palate. Great for summer with a chill.
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Heroe Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This lovable hearty red includes 10% Petite Sirah, the grapes pulled from five vineyards across the appellation. Smooth, thick and concentrated, it offers graham cracker, blackberry jam and a presence of dark chocolate.
Name: Armida 2016 PoiZin Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Vivid fruit flavors and a lively texture make this medium-bodied wine very refreshing and mouth-cleansing to sip. It has bright raspberry and ripe blackberry flavors accented by light earthy spicy notes.
Name: Iron Hub 2014 Esola Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromas of chocolate and mint lead to very ripe, almost sweet fruit flavors and a soft, melting texture like that of a dessert wine. It has low acidity and very little tannin. Recommended for after a meal at fireside.
Name: Jessie's Grove 2014 Westwind Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Brambly, wild-berry aromas and generous plum, maple and milk chocolate flavors make a delicious combination in this full-bodied plush-textured wine. It's soothing on the palate and has an almost-sweet finish.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Boysenberry and chocolate flavors flood the taste buds as this full-bodied and broad-textured wine fills the mouth with richness. It tastes lush and ripe, feels smooth and almost soft.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full bodied and very ripe tasting, this bold wine is packed with plum and raisin flavors and supported by moderate tannins that add grip to the texture.
Name: Iron Hub 2014 Clockspring Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling of a Zinfandel rosé is very darkly hued, showing aromas of dark berries, cola and plum. There is decent zip to the sip, with heavy flavors of berry, plum skins and darker spices.
Name: HammerSky 2017 Rosé of Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full bodied and nearly sweet, this very ripe and fruity wine smells like waffles and maple syrup and tastes like strawberries and blackberries. Should be good to pair with salty and spicy dishes.
Name: Zinfandelic 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling of a Zinfandel rosé is very darkly hued, showing aromas of dark berries, cola and plum. There is decent zip to the sip, with heavy flavors of berry, plum skins and darker spices.
Name: HammerSky 2017 Rosé of Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very concentrated aromas of kirsch make for a thick, slightly sweet-smelling entry to this bottling. The palate dries up considerably, showing rose petals, salted plums and dried red cherries.
Name: Grosso Kresser 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This smooth and soft wine is very easy on the palate despite its full body. Not as well structured as the last two vintages, it has low acidity and very little tannin to firm up the ripe plum flavors.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2016 Home Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Plummy aromas meet with thyme and sage on the juicy nose of this bottling from a vineyard near San Diego. It's a bit thin and taut on the sip, with flavors of black tea, boysenberry, pepper and herbs.
Name: Highland Valley 2015 Zinfandel (San Diego County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smooth and mellow, this wine has softly spicy, earthy aromas and ripe mature fruit flavors that pick up a maple syrup note on the finish. The tannins are very light and the texture is very smooth considering the high alcohol level.
Name: Jessie's Grove 2013 Fancy Quest Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reduced on the nose, this tannic wine is tautly wound in oak, its concentrated full-bodied flavors ripe and fleshy in blackberry jam and vanilla.
Name: St. Francis 2015 Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: On the lighter side, this wine is very smooth and flavorful, not very tannic, and easy to drink. It blends good cherry and plum notes with some savory, black-pepper complexity.
Name: The Winery SF 2013 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Intense smoky, meaty aromas lead to thick toast and spice flavors in this full-bodied and very oaky wine. Moderate berry flavors and medium tannins lie underneath the oak.
Name: Brazin 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This extravagantly woody wine has spicy, almost sweet aromas of cedar and pine followed by flavors like strawberry and blackberry jam. The texture is very smooth.
Name: Trinitas 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is earthy and herbal with a persistently tart tannic personality that's hard to crack. Full bodied and ripe, it finishes short and quick.
Name: Willowbrook 2015 Harris-Kratka Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine presents as slightly sweet and unstructured, muddled in pungent earth and leather.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This lightly sweet and light-bodied wine made from Zinfandel grapes has a vivid pink color, muted aromas and candy-like flavors. It's simple and soft in character.
Name: American House Wine 2016 Rosé of Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an organically farmed site managed by go-to viticulturist Phil Coturri, this is a delightfully memorable wine, a mix of blackberry, chocolate and leather that's intensely ripe and robust. Strong in cedar and dried herb accents, it finishes balanced despite its abundance of fruit.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Rossi Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a fantastic, high-elevation site, this wine impresses in its broad, muscular power that settles onto notes of black licorice, black cherry and cocoa powder. While not shy in richness or concentration, it remains fresh from supportive acidity.
Name: Armida 2015 Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A beautiful shade of purplish red, this bottling shows cohesive aromas of black plum, strawberry sorbet, vanilla and nutmeg on the nose. The palate is full, rounded and rich in plum jam flavor, but with enough baking spice and a strong crushed rock minerality to add elegance and intrigue.
Name: Opolo 2016 Mountain Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very distinctive thread of pure fruit flavor winds through this full-bodied wine from the first sip through the lingering finish. It smells like lilac, cloves and blackberry jam and tastes full, rich and ripe, while a layer of fine-grained tannins adds structure. A hint of dark chocolate echoes on the finish.
Name: Renwood 2015 Story Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the famous Sonoma Valley site farmed by the same family since 1895, this includes 6% Alicante Bouschet and a touch of Petite Sirah from nearby Rossi Ranch (another of the producer's vineyard designates). Juicy, broad and likably round and soft, it features a grittiness of black cherry and pomegranate.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has the brambly, wild berry character of Zinfandel in spades. Combine that signature flavor with good balance, medium to full body and a mildly tannic texture, and a well-crafted, distinctive wine is the result. Aged in 40% new French oak, it is not overtly spicy, but finds great flavor balance.
Name: Renwood 2015 Special Reserve Grandpère Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big and bold, this wine gives most people what they want in a Zinfandel—mouth-filling, luscious, palate-drenching berry flavors and good structure, too. Firm tannins and supportive fruit acidity keep the fruit notes from being cloying and help the wine linger nicely on the finish.
Name: Renwood 2015 Indian Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Like a walk through a chaparral thicket, this bottling shows tons of herbal influence, with dried oregano, thyme and sage sprinkled atop tones of red plum and hibiscus. Those herbs also decorate the palate's cranberry core, which also offers a roasted meat flavor.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Snow Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a firmly textured, well-balanced wine that offers aromas of black pepper and grilled beef. The palate brings a fresh blackberry flavor, with a gripping mouthfeel framed by good tannins. Made from 100% Zinfandel, it comes off dry and concentrated. Best after 2023.
Name: Renwood 2015 Jack Rabbit Flat Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This reserve bottling takes some time to open up, but is quite elegant when it arrives. Aromas of muddy earth and dark fruit lead into a dense, lavish palate framed by firm tannins. Red plum and strawberry sorbet flavors rise above the loamy, clay-like elements at the core. Cocoa spice and a soft texture unfold with patience.
Name: Opolo 2015 Forte Reserve Collection Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine offers expansive aromas of lavender and rose on the nose. Ripe plum, fig and cassis mark the softly textured palate, with a rich finish almost like a late-harvest wine.
Name: Andis 2015 Indian Creek Vineyard Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an abundantly earthy wine, full of meat and black and white pepper. Cedar, pencil shavings and big-boned black cherry add to the intrigue, with a hint of black olive and substantial tannin that suggest aging. Enjoy best 2025 through 2028.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the producer's home vineyard in the heart of the appellation, this is dusty in plum, raspberry, black licorice and tobacco, with a lift of floral aromatics and grippy structure. It includes 12% mixed black and white varieties, from Grand Noir to Malvasia.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rich expression of the grape, this single-vineyard bottling shows hearty aromas of black currant and concentrated violets. There is a chalky structure and turned loam minerality to the palate, with Indian spice, pepper and cardamom enhancing the black plum core.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Bailey Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strawberry and raspberry sorbet meet with sweet wood, cherry blossoms, earth and leather on the nose of this reserve bottling. Herbal tones of oregano and marjoram frame the sip, surrounding the framboise and root beer core.
Name: Seven Oxen 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A broad-shouldered, fruit-forward wine with plenty of ripeness, this is blended with a hearty 15% Petite Sirah. Cherry, blackberry, vanilla and peppery cinnamon take turns on the rich, concentrated palate, finishing on an oaky tone.
Name: Napa Cellars 2015 Classic Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Extremely fruity and relatively light in body, this exuberant wine is easy to quaff. The strawberry and cherry flavors are so ripe and fresh they taste sweet, and the texture is soft and full with very little tannin.
Name: The Endless Summer 2014 Montfort Vineyards Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of red currant, alpine strawberry and carnation show on the nose of this bottling from one of the region's Zinfandel pioneers. The palate follows suit, with a juicy blackberry sorbet flavor and a gravelly minerality that are upheld by firm tannins and solid acidity.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Clevenger Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Mixed with small amounts of Syrah and Petite Sirah, this is aged in both French and American oak, and it shows a richly woven palate of grainy leather, tobacco and cedar. The ripe succulent fruit is jammy in blackberry and dark chocolate.
Name: Fogline Vineyards 2014 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 14% Petite Sirah from a planting that dates back to 1904, this wine is smoky in oak and brightly fresh in black cherry and blackberry fruitiness. Focused on the palate, it's robust yet balanced and enjoyable.
Name: Puccioni 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rusty red cherry, dried anise and a hint of carnation show on the nose of this bottling. A rose petal flavor is strong on the lightly bodied palate, where a firm tannic structure and solid acidity frame soft, welcoming flavors of Concord grape and vanilla on the finish.
Name: Seven Oxen 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site planted in 1934, and blended with 4% Carignan, this is an earthy pungent wine that is concentrated and approachable. Tobacco, dark cherry and dried herb mingle well along a velvety smooth palate of full-bodied ripeness.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Papera Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plum jelly, sarsaparilla and cola aromas show on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is great freshness and liveliness to the palate, where white pepper spices up the grenadine flavors.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Especial Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: From vines planted in the late 1800s, this offers cigar box, raspberry, cranberry and cherry aromas and focused cranberry, plum and raspberry flavors. It's spot-on for the variety.
Name: The Pines 1852 2016 Old Vines The Pines Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
