Description: A robust component of smoky aromas and flavors give a large personality to this concentrated, ripe and extremely full-bodied wine. It practically spills over with juicy blackberry and boysenberry flavors, and has a full but sleek mouthfeel backed by mild tannins.
Name: Andis 2014 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Muted aromatics lead to soft, thick layers of rounded black cherry and blackberry, with moderate structure and ripeness in check. Vanilla and chocolate flavors contribute additional richness.
Name: Kunde 2014 Heritage Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This gentle giant is full flavored, soft and expansive on the palate and not at all tannic. It's easy to appreciate the ripe strawberry and brown-sugar aromas, rich and slightly sweet fruit flavors lightly accented by oak spice, and plush mouthfeel.
Name: Andis 2013 Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Candied red fruit, mace and nutmeg show on the familiar nose of this bottling, which includes 20% Petite Sirah. It's quite ripe and seemingly sweet on the palate, which is full bodied with smooth tannins and a soft acidity.
Name: Lorimar 2014 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied strawberry and nutmeg aromas make for a very inviting entry to the nose of this rich bottling. It's very hedonistic on the palate, where vibrant red fruit and cinnamon flavors meet with fresh fennel. The alcohol is well hidden, but it does become sweeter as it opens up.
Name: Seven Angels 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: There's lots of sweet-seeming spicy oak in this full-bodied wine, yet it also has a good core of ripe blackberry and plum to keep it in balance. Moderate tannins and a mouth-filling texture give it heft.
Name: Klinker Brick 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied black-currant and licorice spice aromas meet with loamy soil and sarsaparilla on the nose of this wine, which is a tad overextracted. Cooked blueberry and prune flavors show on the sip alongside roasted chocolate and charred meat.
Name: Truth & Valor 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Extremely fruity and relatively light in body, this exuberant wine is easy to quaff. The strawberry and cherry flavors are so ripe and fresh they taste sweet, and the texture is soft and full with very little tannin.
Name: Rolling Plains 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Heavily influenced by spicy oak, this wine smells like maple syrup and blackberry jam, tastes like ginger cookies, and is a touch sweet.
Name: Carol Shelton 2016 Piazza Ranch Old Vine Pizazz Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is stewy in black cherry and baked plum, with a density of big ripeness and oak. The finish has a dash of black pepper on offer.
Name: The Lost Chapters 2013 Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's raspberry and cranberry aromas seem slightly dried out, with plenty of baking spice notes from 20 months in 65% new European and American oak. The full-bodied red fruit flavors finish tart.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Vineyard Series Painted Hills Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a beautifully polished, full-flavored wine from the producer of The Prisoner. It has a captivating, velvety texture, mouthfilling blackberry and black-cherry flavors and a warm coating of perfumed but subtle oak permeating from the first whiff to the lingering finish.
Name: Saldo 2015 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, enormously flavorful wine offers potent blueberry and blackberry flavors and a sturdy tannic texture. A slight sense of reserve from the fine-grained tannins and good acidity make it especially appetizing and protein friendly.
Name: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Fresh and earthy, despite a complete embrace of ripeness, this complex red is lovely and memorable in a constructed blur of dried herb, wild strawberry and vanilla. The oak is integrated and supportive, helping to echo a delightful nuance of white pepper.
Name: Grgich Hills 2013 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: It's great to find a big dry wine like this that has good structure without giving up the expansive berry flavors that Zin does so well. The aromas are potent with ultraripe blackberry and black cherry, then the mouthfeel has good gripping tannins for a lip-smacking finish.
Name: Peter Franus 2014 Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Stewy, meaty and juicy, this wine is fleshy and expansive on the palate, with deft touches of smoke, black cherry and berry pie. Seasoned throughout is a classical layering of black pepper and cinnamon that keeps it fresh and spicy.
Name: Peter Franus 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This lovely, balanced red is from vines estimated to be between 90- and 100-years old, and made in tiny amounts. Baked berry, cherry and plum flavors wrap around bright mineral undertones and focused acidity. The texture is taut in grainy tannins, while the oak is subtle and supportive.
Name: Cellars 33 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky barbecue and stewed plums give this wine a robust rustic edge that works within its larger context of complexity. Meaty, it's smooth and grippy, with lingering notes of tobacco leaf and cedar.
Name: August Briggs 2014 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Subtle oak aromas, layered fruit and spice flavors and a creamy texture make this wine a standout. While full bodied, it feels gentle and rich on the palate, and slowly unleashes more raspberry, blackberry, mint and vanilla with each sip.
Name: Iron Hub 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Appealing aromas of spice, cranberry, raspberry and candy bar lead to rich, full bodied, ripe fruit flavors that completely coat the palate. The listed alcohol level pushes the upper reaches but it maintains its balance extremely well. If you're looking for a delicious, hedonistic interpretation of this variety, look no further.
Name: Two Vintners 2015 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a bold, seriously fruity and distinctive wine. It combines lots of rich blackberry and boysenberry flavors with a texture that's firm enough to bring good balance while staying very smooth. It has moderate fine-grained tannins and full body.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Neal Vineyard Zinfandel (Fair Play)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumed in smoky char, this is a sizable, high-octane red wine, smooth and succulent on the palate with highlights of spicy cinnamon, black pepper and cedar. It conjures up notions of strawberry pie.
Name: Martinelli 2015 Vigneto di Evo Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruit-forward and robustly ripe, this vineyard-designate offers dark strawberry flavors and slight complements of lavender, leather, cedar and smoke. It's full bodied, grippy and succulent from start to finish.
Name: Muscardini 2014 Los Chamizal Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is full bodied and silky, bringing lots of jammy fruit flavors, generous vanilla and black pepper while remaining very smooth and deceptively light on the palate. Tannins and acidity stay in the background to let a creamy sensation come through.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Smoky and earthy, this wine has an underlying vegetal character that works against its old-vine, grippy and full-bodied nature. Smoky char, pencil and black-cherry and berry flavors add to the well-made whole.
Name: August Briggs 2014 Old Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is 100% varietal and aged only in older French oak. Restrained, it offers funky compost aromas and a pervasive sense of mineral earthiness. Structured, it's expansive on the palate with supportive, tight-grained tannin and savory elements of cedar and black pepper. It should do well with aging; enjoy best 2020 through 2024.
Name: Dashe Cellars 2014 Louvau Vineyard Old Vines Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This polished wine has enticing aromas of vanilla and almond, rich flavors that combine ripe blackberries with mild baking spices, and a creamy, layered feeling on the palate. It's supersmooth and enjoyable.
Name: Ivory and Burt 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Sweet juicy red and black berries show a briary brambly side that makes this wine soft and integrated in its richness and undeniable ripeness. Black pepper and shocks of cinnamon complement the fruit.
Name: August Briggs 2014 Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This robust, hearty estate wine is blended with 7% Petite Sirah, 3% Syrah, 1% Petit Verdot and 1% other red varieties. While rustic on the nose nose, it's palate is juicy and tannic, offering baked blackberry, leather and tobacco flavors.
Name: Ballentine 2015 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big-boned wine works a lot of spicy, complex oak flavors into its potent blackberry and dark chocolate base, while firm tannins add to its structure and grippy mouthfeel. It's bold and dry, for drinkers who like a little bite in their wine.
Name: Cabana Wines 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Rustic tones of earth and wood meet smooth, seductive layers of vibrant strawberry and blackberry jam dipped in milk chocolate. This is full in body and rich in feel.
Name: Girard 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Generous fruit flavors make this wine a standout. There is very little new oak influence, and who needs it when the blueberry, blackberry and raspberry notes are so delicious and layered? A creamy texture and lingering finish complete the picture.
Name: Plungerhead 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a well-known site in the heart of the appellation, this wine is tight and tannic, offering robust layers of leather, tobacco, toasted oak, black licorice and dust tones. There's also an earthy element that works well with lingering cedar and black pepper notes.
Name: The Hidden Gallery 2015 Unti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Very ripe and saturated in flavor, this wine lives up to its name and velvet-finish label. It is full bodied, mouthfilling and nicely viscous in texture. Late harvest and dried-fruit flavors like raisins and prunes dominate the aroma and palate, while moderate tannins and acidity liven it up a bit. A sense of richness helps all that flavor linger on the finish.
Name: Big Smooth 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reduced, this wine is densely concentrated and thick in tannin and oak. Structured to age, it offers an abundance of blackberry, cherry and cured meat, with a lasting imprint of smoky char.
Name: Cast 2014 Watson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Baked earth, mocha and vanilla characterize this field blend of 90% Zinfandel with a rough mix of 10% Mourvèdre, Charbono and Carignan. Robust on the palate with a textured mouthfeel, it's full-bodied with bright, underlying acidity and black peppery finish.
Name: Peter Franus 2014 Brandlin Vineyard Zinfandel (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is aged in American oak for 10 months. It offers a commingling of strawberry jam, tree bark, black pepper and smoky flavors set on a brawny, rich palate.
Name: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Sin Zin Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pruney dried fruit dominates on the nose of this wine, which is smoothly textured and roundly rich. Black cherry and mocha ride up against a worthy foundation of dried herb and cedar herbaceousness.
Name: Dashe Cellars 2014 Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A bare-knuckled punch of barnyard compost gives this wine an earthy edginess straightaway as bright, lively acidity builds up on the palate to support red fruit and licorice flavors. Medium-toned in ripeness and structure, this is a nice spicy well-integrated wine.
Name: David Clinton 2015 Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Medium bodied and moderately pink in color, this wine is fleshy and creamy on the palate, with body to spare. Cherry and raspberry flavors highlight the experience.
Name: Hawley 2017 Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Gutsy and structured, this wine has more grip than many of its peers, as firm tannins underpin an abundance of black cherry and raspberry flavors. It is concentrated, has enjoyable layers of fruit and good balance.
Name: Writer's Block 2015 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Description: Aromas of candied strawberry and cherry jelly bean meet with elegant touches of nutmeg and baking spice on the nose of this bottling. Those elements are nicely woven on the palate, where red currant mixes with mint and fennel frond.
Name: The Blending Lab 2015 Z Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Focused fruit flavors and very little oak influence make this a straight-shooter of a wine. It has appealing blackberry and raspberry aromas, rich berry flavors and a smooth texture with just a nip of tannin to balance all the fruitiness.
Name: Ben Ish 2016 Ben's Select Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromas like toasted nuts and dried leaves precede ripe plum and prune flavors while a full body and a welcomed layer of fine-grained tannins lift the palate impression. It's a slightly different take on the varietal.
Name: Victor Vineyards 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Peppery, smoky oak influences dominate the aromas and flavors of this dramatic, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. It adds beefy, grilled herb nuances to underlying blackberry fruit for a bold and appealing profile.
Name: Castle Rock 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine has earthy, mineral, petrol aromas and black pepper flavors for an untamed personality. Oak nuances lend a hint of sweetness, and a firm texture features good, grippy tannins.
Name: Grayson 2016 Lot 12 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoothly textured and offering surprisingly lively acidity, this robust, intensely ripe red is brooding in dark berry, cola and chocolate flavor, the whole aged just over a year in American oak. The oak adds a sweetness of vanilla.
Name: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Redemption Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This chewy-textured wine has a high level of oak flavor that registers as a sweet-seeming enticing spiciness. Aromas of vanilla and cedar lead to maple syrup, wood smoke and nutmeg flavors that blanket the ripe fruit flavors underneath.
Name: Big Six 2015 Whiskey Bourbon Barrel Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-purple fruit, brown sugar and sweet wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers elderberry jam with dried herbs, riding a slightly sticky structure.
Name: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Jammy flavors and a sense of sweetness are appealing in this full-bodied, ripe and rich wine. It is expansive on the palate, light in tannins and brings a little heat on the finish.
Name: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Baked bread aromas ride alongside velvety thick layers of black cherry, licorice and vanilla in this robust full-bodied wine from the long-farmed site.
Name: David Clinton 2015 Ancient Vine Teldeschi Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Intensely concentrated and leathery, this is a full-bodied and ripely rich red, showing a wealth of bold black licorice, toasted oak and meat.
Name: Madrigal 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a well-made, value-priced wine with plenty of juicy berry flavors, accented by caramel and vanilla. It is mouthfilling, not-quite sweet and very easy to sip, with a smooth texture.
Name: McManis 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: With a semisweet balance and loads of chocolate flavors, this wine is more of a dessert than a dinner wine. The aromas are packed with blackberry jam and raspberry syrup, while the flavors are lush and sweet and the texture soft.
Name: OZV 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Charred cedar is strong on the nose of this bottling along with sweet black cherry aromas. The palate is also very woody, with damp forest and pine oil flavors overcoming the tangy red fruit.
Name: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very ripe and fruity, and quite sweet, this full-bodied wine oozes blueberry and blackberry jam, and feels soft and luscious. The sugar element is high enough to relegate this wine to dessert.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2015 Rogers Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a small 40-year-old site in the appellation, this wine presents as stewy and overly ripe in ways that don't complement. Plum and leather poke through sizable sticky tannin.
Name: Fallon Place 2015 Landa Vineyard Zinfandel (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bourbon barrel-aged expression shows stewed red fruits, dried ginger and mace spice on the nose. The palate starts smooth, plush and full but then the extremely powerful acidity is almost painful, leading into a vanilla and white-chocolate finish.
Name: Paso Ranches 2015 Bourbon Barrel Aged 3 Months Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An overt, almost raw oakiness overwhelms the grape flavors in this full-bodied, tannic and tight wine. It smells strongly like cedar and toasted oak, tastes spicy and woody, and feels astringent on the palate.
Name: 2Plank 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of vanilla, cherry cough syrup and spice. The sweet fruit and spice flavors show a lot of warmth.
Name: Roza Ridge 2015 Zinfandel (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is one of the most blatantly oaky on the market. Smelling like Lapsang Souchong tea, which is smoked over pine wood, and tasting like burnt toast, it's oddly fun to taste but way over the top for most people.
Name: Predator 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There are the typical rich aromas of blackberry pastry and black plum on the nose of this Zinfandel, but also a flowery elegance and savory hints of char. The palate is quite interesting, with powerful cracked pepper, dried herb and charred wood decorating the pure black plum backdrop and a long caramelized finish. A compelling take on Zin.
Name: Labyrinth 2015 Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spicy bramble berry aromas are lifted and pure on the nose of this wine, riding over an earthy core of pressed violets and Mediterranean scrub. There's energy to the moderately full palate, with vibrant acidity cutting through juicy red and black berry flavors. Orange rind and tense granite tones provide further intrigue, with soft, integrated tannins giving structure.
Name: Tenute Chiaromonte 2012 Riserva Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Zinfandel from Bailey Ranch, Will's Hills and Osgood Farms offers aromas of dark strawberry, black cherry and a dusty baked-earth minerality. The dark black fruit is prominent on the sip, where richness is central to the experience, with hints of dried marjoram giving depth and a rising acidity on the finish.
Name: Thacher 2014 Triumvirate Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Vibrant in aromas of spicy cherry, blackberry and wild mint, this Primitivo sees no time in oak, opting for aging in cement tanks. This translates to pure fruit expression on the palate, showing juicy red cherry and strawberry, with flecks of spice, earth and crushed stone adding nuance to the medium-length finish. Lithe in feel, but with proper tannic grip, this is a savory and enticing expression of the variety.
Name: Rivera 2015 Triusco  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite impressive for the entry level Zin, this bottling by brewer-turned-winemaker Sherman Thacher shows black currant, loamy soil, vanilla and licorice on the nose. The palate is rounded with black-cherry flavors and minty herbs, proving a cohesive experience.
Name: Thacher 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Sourced from the clay soils of the Montevella Vineyard, this Primitivo sees no time in oak, yet brims with complexities. Bergamot, cedar oil and moist earth aromas ride over a core of dense blackberry. These notes echo on the full-bodied palate, balanced by vibrant acidity and an energizing mineral vein that lingers on and on.
Name: Polvanera 2013 17 Vigneto Montevella Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This iconic Primitivo from winemaker Gianfranco Fino delivers in its dense aromas of spiced cranberry, blackberry, violets and tilled earth. There's weight and intensity to the palate in all aspects, from the punchy, juicy berry and dark plum flavors to the racing acidity and bracing tannins. Time in the cellar to soften the sharp edges will reward with the already developing complexities. Drink from 2022.
Name: Gianfranco Fino 2015 Es Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a pleasing richness to this wine in its aromas of ripe dark cherry, blackberry and tobacco leaf. The palate brings oak tones that are well-integrated with the juicy dark fruit flavors, the medium-grained, grippy tannins and vibrant acidity offer solid support.
Name: Concura 2013 Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine is brooding in dense cherry and red plum aromas, peppered with notes of herbs and violets. The palate is broad, bright, juicy red and black fruit flavors and lively acidity are balanced by the bolstering tannins.
Name: Tenute Chiaromonte 2014 Muro Sant'Angelo Contrada Barbatto Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Sourced from the clay and limestone soils of the Marchesana Vineyard, this Primitivo is earthy in aromas of tilled earth, pressed violets and Mediterranean scrub. With no time in oak, the palate is transparent in its juicy bramble fruit intensity, with additional floral and herb notes imparting interest. A rich feel, balanced by bright acidity and integrated tannins make this immediately appealing.
Name: Polvanera 2013 14 Vigneto Marchesana Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Savory herb and game aromas ride over a core of spiced cranberry and cherry in this wine. There's nice weight and tension, offering a balance of juicy red fruit flavors, earthy tones and lively acidity. Medium-grained tannins lend plenty of support.
Name: Masseria Altemura 2014 Altemura  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a surprising intensity to the aromas of fresh blackberries, turned earth and violets. The palate mirrors the nose in a package of grippy tannins and crisp acidity. While enjoyably straightforward in nature, the concentration is rather light, so enjoy for its immediate appeal.
Name: A Mano 2015 Imprint Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A mix of jammy red and black berries mix with Mediterranean herbs and violets on the nose. Despite the weighty alcohol, the palate maintains a nice balance of rich berry fruit cut with juicy acidity.
Name: Tenute Chiaromonte 2015 Nigredo Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Red cherry and blackberry aromas meld with snippets of baking spice and menthol on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is firm, with structured tannins and crisp acidity, housing juicy berry flavors dotted with red floral tones. Dark plum rounds out the finish.
Name: Tormaresca 2015 Torcicoda Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fresh and floral on the nose, the palate is ripe in red berry flavors, balanced by streaks of granite. Vibrant acidity helps cut through some of the fruit weight. This is simplistic but easy to glug.
Name: A Mano 2016 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Jammy red fruit aromas mix with floral and sweet spice undertones on the nose. Medium in weight, with gentle acidity, the palate bursts with red berry flavors and notes of anise and mint.
Name: Leone de Castris 2016 Villa Santera  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A wealth of oak tones—wood, vanilla and cocoa—ride over a core of cherry jam. The full-bodied palate follows suit, with pillowy tannins and mild acidity giving just enough support. The oak sticks out a bit, but beneath that layer is a rich fruity core.
Name: San Marzano 2014 Annivesario 62 Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a density to the nose and palate that can't be ignored, which translates to a syrupy aroma and thick palate. There are some uplifting tones of herbs and savory cherry that offer levity, with brisk acidity and bolstering tannins giving support.
Name: San Marzano 2013 Sessantanni Old Vines  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fresh red- and black-berry aromas are underscored by tilled earth on the nose. The palate is similar in character, boasting a ripe and juicy feel, with medium weight, light tannins and soft acidity. Drink now.
Name: Conti Zecca 2016 Donna Marzia Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's an intriguing levity to the nose of this this wine in its pressed violet, mint and wild strawberry aromas. Medium in weight, with solid tannic grip, the palate offers more of the same, yet ends on a chalky, mineral finish.
Name: Tenute Chiaromonte 2015 Elè Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe red berries and violets are fresh and light on the nose. A juicy, medium-bodied palate of blackberry and racy cranberry flavors shows good concentration, with floral accents that dot the finish.
Name: San Marzano 2016 Il Pumo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's plenty to enjoy about this lighter-than-average Primitivo. It's ripe and spicy, with a strong showing of bramble berries and anise. A soft, pliable feel make it immediately appealing.
Name: San Marzano 2013 Talò  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Red berry jam aromas meld with fresh raspberry and baking spice on the nose. The palate is light in feel, with ripe juicy berry flavors struck against a dry, chalky finish.
Name: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2013 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spiced red-berry aromas meet shades of herbs and sarsaparilla on the nose. Sandy tannins and bright acidity provide the backbone for a medium-bodied palate of tart red fruit and savory herbs.
Name: Castello Monaci 2015 Pilùna Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Jammy red-fruit aromas linger under a blanket of oak-driven coffee in this wine. The palate mirrors the aromas, yet the creeping acidity and medium-grained tannins offer a nice counterbalance.
Name: Masseria Altemura 2014 Sasseo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Jammy red berry aromas and flavors mix with grilled herbs and are grounded by a sanguine vein. Medium in weight and structure, the acidity starts off soft but builds on the midpalate, offering a bit a levity on the finish.
Name: La Fiera 2016 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Saucy plum and cherry syrup aromas turn brighter and cleaner on the medium-bodied palate. A bit of sweet spice kicks in on the midpalate, but ultimately this is primary, soft in feel and straightforward.
Name: Felline 2015  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Easygoing, primary aromas of strawberry and raspberry jam take center stage on the nose and palate. This is light in feel and juicy in profile, ending on a dry, cranberry skin finish.
Name: Tenute Chiaromonte 2015 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Baked berry and sweet spice aromas dominate the nose, while toasted oak tones arise on the palate. Medium in weight and light in concentration, crisp acidity keeps this refreshing, but short.
Name: Cantele 2015 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Dark, jammy fruit aromas are at the core of this otherwise oak-driven wine. Baking spice flavors of vanilla and cocoa powder are prominent and not entirely integrated with the baked fruit character. Medium weight and soft acidity make this an easy-drinking sipper.
Name: Concura 2016 Fasi Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: There's a great deal of oak covering the red berry aromas on the nose. The medium-bodied palate shows a bit more integration, melding dark cherry and blackberry flavors with baking spice.
Name: Layer Cake 2015 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: From a historic site planted in 1905, this impressive wine is defined by well-crafted layers of black pepper, tomato leaf and blackberry. Its sizable length and breadth is laced in cinnamon spice and ample acidity that reins it in from becoming overdone.
Name: Mike and Molly Hendry 2015 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is aged in American oak and blended with 12% Petite Sirah. Concentrated blackberry fruit rides a foundation of soft, silky and well-integrated succulence, with touches of leather saddle, black pepper, smoke and brick. While full bodied, it manages to drink light on its feet.
Name: Pedroncelli 2015 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from older vines, this vineyard-designate wine is seductive on the nose in a rose petal aroma. Restrained in oak, the palate is structured and vibrant in flavors of dark cherry, raspberry, black licorice and chocolate.
Name: Williams Selyem 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a standout wine that tastes ripe and full, but also has good balance, a polished texture and a wonderful sense of layering and finesse. Blueberry, blackberry and dark chocolate waft from the glass and equally generous flavors coat the palate, propelled by a velvety layer of fine-grained tannins and full body.
Name: Portalupi 2015 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a big flavor-packed wine made from some of Lodi's oldest vines. It's quite deep in color, very fruity in aroma, full in body and with nice depth to the ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors. Accents of black pepper and clove emerge with each sip, while the wine has enough tannin and more than enough body to give a good sense of heft.
Name: Jessie's Grove 2013 Royal Tee Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Full bodied and nicely dry, this well-built wine starts with smoky black-pepper aromas that lead to mouthfilling blackberry and black-cherry flavors supported by firm tannins. It's the kind of wine that will pair beautifully with a meaty or cheesy meal, because it has the texture to match that kind of richness.
Name: Paris Valley Road 2014 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Saturated with dark, almost jammy fruit flavors, this is an extremely flavorful and nicely dry wine that also has great structure. An intensely dark color leads to blackberry and boysenberry aromas, distinctive blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a rich mouthfeel that is well-laced by fine-grained tannins.
Designation: Old Vine Family Farmed Sustainably Grown
Name: Artezin 2016 Old Vine Family Farmed Sustainably Grown Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a real standout wine from the Sobon family—established as winemakers in Amador County in 1977. The wine is ripe, full bodied, firmly structured and dry. It starts with whiffs of white and black pepper and aromas, carrying to the juicy palate of blackberry and cedar flavors, with soft tannins offering a mouthcoating feel.
Name: Sobon Estate 2015 ReZerve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A big wine that's unabashedly oaky, this one sports a delicious, spicy, toasty, and lightly smoky character from the first whiff through the densely packed flavors and then continues to linger on the finish. The texture is dense, soothingly tannic, and coats the tongue and sides of the mouth with spiciness as well as ripe berry and new leather accents.
Name: Peltier 2015 Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a vineyard that is increasingly establishing its prominence, fruit-forward aromas of plum, boysenberry, dried herb, spice and moist earth are followed by saturated sumptuous blue and red-fruit flavors. It's undeniable in its appeal at a price that can't be beat.
Name: Casa Smith 2015 Porcospino Northridge Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An aroma like white pepper and damp earth leads to brawny fruit flavors in this full-bodied, concentrated and complex wine made from a grape variety genetically identical to Zinfandel, but often with slightly different flavors. It has a good firm texture, attractive balance for a wine of its size, and a lingering finish.
Name: Brutocao 2013 Contento Vineyard Estate Bottled Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 8% Petite Sirah, this is a velvety herbaceous wine with earthy undertones that presents as both rustic and refined. Leathery black pepper meets mushroom and cedar as the medium-ripe flavors lead to a juicy finish.
Name: Dashe Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine, from a vineyard first planted in the 1860s, has good balance an a distinctive flavor profile, as meaty earthy nuances vie for attention with delicious plummy flavors and a broad, rather soft texture. Full body gives the wine a little grip on the palate in lieu of heavy tannins.
Name: Noceto 2013 OGP The Original Grandpère Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a traditional dry, full-bodied and well-balanced Zin that's made to go with a hearty meal. Ripe but not sweet boysenberry flavors are shaded with mineral, wood smoke and light baking spice accents, while firm tannins lend grip to the mouthfeel.
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine has a puckering sensibility of tannin on entry but settles in the glass to show a fresh core of strawberry, black cherry, cedar and soy. The oak is buttery and spicy, good at playing a supporting role to the density of mountain-grown high-toned fruit.
Name: Heitz 2013 Ink Grade Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Attractive and focused raspberry and black-cherry flavors fill out this medium-bodied wine. The aromas are fruity, with touches of clove and cinnamon, while the flavors are clean, pure and delicious. The wine has just enough tannin to firm up the texture, along with good acidity for balance. Drink now or hold through 2022.
Name: Bella Grace 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Peppery, this old-vine wine is well integrated and thickly restrained, with a lip-smacking taste of blackberry cobbler and dark chocolate. Gritty tannins give it texture and ample weight, while a freshness of acidity persists.
Name: Dashe Cellars 2015 Todd Brothers Ranch Old Vines Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A touch of smoky, spicy oak flavor gives this ripe and berry-soaked wine a nice twist of complexity. It has strawberry and boysenberry aromas, and full, almost jammy, flavors riding on a smooth texture that shows soft tannins.
Name: Sobon Estate 2016 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Nice depth and breadth come together in this richly packed, fruity and full-bodied wine. There's a hint of freshly baked bread in the aroma along with ripe plum and blackberry, while an almost jammy richness spreads across the palate and lingers on the finish.
Name: XYZin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Full of yummy, ripe plum, boysenberry and black-pepper flavors, this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine is a great value. It's very mouth filling, soothing and delicious and has a deep color, lush and fruity aromas and soft tannins on the palate.
Name: LangeTwins 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked meat, dried mint and roasted black plums combine for a complex sense of elegance on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are cohesive yet varied, with black currant, violet and roasted beef, upheld by tannins that are soft yet steady, with a growing presence toward the finish.
Name: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is thick and sinewy, ripe and soft in texture. Spicy clove, pepper and cinnamon highlight a richness of strawberry puree and mocha chocolate flavor, the oak subdued in the background.
Name: Bailarin 2015 Love Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Graham cracker and vanilla wafer aromas entice on the nose. This is a ripe, dense wine which boasts a sinewy backdrop of leather among a broad expanse of rich fruit flavors. A cinnamon note lingers on the finish.
Name: Gallo Signature Series 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dark but friendly fruit flavors seem to saturate this medium-bodied wine, showing admirable concentration on the palate and good length on the aftertaste. Blueberry, boysenberry and mild spices give it lots to like. The wine is 100% varietal and has a firm texture without obvious tannins.
Name: Bella Grace 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very ripe, Port-like flavors and a big but soft presence on the palate give a bold personality to this full-bodied wine. It's deep and concentrated in berry and raisin flavors that are layered and delicious, squeezing dark chocolate and mint between them.
Name: Shooting Star 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors push through a firm and tannic texture in this medium to full-bodied wine from a new brand and a French-born winemaker. It's distinctively lean in mouthfeel due to substantive tannin content, but in the aromas and on the finish, an abundance of berries and dark spices comes through.
Name: Omen 2015 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Seductive in black raspberry, this wine has sizable walls of tannin to burst through and is hugely concentrated in cherry cola and an herbaceous streak. Interlaced acidity saves the day and keeps it relatively fresh in the glass.
Name: Enkidu 2014 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Baked leather rides over flavors of black licorice and pepper in this perfumed, older vine wine. Gritty in texture, it's full bodied and densely packed in tannin, with a streak of acidity that keeps it fresh in underlying strawberry and cherry cola.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a taut sinewy wine, generous in oak, with a bite of powerful ripeness. Cherry cola, vanilla and biscuit add richness to the flavor profile, with streaks of black pepper and cinnamon chiming in.
Name: Titus 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has more concentration than average, adding accents of black pepper and smoke to the varietal's famously fruity flavors. The texture is nicely firm, having support from moderate tannins, so it invites a pairing with substantial proteins.
Name: Wilderotter 2014 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from a field-blended vineyard planted in 1995. Ripe, juicy and dusty, it's a well-integrated wine that holds its high level of succulence and concentration well, showing a sweetness of vanilla oak that's nicely offset by black pepper and leather accents.
Name: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Conte Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Eucalyptus, Bay leaf and mint figure in prominently to the nose of this wine, an herbaceous expression of the variety that's sinewy in thick blackberry, almost to a syrupy level. From head-trained older vines, it retains that mix of fruit and earth to the powerful end.
Name: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Paradise Lane Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Hints of vanilla bean and maple bar in the aroma make this full-bodied wine seem more sweet than it is, because it responds on the palate with mouth-filling fruit, moderately firm acidity and tannins. It finishes nicely dry, quite fruity and generous.
Name: Dancing Bull 2015 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine packs in ripe dark-fruit flavors of blackberry and boysenberry, and has smoky oaky accents to add some welcome complexity. Adding in 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2% Malbec and 2% Merlot accounts for some of that complexity. The wine is concentrated and mouth filling in texture without being too tannic.
Name: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Oozing with blackberry jam aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine has a very rich, lightly sweet mouthfeel, tons of blackberry and boysenberry on the palate and a toasty, spicy, lingering finish.
Name: OZV 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: There's an intriguing blend of candied cherry and rosewater reduction on the nose of this bottling, which includes 5% Syrah, along with sweet bay leaf and fennel. Red currants and cranberries show on the sip, lifted by caramelized sage and pepper dust.
Name: Avensole 2013 Aventura Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This attractive medium-bodied wine has dried cherry and plum aromas, late-picked fruit flavors and a fairly smooth texture. It has subtle, spicy, tea-like nuances that add complexity.
Name: Sierra Starr 2014 Old Clone Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Richly developed flavors of dark chocolate, pretzel, leather and cedar with dried herb mark this big darkly concentrated wine, that is substantial in tannin.
Name: Tin Barn 2014 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and earthy aromas of red and black cherries meet with loamy soil, crushed rocks and rusty earth on the nose of this bottling. Meaty flavors show on the palate alongside gravel, tangy black plum and a hint of anise, with a decent tannic structure carrying roasted coffee bean flavors into the finish.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is frosted with a chocolaty character from oak, and has ripe plush fruit flavors underneath. The spicy cocoa-like oakiness also has a smoky tinge.
Name: Sobon Estate 2014 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is very fruity, concentrated and saturated in terms of flavor and rich and broad in texture. The tannins are quite soft and acidity low so It seems mouth-filling but not heavy on the palate.
Name: Sobon Estate 2015 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Complexity is the hallmark of this medium-bodied, organically grown wine that smells like cedar and new leather and tastes like tamarind and raspberries. It has more vivid acidity than usual, and a lively gripping texture.
Name: Briceland 2014 Ishi Pishi Ranch Zinfandel (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a very pleasant, smooth and ripe-tasting wine that glides across the palate and spreads a jammy blackberry flavor to the corners of the mouth. It's soft in terms of acidity and tannins and has a sensation of sweetness from its ripeness.
Name: Identified 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very ripe fruit flavors like raisins and dried plums give this full-bodied wine a high concentration factor, while moderate tannins add more heft to the texture. It has a mouth-filling richness, high alcohol and a jammy character that lingers on the finish.
Name: Russian Ridge 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Opulent, very ripe fruit flavors fill this wine to the brim, from the aromas of strawberry jam to flavors of blackberry syrup. It's full bodied but light on tannins, so the mouthfeel is lush and soft.
Name: Longvale 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pruney raisin and plum aromas and flavors are met by fruit-forward notions of blackberry jam and cherry, providing a generosity of ripe fruit. Spicy cinnamon and dusty tannin accent the full-bodied concentration and simple finish.
Name: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Kirsch, caramel, maraschino cherries and hickory smoke make for a pleasing if somewhat sweet nose. Alpine strawberry and stewed raspberry show on the palate, which is fruity and flavorful if somewhat simple. Caramel pops on the finish.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2015 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is generous in flavor, a touch soft in texture and has a bit of sweetness to round off any rough edges. It smells jammy and tastes like blackberries drizzled with maple syrup, while any tannins are softened by the ripeness and body.
Name: Caricature 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Lots of fresh dark-fruit flavor and a silky texture make this wine easy to sip and enjoy. Touches of spiciness and milk chocolate give it a sweet edge, and the tannins are soft on the palate.
Name: Gen5 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Extremely fruity jammy aromas and flavors ride a soft juicy texture in this smooth easy-drinking wine. It's low in tannins and acidity, and has a sweet accent like maple syrup.
Name: Hunted 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Extremely fruity jammy aromas and flavors ride a soft juicy texture in this smooth easy-drinking wine. It's low in tannins and acidity, and has a sweet accent like maple syrup.
Name: Hunted 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a well-behaved wine that should please a crowd with its easygoing plummy flavors, smooth texture and soft acidity. It's medium-bodied and fresh-tasting.
Designation: Front Row Earth Zin and Fire
Name: Jessie's Grove 2013 Front Row Earth Zin and Fire Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fruity and flowery aromas of black cherry soda, dried strawberry and hibiscus show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is somewhat thin, with flavors of berry jam, anise and a pinch of thyme.
Name: Clos La Chance 2015 Reserve Primitivo (Central Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a very smooth, gentle wine, offering plenty of lush strawberry and cherry in the aroma and flavor while not going overboard in body. It feels supple and lightly sweet on the palate, and has very mild tannins.
Name: Zinsane 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Wood smoke aromas and flavors give a spicy edge to this full-bodied, moderately tannic and perhaps slightly sweet wine. A toasted oak element is behind the smokiness, and it provides good counterpoint against the almost syrupy fruit flavors.
Name: Nine North Wine Company 2014 Hullabaloo Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A very strong and spicy oak aroma leaps from the glass, and the same dramatic smoke and chocolate element dominates the flavors of this full-bodied wine to the point that any fruity aspects are very muted.
Name: Jessie's Grove 2012 Vintner's Choice Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a delicate spicy wine despite its robust ripeness and brawny underside. Compost and brambly brush combine with blackberry and an undeniably delicious streak of white pepper, making for a complex, complete wine that's enjoyable from start to finish.
Name: Hendry 2014 Blocks 7 and 22 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny and expansive in dusty minerality, this dry wine is velvety thick and floral in violet aromas. Blackberry, cherry and an herbal undercurrent of menthol work together seamlessly to provide complexity and bold swathes of persistent flavor.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Montafi Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This potent red begins with rich blueberry and cherry fruit paired with ample barrel flavors evoking caramel, coffee and dark chocolate. Young, tight and focused, it may be enjoyed immediately (if decanted), or cellared for up to a decade. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Sineann 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a brawny leathery red with voluptuous black fruit and a taste of black pepper. Grippy, it offers plenty of structure and complexity to suggest long-term enjoyment, and is a good versatile call for the table.
Name: Ousterhout 2012 Bradford Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite lovely aromas of rose petals, raspberry framboise, gravel, baked earth, vanilla and caramel show on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is an intriguing peppery spice and herbal character of thyme, bay leaf and oregano on the sip, all set against a backdrop of exotic cherry.
Name: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 12% Petite Sirah, this old-vine wine is dominated by candied plum on the nose and mouth, with additional notes of ripe black fruits on the palate. The palate is bold yet well-integrated, with a velvety texture and graceful structure.
Name: Miro 2015 Ponzo Vineyard Old Vines Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: This comes from the producer's own estate and from its top blocks of old vines. Spiced, it's also herbal in cedar and sandalwood, in addition to black licorice. Thick and spicy, it has enough acidity to brighten denser pockets of blackberry and black cherry. It shows plenty of structure for long-term enjoyment.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Beatty Ranch Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is predominately Zinfandel, with 10% Carignane, 6% Petite Sirah and 3% Alicante Bouschet. Smoky bacon, cherry, citrus and watermelon all meld in this broadly structured, full-bodied red.
Name: Leonard 2014 Branham Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine pays homage to a historic revolt in Sonoma in 1846. Waves of dark cherry and vanilla surround a strong core of integrated oak and supple texture in this well-made wine. Ripe, full-bodied and well-balanced, this wine will please many a palate with ease.
Name: Bear Flag 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny and fully ripe in knock-down layers of tobacco, leather and baked dark fruit, this wine succeeds in its embrace of thick concentration and velvety luxuriousness. Richly robust, it finishes dusted in black pepper and cinnamon toast.
Name: Kokomo 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Timber Crest Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From the eastern edges of the Napa Valley, this is a bright and effusive wine, balanced in red fruit. Small percentages of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Grenache Blanc are included. It was barrel-aged for 18 months in French oak, 25% of it new. The wood is integrated and the texture softly layered.
Name: Leonard 2014 Rustridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is quiet on the nose, but comes to life in its fistful of brawny, thick black fruit and gritty, leathery texture. A touch of black pepper and cinnamon play off each other on the long, resolved finish.
Name: David Clinton 2014 Teldeschi Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From vines planted around 1893 on a high bench on the south-eastern edge of the appellation, this 100% varietal wine shows plenty of power and concentration, teasing bold cherry, cinnamon and pepper out of its substantial core.
Name: Ravenswood 2014 Big River Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty and peppery, this big-boned wine leans into tart red-fruit flavors like cranberry and strawberry, with a thickness of tannin at its core. Leather, coffee and cinnamon swirl around adding seasoning to its overall length and breadth on the palate.
Name: Sbragia 2014 Gino's Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Red-fruit-driven, this is a light, elegant version of the variety, unexpected in tight tannin and with a grainy dry carpet of texture. Cranberry and currant dominate and maintain a fresh tangy quality to the taste.
Name: Bodkin 2014 Peaceland Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Leather, cedar and juicy blackberry fruit combine with force in this expansive, concentrated wine. Chocolate toffee layers provide additional richness and complexity, as the finish ends smooth.
Name: La Storia 2015 Block 303 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended from several appellations across the county and adding in 14% Petite Sirah, 6% Carignane and 3% other black grapes, this wine succeeds in combining brambly black fruit ripeness with black pepper spiciness, expanding across the palate with grace and power.
Name: Ravenswood 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the historic site on the eastern edges of the valley, this wine is juicy, soft and layered in cranberry, cherry and vanilla. Expansive and robustly concentrated, it benefits from the addition of 19% Petite Sirah and 5% Carignane, seasoned in cinnamon and black pepper.
Name: Ravenswood 2014 Teldeschi Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a peppery, plummy wine with plenty of grip on the palate. Structured and meaty, it rides its ripeness with ease, showing a taste of vanilla soda on the finish. Mixed black grapes account for 25% of the whole and originate from vines planted around 1900.
Name: Ravenswood 2014 Belloni Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and broad aromas of strawberry and red currant meet with peppercorns and crushed oregano on the nose of this bottling of old-vine Zin from southern Santa Clara County. It's a lighter style on the palate, with bright red plums, crushed river rock and a good helping of herb flavors.
Name: Birichino 2015 Saint Georges Old Vines Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big but balanced, this wine from one of Amador's higher elevation districts. It has a nice deep color, spicy sweet oak aromatics and generous juicy fruit flavors backed by moderate tannins and full body.
Name: Renwood 2014 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Brambly blackberry, black cherry and black coffee intermingle in this full-bodied richly ripe and robust red. Thick in tannin and oak, the fruit finds its balance and has its day.
Name: Frank Family 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of plum, spice cake, dried ginger, loam and purple flowers make for a dense entry to this heavy-duty bottling. Ripe flavors of dark strawberry meet with star anise and clove on the sip, where a chalky tannic structure almost hides the slight sweetness.
Name: Midnight 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which includes some Petite Sirah and Monastrell, is still quite wound up on the nose, with aromas of slate, wet mud, berries and a bit of baking spice showing shyly. Rounded red-fruit flavors show on the sip as does that muddy clay-driven minerality, all framed by decent acid and tannins.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Territory Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This has a dried-fruit component of plum and cherry—akin to a fruitcake in richness and flavor. Supple on the palate, it finishes in a cloud of brown sugar.
Name: Miro 2015 Gaddis Vineyard Old Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is aged entirely in French oak, 75% of it new. Grippy structure surrounds a softened sensibility of dark cherry and chocolate, the oak smoky and tinged in vanilla.
Name: Mill Creek 2013 Hillside Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With the addition of 14% Petite Sirah, this delightful old-vine wine is lightly spiced with a taste of black licorice. Vanilla, blackberry and white chocolate add layers of complex, welcomed flavor and succulence to the full-bodied whole.
Name: Puccioni 2014 Puccioni Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A dash of Carignane contributes to the whole of this easygoing likable wine. Softly layered baked plum and prune flavors are given additional heft and roundness from a richer undertone of caramel and brown sugar.
Name: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This comes from a vineyard 1,400-feet elevation, and it is blended with 14% Petite Sirah. Thick tannins surround a core of extracted red cherry and blueberry fruit; the texture is mild and fleshy.
Name: Carol Shelton 2014 Florence Vineyard Rocky Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel and barrel aged, this hearty wine is soft and simple with a juiciness of Kool-Aid-like flavors and dusty leather.
Name: XYZin 2013 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sweet berry-cherry flavors meet a fleshy rounded midpalate in this simple and easygoing red that has a substantial taste of dried fruit and leather.
Name: Portalupi 2015 Marcucci Farms Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has an oxidized sensibility that makes it feel flat somewhat on the palate. Flavors of tobacco leaf are the strongest
Name: Ousterhout 2013 Nance's Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is 100% varietal. It was given time in oak for two years in a combination of French and American barrels. A sweetness from the oak is noticeable, as a taste of root beer combines with juicy blackberry, the fruit ripe and round.
Name: Mill Creek 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This perennial favorite lives up to its word-of-mouth goodness, offering fistfuls of blueberry and huckleberry with a juicy length and throughput of acidity. Soft and strong, it's supple, floral and memorable in its deliciousness.
Name: Robert Biale 2015 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Zinfandel project comes from a block that combined plantings from historic vineyards across the state, and the result is excellent. Aromas of red and purple flowers meet with wild sagebrush, roasted coffee and persistent black-cherry ripeness. The mouthfeel is soft but with an upright tannic structure, delivering flavors of blackberry, cocoa and dried sage.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 D Block Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Robustly concentrated, this is a rich rewarding wine exuberantly layered in black raspberry and blackberry flavor. Boldly structured, with depth and length for days, it hits the palate with pleasing jolts of cinnamon, clove and black licorice.
Name: Quivira 2015 Anderson Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Waxy plum, cherry and a thread of oak accent a full-bodied warmth of soft tannin in this lovely wine, which also unfurls savory elements of cedar and graphite. Succulent, it shows the remarkable acidity for which the site is known.
Name: Robert Biale 2015 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a floral, juicy and full-bodied wine that feels lighter than its weight. A soft, supple texture wraps around rustic baked fruit and crisp, persistent acidity that provides substantial freshness.
Name: Gary Farrell 2015 Maffei Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy, tangy and tart, this well-made wine is softly layered and complex—a moderate and balanced version of the variety that shows cranberry and red-cherry goodness dotted in cinnamon and black pepper.
Name: Quivira 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark in the glass, this bottling shows strawberry, black plum and gingerbread aromas on the inviting nose. The mouthfeel is airy and relatively light, with a strong tannic tension that frames flavors of dark purple fruit and baking spice.
Name: Sextant 2015 Holystone Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Smoothly seductive and smoky, this wine from a long-standing site in the heart of the city is lush in vanilla and black cherry. Full bodied, the fruit is seasoned in inviting tones of black pepper and leather, an earthy element riding along.
Name: Robert Biale 2015 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy, soft red layers of fruity dark cherry and blackberry accentuate this sophisticated, boldly ripe wine, with integrated oak and firm supportive tannin.
Name: Leonard 2014 Collins Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine has a quiet entry and soft lilt of cinnamon and black pepper spice. A grip of strong-willed tannin envelops a firm concentration of red berry, leather pouch and mountain sage.
Name: Robert Biale 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This impressive wine is succulent in delicious berry flavor that's been dipped in smoky leather. Supple firm tannin adds structure and strength, as a length of spice and tobacco plays palatable games on the finish.
Name: Quivira 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Weedy, herbal and strong-willed, this is a warm concentrated wine that's softly textured and moderate in structure. Extracted flavors of red cherry and vanilla accentuate the wine's succulent nature.
Name: Robert Biale 2015 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Deep dark black fruit is seasoned in big bold flavors of graphite, dried herb and chocolate. Full bodied and robustly ripe, this wine has a touch of heat to it, finishing in a smack of leather and tar.
Name: Wonderment Wines 2014 Pritchett Peak Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky char, dried herb, cedar and cherry with plum adorn this full-figured concentrated wine, which shows a touch of heat on the palate. From a site at 1,500-feet in elevation, and blended with 5% Petite Sirah, it mellows well in the glass.
Name: Beekeeper Cellars 2015 Monticello Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, the aromas of this wine are very varietal, with scents of cranberry, raspberry and high-toned spices. The palate is quite sweet, giving the appearance of carrying some residual sugar. It comes off as a bit hot. Still, there's enjoyment to be had.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fruity and slightly candied flavors make this wine taste fresh and soft. One of very few vineyard-designated white Zins, it has strawberry and raspberry jam flavors, relatively full body and a rich texture.
Designation: Zin Nymph Sophia Favaloro Vineyard White
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Zin Nymph Sophia Favaloro Vineyard White Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky like a barbecue, this wine offers a soft simple thread of cured meat and sweet berry pie, while the oak is supportive and evocative of vanilla. Full bodied, this is a bold, ripe wine.
Name: Foppiano 2014 Nonno's Block Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a decades-old site that's steeply planted, this is a brawny wine, smoky in leather and black pepper. Bold ripe blackberry flavors match a fierce tannin profile and lingering specks of cinnamon spice.
Name: Fallon Place 2014 Landa Vineyard Zinfandel (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Simple but pleasant aromas of violet, plum, grape and mulberry show on the nose of this widely available and well-priced twist-top bottling. The palate pops with acidity, showing flavors of blackberry, boysenberry and tart plum skins, framed by thin though sticky tannins.
Name: Sextant 2015 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Wood-spice aromas are at the fore followed by red fruit, with the wine also showing a fair amount of heat. The cranberry, raspberry and oak flavors are full bodied, seeming a bit boozy.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a rounded mouth-filling wine that takes mild watermelon aromas and adds subtle white peach and pear flavors. It's quite rich in texture, low in acidity and alcohol, and has a lingering finish.
Name: Uphill Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Rosato di Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky flavor envelops a soft supple layering of blackberry and cherry in this wine, that's big, broad and full of heat. A sweetness of oak provokes the fruit.
Name: Foppiano 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is somewhat weedy and herbal, with extracted black fruit displaying prominently on the palate. Oaky and tannic, it overwhelms somewhat, needing time in the glass to settle down.
Name: Trecini 2015 Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine has a hot-pink color, effusive strawberry and cherry aromas and then sweet fruit flavors that give a sugary impression on the palate. It's very simple in approach and low in alcohol.
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 White Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is another fantastic vintage of this Zinfandel, blended smaller amounts of Mourvèdre and Petite Sirah. It offers a wealth of soft, juicy milk chocolate and cherry pie character and is high in acidity and dusty tannin. A beautiful, memorable testament to what this variety can be.
Name: Limerick Lane 2015 Rocky Knoll Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated cola, dark cherry, tree bark and wet-gravel aromas make for a very focused and intense nose in this bottling. The palate is hearty and full of blackberry and black plum fruit, with more complex char and tar flavors. Quite layered and compelling.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Vortex Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from a warm part of the upper Carmel Valley is lavish, rich and inviting on the nose, with cassis, French toast, vanilla and lilac aromas. It's thick on the palate, with blackberry syrup, maple and snickerdoodle flavors, cut by bountiful acidity.
Name: Boekenoogen 2015 Bell Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (Monterey)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From one of Sonoma County's newer mountain appellations, this wine is expressive, with juicy black licorice and blackberry flavors, grippy tannins and a slight reductive note. Leather accents adorn the full-bodied palate, softening as it approaches its long, spicy finish.
Name: VGS Chateau Potelle 2015 25th Anniversary Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Generous tannins give this wine power and weight, as bright bursts of red cherry and inviting vanilla notes give it a counterpoint of focus. Softly textured, it's an exploration of brambly blackberry flavors, baking in the summer sun.
Name: Limerick Lane 2015 1910 Block Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A focused streak of acidity supports this 100% varietal wine's well-developed cherry, berry and leather flavors. Its floral underbelly, recalling violet and lavender, provides welcoming aromas and secondary characteristics.
Name: Sequum 2014 Kidd Ranch Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Volcano Ridge vineyard, there's nothing shy here. Ripe to the edge of jammy, it's bursting with black fruits. An interesting streak of menthol/wintergreen amps up the freshness, and it has sufficient acidity to lift the finish. Add this to the short list of must-taste Oregon Zins.
Name: Huett 2015 The Gold Lot Zinfandel (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Zinfandel from a warm area that hugs the Arroyo Seco appellation boundary (and will likely one day be part of it) shows baked blueberry, nutmeg, clove, licorice and turned loam aromas. Its dark plum and boysenberry flavors are strong, yet rocky mineral notes, cocoa spice and upright tannins kick it up to the next level.
Name: Mesa Del Sol 2013 Zinfandel (Monterey County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft yet perky strawberry aromas meet licorice, fennel bulb and cinnamon on the nose of this well balanced Zinfandel from a historic vineyard. There is a strong garrigue edge to the palate and a touch of roasted meat, giving depth to the bright and candied red fruit. Great with barbecue.
Name: Stephen Ross 2015 Dante Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Intensely ripe and chocolatey, this full-bodied wine swims in blueberry and blackberry jam flavors, slathered with graham cracker and vanilla sweetness. Broadly appealing, soft and round, it takes on a cola note as it finishes.
Name: Kokomo 2015 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This widely available and reliably tasty bottling shows plum, blackberry pie, fennel pollen and rocky mineral notes on the nose. The palate is thick with ripe and juicy black cherry, dark strawberry and black plum fruit, which grabs one's attention. Baking spice flavor emerges toward the finish.
Name: Sextant 2015 Wheelhouse Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Complex blackberry, black plum, white pepper, wet slate and sagebrush aromas lead into a palate of dried berry, gravel and tar flavors. Its bountiful fruit character is offset by a background of dried oregano and thyme notes.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Westside Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Boldly etched with milk chocolate and baked plum notes, this wine is ripe, robust and jammy in spirit. Leather, black pepper and cinnamon accents season it nicely.
Name: Papapietro Perry 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 8% Petite Sirah and aged less than a year in French and American oak, this wine is simple, with compostable earth scents and soft, round layers of brambly blackberry fruit.
Name: Pech Merle 2014 Treborce Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
