Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A bit weak on the nose, this bottling shows elderberry, raspberry and wet chaparral aromas. Sweet fruit shows blandly on the palate, with touches of sage and thyme.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2015 Incredible Red Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp, hard and stiff, this high-alcohol wine offers plenty of power, but little in the way of charm .A tight streak of burnt rubber runs through the core of black fruit.
Name: Spangler 2014 Zinfandel (Oregon)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This organically farmed field blend includes some Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet. It has soft acidity and a simple structure, the flavors a mix of red and black cherry and berry.
Name: Barber 2014 Mr Beast Topolos Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A dull, unformed nose gives way to sweet dried prune notes in this highly ripe, earthy wine.
Name: Pech Merle 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine has a distinct personality beyond the normal jammy-fruit flavors of the varietal. A fragrance like sunbaked earth and wild sagebrush meets dried cherry, dried herb and meaty flavors, supported by firm tannins and good acidity for a lip-smacking texture.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2015 Zinfandel (High Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Powerful, mouthwatering, concentrated black-cherry and blackberry flavors form the core of this full-bodied, full-flavored and well-balanced wine. Starting with aromas of toasted oak and wood smoke, the wine has a broad rich mouthfeel and moderate tannins that propel the gorgeous fruit flavors across the palate and linger a long time on the finish.
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2015 Rezerve Paul's Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An amazing amalgam of berry flavors fills this full-bodied and intensely fruity wine. It gushes with blackberry, raspberry and strawberry in the aromas and on the palate, supported by good acidity and moderate tannins. It may be high in alcohol but it's so jam-packed with red and black fruit that it tastes balanced and appetizing.
Name: Carlisle 2014 DuPratt Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Outstanding concentration rides an impressive structure in this huge but well-balanced wine. Freshly picked blackberries and raspberries meet hints of chocolate, baking spices and black pepper while vivid tannins and firm acidity lift up all those flavors and carry them to a lingering finish. Compelling to drink now, it's also built to age well. Best after 2020.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2013 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a very complete, well-balanced and satisfying wine that has a firm tannic structure to carry the tempting berry and black-cherry flavors. It starts with light cinnamon, clove and vanilla aromas that join loads of fruit on the palate, layering nicely for an interesting, complex and substantive character. Drink through 2025.
Name: Boeger 2015 Rosa Canina Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral aromas like rose and lilac give this lush and fruity wine a unique character. It has very ripe, exotic fruit flavors that resemble blueberries, macerated cherries and boysenberries. Subtle oak nuances form a lightly spicy background, while firm tannins add grip to complete a nicely balanced and high-intensity package.
Name: Uphill Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a bold, very ripe and full-bodied wine that has a good frame of firm tannins and acidity to give it an appetizing texture. While packed with plump, almost sweet flavors like blackberry jam, it is nicely dry and well balanced, leading to a lingering finish that last for 30 seconds.
Name: Uvaggio 2015 Radix Vinea Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This unabashedly powerful and jammy wine shows black-cherry candy, sweet roses, vanilla, black rocks and black pepper on the nose. The soft tannins carry forth waves of vanilla, coconut, caramel and blueberry jelly, perfect to please those seeking a whopper of a wine.
Name: Opolo 2015 Mountain Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Intensely ripe and concentrated fruit flavors dominate both the aromas and flavors of this very full-bodied but ultrasmooth wine. Light notes of dried sage and cinnamon dust the blackberry jam and candied-strawberry flavors for a nuanced complexity despite the high alcohol and supreme ripeness.
Name: Sol Rouge 2013 Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely dark and viscous in the glass, this 100% Zinfandel shows dark intensity on the nose, with aromas of hearty blueberry, crushed violet, vanilla and black pepper. The blueberry element explodes onto the palate, but it's tightened up by a rocky texture and a touch of pepper dust.
Name: Bella Luna 2015 Fighter Pilot Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: While not so big and bombastic as many, the wine has wonderful complex aromas, layered flavors and a feeling of elegance and length on the palate. Savory aromas precede mineral and cranberry flavors firmed up by good acidity and moderate tannins. This is what great balance tastes like.
Name: Wilderotter 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well-integrated oak, deliciously ripe fruit flavors and an absolutely luscious texture make a great combination for this very full-bodied wine. The entry is smooth and light, then the flavors of ripe plum and boysenberry build on the palate, very mouth filling and rich, before lingering on a long finish.
Name: Amador Cellars 2014 Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This brand offers excellent value across the board, and this Zinfandel competes strongly with much more expensive bottlings. The balanced nose offers hearty blackberry, roasted meat, charcoal, violet and black pepper. The dark fruit and purple flowers of the palate are offset by gravelly minerality and dark chocolate flavors.
Name: Rabble 2015 Mossfire Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a classic Zinfandel, scented with wild sage and forest berries, and full of raspberry, strawberry and black-cherry flavors. It's full bodied and well balanced, but generous and soft in texture, while mild tannins help carry the flavors through a lingering finish.
Name: Renwood 2014 Special Reserve Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The opulent, concentrated and jammy flavors of this big but smooth wine are hard to resist. Black plum, blackberry and a touch of black pepper make a classic combo on the palate as a broad texture and generous mouthfeel carry them through the finish.
Name: Miller Wine Works 2014 Shake Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This terrific wine has vibrant fruit flavors and feelings of focus and energy on the palate. Firm acidity and fine-grained tannins add structure and lend support to the spicy oak and ripe cherry and blackberry nuances that start in the aromas and carry through the taste and finish.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2015 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hints of damp earth and new leather lend a distinctive taste profile to this full-bodied, ripe and broad-textured wine. Boosted by baking spices, toasted baguette and dried plum notes, the wine gets more complex with time in the glass.
Name: Andis 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Floral cedary aromas and big berry-soaked flavors come together on a smooth but appropriately tannic texture as this full-bodied wine drenches the palate with blackberry and boysenberry richness. It combines power with complexity and has the grippy texture needed to carry all that ripeness. It was blended with 11% Petite Sirah and 5% Barbera.
Name: Marietta Cellars 2015 Román Estate Grown Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied Zinfandel adds in 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, which is an unusual blend but works really well. It shows a great mix of fruit and spice flavors, with a rich, smooth texture. It's lightly tannic, oozing raspberry and blackberry flavors on the palate and through the finish.
Name: Concrete 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A dramatic spiciness infuses this full-bodied wine with complexity from the aroma through the flavors and lingering finish. It has a dominant streak of smoky oak, a generous mouthfeel, mild tannins and plenty of blackberry and black plum notes.
Name: Zinderella 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of wood smoke and grilled meat set up bold smoky, peppery flavors in this complex, spicy and full-bodied wine. The savory beefy aspects are a pleasure to taste and there is a good foundation of mild tannins and solid cherry flavors.
Name: Cedarville 2014 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Flavorful but also gentle on the palate, despite the brand name, this is a lushly textured, full-bodied wine that lifts beautiful blueberry and blackberry flavors on fine-grained tannins. It has lightly spicy aromas, a mouthfilling viscosity and long finish.
Name: Boneshaker 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe and saturated with fruit flavor, this wine is so full-bodied that it comes off almost sweet in spite of a good streak of acidity. Strawberry and boysenberry seem to coat the palate and a broad, smooth texture carries the extreme fruitiness through the finish. Enjoy it after a meal with dessert or cheese.
Name: Everhart Cellars 2014 Pilot Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This drinks like a Port, with extremely ripe and definitely sweet flavors of raisins, dried plums and blackberry jam. It's not so much a dinner wine as something to sip around the campfire or with a dark chocolate dessert.
Name: Everhart Cellars 2014 Estate Grown Happy Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A distinctive cedar and smoke character makes this medium-bodied wine interesting to taste, and the herb and ripe black-cherry flavors underneath give it a substantial fruit component. It's light on tannins but big on flavor.
Name: Sobon Estate 2015 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It's great to find both lots of fruit and good structure in a Zin, especially at such a reasonable price. Spicy aromas like vanilla and nutmeg precede vivid and ripe fruit flavors and more of those oaky spices on the palate where firm tannins and a bite of acidity give a mouthwatering balance.
Name: Cline 2015 Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An extreme aroma of heavily toasted oak carries through to the intense smoky, meaty flavors of this full-bodied and quite tannic wine that was aged in 80% American oak and 20% French. It's rowdy and robust, but fun to drink for fans of no-holds-barred oakiness.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2014 Epicenter Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Velvety smooth, and brimming with ripe berry flavors, this wine feels broad and rich on the palate, carrying flavors like black plums and boysenberry jam. So ripe it's almost sweet, the wine is nothing if not generous and fruity. A 7% addition of Port-style sweet wine gives it that extra dimension.
Name: Scott Harvey 2013 InZinerator Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromas like vanilla and candied cherry meet very ripe cherry and berry flavors in this rich, almost syrupy wine. The fruit flavors are very concentrated and the texture is smooth and polished, showing very little tannin.
Name: Criss Cross 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fruity and savory elements are well blended in this nicely mature full-bodied wine. It has a sense of being polished and smooth on the palate, not very tannic but just very mellow to sip.
Name: Sobon Estate 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The freshness and concentration of the fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine is exceptional. It smells like Concord juice and tastes dark and grapy, forming a simple but appealing personality that's hard to resist.
Name: Infidel 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a great value for a wine from the celebrated Amador region. Aromas like strawberry jam and brown sugar lead to very ripe and fruity flavors in this full-bodied but lively wine. It's fun to sip and doesn't try for a serious profile or heavy texture.
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2015 Special Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This is an extremely ripe and viscous wine, almost too much to handle. The nose shows juicy blackberry syrup, crème de cassis, coconut and a hint of herbs, and then the palate delivers coffee, fudge, elderberry, black currant and pepper.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2013 Old Vine De Ambrogio Block Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Opulent and obvious oak aromas and flavors weave through this extremely ripe, full-bodied and rather sweet wine, making it an outlier, though a very flavorful one. It smells like charred cedar, toasted oak, cloves and vanilla while tasting jammy and syrupy.
Name: Moss Roxx 2013 Ancient Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Waffles and maple syrup in the aroma, and blackberries in the flavor seem to recommend this full-bodied wine for breakfast time. In fact it is a little sweet, and those maple-like notes continue in the flavors along with vanilla and cinnamon.
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2015 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bold wine has a charred oaky aroma, flavors that are almost sweet and also plenty oaky, along with ripe and concentrated berry flavors that peek out from under the smoky toasted layer after a few moments.
Name: Dante Robere 2014 Zinfandel (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a supersmooth, easy-going wine with mild dark-fruit flavors, very little tannin and a soft texture. Two years aging in previously used oak barrels helped round off any corners in the mouthfeel.
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A heavy oak element dominates the aromas and flavors of this sweet-seeming, medium-bodied wine. It starts with toasted oak and smoked meat impressions and then gushes black-cherry and boysenberry notes on the palate.
Name: Maggio 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The tarry herbal aromas and roasted peppery flavors of this medium-bodied wine give it a rather lean taste profile and the texture is moderately tannic.
Name: Cedar View Winery 2014 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Composed, complex and complete, this mellow wine is very comfortable in its skin. Touches of oak, tobacco, dried plum and cardamom fill the aroma, and ripe but not overripe black cherry, tamarind and cola flavors flood the palate, supported by fine-grained tannins and medium-full body.
Name: Scott Harvey 2012 Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: From dry-farmed 40-year-old vines perched along the Rutherford Bench, this impressive offering is sanguine and elegantly balanced, a showcase of cranberry, raspberry and milk chocolate. Refined acidity contributes to an overall lightness, with dried herb and dust lingering on the finish.
Name: Tres Sabores 2014 Perspective Estate Zinfandel (Rutherford)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and surprisingly bright, this wine is driven by sharply etched acidity and citrus—its flavors balanced and complementary. Red cherry and raspberry find companionship in seasonings of cinnamon and clove, the texture slightly leathery and bold.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big and juicy, this wine draws on a few sources as well as 15% Petite Sirah to offer a complex and layered expression of black cherry, cardamom and chocolate. Rich from start to finish, it satisfies as it calls out for smoky meat.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sanguine and restrained, this is a lovely version of the variety from the region. It is high-toned in refreshing acidity and accented in red cherry and a memorable spiciness of cinnamon and pepper. Completely understated, it will do well at the table or on its own as aperitif fare.
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2012 Zeigler Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Despite its decadent profile, this wine manages to be complex and beguiling, intensely fruity, with an uplift of high-toned red cherry. Violet, lavender and gamy meat give it personality and intellectual challenge, asking for forgiveness rather than permission.
Name: Inspiration 2015 Estate Old Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a great example of a dry well-balanced Zin to drink with dinner rather than as a sweet dessert. It's also a taste of history, coming from a vineyard originally planted in 1869. It's medium bodied, nicely structured with firm tannins and has aromatic complexity from cedar, tobacco and cardamom notes, plus delicious just-ripe cherry flavors.
Name: Scott Harvey 2014 Vineyard 1869 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the mighty site, this is a mountainous wine, generous and layered with bold big flavor. Plum candy, cinnamon, nutmeg, licorice and raspberry swirl in the glass with tension and grace, finishing in a wrapping of firm oak and tannin.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine surprises and delights in its heady perfume and depth of cherry, cinnamon and brown sugar. Undoubtedly ripe, it holds its boldness well, allowing for glimpses of elegance amid the velvety layers of serious flavor.
Name: Kokomo 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Good concentration and a nicely tannic velvety texture make a great combination in this gutsy full-bodied wine. The aromas and flavors favor sunbaked earth, ripe plum, sage and beef juices, creating a complex and brawny character that will pair awesomely with a grilled steak or chop.
Name: Scott Harvey 2014 Mountain Selection Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is lengthy and earthy, with wraparound tannins that coat the mouth. Smoky char, black licorice and a depth of baked plum provide decadence and ripe rich flavor within complex structure of acidity.
Name: Clif Family 2015 Gary's Improv Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Wonderful richness, depth and concentration make this full-bodied wine a standout. Rich berry and cherry flavors are densely packed within a velvety viscous texture that soothes the palate and clings to the sides of the mouth. A long finish completes the picture.
Name: Oak Farm 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A wine for grown-ups, this is big but balanced and dry in style. It matches impressive layers of just-ripe blackberry and black-plum flavors with a sturdy structure of fine-grained tannins that clean the palate easily. It has considerable depth and focus, indicated by how the dark fruits seem to keep increasing in intensity even on the finish.
Name: Uvaggio 2015 Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a boldly jammy uninhibitedly ripe wine—a mix of compost, old barn, jammy raspberry and prune. The size and structure work well together, with toasted oak supporting brawny texture and grip.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Mancini Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pungently earthy in cigar box and compost, this is a compact and densely powerful wine, full of blackberry-jam flavor dipped in chocolate and cinnamon spice.
Name: Sbragia 2014 Nonno's Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a rich concentrated and high-toned wine, layered in cinnamon, chocolate and blackberry jam, with an underlying acidity that keeps it fresh despite its thick wrapping of oak. A handful of Petite Sirah is within the blend.
Name: Sbragia 2014 La Promessa Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is the last vintage from this site from this producer: a sad farewell that doesn't hold back on ripeness or full-figured body. Lush and soft on the palate, it has a strong sense of self, etched in black cherry, chocolate mint and firm tannin. Sock it away and best enjoy beginning in 2024.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Hayne Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very dark color and intensely ripe aromas precede flavors of black cherry, blackberry jam and brown sugar in this full-bodied and thickly textured wine. It's impressive for the level of concentration and sense of saturation.
Name: Deaver 2015 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Saldo comes from the folks who brought you The Prisoner. Admirable ripeness and lushness carry this full-bodied, dark-colored and densely fruity wine from a smoky aroma through jammy dark-fruit flavors to a lingering finish that has a drop of baking-spice sweetness.
Name: Saldo 2014 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sanguine, with a voluptuous mouthfeel, this wine is soft and integrated in chewy sticky tannins that resolve in the glass, and dusty in dried herb. Blackberry bramble adds a fruity edge that finds companionship in the boldly etched fruit.
Name: MacLeod 2014 Indian Springs Ranch Estate Grown Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumed and lovely, this hearty full-bodied wine evokes berry pie, so rich and brambly is its depth of concentrated flavor. Rapturous, it finds its savory side with an intensity of cinnamon, nutmeg and pepper.
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2012 Bastoni Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Rich and robust, this estate wine shines in milk chocolate, leather and smoky oak, its texture densely layered and soft.
Name: Laura Michael 2012 Oat Hill Estate Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Brawny as a leather pouch, this big-shouldered wine shows the age of its vines in blackberry-compote flavor and accents of cinnamon and smoky char. Bright perfumed aromatics lift the burly, concentrated fruit alongside supportive acidity and a succulent finish.
Name: August Briggs 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Richly rewarding as a berry bramble, this wine is bright and refreshing within a softly layered texture of ripeness and a full body. Cinnamon and leather saddle complement the heady fruit.
Name: Crux 2014 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: From a site adjacent to the Pines vineyard, this rare Oregon Zinfandel deftly melds toast, sweet spice, buttered nut, espresso and black cherry flavors. It's big, bold, dark and delicious, with more lift than its high alcohol might suggest.
Name: Heart Catcher 2013 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump blackberry, dark strawberry, dried herbs and baking spice show on the nose of this well-rounded and easily likable bottling. The palate mixes fleshy red and purple fruit with a strong chaparral component in the midpalate. The firm grippy texture makes this a more serious Zinfandel than most.
Name: EOS 2015 Algunas Dias Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The great majority of this wine is made from old-vine grapes, planted pre-Prohibition. The age tells tales of soft leathery chewiness on the palate as swathes of cherry-syrup flavor make for a hearty velvety explosion that's lengthy and rich. Black licorice plays a part.
Name: Carlisle 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Big but poised, this full-bodied, 100% varietal wine has plenty of dark berry and spice flavors and a generous broad texture that's well supported by tannins. It's nicely dry, mouthfilling and needs a rich protein dish to pair with.
Name: Graziano 2013 Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Subdued and delicately ripe, this wine offers understated notions of leather, chocolate and blackberry bramble, with an electric undercurrent of fresh-squeezed citrus. Light and bright, this is a study in holding back, with complexity at its core.
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2012 Mancini Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Smooth and soft in texture, this wine is full-bodied and bold in its brawny embrace of rich fruit, showcasing dense layers of cherry, plum and vanilla.
Name: Raymond 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Intensely ripe, jammy and toasty aromas and equally effusive fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine easy to enjoy. It seems to overflow with boysenberry and blackberry, and has a touch of wood smoke from oak.
Name: Gnarly Head 2015 Old Vine Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried strawberry, herb-laced berry compote, maple and campfire aromas show on the nose of this bottling from one of the earlier Paso pioneers of the modern era. It's soft in texture and rich in syrupy strawberry and plum flavors, enhanced by hints of mocha and held up by firm tannins on the finish.
Name: Opolo 2015 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Intensely built, this is a big-boned and richly layered wine, dense and ripe in blackberry jam. The fruit is joined by smoky oak and further flavors of chocolate-covered coconut.
Name: Sbragia 2014 Italo's Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Unusually restrained for the varietal, this appetizing and firmly textured wine has moderate fruit and clove flavors, great balance and a good snap of tannin in the mouthfeel. Its sense of moderation will make it consistently likeable, bottle after bottle.
Name: Monte Volpe 2013 Primitivo (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: High-pitched acidity helps balance the bigger, bolder elements of truffle earth, leather and cherry cordial than run freely in this full-bodied softly textured wine.
Name: Laura Michael 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Restrained and dusty in leathery tannin, this wine opens in the glass to unravel bold black-fruit and licorice power, offering stark succulence and moderate acidity on the palate.
Name: Bruliam 2015 Rocky Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Sweet-seeming fruit and maple flavors give a candy-like quality to this medium-bodied, ripe and soft wine. The vanilla and maple flavors meld nicely with rich raspberry and sweet cherry notes.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2015 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Generous black plum, dried purple flowers, sweet raisin and sarsaparilla spice show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are rich and full with bright red plum and strawberry, but there is a rocky core and pinch of oregano as well.
Name: Vintage Cowboy 2014 Estate Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Quite sweet and quite delicious, this ripe and fruity wine has lots of black plum, dried cherry and raisin flavors, a soft texture and a lingering, berry-pie finish.
Name: Deaver 2013 Ten Zin Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A tad shy on the nose, this offers dark fruit and earthy aromas. The flavors are woody with cedar and pencil shavings decorating the dark core of toast and charred fruit.
Name: Twisted Paso 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Aromas like bourbon and soy meet flavors of dried herbs, raspberries and black cherries in this full-bodied dry wine. It creates a good mouthful of flavor and has a healthy dose of tannin for a nicely firm texture.
Name: Angry Bunch 2014 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smoke and black pepper accents give a nice kick to this otherwise fruity berry-like wine. It is medium bodied, has a soft easy texture and a touch of brown sugar on the finish.
Name: Black Saint Peter 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has unapologetic late-harvest flavors like raisins and prunes dusted with dried herbs, and a firm texture that comes with alcoholic heat.
Name: Deaver 2013 Henry's House Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This unbaked wine in a can tastes a bit tired, but it has an earthy appeal. The color is a brownish red and the aromas seem dusty and mature. The flavors are beefy and peppery while the texture is nicely tannic.
Name: Sans Wine Co 2016 Poor Ranch Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Almost as big as a Port, but not sweet, this densely concentrated but surprisingly gentle wine offers opulent, ripe and almost jammy berry flavors that coat the palate and cling to the sides of the mouth long after each sip. It's technically dry, but so rich with blackberry and cassis flavors that it seems sweet from the first aroma to the lingering finish. It will be best after 2024.
Name: Renwood 2014 Grand Wren Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A gorgeous aroma like roses and blackberries meets richly concentrated and ripe black-fruit flavors in this full-bodied, luxuriously textured wine. While extremely ripe and bold, the wine is also smooth and voluptuous, balanced out by silky tannins that keep the mouthfeel lively and fresh sip after sip.
Name: Easton 2014 Old Vine Rinaldi Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dark in color and deep in heavily ripened fruit flavors, this full-bodied, concentrated wine is a show-stopper. A quiet sense of power comes from the dried plum and raisin aromas and the rich blueberry, clove and dark-chocolate flavors. This is a keeper that will be best to drink after 2020.
Name: Easton 2014 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made by Ric Forman from Zin grown on the Nichelini Vineyard in Chiles Valley and Sangiovese from the Antinori family's Antica Vineyard on Atlas Peak, this wine is rich and dense in red fruit that's layered and ripe. Aged for a year in used Burgundy barrels, it retains juicy freshness and elegance, with subtle touches of vanilla and baking spice.
Name: Rossi Wallace 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the historic vineyard site surrounded by Pinot Noir, this wine makes the case for variety and heritage, coaxing bright acidity and floral aromatics out of the grapes. Full bodied, its flavors combine plum, raisin cake, dried cranberry and dust into a leathery whole, finishing in chocolate cinnamon.
Name: Williams Selyem 2015 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This distinctive and bold dry wine has a flavor signature that incorporates blueberry, black olive and blackberry, while filling the mouth with fine-grained tannins and full body. Those tannins and firm acidity give it a great, grippy texture and help extend the finish.
Name: Easton 2014 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the mighty site, this is aged in both French and American oak, half of it new. Rich, robust layers of Dr Pepper, vanilla and chocolate rise on the smoothly textured palate, impressing in power and density.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Monte Rosso Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A velvety texture and extremely concentrated black-fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine delicious to savor. It has beautiful big tannins that are well integrated, luxurious blackberry, sage and cedar flavors, plus great length on the finish.
Name: Easton 2015 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Beautiful black-cherry aromas and flavors make this wine direct and focused. A slightly gripping texture of fine-grained tannins and good acidity keeps the mouthfeel lively. It has a wonderful sense of purity and focus.
Name: Bonterra 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sanguine and nuanced, this vineyard-designate comes from a relatively warm site in the appellation, finding a way to be ripe and bold while balanced. Red currant, cranberry and a bright, persistent acidity give it personality and show a softer take on the variety, the texture equally smooth.
Name: Cellars 33 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied blueberry and blackberry syrup make for a very fruity and yet quite appealing entry to this bottling from the Bill Foley-owned band. The purple flavors are strong on the sip as well, with grape Jolly Rancher most prominent. Elegance comes from hints of Earl Grey tea and lavender, making the wine both hedonistic and heady.
Name: EOS 2015 Santa Margarita Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Both dried and juicy red currants form the core of this impressive wine, made in larger quantities with a deft hand. Medium bodied and offering grip and structure, this restrained version of the variety doesn't skimp on flavor.
Name: Decoy 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, high-toned aromas of raspberry and cranberry jam lead to full-bodied jammy, lip-smacking red-fruit flavors with the barrel influence dialed back. It's a spot on example of the variety.
Name: Catman 2015 Zinfandel (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grown from cuttings derived from pre-Prohibition vines, this wine impresses in its burly red fruit and high-acid backbone. With 20% Petite Sirah and 1% Carignane, it's ripe and dense, with rich, concentrated highlights of mocha and leather.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sweet strawberry and red-melon fruits show on the nose of this bottling along with clove, star anise and a touch of herbs. The boysenberry flavors on the sip are laid across fine-grained tannins and a decent acidity.
Name: EOS 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a spicy, generously ripened wine, emboldened by fistfuls of cinnamon, leather and blackberry pie.
Name: Rock Wall 2014 Julie's Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of top Zin lots from across the region isn't made every vintage. This wine shows slightly sour black plum, dark leather, wet soil and a touch of tar on the nose. Dried red fruit is spiced up by dried herbs on the energetic. Acidity and soft tannins emerge toward the caramel-laced finish.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2015 Zinfusion Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Light sage, thyme and earth aromas top the ripe blackberry and plum flavors of this well-built, rich and fruity wine. Full bodied, it has soft tannins and a touch of candied fruit on the finish.
Name: Lava Cap 2014 Old Vine Estate Bottled Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoothly textured, this wine is thick and generously layered in flavors of blackberry coffee cake and coffee bean, the two combining nicely into one. Grippy on the finish, it's full bodied and brawny, as well as dusty in old-vine character.
Name: J. Rickards 2014 1908 Brignole Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brawny and brooding, this rich wine shows a density of flavor and personality. Plum, strawberry and leathery black pepper form its core.
Name: Frei Brothers 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A smoky aroma, lots of jammy fruit flavors and a healthy lacing of tannin make this medium-bodied wine taste both generous and dry. It was aged in a combination of French and American oak barrels.
Name: Bella Grace 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky oak and a distinct note of birch mark the nose of this broadly built, full-bodied and robustly ripe wine. Grippy tannin and leathery texture give it extra weight and breadth, with a green undercurrent of cedar and peppercorn lurking beneath.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma County-San Joaquin County, California Other, California, US
Description: Compactly built with dense, ripe fruit, this wine offers plummy flavors that lean toward raisiny richness amid a perfumed nose of blackberry and cinnamon. Its full-bodied boldness finishes dry and dull.
Name: Ghost Pines 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County-San Joaquin County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine has an unusually dark color, plus potent and spicy charred-oak aromas. A very aggressive sweet-oak flavor coats over the grape flavors. It stays somewhat sweet on the palate and finish.
Name: Carnivor 2015 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Very concentrated aromas of kirsch, dried berries, chocolate and spice cake show on the nose of this bottling that is bolstered by 10% Petite Sirah. That density extends to the palate, where treacly black-cherry-syrup flavors mix with baking spice.
Name: Monte De Oro 2013 Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from the Teldeschi and Ramazzotti vineyards, with 12% Petite Sirah and 6% Carignane, this impressively bold, inky wine is undeniably pretty on the nose, recalling strawberries and cherries. Juicy, big and delicious, it has memorable structure and elegance that balances the ripeness of its fruit.
Name: Elyse 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Winemaker Joy Merrilees got more oomph out of Two Bud Block in 2013. A deeper than usual color, darker than normal fruit flavors and a satisfying, dark chocolate and cappucino richness on the palate make this big, luxurious wine stand out. The flavors are fruity but distinctive, blending blackberry, black cherry and mocha.
Name: Shannon 2013 Reserve Two Bud Block Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: While quite ripe and fruity, this wine is also dry, nicely tannic and firmly textured, so it will pair beautifully with rich proteins. Aged 18 months in oak, mostly French, it has concentrated dark fruit aromas, and a layered array of flavors that recalls blueberry, dark chocolate and blackberry syrup. Bright acidity keeps everything in balance.
Name: Klinker Brick 2014 Old Ghost Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and thick in the glass, this bottling has a focused nose of pressed blackberry and boysenberry scents, with hints of peppercorn, purple flower and dried meat. Rich and soft tannins coat the palate, where that unique dark berry character meets roasted coffee and milk chocolate flavors.
Name: Daou 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: There's no denying the concentration of this full-bodied, lavishly textured wine. It pulses with ripe blackberry and boysenberry from the aroma through the flavors and into the lingering finish. Delicious new American oak flavors lend complexity without overwhelming the taste of the grapes.
Name: Klinker Brick 2014 Marisa Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smoke and black-pepper aromas and savory flavors put an interesting, appetizing spin on this dry dinner wine. Beefy, earthy flavors follow wood smoke and rosemary aromas, balancing the underlying moderate cherry and plum flavors and making it memorable.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2015 Home Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This winery's name is a nod to the adjacent Pleasant Valley Cemetery in San Miguel, where the warm climate suits Zinfandel well. Plump and bursting boysenberry and lingonberry aromas are dusted with vanilla and marjoram on the nose. The palate's flavors range from ripe red fruit to clove-driven spice and herbal touches, with pepper-laced acidity.
Name: Graveyard 2015 Mortal Zin Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Northern Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from several appellations, including the producer's heritage Russian River Valley site, this wine offers smoky oak, bacon and blackberry jam flavors. Thick and florally perfumed, it balances its brawnier side with spice.
Name: Rodney Strong 2014 Estate Vineyards Knotty Vines Zinfandel (Northern Sonoma)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is rich, ripe, concentrated and almost sweet. It's wonderful to smell the raspberry syrup aromas, taste the blueberry and blackberry flavors and feel the creaminess of the texture coating the palate. Low in tannins but high in viscosity, it's a pleasure to sip.
Name: Klinker Brick 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The nose of this juicy wine conjures plum and raisin cake, and the palate follows with explosive red cherry and clove and cinnamon seasonings. Big and brawny, it's also softly textured and layered, winning one over in its head-on hedonism.
Name: Novy 2015 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine's restrained aromas take time to come around, showing a mix of dust and black pepper before waves of juicy red fruit and soft tannin and oak mingle together seamlessly on the palate. Toasted oak and vanilla notes mark the long finish.
Name: Rodney Strong 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aged 22 months in 35% new French oak, this semisweet wine is so rich and luscious it could be poured at the end of a meal to pair with chocolate or chunks of salty pecorino. It smells like strawberries and black cherries, tastes ripe and jammy and has a soft, mouth-filling texture and low acidity.
Name: Miraflores 2014 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: One of the producer's new single-vineyard wines, this shines with savory leather, black pepper and spicy red-fruit flavors. Layered and compact, it has an underlying grip of tannin, ultimately finishing soft and easy on the palate.
Name: Marietta Cellars 2015 Angeli Estate Grown Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and rich with tobacco and dark chocolate notes, this vineyard-designated wine shows a generous helping of brambly black fruit, its midpalate baring the teeth of sharp tannin and smoky oak. It finishes soft and contained.
Name: Hawley 2015 Ponzo Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: From a ranch planted many decades ago, this wine includes mixed blacks such as Grand Noir and Carignane, adding juicy red and black fruit to the mix. Smoke, cinnamon and leather highlights are kept firm by an integrated tannic structure.
Name: Elyse 2013 Korte Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A good example of the late-harvest approach, this indulgent wine has strawberry syrup aromas, crushed raspberry and blackberry flavors, great concentration and a high level of ripeness. Drink it in lieu of dessert.
Name: Chacewater 2014 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This softly textured wine explodes with chocolate and strawberry flavors, a bright streak of acidity keeping its ripeness in check. Low in oak impact, it shows cigar and black licorice seasonings as it opens in the glass.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Hendry Vineyard Block 29 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A distinctive smoky, peppery aroma and equally interesting savory flavors complement plenty of ripe fruit in this full-bodied, dry and balanced wine. Co-fermented with Petite Sirah and Barbera, it shows plenty of fine-grained tannins, giving good grip to the palate and more than just fruitiness. Best after 2020.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2015 SHR Field Blend Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very savory take on this close Zinfandel cousin, this bottling shows dried herb, peppercorn, forest floor and dessicated red fruit aromas. The palate is a tad riper, with black cherry and cola flavors, spiced with black pepper and more herbs, including oregano and marjoram.
Name: AronHill 2014 Estate Grown Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine from one of Amador County's legendary vineyards is structured, oaky and pleasantly dry. Toasty, peppery, grilled aromas and straightforward blackberry and raspberry fruit flavors are backed by firm tannins and acidity, lending the palate appetizing bite. While this vintage tastes tighter than the last two, expect it to mellow through 2020 at least.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2015 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Raspberry and blackberry aromas and ultraripe, opulent, jammy flavors fill the big, soft frame of this full-bodied wine. It has fruit in spades, milk chocolate and raspberry notes that linger on the finish, relatively light tannins and a touch of richness.
Name: Paul Dolan 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a bright savory rosato that has an intense nose of Mediterranean scrub, fragrant wild flower, red berry and citron. It's zesty and refreshing, with flavors of crushed raspberry, pink grapefruit and a hint of fennel seed. A saline note marks the close.
Name: San Marzano 2016 Tramari Rosé di Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a block planted in 1890 interspersed with dozens of field blend varieties, this wine is ripely sweet with baked cherry fruit, a smoky undercurrent and a soft, moderately balanced structure. Coffee, cinnamon and nutmeg power the finish.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Alegria Vineyard Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky leather and cedar notes rest on a brawny foundation of bold, dry tannin and generous black fruit in this dusty wine. Full-bodied and dense, it opens to show additional tobacco and chocolate aspects.
Name: Pedroncelli 2014 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tartness and moderate tannins lend plenty of mouth-puckering grip to this medium-bodied wine, and that tartness comes off as a touch of raspberry vinegar on the palate. It has an appealing earthy, iron-like quality and a definite textural bite.
Name: Domenico 2012 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This distinctive, complex and layered wine brings a unique aromatic profile of raspberries, sage and spice before fanning out across the palate with gorgeous raspberry syrup, dark chocolate and blackberry flavors. Its lightly grippy texture of fine-grained tannins perfectly counters the plush effusiveness of its fruit.
Name: Harney Lane 2014 Scottsdale Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bright, firmly structured and full of classic berry and savory flavors, this wine is rich but balanced and ready to serve with a steak, chop or rack for a special occasion. It has ripe fruit bolstered by firm acidity and a healthy coating of fine-grained, grippy tannins. Best after 2020.
Name: Renwood 2014 Story Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This densely textured, deeply flavored wine showcases the beauty of old vines in Amador terroir. It has an opaque color, opulent clove, blackberry and cassis aromas, and ripe, jammy flavors that drench the palate yet are supported by tannins firm enough to keep it balanced and appetizing. Best after 2020.
Name: Renwood 2014 Grandpère Special Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Loads of ripe blackberry and boysenberry aromas lead to a plush, not quite soft mouthfeel laced with berry, cherry, clove and cinnamon flavors. It's a very generous, mouth-filling wine that will bring a lot of enjoyment.
Name: Renwood 2014 Jack Rabbit Flat Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which is both a reference to the Lynyrd Skynyrd song and an ode to the grape growers, offers vibrant blackberry, slate and vanilla aromas. The palate is ripe and juicy but balanced, with tangy plum skin and dark spice flavors, framed by a chalky tannic structure. It's fruity enough for traditional California Zinfandel fans but complex enough to win converts.
Name: Barton 2013 Simple Man Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bold and rich without feeling heavy, this luscious wine oozes with ripe blackberry and boysenberry fruit and has a mouth-coating, mouth-filling texture that keeps its flavors echoing through the finish. Occasio makes exceptional wines in small quantities.
Name: Occasio 2014 Del Arroyo Vineyard Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plush and elegant dried purple flower, baked black fruit, graphite and char aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of flavors that range from rich black currant to lively anise and cedar. Quite tasty and complex all around.
Name: Écluse 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the property of a longtime vineyard manager for the winery, this bottling is deliciously unique. The nose abounds with earth, dried cherry, anise, roasted meat and herb aromas. The structure is solid and somewhat gripping, presenting deep red-fruit flavors with dried herb accents, driven by balanced acidity.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2013 Joughin Vineyard Primitivo (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The historic Santa Cruz Island Zinfandel clone excels more at the Rusacks' Ballard Canyon estate than their Catalina Island vineyard. Deep strawberry and red plum aromas mesh with cinnamon, mace and a touch of earth on the nose. There's enough tannic grip to show elegance, with bright red fruit and hearty sagebrush spice flavors.
Name: Rusack 2014 Estate Zinfandel (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy blackberry and clove scents ride a full-bodied wave of flavor and leathery texture in this impressive wine. It shows both the brightness and the density of the appellation in a strong, warm vintage.
Name: Sbragia 2013 Gino's Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Another outstanding Renwood vineyard designate, this has great structure and abundant fruit flavors without overt oakiness. Full-bodied, smooth and seamless, exudes a wild berry and mineral character in the aroma and flavor, and keeps everything in balance due to moderate tannins and acidity.
Name: Renwood 2014 Sea of Grapes Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Wood smoke and black pepper aromas start this full-bodied wine out with a bang. Lively, spicy blackberry and black cherry flavors contribute richness on the palate, accented with toasty, savory, meaty overtones. Add its moderate tannins, and the overall effect is a generous, complex and interesting wine.
Name: Cosentino 2015 Cigar Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich and mouth-filling, this full-bodied wine has plenty of fruit flavor and is structured with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. It blends ripe berry and plum notes with more vibrant red cherry for complexity and has a lingering, layered finish.
Name: Renwood 2014 D'Agostini Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the head-trained, dry-farmed Martinelli Vineyard, this wine is like a lens into history. It's mighty flavorful, too, with jubilant cinnamon, rose water and wisteria aromas and a rounded and juicy palate of plum and boysenberry fruit. Asssertive baking spice notes and chalky tannins complete the picture.
Name: Lone Madrone 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Beautiful, ripe fruit flavors light up this full-bodied but silky-textured wine. It leaves an almost-sweet impression, as layers of blackberry, raspberry and strawberry coat the palate and linger on the finish. The texture is almost syrupy because the wine is so rich, making it a great pairing for chocolate or aged cheese.
Name: 1850 2015 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big flavors and structure come together perfectly in this full-bodied, dry wine that's meant for the dinner table. Its unique fruit character combines raspberry, blackberry and rhubarb, while firm tannins and vibrant acidity create an appetizing, mouth-cleansing texture.
Name: Sierra Starr 2013 Phil's Selection Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a screaming deal for such an admirably good wine, blended with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah and Syrah. Compressed black fruit meets fresh leather on the perfumed nose. The palate follows with thick tannins and mouthcoating flavors of licorice and cinnamon.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very solid wine for its price, with rocky mineral, dried fennel and herbal aromas on the nose. It really shines on the rich and juicy palate, where smoked beef, oregano, marjoram and thyme notes back up the blackberry fruit. Complex and tasty.
Name: Maddalena 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and robustly concentrated wine has chocolate and cherry aromas, rich and ripe plum and blackberry flavors and layers of chocolate and vanilla on the palate and finish. It feels broad and juicy in texture, too.
Name: Skinner 2014 Six Horse Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Exotically fruity with an enticing floral character, this full-bodied, almost-sweet wine has lots to appreciate. It starts with a complex bouquet of black currant, cedar and ripe black cherry and continues on the palate with ripeness and concentration, without a lot of tannin.
Name: 1000 Stories 2014 Bourbon Barrel Aged Batch No 13 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark cherry and black licorice flavors combine in this wine from a 1,650-feet-elevation, estate-grown site. Moderate acidity buoys the fruit's ripeness and concentration, structured with firm, tight tannins.
Name: Wilson 2014 Sydney Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and brightly layered despite its ripeness and soft density, this shows rich strawberry and raspberry flavor, wrapped in leathery earth.
Name: Buena Vista 2014 Arpad's Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright red berry fruit meets smoky undertones of peppered meat, seasoned further with licorice and cola. Full-bodied and robust, the wine's tannins are grippy and supportive.
Name: Buena Vista 2014 Attila's Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Compelling warm berry compote and orange rind aromas mark the nose of this stylishly labeled bottling, with dried fennel, cola and dill accents. The palate is as hearty as expected, with ripe blackberry, vanilla, rose petal and ginger snap flavors.
Name: McClean 2015 Simone Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: With the addition of 8% Petite Sirah for color, this jammy bottling offers boysenberry and blueberry fruit, along with oregano and a touch of tar on the nose. Deep berry flavors and lava rock minerality lead the palate, with peppercorn and roasted herb notes adding depth, and a tannic backbone providing structure.
Name: Sculpterra 2015 Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Deep in color and dramatically smoky in flavor, this full-bodied wine is not at all shy. It tastes fruity, saturated, nicely tannic and very oaky. Charred meat, black pepper and espresso impressions wind through the generous black cherry and blackberry notes.
Name: Beran 2013 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Winemaker Neil Collins spends his time diving into the region's little known, dry-farmed old vines to deliver distinctive and delicate Zinfandels. This one shows wet riverstone scents, with smashed blackberry and lavender. The palate offers tart black plum, peppercorn and tar touches.
Name: Lone Madrone 2014 Sheep Camp Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Toasted oak and maple syrup aromas meet indulgent brown sugar and blackberry jam flavors in this very ripe-tasting, full-bodied wine. It's easy to gulp and enjoy, not being especially brawny or tannic, and should be great with pulled pork or Mexican molé.
Name: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a lot of Central Coast scrub on the nose of this bottling, with anise and sagebrush spicing up the ripe red cherry and rounded strawberry notes. It's light in body, with loads of dried herb, red plum and tart strawberry flavors, proving easy to drink, with compelling acidity.
Name: Pianetta 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a head-trained, dry-farmed vineyard, this very delicate and rather light bottling shows minerally lava rock and riverstone aromas, tart red-cherry fruit and a touch of chaparral. The palate's light structure offers rust and red cherry flavors.
Name: Lone Madrone 2014 Bailey Ranch Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: High-toned acidity complements the generous, brambly black fruit and brown sugar notes in this wine, its savory undertone recalling leather and coffee.
Name: Wilson 2014 Sawyer Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark pink-orange in color, this pungent 100% varietal wine was given no time in oak, allowing its crisp orange peel, grapefruit and cherry flavors to shine. Moderate acidity underlies the simple finish.
Name: Pedroncelli 2016 Dry Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Old Zinfandel plant material from Santa Cruz was propagated in one of the most inhospitable sites for grapes on Catalina Island to make this wine—a fascinating story for any history lover. The wine itself is somewhat simple, with generic red fruit, turned loam and black pepper scents, followed by cranberry, white pepper and crushed rock flavors on the palate.
Name: Rusack 2014 Santa Catalina Island Vineyards Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 10% Alicante Bouschet and aged for 20 months in French oak, this wine shows bright baked strawberry fruit that becomes brooding in the glass, layered with black licorice and peppered leather. Densely built, it finishes seductively smooth.
Name: Ledson 2013 Century Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft and perceptively sweet, this densely built, full-bodied and intensely ripe wine layers brown sugar and baked plum notes, with a lingering taste of cola.
Name: Wilson 2014 Treborce Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This twist-top bottling is bolstered by 15% Petite Sirah but remains a bit wound up and tight on the nose, with caramelized blackberry, caramel and chocolate syrup notes. The mouthfeel is soft and lush, with black cherry flavors cut by graphite, wild sage and bay leaf accents.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A smoky, charred oak aroma leads the nose of this full-bodied, high-octane and appropriately tannic wine, and vivid, peppery notes jazz up its solid fruit flavors.
Name: Rock Wall 2014 Pearl Hart Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This estate-grown wine is burly, brambly, dense and syrupy, with blackberry, chocolate, cinnamon and leather flavors. Its thick texture persists on the finish.
Name: Wilson 2014 Carl's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine's aroma evokes a thicket of strawberries and blackberry bramble, feeling densely ripe yet bright with fruit. The finish veers towards sweeter notes of cola and vanilla.
Name: Wilson 2014 Tori Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart cherry flavor meets firm tannins and chalky texture in this robust, ripe and brawny red. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it holds its ripeness in check.
Name: Collier Falls 2013 Hillside Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Vanilla, cherry and raspberry flavors are complemented by smoky meat and tar in this softly built, mellow and pensively sweet wine that's ripe and generous in body.
Name: Wilson 2014 Carl's Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This leathery, full-bodied red is rich with blueberry cobbler, coffee and smoked meat flavors. Soft and round in structure, it tastes robustly varietal.
Name: Burnside Road 2014 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This soft, easy-going wine smells like chocolate and tastes like plums. Though full bodied, it's very light on tannin and acidity, so the mouthfeel is smooth and rich.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2014 Zinfandel (Yolo County)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fleshy plum and bramble aromas meet crushed riverstone and dust notes on the nose of this appellation blend. Cooked berry, black plum and soil touches arise on the palate, making for a good weekday quaffer.
Name: Lone Madrone 2014 Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine combines smoky, baked blackberry fruit with sweet vanilla accents. It's full bodied, soft and smooth on the palate, proving likably approachable.
Name: Wilson 2014 Molly's Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark strawberry meets clove spice, licorice and star anise on the nose of this bottling, which takes a little time to open up. The palate offers baked strawberry and vanilla notes, proving likable if not very complex.
Name: Sarzotti 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An underlying smoky oak impression complements the succulently ripe, soft blue fruit in this medium-bodied wine. The finish is powerfully rich.
Name: Viszlay Vineyards 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart cherry and cranberry flavors form a core of richly round fruit and texture in this late-released wine, which exudes both power and finesse.
Name: Wellington 2012 Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine's nose and palate bring linzer torte, raspberry jam and charred meat to mind. Thick, big-boned and robust, it finishes on sweet vanilla.
Name: Wilson 2014 McClain Primitivo (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A streak of vanilla winds through the almost-sweet fruit flavors of this medium-bodied and soft-textured wine. Ripe cherry aromas and strawberry jam flavors come with very little tannin and low acidity.
Name: Dark Horse 2015 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bold, meaty and softly simple, this robustly full-bodied wine is redolent of mocha and brown sugar. Its ripely sweet blackberry fruit is cut with savory black-olive notes.
Name: Wilson 2014 Heartland Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sanguine, earthy and as thick as blackberry jam, this soft, moderately structured wine shows abundant anise, cola and black olive notes.
Name: Wilson 2014 Cypress Ridge Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft and lacking focus, this ripe and simple wine shows cherry, blackberry jam, chocolate and brown sugar flavors, the oak refreshingly subtle.
Name: Wilson 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Flat on the palate and somewhat reduced, this big, ripe and generously round wine delivers robust blueberry, black licorice, mocha and oak notes.
Name: Collier Falls 2013 Hillside Estate Primitivo (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Meaty, sanguine and flat, this wine shows a reduced whiff of burnt rubber and tar. Red, brambly fruit attempts to make itself heard amidst a din of powerful ripeness.
Name: Wilson 2014 Botticelli Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A perennial knockout, this vintage delivers as always, combining 7% Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Syrah from the estate into the mix. Altogether, it opens in a field of wildflowers aromatic before unfurling tart acidity to keep freshly layered soft, supple tannin and red cherry and berry. Sprinklings of white pepper and clove factor in.
Name: Limerick Lane 2014 Rocky Knoll Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Robust and richly layered, this block-designate from the producer's estate is sly in complexity, pumping its fist in ripeness and concentration before slowly unfurling elements of dusty black cherry, black olive and fig. The finish teases in white pepper and cardamom.
Name: Limerick Lane 2014 1910 Block Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Leaving its primo estate in the Russian River, the producer travels to a similarly minded site in the heart of the Valley of the Moon, planted partially to mixed blacks. Here, 12% mixed blacks make up the whole, offering a bright and juicy explosion of brambly blackberry, smoked cherry and leathery licorice. The finish is soft and spicy.
Name: Limerick Lane 2014 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and balanced in red and black berry, this is meaty, smoky and accessible wine, as complex and sultry as any of its vineyard or block-designates, yet softer and rounder, ready to play. A handful of Syrah, Petite Sirah, Peloursin and Negrette are included.
Name: Limerick Lane 2014 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a lovely vineyard-designate, brawny and bold and completely floral. Brambly blackberry is met by plum and raisin as a leathery texture provides grit and brawn. Spicy black pepper and cinnamon season the finish.
Name: Ravenswood 2014 Dickerson Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 19% Petite Sirah and 3% Carignane, from vines averaging 50-plus-years of age, this is a bold and brambly wine, laced in elegance. Coffee, leather and a taste of caramel are seasoned in allspice and black pepper, as persistent, sinewy tannins provide weight and heft.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a 1,000-foot-elevation site, this wine traffics in juicy red cherry, plum and blackberry, its body robust and full-bodied. Red licorice adds to the power and brightness of acidity, the wine finding its balance between concentration and peppery spice.
Name: Joseph Jewell 2013 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright, dusty leather is a highlight of this structured, meaty, balanced wine, firm and grippy in tannin. Red berry and coffee complement each other to find a tension between fruit and spice.
Name: Ravenswood 2014 Old Hill Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is Zinfandel at its unabashed best, bringing aromas of vanilla, spice, raspberry and cranberry. The palate holds nothing back—full bodied and rich. It's a heavy hitter but keeps its balance remarkably well.
Name: Two Vintners 2014 StoneTree Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fully ripe, extracted fruit dominates in this robust, heady wine, a mixture of red berry jam and vanilla that takes on a perceptible sweetness on the palate. From the mighty mountain vineyard, it also shows dustings of dried herb and brush, an herbal undertone that balances its overall intensity.
Name: Louis M. Martini 2014 Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Rich and thick, this full-bodied, ripely bold wine has small amounts of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Mocha chocolate meets blackberry jam washed down in fresh-brewed coffee, making for a memorable experience.
Name: Ballentine 2014 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Simple in robust red fruit, this vineyard-designate shows richly crafted layers, full-bodied layers of leather, coffee and cola that get a lift of acidity on the finish.
Name: Martin Ray 2014 Puccioni Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big-boned, this wine is juicy and herbal, a nice mixture of pipe tobacco and rustic, brawny blackberry and sage.
Name: Keating 2014 Montecillo Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This generously ripe wine has a tartness of acidity and cranberry crunch dotted in black cherry that freshens its overall thickness and density. Full-bodied, the oak is nuanced, 30% of it new American oak.
Name: Tin Barn 2013 Los Chamizal Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Nutty in generous oak, this wine is smoky in bacon fat, tart and intense. Full-bodied and ripe, the fruit leans dark and brambly, with under layers of cigar, leather and cinnamon.
Name: Oakville Winery 2014 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Oakville)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From head-trained vines interspersed with Alicante Bouschet and Petite Sirah, this is a bright, likable wine, teased in bacon, cola and brown sugar that finds a fresh streak of red currant and juicy strawberry as it opens, the acidity in full view. A bite of chocolate dots the finish.
Name: Kunde 2014 Reserve Century Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is high-octane and boldly ripe wine from the wilds of Calistoga, offering bacon char, cranberry, plum and a richness of milk chocolate.
Name: Hunnicutt 2014 Luvisi Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Yeasty with aromas of beer batter, this is an interestingly robust wine, concentrated in blackberry and dark cherry with undertones of tar and bitterroot.
Name: Keating 2014 Buchignani Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of raspberry, herb, cigar box and dried cranberry are followed by full-bodied cranberry and raspberry flavors. It delivers enjoyment but seems a bit dried out.
Name: Angel Vine 2013 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Cherry, berry and smoke ride atop a sultry texture in this estate wine, 100% varietal. Leathery accents provide texture and additional weight as a buildup to a seamless, easygoing finish rides out.
Name: Benessere 2014 Estate Black Glass Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Ripe and plummy in explosive fruit and heat, this wine shows cherry-berry jamminess wrapped in a leathery, meaty package dusted in cinnamon and brown sugar.
Name: Mazzocco 2014 Beasley Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reduced and extracted, with 10% Syrah blended in, this big-boned wine imparts big tannins around a taste of boysenberry, strawberry and tobacco.
Name: Meeker 2013 Barrel Select Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A healthy addition of 13% Petite Sirah provides added weight and intensity to this wine, a soft, supple and richly conceived combination of smoky black fruit and mocha.
