Name: Napa Cellars 2014 Classic Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Cola and Dr. Pepper both appear on the nose of this thick, dense and heavy wine, that's hugely concentrated in black olive and blackberry.
Name: Wilson 2014 Three Dog Zin Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Raisin-plum cake comes first to mind in this richly ripe, densely bold wine, rounded and approachable on the palate in thickness and a taste of brown sugar.
Name: Mazzocco 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a smoky, earthy wine that's fully ripe and flush in juicy fruit. Cherry, blackberry and grilled mushrooms find cinnamon and cola flavors as a tart finish builds on the palate.
Designation: Two Acre Villa Andriana Vineyard Estate
Name: Summers 2014 Two Acre Villa Andriana Vineyard Estate Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tight, firm tannins envelop bittersweet tobacco, subtle oak and blackberry in this boldly ripe and full-bodied wine, the structure simple and supportive. Vanilla and cinnamon prevail in accenting the density of the fruit.
Name: Kunde 2014 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Smoky char takes on a grilled meatiness in this wine, a fatness of bacon and blackberry jam emphasizing the intense ripeness and grip of it all. Blackberry jam and vanilla sweetness underscore its big personality.
Name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2013 Maestro Collection Ranch 11 Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas smell disjointed, with notes of barrel spice, vanilla and maple syrup. The palate is quite sweet and ripe, with abundant baking-spice accents.
Name: Coyote Canyon 2013 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Primitivo (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A blend of Zinfandel with Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah and Merlot, this wine takes on a heady mix of herbal cedar, tobacco leaf, tar and subdued blackberry within a context of charred oak and dense body.
Name: Director's Cut 2013 Cinema Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruity berry takes on jammy fullness on the palate in this supremely ripe wine. Dotted in leather, vanilla and cinnamon, its finish is a touch rough.
Name: Silver Veil 2014 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a blend from several vineyard sites, including Banfield, Saitone, Carlisle, Montafi and Papera, each boasting more than 100-year-old vines. A chocolate cordial note dominates the palate, as bold cherry, rhubarb, cinnamon and citrus flavors wander in. It's a steal for the price, too.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Old Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A yeasty baked bread note leads this wine's nose before smoky oak and lushly layered blue and black fruit take over. With spice- and leather-laced flavors, it offers a wealth of brawny structure and lip-smacking succulence, finishing soft.
Name: Beltane Ranch 2014 Heins Block Estate Grown Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Intense with cherry and surprising tart citrus notes, this vineyard-designated wine is a perennial knockout. High in acidity, it offers a lively structure, soft texture and a muscularity of tobacco and dusty, brambly flavors.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This almost-100% Zinfandel bottling from the heritage Papera vineyard is delightfully complex and juicy—an expressive celebration of spiced plum and soft, juicy cherry. The spiciness on the back palate is especially rewarding.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Papera Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: High-toned cranberry and cherry fruit meets masculine leather, coffee and tobacco flavors in this vineyard designate from a gravelly site. Asian spice and cinnamon notes give it seasoning and complexity that complements the brambly fruit.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Solidly built and fruity without seeming sweet, this full-bodied wine combines concentrated flavors with a firm structure of fine-grained tannins and supportive acidity. Light oak touches add interest, but the wine's power and appeal come from bold varietal-fruit flavors.
Name: Hilt & Blade 2015 Antecedence Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the 1904 planting at Puccioni Ranch, this impressive wine packs tons of flavor in a soft, peppery, integrated package of red fruit and baking spice. Though weighty and robust, it has an underlying acidity to lend freshness and vibrancy.
Name: Puccioni 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and austere in understated waves of cranberry and cherry fruit, this wine delivers subtle power and intensity in a leathery-textured package. True to its old vine heritage, it shows a dry dustiness of peppery spice.
Designation: Home Ranch Teldeschi Vineyards Century Old Vine
Name: Del Carlo Winery 2014 Home Ranch Teldeschi Vineyards Century Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a spirited, juicy and satisfying coastal wine, bright with layers of raspberry and cherry that wear their full-bodied ripeness well. The fruit is sprinkled beautifully with a light spiciness of vanilla and cinnamon oak.
Name: Armida 2014 Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an almost centenarian vineyard planted to mixed varieties, this has juicy core of cherry and blackberry fruit. An undercurrent of Asian spice and white pepper shows through, finishing on a minty chocolate note.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine contains 14% “mixed blacks,” including grapes like Alicante Bouschet, and is powerful and ripe. Its flavors seem at once tart and sweet, framed by dusty cherry and vanilla. There's a persistent, feral, compost-like thread throughout its dense structure and tannic finish.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a classy, elegant expression of the variety, despite its brawn and ripe density. Fruit-forward, with blackberry and cherry flavors, it shows traces of vanilla, spicy pepper and smoky oak. The texture is soft, with subtle tannins.
Name: Buehler 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Subtle oak shadings add welcome complexity to this medium-bodied, well-balanced and delicious wine. It has hints of vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon, ripe blackberry fruit and maple-like sweetness, but firm tannins keep it appetizing.
Name: Renwood 2014 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: With its quirky cartoon label, this is a very enjoyable wine from an obscure region northeast of San Diego. Bright and vibrant on the nose with cola, dried violet and plump plum fruit aromas, this bottling is unabashedly jammy. Root beer, black plum, cocoa and nutmeg spice mark the palate. Just a fun, juicy treat.
Name: Two Dogs Barking 2014 Zinfandel (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a well-built, elegant Zinfandel, with restrained blackberry, sagebrush and wet clay aromas on the nose. A chalky structure shows on the palate, where wild mint and thyme notes add nuance to the elderberry and black plum skin flavors. Patience and cellar time will allow further aromatic layers to emerge.
Name: Arndt 2014 Benito Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brick red in color, this wine also smells of brick and smoke. On the palate, it's moderately structured and robustly ripe, showing burly blueberry and mocha chocolate flavors with unfettered fervor.
Name: Mounts 2014 Old Vine Estate Grown Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Nicely dry and well structured, this full-bodied wine will provide serious enjoyment at the dinner table. It has all the ripe, juicy berry qualities of the grape variety and adds moderate tannins for a firmer mouthfeel. Layers of blackberry, cherry and pepper flavors make it especially interesting.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2014 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Ripe, full-bodied and delicious, this wine is big and bold, pushing the envelope with late harvest flavors, seeming sweet on the palate and the finish. It tastes like blackberry jam and dark chocolate. It would make a fine after-dinner drink, too.
Name: Renwood 2013 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright with a touch of smoky leather, this ripe, full-bodied red is lengthy and lush on the palate, seasoned with black pepper, mocha and blackberry preserve.
Name: Rosenblum 2013 Rockpile Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rum-raisin cake comes to mind when smelling this robust, ripe wine that wears its intensity well. Fruit-forward with cherry and berry flavors, its texture is soft and luxuriously simple.
Name: De Loach 2014 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy leather and black pepper notes play against tart cherry and raspberry flavors in this light-bodied red blended with 8% Petite Sirah. Bright acidity supports the fruit.
Name: Hobo 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Perfumed with oak and smoke, this is a full-bodied, robustly built and powerful reserve-level wine, the fruit taking on a candied berry quality as it opens. Soft tannins fill out the palate, while a layering of pepper and cinnamon notes weigh in, taking full strength on the finish.
Name: Frank Family 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright, juicy red raspberry and bramble aromas meet red spice and earthy loam characteristics on the nose of this bottling. Medium in density on the palate, it's playful and flavorful, if not especially complex, with hints of wild thyme giving herbal nuance its core of red fruit.
Name: Transmission 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard designate is grippy with plush, sizable tannins, allowing for a textural softness beneath all its power. Light-bodied currant, plum and blackberry flavors are supported by sharp acidity, remaining fresh and vibrant through the finish.
Name: Hobo 2014 Branham Rockpile Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Zinfandel-based wine, which blends 13% Tempranillo and 6% Petite Sirah, shows strawberry, cherry, baking spice and cola aromas. There is decent tannic tension on the palate, and the flavors—sarsaparilla, cola, stewed plum and clove spice—are easily enjoyable.
Name: Chronic Cellars 2015 Dead Nuts Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a pungent lanolin-like aroma on the nose of this bottling, while wet clay and char notes lend nuance to its black fruit. The palate offers density and tannic depth, with dried mint and blackberry jam flavors that extend into the finish.
Name: Seven Oxen 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A youthful, light-bodied and exuberant expression of the variety, this shows raspberry, vanilla and currant flavors, with a tangy tartness of citrus on the palate. Oaky tannin comes through on the finish.
Name: Camp 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Fresh grapey, berry-like aromas and rich, ripe flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to drink. It's smoothly textured and almost sweet, with generous fruit elements filling out the palate and persisting through the finish.
Name: Renwood 2014 BBQ Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Simple red and black berry fruit defines this estate wine, along with its soft, ripe and lightly structured body. Vanilla and cranberry notes emerge on the midpalate, while the finish is marked by a grip of oaky tannin.
Name: Kokomo 2014 Timber Crest Vineyard Estate Grown Primitivo (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This rustic wine from a site just outside of Healdsburg offers a dense taste of grenadine liqueur and cola. It has moderate structure and plum and nutmeg accents.
Name: Parmeson 2014 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoke, brawny black pepper and black cherry flavors meet on the palate of this intensely ripe wine. It's grippy and high-octane in power, with a layering of mocha dust.
Name: DeLorimier 2014 Osborn Ranch Primitivo (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with less than a handful of Petite Sirah, this wine is thick and ultraripe, showing dense chocolate and plum sauce flavors, accented with soy.
Name: Mazzocco 2014 Sullivan Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: High in ripeness and intensity, this vineyard designate overpowers with astringency as it plows through a wall of blackberry jam and chocolate flavors.
Name: DeLorimier 2014 Two Pear Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This soft, robustly ripe wine shows a raisin-like prune character, tasting somewhat chalky on the palate.
Name: Mazzocco 2014 Fog Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Big, powerful and confidently ripe, this full-bodied wine oozes with luscious blackberry, wild sage and blueberry flavors that seemingly melt in the mouth. A great example of the late harvest style without being sweet, it's dry, concentrated and persistent on the finish.
Name: Three 2014 Bigelow Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Harvested late but not sweet, this decadently rich and fruity wine pairs well with cheese or an equally opulent dish such as osso bucco or red wine risotto. It has grapey, jammy aromas and late-picked flavors like fig, plum and black raisin that glide along the palate. The alcohol is high, tempered by a velvety texture and moderate tannins.
Name: Three 2014 Mazzoni-Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is big and bold, but its opulent, generous fruit flavors perfectly fill out its frame, giving it the balance it needs for enjoyment. Ripe blackberry and black cherry notes mark the palate, unfettered by oak-inflected flavor. The texture is firm with lots of fine-grained tannins, while the fruit lingers nicely on the finish.
Name: Bonterra 2014 Made With Organic Grapes Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Savory pepper and grilled beef aromas make this wine appetizing, its rich berry and ripe plum flavors bringing excellent concentration and depth to the palate. It's big and bold, yet polished. Firm tannins interlacing with ripeness and spiciness to keep it balanced and help propel a lingering finish.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opulent and ripe, this full-bodied wine has great fruit concentration, a rich texture supported by firm tannins and a lingering, plummy finish. Oak plays a minimal role through all its blackberry and black plum flavors, but spicy clove and cedar accents emerge and persist through the finish.
Name: Three 2014 Old Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This substantial dry wine made from dry-farmed vines planted in 1980 has tempting jammy aromas and ripe and satisfying fruit flavors matched by a solid backing of fine-grained tannins and acidity. It has the appetizing bite and firm texture that will make it mouthwatering at dinner.
Name: Lula 2014 Mariah Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full of berry and spice aromas, this wine is full-bodied, dry, and grippingly tannic in texture, offering ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors that match its big structure. Gutsy and concentrated, it's made from estate-grown fruit.
Name: Andis 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A classic Zinfandel with its unmistakable spice aroma and wild berry flavor, this is dry and tannic enough to provide balance. Medium bodied, it packs plenty of flavor and an appetizing mouthfeel.
Name: Brutocao 2012 Bliss Vineyard Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Far and away the best red in the winery's entire lineup, this deeply fruity wine is loaded with concentrated blackberry flavors. It's a dark and stormy night of a wine, with thick tarry tannins and a streak of espresso to wrap it up.
Name: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Hillside Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Potent oaky aromas like nutmeg, cinnamon and toasted baguette meet abundant, jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has moderate tannins that provide nice grip and shore up the oak and fruit components for balance.
Name: Brazin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is fresh and fruity, full of raspberry and strawberry jam flavors that taste like they're straight from the crusher. Despite its full body, it's not a monster of a wine, feeling rather balanced, dry and well filled-out by flavor.
Name: Andis 2014 Toy Vineyard Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Borden Ranch, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripe fruit flavors and chocolate accents give opulent character to this full-bodied wine. The flavors are suggestive of late-picked grapes, raisins and ripe figs, while the texture is easy and almost soft, with no tannic bite.
Name: Neyers 2015 Vista Luna Zinfandel (Borden Ranch)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has a unique, earthy fig aroma and flavor, full body and a broad, mouth-filling texture. Its slight rustic character is interesting to explore and doesn't overwhelm the palate. An enjoyable and different expression that's also reasonably priced.
Name: Andis 2013 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A blanket of sweet-seeming, oaky, baking-spice flavors wraps around ripe fruit in this medium-bodied, supple and relaxed wine. It will be a lot of fun for people who like the full-on new-oak style.
Name: Amador Cellars 2013 Estate Family Reserve Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Dramatic oaky aromas and flavors, like nutmeg, butter and vanilla, create an attention-grabbing profile in this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine. It has solid fruit as well, but that character plays second fiddle.
Name: Jelly Jar 2014 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smoky, charred aromas and roasted flavors give this full-bodied wine a big, rowdy personality, nearly outshining the fruit flavors. That heavy toast an oak-derived attribute that tends to polarize wine drinkers, but those who love it will appreciate this wine.
Name: Predator 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a lovely, full-bodied wine from a historic vineyard site on Westside Road. Bready and brambly, it offers a juicy, exuberant palate that's rich and layered in blackberry, coffee and a persistent backdrop of white pepper. It's structured and balanced, with a deft twist of dusty dried herb.
Name: Williams Selyem 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From the only producer to source Zin from this famous vineyard, this wine is abundant in a complexity of baked bread, blackberry jam and vanilla, with endless depth on the palate. Fresh and juicy, it balances its fruitiness with mountain-sized tannin strength and concentration.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Stagecoach Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Perfumed in a wildness of violet and lavender, this beautiful wine is rich and smooth on the palate, both textured and layered. Seductive in its hint of leathery white pepper, it develops brambly blackberry-compote flavors as it opens in the glass.
Name: VGS Chateau Potelle 2013 Zinfandel (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Meaty and dusty, this wine from a Vineburg-based site is full bodied, ripe and voluptuous with a light dusting of black pepper and clove. Within its cradling of dense concentration, an underbelly of acidity allows for freshness within the power.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Valsecchi Vineyard Zinfandel (Carneros)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Peppery, brambly, integrated and balanced, this impressively layered and complex 100% varietal wine highlights the grape's ability to be fruity, spicy and soft all at the same time.
Name: Alyris 2014 The Audition Mount George Estate Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: “Wow” is the first word that comes to mind when tasting this superconcentrated and immensely fruity wine. It practically overwhelms the nose and the palate with ripe, jammy boysenberry and blackberry, sprinkled with licorice and black-pepper nuances that add attractive complexity. It's a big wine all the way, but not extreme in alcohol.
Name: Artezin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Luscious and sleek in mouthfeel, and drenched with wonderful fruit flavors, this wine is a beauty. It has ample ripe fruit flavors like boysenberry and cherry pie without being literally sweet, while a sense of quiet concentration lasts on the lingering finish. It is structured with enough fine-grained tannin to age gracefully, so it's best to drink after 2019.
Name: Rosenblum 2012 Carla's Reserve Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a dry-farmed vineyard planted more than 50 years ago, this 100% varietal wine is highlighted in compost, leather and graphite. Well structured, with firm, strong tannins, it offers a tartness of pomegranate and black cherry along with a complexity of savory tobacco leaf.
Name: Ottimino Vineyards 2013 Biglieri Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This sultry, big-boned wine offers deft aspects of black pepper and dried herb atop a softly layered touch of brown sugar. Richness is there, as is a voluptuous flirtatiousness, yet it remains dry and dusty on the palate and classically varietal.
Name: Haraszthy 2013 Indian Springs Ranch Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a block planted in 1910 consisting of hearty portions of mixed blacks, this wine is abundantly floral in rose petals, with a plummy core dusted in smoky oak. The tannin structure is sizable, while the wine is full of leather, cigar box and black pepper accents that weave within the ripe fruit.
Name: Armida 2014 Tina's Block Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: In this wine, a distinct and delicious blackberry-jam aroma is backed up by concentrated and pure fruit flavors. But the balance is good and dry, and the wine has a mouth-filling texture buoyed by fine-grained tannins and full body. This is a wonderful example of a flavor-packed but sophisticated dinner wine from this varietal.
Name: Jaxon Keys 2013 Estate Michael's Reserve Norma's Vineyard Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This showcases a highly sought-after vineyard site known for its tension of big, bold, ripe fruit and notable acidity. Red currant, cranberry and leather find a well-composed rendering of leathery clove and other lively hits of spice, including black and white pepper.
Name: Novy 2014 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Named for his sons Hunter and Ryder, this is part of Guy Fieri's small wine project based in Sonoma County. The partnership with Winemaker Guy Davis of Davis Family Vineyards sources from three old-vine sites, including Doug Rafanelli's, to make a balanced wine marked by savory black olive, black pepper and a strong current of Italian deli aromas and flavors. Pillowy tannin and a shot of tobacco add nicely to the whole.
Name: Hunt & Ryde 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Leathery at its core, this small-production wine is subdued and relatively restrained, showing bold, juicy layers of strawberry and cranberry. It offers enviable structure and ability to age. It will drink best 2023–2028.
Name: Sequum 2013 Kidd Ranch Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From estate-grown grapes, this impressive bottling is moderately spicy, showing a floral flair on the nose. Medium bodied and soft on the palate, it shines in a depth of plum, leather and black pepper.
Name: Ancient Oak Cellars 2012 Pagnano Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An unusual level of flavor concentration and density of texture make this wine substantive in mouthfeel, intriguing in depth, and a good wine to age for a few years. It has touches of sage and sweet oak in the aroma, plus full-bore flavors of blackberry and black cherry on the palate. With great structure due to firm tannins and acidity, it will be best to drink after 2019.
Name: Graziano 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dried sage and a hint of saddle leather highlight this dry, dusty wine noteworthy for its bright, buoyant acidity and layering of red currant. It delivers plenty of full-bodied flavor within a complex, approachable experience.
Name: Novy 2014 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a selection of its best vineyards across the county, this producer showcases a majority of the variety with 16% Petite Sirah, all aged in French oak, 25% of it new. Black olive, spicy leather and cinnamon make for a bold, dry and boisterous wine that's entirely enjoyable, integrated in terms of both tannin and oak.
Name: Ottimino Vineyards 2013 Zinfinity Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An earthy, black-pepper aroma and classic blackberry, raspberry and brambly spice components make this a fine example of Zinfandel. It is full bodied, mouthfilling and generous in flavor, benefitting from good acidity and moderate, fine-grained tannins for structure.
Name: Black Saint Peter 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated strawberry, black cherry, cinnamon-laced latte, licorice and mocha converge in an intriguing and beautiful nose from this legendary Zin winery. The structure is immediately apparent on the palate, framing smoked strawberry, oregano and dill flavors. It's full of plush, ripe fruit, but seemingly bone dry.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2014 Vortex Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky and abundant in brambly blackberry and black cherry, this is a soft, ripe and leathery wine from a dry-farmed site. Black olive and black pepper contribute additional complexity and spicy intrigue, while measured acidity keeps it grounded.
Name: Beekeeper Cellars 2014 Secret Stones Madrone Spring Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal wine aged in French oak from a dry-farmed site. It begins with a heady rush of ripeness before finding a balance between acidity and concentration. Soft layers of cherry, berry and white pepper combine expertly for a delicious expression of the grape.
Name: Ottimino Vineyards 2013 Rancho Bello Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fragrant, spicy oak aromas blend with ripe raspberry and blackberry flavors in this full-bodied, almost-sweet tasting wine. All that spice and fruit fills out a soft, velvety frame shaped by light tannins, an almost thick texture and elevated alcohol.
Name: Sobon Estate 2014 Rezerve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This old favorite has an excellent new release. A classic style of Zin, it surrounds generous fruit and spice flavors with a firm texture and appetizing tannins. It starts with light black pepper and sage aromas to complement the rich blackberry and raspberry fruit, and finishes with lingering nuances of spice and berry.
Name: Rosenblum NV Vintner's Cuvée XXXVIII Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: From a terrific, old-vine site in the heart of the southern-lying appellation, this is a mild-mannered, juicy wine, structured and balanced despite the abundance of ripe red fruit. Cinnamon and pepper complement the restrained nature of the brambly cherry.
Name: Mike and Molly Hendry 2014 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pungent earth and a tease of potato skin add to a perfumed nose of brambly blackberry and strawberry, surrounded by big, grippy tannin. Full bodied, it develops further flavors of vanilla, cinnamon and dried herb.
Name: Gehricke 2014 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has that wonderful but hard-to-pin-down Zinfandel essence that's extremely fruity but also uniquely spicy and brambly. It blends together ripe raspberry, creamy vanilla and red cherry on a smooth, nicely viscous and very full-bodied frame that helps the finish linger.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2014 Big Wood Zin Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Measured oak cradles spicy pepper and a richness of vanilla-kissed black cherry and blackberry in this bold, full-bodied wine, that yes, would pair deliciously with wild boar.
Name: Quivira 2014 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich, spicy aromas and flavors of black cherry and cedar make this full-bodied wine from one of the longest-running wineries in California's Sierra Foothills hard to resist. It has a feeling of breadth and depth on the palate alongside lush layers of tasty fruit.
Name: Sobon Estate 2014 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Powerful fruit flavors and a firm, high-octane feeling on the palate make this a big, imposing wine. It offers tasty, ripe boysenberry-jam flavors, moderate tannins and a lip-smacking finish.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this is very fruit-forward on the nose, with blueberry sauce, tart plum skin, turned loam and vanilla aromas. Ripe blackberry fruits mix with licorice on the palate, where rising acidity and soft but present tannins also offer up roast-beef flavors.
Name: Mattucci 2014 Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruity in wild strawberry and cherry, this is a straightforward, lightly spiced wine from a marquee old-vine site, complete with dusty tannin and softly integrated oak.
Name: Novy 2014 Papera Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very ripe, very fruity and practically oozing across the palate, this full-bodied and very fairly priced wine tastes sweet and lightly tangy. The berry and plum flavors are quite concentrated, keeping the wine focused on fruit and freshness.
Name: Sobon Estate 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This big, bold wine has the taste profile of a Port but is not so sweet or full bodied. Deeper than usual in color, it's concentrated to the point of overripeness in aroma. Rich on the palate with flavors like blackberry syrup and dark chocolate, it should be perfect as an after-dinner wine.
Name: Jaxon Keys 2013 Estate Mae's Block Ravazzi Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smoky, toasty oak aromas and flavors give a flamboyant personality to this full-bodied wine. It smells literally like wood smoke and toasted French bread, while flavors recall jam spiced with cloves and cinnamon. These are all tasty elements, and this wine will be a hit with oak lovers.
Name: Sobon Estate 2014 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lots of spearmint, coyote mint, hot licorice, ginger snaps and Dr Pepper spice up the strawberry fruit of this wine that provides a very herbal take on the grape. Oregano, marjoram, thyme and dill all make a showing on the sip, against a backbone of sweet cherry and blackberry fruit, finishing on cedar.
Name: Martin Ranch 2014 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Blackberry and boysenberry flavors so ripe they seem sweet fill out this smooth, full-bodied wine. The texture is soft and not at all tannic, letting the potent fruit flavors flow easily through the finish.
Name: Great American Wine Company 2013 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cinnamon, leather, roasted beef and red cherry show on the nose of this bottling from a winery that essentially enjoys its own appellation above the Cuesta Grade in the very southern corner of the Paso Robles region. Candied red apple and candied cherry show on the easy-drinking, somewhat sweet sip, with more cinnamon and a touch of bay leaf.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2014 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and brimming in baked-bread aromas, this full-bodied, full-flavored wine is simply layered, with muted characteristics of brambly berry, sage and leather.
Name: Pech Merle 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rather light, easy-to-enjoy aromas suggesting fresh strawberry and raspberry, along with equally fruity flavors don't indicate how full-bodied and high-octane this wine is. Still, it has a smooth texture and lingering finish.
Name: Iron Hub 2013 Esola Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very mellow and mature tasting, this full-bodied wine leaves no rough edges or elbows sticking out, so sipping it is a pleasure. Aromas are savory, herbaceous and lightly earthy rather than fruity, and the flavors follow the same path.
Name: Iron Hub 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a severity of sour cherry and yeasty baked bread on both the nose and palate, showing a lightness of touch in terms of ripeness and oak. It's simple and bright.
Name: Haraszthy 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Astringent tannin mars wild cherry and sage tones that take on a heightened sense of ripeness in this vineyard-designate.
Name: Kenwood 2014 Jack London Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard continues to impress in both this variety and others, this wine showing off its ability to offer fistfuls of red, blue and black fruit as juicy acidity signals freshness and ageability. A wooded undertone of brush and bramble meets swathes of lavender, licorice and ever-so-satisfying dark chocolate as the length of the wine goes on for days.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: From the warmer reaches of the appellation below Mount St. Helena, with vines that have been farmed by the same family since the 1920s, Falleri is a gorgeous wine. Horse saddle and leather give it an exotic edge, while bright red fruit and clove provide a well-crafted balance of fruit and spice. Relatively moderate in weight and ripeness, it may be the producer's most elegant species this vintage.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Falleri Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Named for Bob Biale's father Aldo, who maintained head-trained, dry-farmed vines planted in 1937, this red is as mighty as the man, with a length of powerful acidity. Cherry, blueberry and vanilla play against dried flowers and smoked meat, with a tanginess of Asian spice.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Aldo's Vineyard Estate Grown Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This beautifully concentrated wine is all-fruit, all the time. It's appetizing texture is buoyed by firm, fine-grained tannins. It oozes blackberry syrup aromas, and floods the palate with rich grape and cassis flavors that linger a long time on the finish.
Name: Bella 2013 Block 10 Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: From a historic vineyard property that has gone through recent restoration and some replanting, Old Kraft lies in the heart of the warm appellation, on its western edge below the Mayacamas Mountains. Mouthwatering red fruit takes on a brandy-like velvety hint of molasses as sturdy tannin rides shotgun with softly integrated oak. Cinnamon stick shines through on the finish.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the rocky, volcanic soils of the mighty, high-elevation vineyard, this wine imparts generous layers of blood-red berry, smoke, vanilla and cranberry, a testament to terroir and unobtrusive winemaking. Powerfully built in tight, leathery structure, it conveys a distinct taste of that volcanic rock.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: These Pines Vineyard vines are nearing a century in age. In the new vintage, the wine seems almost brutally powerful, with rough, rugged oak flavors that will want further bottle age to mellow. Ripe blueberry and cherry tones are matched to strong streaks of caramel, cocoa and coconut. Drink 2018–25.
Name: Sineann 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From century-old vines, this wine is potent and focused, with powerful, ripe fruit flavors and a texture that feels polished and precise. The aromas favor black cherry and black pepper, the flavors are fresh and mouth-filling, and the wine has firm acidity and tannins that make the texture appetizing.
Name: Bella 2013 Big River Ranch Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This must-have wine from the producer is always fun, a celebration of bright, juicy acidity and softly rendered dried lavender. Seamless on the palate, it will please fans of the variety and bring new ones into the fold, alluring in its smoky leather, white pepper and depth of blackberry.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This delivers a no-holds-barred Paso-style of richness, with black plum, vanilla, caramel, cola and cherry-filled ganache aromas leaping from the glass. It's soft and luxurious on the sip, with caramel-laced fudge, espresso cream, black-cherry sorbet and loads of milk-chocolate flavorings.
Name: Sextant 2014 Holystone Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: Made from the oldest vineyard in the appellation, first planted in 1905, this wine shows a cooler-climate vibe of dried fruit and leather, accented definitively in white pepper. Smoky oak provides a sultry backdrop against which riches of berry pie, cola and brown sugar play.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Complex and well balanced, this is a great example of a wine made for meal time. Aromas of wood smoke, raspberry, cherry and plum lead to light savory, beefy, spicy notes in the flavors. The body is full, the texture broad and soothing, and the finish lingers warmly.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2014 Home Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very soothing to sip, this is nevertheless a full-bodied wine with generous cherry, raspberry and almost-meaty flavors that flood the palate and spread to the edges of the mouth. The texture is broad and expansive, with only mild tannins.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2014 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 14% Petite Sirah, this old-vine powerhouse is juicy and sultry, with a hint of smokiness. Leather and bark add to the savory picture, while the tannin profile is decidedly soft and smooth.
Name: Macauley 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe blueberry, black-cherry syrup, cola and clove cream combine for a complex nose on this bottling by winemaker Carl Bowker. The palate is vibrant with acidity, yet rich with baked blueberries. Waves of wild California herbs add further nuance, making for a wine that finds a nice balance between disparate elements.
Name: Caliza 2013 Primitivo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the rocky, high-elevation appellation north of Dry Creek Valley, this Zin is rich in baked and velvety layers of brown sugar and blackberry compote, with a softness on the palate. Full bodied, it pushes on ripeness but reins in any excess by coaxing lively acidity from the fruit.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From old-vine blocks planted in 1934, this vineyard-designate also contains 4% Carignane. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it has pillowy tannins, and aromas and flavors defined by mint, dill, black licorice and leather. Layers of deep, dark blackberry and black cherry give it a pleasing fruitiness as well.
Name: Artezin 2014 Collins Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An honest-to-goodness traditional style of California wine, this smells like very ripe grapes and black pepper. Flavors are complex, a little earthy but well structured with sturdy tannins and echoing some of that ripe, raisiny fruit. The high-alcohol level suggests sipping it after dinner.
Name: Domenico 2011 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from a family-farmed vineyard first planted in the late 1800s, this brawny, robust 100% varietal red offers meaty black pepper and baked plum along a stewy, spicy backdrop of full-bodied ripeness and weight. The tannins are sizable yet soft, making for a food-friendly wine.
Name: Artezin 2014 Everett Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-cherry fruit is decorated with crushed thyme, dried sage, roasted meat and cinnamon on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers more cherry fruit but also a bit of black-plum-skin tartness, as well as decent amounts of asphalt and turned earth.
Name: Sextant 2014 Wheelhouse Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With sizable yet soft tannins firmly in place, this wine unleashes substantial flavors of raspberry and prosciutto-wrapped fig. Its seamless texture is dotted in vanilla and smoky meat, ending with plush, round knots of blackberry pie.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2013 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An especially ripe, concentrated aroma of dark fruit carries over beautifully on the palate, where the black cherry, clove and black currant jam flavors are delicious, and the balance feels just slightly sweet. This is a big, full-bodied but smooth-textured wine.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied cherry, crushed fennel, rosebuds, baking spice and baked blackberry show on the sweet-smelling nose of this single-vineyard Zin. Anise arises first on the palate, then more candied red-cherry elements and herbs. The texture is not complex, but the overall experience is nicely varied.
Name: Brophy Clark 2014 Whale Rock Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A thick, sweet and meaty dessert wine made from older vines, this offers a richness of Dr Pepper, baked plum and dried cherry.
Name: David Clinton 2012 Forté Unti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An action-packed wine, especially considering the price, this is a lighter, fresher style of Zin, with smashed strawberry and boysenberry fruit aromas alongside chipped asphalt and riverstone. Juicy olallieberry and baked cherry show on the sip that is enhanced by a touch of oregano.
Name: Sextant 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's 3% each of Grenache and Petite Sirah in this wine that is quite ripe and straightforward in its fruity waves of blackberry, cherry and oaky chocolate. Firm tannins don't overwhelm, opting instead to support and structure. Black pepper leaves a lasting impression on the finish.
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2014 Old Vines Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bacon fat, smoked meat and caramelized onions initially come to mind in this rich, robust red, blended with the tiniest amount of Merlot. Blackberry jam, tar, gunpowder and black pepper characterize the mix of savory with ripe, while the tannin profile remains soft.
Name: Plungerhead 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This superripe, late-harvest style of wine smells like raisins and dried plums. It tastes so fruity and ripe that it's sweet, with a full body to match. It would be best as a dessert wine.
Name: 2Plank 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hefty, spicy aromas like black pepper, cardamom and wood smoke are followed by ripe, almost thick sensations of blackberry, blueberry and dried black fig. The mouthfeel of this wine is broad and soothing, the body extra full, and the finish lingers nicely.
Name: Trinitas 2014 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine has peppery, meaty aromas, good flavors that meld beef with berry, and a rich, mouthcoating texture. It's full bodied, very ripe but not sweet, and it encourages one sip after another.
Name: Trinitas 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of black-cherry syrup meet with raisin, leather and fudge on the rustic but inviting nose of this dessert bottling. It's sweet and lavish on the sip, but with impressive grip, showing strawberry and cherry-sauce flavors along with cinnamon and clove spice.
Name: Mesa Del Sol 2011 Late Harvest Zinfandel (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Intense fruitiness along with touches of mint and baking spices make this full-bodied wine impressive as well as complex and layered. The vivid, ripe strawberry and blackberry components are well balanced by firm tannins and a light oak coating.
Name: Edmeades 2013 Gianoli Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated fruit flavors, full body and a smooth, broad mouthfeel make this wine soothing and satisfying to drink. Made from vines growing on their own roots, the wine delivers a ripe berry and cherry character that floods the palate and lingers nicely on the finish.
Name: Uvaggio 2014 Radix Vinea Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This beautiful wine has aromas as ripe as dried figs, flavors as deep as blackberries falling off the vine, and a welcoming, broad texture that begs for another sip. While full bodied, it's easy to relax into.
Name: Four Vines 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Concentrated, bright and focused fruit flavors feel shaped by a moderate oak influence in this full-bodied and nicely structured wine. A good amount of tannin wraps the raspberry and blackberry flavors in a firm texture.
Name: Edmeades 2013 Perli Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the Horse Heaven Hills region, this wine offers appealing aromas of cranberry, raspberry fruit leather, red currant and spice—all displaying a fine sense of purity. The tart fruit flavors are broad and generous but stay in balance.
Name: Angel Vine 2012 Alder Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Boisterous berry flavors and mouth-gripping texture make this full-bodied wine a lot of fun to taste. It almost gushes with ripe boysenberry and cherry on top of firm tannins, with a lively mouthfeel.
Name: Sottomarino 2013 Primitivo (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A leathery touch of teriyaki and beef char mesh with violet, blueberry and black cassis aromas on the nose of this bottling from deep in the canyons of this appellation. Dark fruits of blueberry and elderberry hang from a strong, cedar-driven tannic structure spiced with vanilla, maple and clove.
Name: Mesa Del Sol 2012 Zinfandel (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Vivid flavors and an unusually firm texture make this a bold, structured and noteworthy wine with good potential for mid-term aging. It is dry, has pure raspberry and blackberry on the palate, fine-grained tannins for grip and a lingering finish.
Name: Edmeades 2013 Shamrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of red fruit, herb and spice are followed by tart, full-bodied fruit flavors. A persistent finish caps it off.
Name: Wind Rose 2013 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fueled by loads of fresh fruit flavor, this is a full-bodied and generous-tasting wine. Tempting cedar and pine aromas lead to raspberry, cherry and blackberry notes that are almost sweet and last long on the finish.
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2014 Old Vine Cuvée Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vibrant aromas of cranberry, raspberry and red currant are followed by full-bodied jammy red-fruit flavors. It drinks quite sweet but overall holds the sugar well and the acid provides a counterbalance.
Name: Angel Vine 2012 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and extroverted wine has become one of Lodi's best-selling. It has an unusually deep color plus lavish aromas of ripe fruit, maple syrup, and milk chocolate. Rich, nearly sweet fruit flavors suggest boysenberry jam.
Name: Earthquake 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is boosted by 10% Grenache, 9% Petite Sirah, 5% Malbec and 1% Syrah. It shows fresh violets and lilacs on the nose along with sharp brown spice, pressed boysenberry and hot asphalt. Juicy blueberry and black plums hit the palate first, followed by elegant touches of thyme and bay leaf.
Name: Proulx 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lightly spicy aromas and rich, soothing fruit flavors make this an attractive, lovable and classically proportioned wine. Cherry and raspberry flavors rest on a lightly tannic but smooth texture, and linger on the finish.
Name: Sierra Starr 2013 Old Clone Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Jammy cranberry, raspberry and maraschino cherry aromas lead to full-bodied very pure fruit flavors that linger on the finish. It pulls no punches but also pulls it off.
Name: Angel Vine 2012 Stonetree Vineyard Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep blackberry aromas are laid across a rocky minerality and lifted by touches of coffee and vanilla on the nicely restrained nose of this best-barrel bottling. Cola, blueberry and black gravel show on the palate, framed by firm tannins.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2014 Zinfusion Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: An almost sweet plum and prune aroma continues to the flavors of this medium-bodied, warm and generous wine. Blended from Sonoma, Amador and Lodi grapes, it offers moderate tannins and a velvety texture.
Name: H Mynors 2013 Old Vine Cuvee Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A blend of dark fruits, savory nuances and black pepper give this dry, full-bodied wine a unique personality. It tastes and feels big on the palate, finishing with warmth.
Name: Cedarville 2013 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lively aromas of brambly red fruit and spice are followed by plump raspberry flavors. It shows a lot of freshness and purity.
Name: Angel Vine 2013 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Lively fruit flavors and great balance make this wine easy to appreciate and a versatile pairing with food. Fresh cherry and raspberry aromas meet rich flavors on a smooth texture that has just enough light tannins for a little grip.
Name: Bogle 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This powerful wine nicely balances big fruit flavors with a firm texture and full body. There are raspberries in the aroma, sweet and sour cherries in the flavor, and a nice, gripping mouthfeel.
Name: Boeger 2015 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Attractive sage and fresh-cut wood accents stay with this full-bodied, value-priced wine from the aroma to the finish. Generous, jammy fruit flavors fill in the middle. Extra time soaking with the grape skins helped make it delicious and spicy, mouthfilling and smooth.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2013 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This soft, easy-drinking wine smells spicy, almost like tobacco, and tastes plummy and pruney. It has a good, smooth texture and lingering finish.
Name: Josh Cellars 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Horse Heaven Hills grown wine shows aromas of tobacco, dried flowers, herbs and red and blue fruit. The palate is full bodied, with tart acidity brightening the flavors.
Name: Angel Vine 2012 Coyote Canyon Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This earthy wine offers dusky, mossy aromas, raisin and light black-pepper flavors, and a touch of sweetness. It has full body and a soft, soothing texture.
Name: Landsman 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Mouthwatering fruit flavors and a firm, dry mouthfeel make this medium-bodied wine easy to appreciate. It smells like fresh cherries and raspberries, tastes ripe and has a fine-grained texture.
Name: McManis 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a good, sturdy wine with ample fruit flavors, a firm texture and full body. It is mouthfilling, ripe and easy to like.
Name: Brutocao 2012 Contento Vineyard Estate Bottled Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh, ripe, almost sweet cherry and raspberry flavors make this wine appealing and easy to enjoy. It is medium to full bodied , with a light coating of tannin to enhance the texture.
Name: Criss Cross 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling shows fresh blueberry and blackberry aromas as well as a bright purple-flower touch reminiscent of wisteria. Bright and juicy on the palate, it features hedonistic touches of strawberry and olallieberry lifted by clove dust.
Name: Peloton 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromas like white pepper and dried herbs lead to ripe, direct fruit flavors and a feeling of power from the very full body.
Name: Rail2Rail 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Minty, menthol aromas and oaky sweetness create a flavorful profile for this medium-bodied wine.
Name: Silk Oak 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A dark aroma like clove and wood smoke makes this full-bodied, ripe-tasting wine seem a little mysterious. It has ripe, easy blackberry and cedar flavors, a smooth texture and a very reasonable price.
Name: Castle Rock 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Flavorful and smooth in texture, this wine smells almost floral, with fruity and spicy notes like cloves. Full of ripe plum and raisin flavors, it has full body and a broad, soft feeling in the mouth.
Name: Leese-Fitch 2014 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Bright cherry and mellow menthol flavors dance on a smooth but firm texture of light tannins in this full-bodied wine. A cedary, minty character lasts into the finish.
Name: Weibel Family 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tasting mature and mellow, this deceptively full-bodied wine has sun-baked aromas, prune and dried-cherry flavors, and a smooth texture. It's lightly tart on the finish.
Name: Fenestra 2012 Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big, bold wine offers lots of fruit flavor, firm tannins and a full body. Ripe berries flood the palate, while a gripping texture makes it feel tight on the finish.
Name: Boyle MacDonald 2012 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Powerful, dark syrupy flavors and strong salt and pepper spices vie for attention in this full-bodied wine. It has heady fruit aromas, savory, spicy accents and a lingering finish.
Name: Ben Ish 2015 Ben's Select Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This relatively light wine smells and tastes like strawberries and raspberries. It has good balance and a straightforward texture.
Name: Zinsane 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Raisin and prune aromas and flavors mark this full-bodied wine as very, very ripe. It has a soft, relaxed texture and earthy notes on the finish.
Name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2013 Free Bird 19 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and earthy wine has a very dark color. Aromas suggest dark chocolate and barnyard, while dense, dark-fruit flavors come with plenty of tannin behind them.
Name: Eagle Ridge 2012 Private Reserve Estate Grown Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This dry, medium-bodied wine has mild berry aromas and flavors. It offers a firm mouthfeel and moderate tannins.
Name: McKahn 2014 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Earthy, peppery aromas and broad but muffled fruit flavors give this wine a rustic feel. It is full bodied and mouthfilling.
Name: Leaping Lizard 2013 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Grande is one of the most historic vineyards in southern Napa, still presided over by the lovely Dorothy Rossi, whose father planted the oldest vines here in 1920, the year she was born. The location, farming and age work together to offer aromas of dusty leather satchel and a richness of juicy blackberry and cranberry. Powerfully elegant and integrated, it evolves in the glass in a myriad of ways, surprising with every sip.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Grande Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard dates to the Civil War era and is owned by Joel and Morgan Peterson, Joel of Ravenswood fame. Funky and selectively spicy, it shows its dry-farmed heritage with dusty tannin and stemmy earth, the density mellowed by piquant red fruit.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: A warm site first planted in 1913 in the heart of the appellation, this vineyard also holds Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah. This wine is hearty and deceptively elegant, mixing flavors and aromas of rum raisin, leather and clove. Gentle tannins wrap around a finishing brightness of red and black berry.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Although one of the cheaper Zins in the winery's line-up, it is showing the best right now, so drink up. Black cherry, licorice, smoked beef and a deep hibiscus note make for a very heady nose. There is a dense yet soft character to the well-structured palate, where strong flavors of blueberry, crushed slate, tobacco, leather and wild herbs make a tasty convergence.
Name: Opolo 2014 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This rich, rewarding wine pleases in baked blueberry pie and a taste of raisin cake, its texture underlined in soft, integrated oak and a velvety density. Cinnamon, black pepper and toffee weave within the waves of ripeness.
Name: Robert Biale 2014 Founding Farmers Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An inviting nose of red currant, violet, lilac and strawberry-laced crème brûlée entices immediately. The palate is framed by wild thyme and sagebrush that decorate charcoal, leather, dark chocolate and roast lamb touches, before finishing on a soft strawberry note.
Name: Opolo 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A totally satisfying wine in its bringing together of velvety texture and flavors of pepper steak, juicy red berry and sultry cinnamon. Aged in American oak, it offers length and body in a ripe, rich package.
Name: Sivas-Sonoma 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of iron and black plum met with cola, wet gravel and dried chaparral on the nose of this bottling from deep in the Carmel Valley. The palate is powered by herbs like thyme and oregano, also showing lots of raw-blood flavors and tons of acid. It's juicy but well spiced.
Name: Boekenoogen 2014 Bell Ranch VIneyard Zinfandel (Monterey)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's surprising brightness to this wine that otherwise traffics in dense chocolate and tightly woven tannin. Beyond full bodied and undeniably ripe, it somehow finds a balance that allows for a palatable experience.
Name: Pezzi King 2013 Row 22 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a mildness to the body and texture, this is big, burly red wine at its most bombastic, an explosion of berry pie and vanilla ice cream that lingers in spicy cinnamon. Ripe and robust, it delivers plenty of flavor and smoothness.
Name: Pezzi King 2013 Harris Kratka Reserve Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine offers soft, malleable red berry, vanilla and marshmallow flavors, making for a ripe, perceptibly sweet experience. Full bodied and densely packed in mellow tannin and oak, it includes a notable hint of peppercorn, and will go well with something similarly appointed, like pepper steak.
Name: Pezzi King 2013 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The mountain aspect of this bottling seems to restrain some of this grape variety's typical exuberance, for better and worse. Light blackberry and dried sagebrush show on the nose, while the palate picks up black raspberry and wet dill flavors.
Name: Opolo 2014 Mountain Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This represents a softer, more subtle side of the variety, holding back on overripeness in favor of simple leather, compost and black pepper. Touches of unearthed truffle offer the wine's one note of richness.
Name: Balletto 2013 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Red fruit dominates in this tightly woven, firmly tannic wine, blended with 9% Petite Sirah. Hints of charred campfire oak support black pepper, cinnamon and berry, the texture smooth and soft.
Name: Decoy 2014 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fistfuls of oak, heat and chocolate-covered blackberry form the basis for this hugely ripe, leathery wine that features a sideshow of tannin. Brick and licorice notes fill out the rest of the generously robust package.
Name: Pezzi King 2013 Oakey Grande Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended from two-thirds Zinfandel and one-third Sangiovese, this red is rustic in smoky fruit, soft tannin, raisiny-plum compote and black olive. Moderate in acidity, it presents as fairly light bodied.
Name: Rock Wall 2014 Rosso di Fiore Marcheschi Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bramble, wet slate, nori, red spice and a smoky, iodine-like element show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers dried red fruit and a gamy quality, dashed with oregano, marjoram and a cigar-like spice.
Name: EOS 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Intense in black, brooding blueberry and cinnamon spice, this wine is robustly varietal if not a bit overdone, dense and syrupy with challenged acidity.
Name: Pezzi King 2013 Hunny Hill Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Densely layered in overwrought notions of brown sugar and vanilla, this wine has a flatness and a discernible sweetness to the overripe black-fruit core.
Name: Pezzi King 2013 Elevation 1040 Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal, dry-farmed and old-vine wine, peppered in cedar, raspberry and vanilla. It's soft and subtle on the palate, with pretty aromatics and a rich backbeat of juicy fruit. Balanced and with an underlying elegance, it delivers in every way.
Name: Vite Vecchio 2013 Centanni Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Nicknamed Black Bee, this hearty, rambunctious old-vine wine is juicy in blackberry and a taste of tar, full-throttled in terms of intensity. White pepper and cinnamon specks provide a spiciness on the palate as the tannins settle in, making way for a fine, leathery finish. Clay Mauritson helped make the wine.
Designation: Black Sears Vineyard Old Vine Reserve
Name: Beekeeper Cellars 2012 Black Sears Vineyard Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This mix of mostly Zin with 14% Petite Sirah from a longtime source for this producer shows plenty of minerality around flavors of cinnamon stick, dark cherry and leather. Soft tannins give it approachability and juiciness that are buoyed by length.
Name: Carol Shelton 2013 Rocky Reserve Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A brawny, hearty and inviting nose of macerated bramble and lush cherry are enhanced by sarsaparilla, leather and turned loam on this bottling from a vineyard planted in 1922. Nutmeg and kola-nut spice enliven the brightly acidic cherry, plum and strawberry fruit. Lilacs and gravel minerality ensue as well, and it all finishes tartly on plum skins.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This variety is a niche player in the state but this wine shows its promise. Aromas of cigar box, mineral, herb and red fruit are followed by a plush full fruit palate. It brings unabashed appeal.
Name: Casa Smith 2014 Porcospino Northridge Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This well-priced wine shows deep aromas of blackcurrant and kirsch bolstered by soft cola, clove and sassafras notes. The palate is framed by a rocky, volcanic minerality and seductive structure that unveils vanilla, minty herbs and rich rhubarb.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2014 Westside Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sweet-seeming oak aromas and spicy-sweet oak flavors bring excitement to this full-bodied wine. It smells like cedar and cinnamon, and tastes like blackberry jam on toast. A moderately tannic texture supports all that richness.
Name: Brooklyn West 2011 Grand Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tiny percentages of Syrah and Petite Sirah play minor roles in this vineyard-designate. They add to the soft, juicy and focused concentration of big-boned red fruit, cinnamon and tangy, tart acidity.
Name: Fogline Vineyards 2013 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from Biodynamic-certified grapes, this opens in tangy cranberry and orange, a refreshingly bright lift for the variety. Full bodied, it teases in leather, pepper and a touch of smoky oak, remaining in balance as it plays out on the palate.
Name: Quivira 2014 Flight Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A savory, woody accent runs through this medium-bodied, earthy and attractive wine made from “America's oldest Zinfandel vineyard.” The mouthfeel is quite smooth, with ample blackberry and strawberry flavors that soak the palate.
Name: Scott Harvey 2013 Vineyard 1869 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of three vineyards, this Zin is slightly lighter in color and shows ripe elderberry, Asian plum and exotic cherry as well as chaparral on the nose. Pepper spice hits the palate alongside soy, light coffee and wild raspberry. It's a compelling sipper.
Name: Felten Cellars 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a hearty, tannic, big and burly wine made from a well-known vineyard in the heart of the appellation. Dense fruit flavors are framed by prominent notes of tar and leather, while a smoky char provides support and additional savory flavor.
Name: David Clinton 2013 Teldeschi Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a hillside vineyard near Moon Mountain overlooking the Sonoma Valley, this wine was blended with 5% Petite Sirah. While not as high in alcohol as some of the producer's other wines, it has a concentrated character on the palate, akin to blueberry syrup, with soft, moderate tannins and a dusty texture. Red and black cherry provide additional fruit flavor.
Name: Beekeeper Cellars 2014 Montecillo Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright olallieberrries, fresh lilacs and crushed graphite show on the rather boisterous nose of this bottling. The wine is quite soft upon the sip, starting a tad sweet and then gaining more serious notes of oregano, tarragon, mint and anise, all presented with strong acidity.
Name: Brian Benson 2013 Arbor Creek Vineyard Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made with 20% Alicante Bouschet, this old-vine wine is perfumed in spearmint and dill, nicely balanced in its approach, allowing juicy blackberry and cherry to speak. A soft texture makes it pleasant on the palate, dotted in comforting waves of leather and coffee.
Name: Miro 2014 Alegria Vineyard Old Vines Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the highly sought-after vineyard high atop the Mayacama Mountain Range, this burly red traffics in smoky leather and big, ripe, juicy black fruit, providing touches of spice and smoke along the way.
Name: Romililly 2013 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy and velvety aromas of dark strawberry and purple fruits show on the nose of this bottling from a winery that also boasts an inn. The palate offers a decent if slightly chunky mineral-driven structure, with slate and crushed-rock flavors hiding the simple blackberry flavors behind a light veil.
Name: HammerSky 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a concentrated wine that borders on bold. Plummy raisin cake underlies a straightforward ripeness and soft bite of bittersweet tannin, the oak subtle but there.
Name: Chalk Hill 2014 Chairman's Club Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick, concentrated and syrupy, this is a burly, rustic and ripe wine, 100% varietal and aged partially in new French oak. It has a nutty aroma and a touch of smoke.
Name: Summit Lake 2011 Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Maple-syrup aromas and a practically syrupy texture make this full-bodied wine taste sweet, while baking spices like cinnamon and vanilla accent the deep, ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors. It's a very tasty wine for oak lovers.
Name: Oak Ridge 2014 OZV Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is easy-going and easy to drink. It smells and tastes like raspberries and red grapes, feels soft in texture and has a mellow fruitiness.
Name: Wilderotter 2012 Estate Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A solid wine for the price, this shows lush aromas of baked red cherries, vanilla, caramel and clove. The palate is more restrained with tart, somewhat rigid tannins that will allow more fruit and spice flavors to emerge with patience.
Name: Hayes Valley 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
