Description: Dried black cherries, vanilla and a touch of roasted meat show on the rich, luscious and fruity nose of this bargain bottling. The palate is juicy with black cherry and milk-chocolate flavors that lean a little bit sweet.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2014 Incredible Red Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Strikingly fresh blueberry and blackberry flavors light up this dry, medium-bodied wine.Relatively light on the palate, it's leaner than most of its peers.
Name: Zinfandelic 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a soft vineyard-designate, approachable and flirting with overripe flavors that rein in accents of soy, brown sugar and Dr Pepper.
Name: Gracianna 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied, intensely ripe wine, slightly sweet-tasting like soda, that benefits from a balance of tangy acidity and a finish of leather.
Name: Badger Hound 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Charred oak, barbecue smoke and a hint of prune detract somewhat in this tart, herbal wine that offers a suggestion of cola. It finishes somewhat flat.
Name: David Clinton 2013 Mounts Family Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plummy and hinting at black cherry, this wine is otherwise soft and simple, with a distracting, full-throttled descent into raisin cake and prune.
Name: Pezzi King 2013 Serracino Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is one of the best Lodi Native wine yet. It has beautiful, soft, fruit and floral aromas, luxurious and soothing berry and black-currant flavors and a layered texture that seems to melt in the mouth. It's full bodied, braced by fine-grained tannins, and seems to unfold nuance after nuance with each sip before lingering nicely on the finish.
Name: St. Amant 2014 Lodi Native Marian's Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a ranch planted originally in 1926 this is a knockout wine, exotically spiced and nuanced in pepper, cinnamon and a distinction of sandalwood. High-toned fruit provides a lift to the lushness that wants to dominate, but never does, allowing the tangy orange and blackberry to speak quietly and clearly.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Montafi Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A lightly earthy, mineral-like quality in the aroma and flavor gives a distinct personality to this subtle and complex wine. Hints of wood smoke and grilled herbs play off a core of ripe, delicious, concentrated berry flavors while firm tannins and a great sense of balance keep it appetizing through the finish.
Name: Maley Brothers Vineyards 2014 Lodi Native Wegat Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is very ripe and jammy in aroma, and delicious like fresh blackberries in flavor. Full bodied, it's almost sweet and very smooth in texture. Made with the Lodi Native hands-off winemaking protocols, it's as close to pure, beautiful fruitiness as a wine gets.
Designation: Lodi Native Lot 13 The Estate Vineyard
Name: McCay Cellars 2014 Lodi Native Lot 13 The Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied but stealthy and deep wine looks very dark in color. It has moderate ripe fruit and spice aromas, but doesn't really show its cards until the flavors almost explode with boysenberry and blackberry jam, and nuances of wood smoke and dark chocolate hit the palate. It has great intensity, layers of flavor and a nice, lingering finish.
Name: Boeger 2014 Primitivo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Cherry, berry and sinewy leather make for a memorable experience of fruit and savory accents in this farm-designate that impresses from start to finish. Offering length and breadth, it's balanced despite noticeable ripeness and body.
Name: Portalupi 2014 Marcucci Farms Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Packed with flavor and hefty in texture, this wine is almost chewy. It shows a delicious ripe berry character and feels velvety on the tongue as its ample, fine-grained tannins mingle with full body and pure flavor concentration.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Field Blend Zinfandel Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely flavorful and intensely fruity, this wine is exuberant, concentrated, very ripe and very full bodied. But it's also smooth and luscious, light on tannins and so packed with blackberry, blueberry and milk-chocolate flavors that they won't quit on the finish.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2012 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This impresses in graceful red berry, dried herb and wild vanilla, each component complementing the next. Well integrated and well made, this is a lengthy, complex and delicious wine that'll please a range of palates in search of moderate ripeness.
Name: Kokomo 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Intensity and subtle power are the hallmarks of this full-bodied, very ripe and fruit-saturated wine. While waves of blackberry jam and sweet black cherry coat the tongue, a sense of sweetness and viscosity clings to the sides of the mouth.
Name: Deaver 2012 Ten Zin Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An aroma like cherry wood and big, ripe fruit flavors shape this full-bodied and very bold-tasting wine. It's dry in style, has some good, fine-grained tannins for grip, and flavors that recall dried raspberries and cherries. It has the concentration to age, so best to drink after 2018.
Name: Fields Family 2014 Lodi Native Stampede Vineyard Zinfandel (Clements Hills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made from fruit grown across the valley, including Chiles Valley and Calistoga, this wine also includes 14% Petite Sirah and 2% Cabernet Sauvignon. It is above all savory and relatively restrained, elegant in red fruit, soft mellow tannin and balanced acidity, with a lingering taste of wild blueberry.
Name: Frank Family 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy dried herb and truffle provide a rough-and-tumble point of view in this wine, a mix of complexity and contoured acidity. The shy, juicy red fruit is cradled in integrated oak.
Name: Quivira 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Always a stellar marriage of site and winemaker, this shows an intensity of red fruit, forest and brown sugar, a streak of dried herb subtly pushing its way through, too. Full bodied and robust, it has juicy acidity that allows for a freshness in the end. Drink now through 2024.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Deep garnet in color, this wine has a nose of blackberry, cranberry and rose petal. It is simultaneously bright yet profound on the palate, with flavors of black currant, red plum, pomegranate, licorice and a hint of green pepper. Soft tannins linger through a spicy but bright finish.
Name: Dalton 2013 D Series Zinfandel (Galilee)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This untamed, rustic wine makes a dramatic detour from the normal commercial highway. It has a wild, brambly thread running through the aromas and flavors, plus nervy, sour-cherry and cranberry that mingle with riper raspberry notes and turn nicely earthy on the finish.
Name: Andis 2012 1869 Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied but also subtle and complex-flavored wine. The aromas bring in mild wood smoke and black-pepper notes, then the flavors add ample fruitiness without going to jamminess. The overall effect is one of sophistication.
Name: Joel Gott 2014 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A co-fermented field blend from vineyards dating back more than 125 years, this heritage red has 13% Alicante Bouschet and 7% Petite Sirah in addition to 2% of a range of grapes, from Tannat to Muscat Noir. Milk chocolate, black pepper and soft black fruit mingle on the medium-bodied palate, with a lingering streak of cinnamon and vanilla on the finish.
Name: Acorn 2013 Alegria Vineyards Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Delicious and bold, this dry wine is easy to enjoy and appreciate. It has aromas like crushed fresh raspberries and blackberries, flavors that are ripe and rich without overdoing it, and a smooth texture punctuated with some fine-grained tannins.
Name: Boeger 2014 Hangtown Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The spicy, oaky aromas are obvious and fun, leading to fully ripe flavors like blackberry jam in this full-bodied, deeply colored and velvet-textured wine. It's big but smooth, and the oak influence is welcome, adding interest and complexity.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2013 Epicenter Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: High-toned red fruit stars in this wine, a nice showing of the sought-after vineyard site atop Moon Mountain. Soft, elegant and integrated in terms of tannin and oak, it retains the structure and acidity to age well and take on additional complexity. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Rock Wall 2014 Monte Rosso Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Elusive on the nose, this wine opens in the glass to show an intensity of chocolate amidst soft layers of black fruit, leather and pepper. The full-bodied texture is soft and generously ripe.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Reserve Zinfandel (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big, hearty and almost meaty wine is full bodied. An earthy/savory thread in the flavor adds complexity and distinguishes this bottling from the field of simply fruity and ripe wines.
Name: Wilderotter 2013 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This classic, versatile, dry table wine has everything in good proportions, from a cherry-like aroma to ripe but not cloying fruit flavors. The moderately tannic texture has an appetizing bite. It's something that can be enjoyed with almost any meal.
Name: Paul Dolan 2014 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dry wine delivers aromatic complexity, firm tannins and solid fruit flavors for an appetizing balance. It smells like raspberries and cedar, tastes like cranberries and raspberries, and finishes with a nice touch of astringency.
Name: Bella Grace 2013 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine has dramatic, smoky aromas and ripe blueberry and toasted bread flavors. The texture is supple, making it hard to realize that this wine is as full bodied as it is.
Name: Trinitas 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a big, tasty and very oaky wine. Smoky, peppery, bacony aromas, and flavors drenched with blackberries find a good fit with the full body, smooth but firm texture and lingering berrylike finish.
Name: Andis 2012 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has good richness, with a sense of heft in the texture. Warm and dark fruit flavors suggest black plum and blackberry, with very full body and a touch of sweetness that lingers on the finish. This wine can be enjoyed like a Port after dinner.
Name: Deaver 2012 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine has a spicy allure, with seemingly more oak influence than most of the Lodi Native wines. Attractive nutmeg and cinnamon aromas lead to even more spicy flavors that are backed with moderate fruit flavors and some good tannic grip in the texture.
Designation: Lodi Native Maley's Lucas Rd Vineyard
Name: Macchia 2014 Lodi Native Maley's Lucas Rd Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smoothness and richness describe this full-bodied wine. It smells plummy and raisiny, tastes ripe like dried fruit, and has a firm texture.
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This very ripe and full-bodied wine has aromas like vanilla and baking spices, sweet cherry flavors and a smooth and rounded texture. A luscious cherry-pie impression lingers on the finish.
Name: Deaver 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is an intense wine, from the concentrated fig and plum aromas to almost-sweet flavors like honey and strawberry jam. It has a very full body and lingering, warm finish.
Name: Ivory and Burt 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a rich and fruity wine with an easygoing, soft texture and lower alcohol than many. Flavors recall boysenberry syrup and strawberry jam, and the wine just seems to melt in the mouth.
Name: Carol Shelton 2014 Wild Thing Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This sports a blue label, to differentiate it from the winery's estate bottling. It's dark and toasty, with robust black-cherry fruit, along with strong notes of charcoal, espresso and vanilla. There's nothing subtle here, but should work well with Korean ribs.
Name: Troon 2013 Blue Label Zinfandel (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Nicely balanced for dinner time, this dry wine is not too fat and not too lean, but just right. It has raspberry aromas, fresh berry flavors and a touch of fine tannin to add grip to the texture.
Name: Big Smooth 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tempting aromas like vanilla and coconut lead to ripe, opulent plum and blackberry flavors and a sensation of sweetness in this full-bodied but smooth and gentle wine.
Name: Bella Grace 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: White pepper and a floral nose pique interest right away in this wine. A relatively light-bodied expression of the grape, it's soft in body and texture that persists in flavors of cinnamon stick.
Name: Boatique 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This old-vine wine intrigues in coconut, chocolate and brambly blackberry goodness. It's also quite ripe in the nose, veering into Port-like qualities, and will please some and not others. Firm, sizable tannins add sustenance.
Name: Williams Selyem 2014 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine is very good in a ripe, almost-sweet style. It smells and tastes like blackberry pie, has full fruit flavors and a smooth, rich texture without noticeable tannins.
Name: Cambridge & Sunset 2014 California Series Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine tastes relatively light and easy despite full body. It has aromas like raspberry jam, flavors that are exuberantly fruity, and a feeling of freshness and brightness.
Name: Bonterra 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Attractive hints of oak in the aroma and fresh cherry-berry flavors make this medium-bodied wine interesting. A good layer of fine tannins adds welcome traction to the texture.
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Chocolate graham cracker and a Port-like aroma of ripeness dominate in this wine, which adds in Carignane and Petite Sirah. Good acidity and a softness of texture complete the picture.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Harris Kratka Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is in the classic mode, offering very ripe and even overripe aromas. Voluptuous berry flavors verge on sweet, and the rich texture comes without a lot of drying tannin.
Name: Bella Grace 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This untamed, boisterous wine has aromas like herbs and cola leading to powerful grapy, berrylike flavors and an assertive, grainy texture.
Name: M2 2014 Lodi Native Soucie Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Very ripe in aroma, almost thick in texture and syrupy in flavor, this wine is full bodied, super fruity and smooth.
Name: Van Ruiten 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Ripe plum and plenty of vanilla and cherry provide the perception of sweetness in this wine. That sensation may stem from the pushing-the-envelope generosity of the ripe fruit or from the oak. or both. It makes for a full-bodied, heady experience.
Name: Pech Merle 2013 Treborce Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is insanely good, from a dry-farmed, yes, rocky outcropping of vines planted first in 1910, then again in 1934 and the 1970s, with Carignane and Petite Sirah in the mix. It's thick, rich and beautifully put-together, full bodied and entirely balanced, with markings of cherry cordial and white pepper that seduce gently.
Name: Limerick Lane 2013 Rocky Knoll Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The appellation famous for Pinot Noir and Chardonnay packs a powerfully pretty punch when it comes to this variety, too, showing in this wine a soft, focused layering of Luxardo maraschino cherry and touch of cranberry. It then reveals an underlying richness that rewards the patient with a splash of white and black pepper, leaving an indelible stamp on the palate. Drink now through 2024.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Saitone Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick, rich and intensely velvety, 1910 Block is structured and surprisingly elegant, with developed acidity surrounding a taste of chocolate-covered strawberry. Leather and black pepper give it a burly robustness that complements the ripe fruit, while the tannins come off as dusty and rocky at the same time.
Name: Limerick Lane 2013 1910 Block Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: From a mountainous vineyard known for its grit and brawn, this wine presents exactly that—a powerful, grippy experience of generous fruit and tannin that's nonetheless complex in a mix of leather, chocolate and coffee. The acidity provides a high-toned undercurrent that makes it enjoyable and ponderous.
Name: Black Stallion 2013 Limited Release Black Sears Vineyard Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-cherry aromas meet with hints of tar and mineral on the restrained nose of this bottling from a historic property in the mountains behind Arroyo Grande. Tart black-plum skin, black raspberry and boysenberry show on the sip, framed by fine-grained, chalky tannins and lifted by a plummy earthiness and touches of dried mint, white sage and pepper.
Name: Saucelito Canyon 2014 Dos Ranchos Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sweetly satisfying and succulent, without being technically sweet, this robust, reserve-level wine offers a layered depth of red-cherry cola and leather that keeps it bright on the palate and impressively lengthy.
Name: Kokomo 2014 Timber Crest Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Co-fermented with 10% Petite Sirah, this red certainly impresses. With a fruity entry, it meets a leathery tightness on the midpalate, its mix of cherry and orange confounding expectations of darker expression from the varieties with its rose-tinged aromas. Spicy pepper rounds out the finish.
Name: Bodkin 2014 The Hill and the Vale Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Combining fruit from two different ranches, as well as 11% Petite Sirah from another site, this fulsome, sultry wine broods in blackberry, vanilla and coconut, presenting itself as friendly if buxom. Broadly appealing, it's full bodied and yet restrained in terms of oak, allowing the fruit to sing.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked meats, concentrated blackberrry and blueberry and a heavily peppered spice character shows on the nose of this bottling, with some dark chocolate for good measure. The tasty smoke invades the palate too, but there's also gingerbread cake, baked black plum, cocoa and baking spices. It offers solid acidity and decent structure too.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2013 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A more modest varietal wine than some of the producer's block-specific bottlings, it nonetheless stuns in its combination of blackberry crumble, dark chocolate and sanguine meatiness. The texture is luxuriously smooth and lasting.
Name: Limerick Lane 2013 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy like a cherry cordial, this medium-bodied vineyard-designate drinks lean and gracefully, showing a spunky side seasoned in cinnamon and clove.
Name: Kokomo 2014 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and showy aromas of olallieberry, packed lilacs and smoked meats make for a very inviting, hearty nose on this bottling. The oak smoke powers the palate, adding savoriness to the plum, cherry and baked-strawberry fruit. A nicely sour herb tension, full of oregano and sage, rounds out the sip.
Name: Pomar Junction 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump blueberry, baked black plum, cracked-rock earthiness and bloody meats show in a reserved way on the nose of this bottling from one of California's oldest vineyards. The sip begins with dark strawberry and ripe red-cherry notes but is quickly consumed by chalky tannins and lively acidity that unleash a wave of white pepper and cola into the finish.
Name: Saucelito Canyon 2014 Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from near the town of Glen Ellen, this is a healthy marriage of power and grace. The wine is fiery in leathery tannin and full-bodied blackberry ripeness laced in cinnamon and black pepper. Aged in new French oak, it's structured and age-worthy, though quite enjoyable now.
Name: Dunbar 2013 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Made from vines at a 3,000-foot elevation by a Zin master, this wine is flavorful, round and rich. It shows plenty of fruit in the aromas and on the palate, serving raspberry and strawberry on a light bed of tannin, with plenty of body to back them up.
Name: Peter Franus 2013 Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Impressively crafted from 20-plus-year-old vines, thus the Heritage tag, this blend of mostly Zin with 20% Petite Sirah and 1% Primitivo is like Sunday brunch. It offers a study in bacon and strawberries laced in syrup, a thick, leathery wine that finishes balanced and just shy of over-decadent.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An interesting study of what years of drought can do to an old vineyard, this bottling is powered by dusty earth on both the nose and palate. Shy aromas of mocha, blueberry and mulberry give way to flavors of cracked river stone and turned earth framed by chalky tannins. There's not much fruit on the sip at all, as if it all dried up.
Name: Saucelito Canyon 2014 Estate Limited Drought Bottling Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A vineyard farmed by the family, Rockpile Ridge is set at the 1,200-foot elevation and planted to nine blocks of the variety, harvested and fermented separately. In this vintage, that leads to full-bodied, well-developed flavors of blackberry dotted in black-peppery meat and dusty tannin.
Name: Mauritson 2014 Rockpile Ridge Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A seductive, oaky, butterscotchy aroma and ripe fruit flavors combine nicely in this bold, full-bodied wine. Good tannins add grip to the texture, and its spicy nuances keep swirling around the blackberry and raspberry through the finish.
Name: Mikami Vineyards 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Iron, beef carpaccio, peppercorn, plum sauce and sesame add intrigue to the black-cherry fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows mulberry, blackberry juice and exotic wild berries as well as shaved dark chocolate and black pepper. A strong acidity lingers long.
Name: South Coast 2013 Oaks Block Zinfandel (South Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine has aromas like toasted oak and baking spices, plus flavors like rich blackberry and boysenberry jam. It's also nicely dry and has a good gripping layer of tannin in the texture.
Name: The Federalist 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Layered aromas of dried rose petals and violets meet with peppery strawberry and plum fruit, proving relatively light with crushed-rock minerality on the nose. The palate is also light but juicy with strawberry, soft cherry and red currant, spiced by black pepper. The tannic structure builds throughout the sip.
Name: Stephen Ross 2014 Dante Dusi VIneyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A peppery, dried-herb aroma and rich chocolate and blackberry flavors make a nice combination in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It feels supple, tastes concentrated and has a lingering, jammy finish.
Name: Gen5 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is an unsually firm and tannic wine for the varietal, and it will be great to pair with a juicy steak or fresh-baked lasagna. It smells like cedar and cinnamon, tastes fresh but not overly fruity, and has an appetizing texture.
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2014 Whiplash Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Berry crumble and licorice star in this full-bodied, hearty and smooth wine, blended with 4% Petite Sirah. Spicy oak and milk chocolate unleash further flavor and spice on the finish.
Name: Dunbar 2012 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This bold but easy-drinking wine offers a good combo of lightly spiced oak notes along with fairly generous blackberry and raspberry flavors. The texture is smooth but with a good tinge of tannin.
Name: Gnarly Head 2014 Old Vine Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Complex, tasty and not too heavy, this is a wine with several subtle attributes that need an extra sip to appreciate. It smells lightly earthy, spicy and nicely fruity, as in cherries and rhubarb, tastes smooth and soft, and has mild tannins.
Name: Fields Family 2013 Old Vine Family Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied cherries, black plums, dried sage scrub and turned earth show on the nose of this bottling, which offers more rustic flair than other Zins. Once sipped, waves of crushed oregano, marjoram and dill take over, followed by red plum and touches of baked raspberry and boysenberry fruit.
Name: Joullian 2013 Sias Cuvee Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a classic, dry wine. It's medium bodied, fresh in aromas and moderately tannic, resulting in a balanced yet grippy texture. It's backed by reserved but tasty cherry and raspberry flavors.
Name: Archgate Cellars 2014 Reserve Bottling Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lighter in color than other Zins, this juicy and easy-to-drink wine would pair with many everyday dinners. Aromas of red plum and strawberry meet with dried spearmint on the nose, while the dainty palate shows soft cherries and clove spice.
Name: Clos La Chance 2012 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A small percentage of Petite Sirah further strengthens this already bold, burly wine.It's powerfully generous in ripe black-fruit flavor and dusty leather.
Name: Wellington 2012 Meeks Hilltop Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spice, herb, smoke and pencil-eraser aromas lead to elegant, tart fruit flavors that don't seem to have fully ripened.
Name: Almquist 2010 Clifton Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Nice manners and medium body make this an easy-drinking, lighter wine. The aromas are like cherries and strawberries, the fruit flavors are almost sweet, and the texture is soft and smooth.
Name: R35 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Petite Sirah and Syrah are included in this intensely fruity wine, aged for one year in French and American oak, 25% of it new. Aromas and flavors of barbecue smoke provide a hint of char, offset by the background sweetness of vanilla.
Name: Director's Cut 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of vanilla, baking spices, Craisins, asphalt and raspberries that seem a bit evolved. The palate drinks off dry and full, with almost port-like flavors.
Name: Almquist 2009 Clifton Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of red fruit, spice and green wood, seeming hot. The cranberry and raspberry flavors are elegant and bring a better sense of balance, though the wood pokes out.
Name: Latah Creek 2012 Monarch Reserve Zephyr Ridge Vineyards Primitivo (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has almost 10% Carignan and has spent considerable time in bottle. It presents as somewhat pruney in aroma, with a slight amount of oxidization, a dusty, high-octane take on chocolate-raisin cake.
Name: Wellington 2010 Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this has a biscuit-like, baked-bread quality to it, with a sweetness of tannin that threatens to overwhelm. The full body lacks in complexity and acidity.
Name: 29 & Oak Wines 2014 Zinfandel (Oakville)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an odd and difficult wine. Strong chocolate aromas recall a just-snapped Hershey bar, and are bolstered with a touch of blackberry coulis. Cola and black cherry show on the palate, but play second fiddle to the overwhelming chocolate flavor.
Name: Graveyard NV Deliverance Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Seductive ripe, oaky and almost sweet flavors make this full-bodied wine easy to love. The plump blackberry and boysenberry flavors coat the palate while hints of nutmeg and vanilla spice up the aromas and continue through the finish. Concentration and a sense of layering close the deal.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2013 Rinaldi Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This seductive wine comes from a side project of Renwood winemaker Joe Shebl. It has perfumed, baking spice aromas and luxuriously concentrated flavors plus a texture that's as plush as it gets. Something about the luscious ripeness and the melting mouthfeel is very compelling.
Designation: Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2013 Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This seductive wine comes from a side project of Renwood winemaker Joe Shebl. It has perfumed, baking spice aromas and luxuriously concentrated flavors plus a texture that's as plush as it gets. Something about the luscious ripeness and the melting mouthfeel is very compelling.
Designation: Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2013 Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With fresh, pure fruit flavors, great balance and very full body, this wine will be great at the table. It has a dry but velvety feel, moderate tannins and good acidity, all of which lift up the great cherry and boysenberry nuances and give an overall impression of freshness.
Name: Renwood 2013 Story Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A handsome vein of toasted oak flavor runs through this opulently ripe wine from the aroma to the lingering finish. Along the way firm tannins and bright acidity buoy up the lavishly concentrated blackberry and boysenberry elements to present a dry, nicely textured and appetizingly tannic wine.
Name: Renwood 2013 Kirkland Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is a tour de force, dripping with luscious fruit flavor and packing power in the full-body and lip-smacking texture. The aromas are classic, ripe raspberry and blackberry, lightly spiced with oak, and the flavors ooze more wild berry and pomegranate. With concentration like this and a lively structure of fine tannins, it's good to drink now but will improve through 2020.
Name: Renwood 2013 Sea of Grapes Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Light hints of licorice and clove dance around lusciously ripe fruit flavors in this big, layered and almost monumental wine. The fruit is darker than usual, like black plum and currant, while the thick yet fine tannins massage the mouth as you sip and pull all that gorgeous fruit through the lingering finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 ReZerve Zin Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is a prime example of a dry but deeply satisfying style of Zin. It has aromas like dark chocolate with hints of wood smoke and cedar from aging in 50% new oak and focused, pure fruit flavors on a firm, lip-smackingly tannic texture that begs for another sip. It's not sweet, but so, so tempting.
Name: 2Plank 2013 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Saracina makes dazzling white wines, but this intense red is outstanding too. Dark fruits like blackberry mingle with bright raspberry in this hefty, substantial wine that's full bodied and handsomely tannic. It's dry, very textural in the mouth and concentrated well enough for a lingering finish.
Name: Saracina 2013 Pick and Shovel Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is more structured, tannic and textural than many, and shows the sophisticated personality of a dry wine that still has plenty of ripe flavors. It smells and tastes like wild blackberries dusted with cinnamon. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Renwood 2013 Fiddletown Special Reserve Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe black cherry and a hint of menthol in both the aromas and the flavors give this brawny wine a unique personality. It has bold fruit, ample tannins for texture and good acidity for balance. This is tasty now but will age well through at least 2023.
Name: Renwood 2013 Grandpere Special Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an outstanding wine from one of the Foothills' rising-star wineries. Dark, concentrated fruit flavors like black currant and dried plum surround a solid texture of firm tannins and ample acidity. It's a big, extremely tasty wine for an attractive price.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An abundance of fresh fruit spills out of this full-bodied, pure and uncomplicated wine in a way that's hard to resist. There is little obvious oak to get in the way of flavors like vine-ripened raspberries and blackberries as they stream along on fine tannins and lithe acidity.
Name: Three 2013 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It's amazing how this super-concentrated wine smells like chocolate cherries and tastes almost like blackberry syrup, yet it's nice and dry in style. A firm coating of fine tannins gives grip on the tongue and seems to extend the juicy fruit and dark chocolate notes on the finish.
Name: Three 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is the side project of vineyard manager Chuy Ordaz and his family, from a vineyard he has long farmed. It's impressively elegant while offering a pack of combustible power. Rustic and earthy on the nose, it follows with truffle, red and blue fruit, leather and coffee, the tannins are big and spicy.
Name: Ordaz Family Wines 2013 Montecillo Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has jazzy, jammy aromas and ripe blackberry and strawberry flavors, wrapping them in a warm layer of fine-grained tannins and a nice dash of sweet baking spices from aging in oak.
Name: Renwood 2013 Riker Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made with grapes from the Steinbeck, Wine-Bush and Cocavin vineyards, this Zin is packed full of baking spice, dark strawberries, smoked beef, black pepper and gingerbread on the rich, inviting nose. The palate shows a tad more restraint, but offers juicy black plum, rounded cola, dried thyme, peppercorn and pencil lead flavors.
Name: Eberle 2014 Steinbeck Vineyard-Wine-Bush Vineyard-Cocavin Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A firm texture, ripe flavors and good sense of balance help put this wine on an equal footing with very good wines from other grape varieties. Juicy blackberry meets dark chocolate on the palate and both linger on the finish.
Name: Renwood 2013 Jack Rabbit Flat Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A formidable expression of a high-elevation vineyard atop what is now known as Moon Mountain, this wine opens with a definitive note of spicy cinnamon stick before venturing into cherry and vanilla. Soft, likable and well-managed in terms of tannin and oak, it finishes rich and robust.
Name: Black Stallion 2013 Limited Release Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fantastically concentrated fruit flavors seem to turbocharge this very full-bodied, superripe wine. Blackberry, boysenberry and dark chocolate weave in and out of the almost-thick and nicely viscous texture, lingering on the finish.
Name: Boeger 2014 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an excellent, dry, well-balanced and nicely tannic wine that would love to come to your next dinner featuring a roast bird or grilled chop. It's a bit reserved, not as showy as a lot of other wines, but has the gripping texture and firm acidity that is great at the table.
Name: Easton 2013 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big, ripe wine wraps intense and delicious fruit flavors in a plush but tannic texture, and does it so well that it's hard to put down the glass. The blackberry and cherry flavors taste pure and concentrated, seeming to gain intensity with each sip, and they linger through the finish with lip-smacking intensity.
Name: Oak Farm 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Beautifully balanced and quietly powerful, this full-bodied wine poises plenty of berry and dark plum flavors on a smooth, sophisticated texture that carries all that fruit through the finish. It's dry, and that's a plus for pairing with most food.
Name: Philo Ridge 2013 Vittorio's Vineyard Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of gingerbread cookies with a black-cherry glaze meet black gravel and a touch of asphalt on the nose of this complex and flavorful bottling. The palate blends the brightness of red cherry and strawberry fruit with a rocky minerality, spiced up by black pepper and settling into a plum-skin groove toward the finish.
Name: Bella Luna 2013 Bailey Ranch Riserva Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied, ripe, well-made and fruity wine, subdued and velvety on the palate in bright red fruit, leather, mint and cinnamon.
Name: Black Stallion 2013 Limited Release Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The grapes for this full-bodied wine hail from the Luvisi Vineyard in the heart of Calistoga old-vine country—a warm and welcome site for the variety. Baked blackberry and black olive combine around a taste of charred meat before brawny spins of brown sugar and nutmeg play on the palate with jolts of chocolate and vanilla.
Name: Hunnicutt 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Inviting aromas of baked blueberries are leveled by crushed asphalt and dried herbs on the refined nose of this bottling. Stewed strawberry and red plum flavors are elegantly cut by more crushed stone, dried spearmint and a touch of sweet tobacco, all held together by grippy tannins.
Name: Graveyard 2014 Mortal Zin Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This well-made wine blends in a hearty 17% Petite Sirah, providing additional power and dusty berry flavor. Sultry and velvety on the palate, it's spicy and peppery in subtle measure, with a juicy cheeriness on the lengthy finish.
Name: Napa Cellars 2013 Classic Collection Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This youthful wine is shyer on the nose than its 2013 counterpart, but is still in development, revealing a complex and layered richness of red cherry and berry, as well as dried herb and lavender.
Name: Ordaz Family Wines 2014 Montecillo Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Peppery leather opens up this wine, blended with 5% Mourvèdre. More savory than fruity, it pleases in big tannin weight and length, with an intensity of brambly wildness and a sagey, smoky edge.
Name: Peter Franus 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An interesting vein of tasty herb flavor runs through this full-bodied, plump and fruity wine. The aroma has hints of dill and sage, and these mingle with black cherry and blueberry on the palate. A sleek texture and long finish complete the picture.
Name: Easton 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Brilliant, pure fruit flavors light up this full-bodied but easy-to-drink wine. Cherry, strawberry and something deeper like black currant dance through the aromas and coat the tongue with their richness. The texture is smooth and plush due to fine tannins and mild acidity.
Name: Steele 2012 DuPratt Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of wilting rose petals, turned earth, wild mint and a lamb-like gamey character entertain the nose on this very special bottling. The palate is quite tart with cranberries, pomegranates and strawberries, with the fruits' bright acidity carrying deep into the finish.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Especial Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A nose of sour cherry and cranberry meshes with sandalwood and savory herbs on this single-site study by the longtime Paso producer. The palate is overflowing with oregano and other dried garden herbs, laid against a juicy red and purple-fruit frame.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of clove, allspice, cinnamon and nutmeg spice show up the strawberry, blueberry and red cherry aromas of this lavish bottling, which also offers scents of crushed rock and turned earth. Similar elements entertain the palate, culminating with a minty pine needle note, proving to be a very dynamic sip.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2012 Old Vine Lopez Ranch Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big and dry wine is a nice change of pace. The wine looks dark, smells deep and tastes full bodied and firm textured. It doesn't have the overripe or semisweet character of many Zins, but instead is rather tannic and even mildly astringent like strong tea, and has lip smacking cranberry and raspberry flavors.
Name: Easton 2013 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Renwood's tiny two-barrel production of its most expensive Zinfandel has aromas like vanilla and coconut and flavors as rich as milk chocolate and strawberry jam. This full-bodied wine is practically a liquid dessert, though it's not overly sweet. It's full-bodied, smooth and broad in texture.
Name: Renwood 2013 Grand Wren Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Northern Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's a lot to admire in this robust wine, from its soft, muddled layers of spicy cinnamon to its well-hewn bursts of black licorice and blackberry. While full-bodied and brooding, it drinks with elegance and a brightness of red fruit on the finish.
Name: Rodney Strong 2013 Knotty Vines Zinfandel (Northern Sonoma)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is an exuberantly fruity, spicy and robust wine, speckled with 2% Petite Sirah. Dark and full of red berry flavor, the palate is dusted in brown sugar and black pepper. Ripe and concentrated, it drinks smooth and elegant despite its serious power.
Name: Grgich Hills 2012 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Minty cedar and red raspberry jam provide a freshness to this medium-built wine, subtle in spice and made in a soft, approachable style. Cherry and cinnamon round out the lengthy finish.
Name: Flinch 2013 Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is complex and deep in flavors, traditional in style and simply gorgeous to sip and savor. It's dry in style, good and tannic in texture, lightly spiced with cedar and cinnamon and grounded in concentrated raspberry and dark cherry flavors.
Name: Martin Lane Winery 2011 Estate Primitivo (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: From vines more than 90-years-old, this is a refreshingly restrained and elegant wine, earthy in grilled mushroom and cherry-berry juiciness, braced in firm acidity. Cocoa and nutmeg provide compelling seasonings that linger on the finish.
Name: Benessere 2013 Collins Holystone Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Like a well-made café latte, this wine balances the dry and restrained elements against creamy, mocha nuances that round out the texture and bring an almost sweet, jammy taste to the finish. Just substitute rich blackberry for coffee flavors to make the analogy work.
Name: Solitary Cellars 2012 East Block Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of red fruit and dark spice shows on the nose of this wine, with dried strawberry and red cherry running into licorice, purple flowers and black slate. The flavors are broad with cherry candy notes, boosted by a boisterous pepper spice, and settling into a decently tart finish.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Bailey Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This winery's site studies show off a nuanced side of Zin, in this case offering dried mint, sagebrush, crushed bricks and a red and purple-fruit character on the nose. Juicy olallieberry fruit emerges once sipped, but an oregano herbaceousness cuts that diligently.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Snow Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Bold and nicely astringent, this wine is full bodied, rich in flavor and even richer in texture due to a thick layer of fine tannins. Built almost like a Cabernet but with brighter fruit flavors, the wine is attractively dry and meant to be enjoyed with something rich like a roast or steak.
Name: Oak Farm 2014 Cemetery Vineyard Indigenous Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This effusive wine is so fruity and plush that it tastes almost sweet, as the strawberry and boysenberry jam flavors flood the tongue followed by black pepper in the wake. High in alcohol and ripeness, it would make a great pairing with chunks of Parmigiano-Reggiano.
Name: Lava Cap 2013 Reserve Estate Bottled Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a lusty, bombastic and burly wine, completely in keeping with the producer's style, mixing smoky bacon, tar, cigar and charcuterie with smooth, round layers of concentration and ripeness. With a handful of Petite Sirah, it aged 14 months in American oak, a charred note that lingers on the finish.
Name: Rage 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Brambly berry and heaps of brown sugar combine for a thick, soft and richly layered wine that pushes the limits in terms of ripeness. It has small amounts of Mourvèdre, Charbono and Carignane blended throughout and was aged in one-third new French oak.
Name: Peter Franus 2013 Brandlin Vineyard Zinfandel (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smooth and very tasty, this wine seems infused with wild berry flavors and has an easy, gliding texture despite very full body. The intense fruitiness tastes almost sweet.
Name: Renwood 2013 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Full-bodied and dry in style, this wine has a nice, gripping texture, plenty of fruit flavors, and accents like black pepper. It's built more for the dinner table than drinking alone, because the firm tannins and good acidity will be great with meat or fowl.
Designation: Maley Brothers Wegat Vineyard Old Vine
Name: Oak Farm 2014 Maley Brothers Wegat Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Extracted in dark blackberry and leather, there's a soft structure that makes this affordable wine work, leaving room for the peppercorn and dried herb so beloved in the variety.
Name: Rancho Zabaco 2014 Sonoma Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas and flavors of overripe fruit like raisins and dried plums distinguish this full-bodied but soft-textured wine sourced from a 90-year-old vineyard. With very little tannin or acidity and all that late-harvest character, it tastes fat and happy.
Name: Renwood 2013 D'Agostini Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smoky, oaky aromas and vibrant spicy fruit flavors make this wine stand out from the pack of simple, ripe wines. It is very full bodied, high in alcohol, moderately tannic and definitely oaky.
Name: LangeTwins 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Try this rare wine from a vineyard planted in the 1880s. Aromas like maple syrup and vanilla, and flavors like raspberry and cherry jam make this wine seem sweet and feel soft as a pillow, but understand that the alcohol level is almost high enough for a Port.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Jesse's Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine struts the full oak treatment. It smells like vanilla, toasted bread and cherry syrup, and tastes almost like cherry pie. It may be technically dry, but it seems sweet with all its baking spice and ripe fruit characters.
Name: Caricature 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark pink-red in color, this is a dry, lean and pleasant quaff, bright in cranberry and orange, with a meaty back note and a quick finish.
Name: Pedroncelli 2015 Signature Selection Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Beautiful raspberry aromas and very fresh fruit flavors make this medium-bodied Zin an attractive and very affordable wine for big parties. It's not tannic but soft and easy on the palate.
Name: Bota Box 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a good-time wine that's superrich and fruity. It's easy to drink and enjoy, uncomplicated and jammy in flavor and soft in texture.
Name: Edmeades 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: In many ways, this is a fascinating sip, but the components are a bit confusing altogether. Aromas of minty berries, tobacco, rustic leather and a very strong camphor scent introduce the nose, and then a lively, quite foamy acidity consumes the palate, where flavors of sweet berries are cut by garden herbs and pepper. It's a little too overpowering.
Name: Joseph Filippi 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in a cooler, lighter-bodied style, this wine appeals with cedar and wild strawberry, integrating the oak and letting the tannins mellow in the background.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2014 Scherrer Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Almost like a strawberry sauce, this jammy-smelling, soft and fruitytasting wine might taste great with a chocolate mousse.
Name: Peirano 2013 The Immortal Zin Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Some obvious earthy, smoky, meaty aromas and flavors make this an unusual Zin, but interesting in its own way. Aged for 43 months in barrels, it has a rather light red-brick color, firm tannins and good acidity—just not much fruit flavor.
Name: Martin Lane Winery 2010 Sanguinetti Vineyard Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This extreme wine has vivid earthy aromas like wood smoke and cured meats and equally smoky, meaty flavors. The mouthfeel is quite dry and tannic, and any fruit flavors take a back seat to the gamey character.
Name: Jelly Jar 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sweet red cherry, strawberry and smoky charred oak figure most prominently in this robust, full-bodied wine, which opens in a yeasty, baked bread note, and which comes across as somewhat undeveloped.
Name: Frei Brothers 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a prime site planted in 1910 and brought back to life in recent years, this is a juicy, rustic wine that's lengthy and boldly crafted—a hint of mushroomy earthiness providing an intriguing additional layer of flavor to the fruity raspberry and strawberry. There's black pepper and cinnamon spice lurking in the background, waiting to exhale. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Wow. This is an incredible wine, as always, but particularly soft and structured in this fine vintage, which deftly marries pretty aromatics and zippy acidity with darker, stormier elements of ripe fig and wood smoke. There's so much complexity and life going on, it'll be hard to wait on this one, though more time in the bottle should make everything that much more settled and complete. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Papera Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a vineyard planted in 1927 and tended to by the producer, this is a bright, lushly crisp wine from a field blend—soft, luxurious and smooth on the palate. The highlights are many, from a seductive leap of raspberry coulis to perfumed lavender and surprisingly nuanced tannins despite the full-bodied ripeness, accentuated by the vintage, and the structured power behind the scenes. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From a historic site planted in 1903, Hayne is perfumed in cherry and raspberry, full-bodied no doubt, yet subtle and nuanced in its plushy complexity and soft structure. Strong on the palate, with a tiny sprinkling of black pepper, it offers length and breadth that suggests further aging. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Hayne Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the gorgeous, mighty Pagani, planted in 1895, comes this powerfully rich and refined wine, a study in woodsy rusticity and layers of fig, blackberry and a stick of cinnamon. Full bodied and luxurious on the palate, a lithe jolt of acidity rears its head just before the finish, trying to compete with the licorice and leather. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From vines averaging 95 years old, this is an impressive effort, in balance between savory, sultry overtones of peppercorn and espresso and a riper, juicier core of blackberry. Supportive acidity provides a freshness to the wine, which offers plenty of length and breadth on the finish.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and lively light clove notes meet with smashed strawberry, baked cherry and vanilla cookie on the nose of this exuberant, delicious Zin. There is lots of character and depth to the palate, with jammy fruit and brown spice similar to the nose, picking up additional allspice, gingerbread and deep strawberry flavors.
Name: Hearst Ranch 2013 Carpoforo Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is such a refreshing take on the variety, still robust and rich in body, yet possessed of firm acidity and a crispness of cherry kirsch and pomegranate. It practically shouts violets and roses on the nose, following through on the palate with a delicacy of power that's entirely surprising. The finish is a mix of allspice and white pepper.
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2013 Dutton Ranch Morelli Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is the deal of the century for wine made at this level from vines dating back as far as 1881, the wine sourced from two sites, the Saitone and Banfield ranches. Yeasty baked bread and juicy strawberry commingle around black currant and blood orange, the texture smoothly seductive, with a cradling of dried herb as a back note.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an Olivet Lane-situated site, where Pinot Noir is its likely neighbor, this head-trained vineyard is planted to a heritage selection put in the ground in the 1920s. It sings in black licorice and juicy black cherry, showing a tightness of texture and medium build, buoyant in acidity. This is a likable, complex wine with traces of dried herb that linger.
Name: Gary Farrell 2013 Maffei Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Minty spearmint and black pepper mark the entry of this wine from an impressionable site, a perpetual stunner of this producer's. Cinnamon and nutmeg add to the earthy, comforting edge, surrounded by a grip of tannin and lasting spiciness on the finish. Drink now through 2020.
Name: V. Sattui 2012 Black Sears Vineyard Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged in new French, American and seasoned oak, this vineyard-designate is soft and spicy with thick, abundant layers of grilled meat, sizzling cinnamon and dark brown sugar. Full-bodied and robustly concentrated, it maintains a thread of acidity that allows it to stay fresh despite its power and ripeness.
Name: V. Sattui 2012 Ramazzotti Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense blackberry and black cherry notes pick up soy, oregano, thyme and roast beef characteristics in this very dark style of Zin. The deep and rich palate offers concentrated black cherry syrup before revealing rustic touches of leather and tobacco. A hearty wine to match your roasted meats.
Name: Opaque 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged in a majority of French oak, and sourced from several vineyards, including many estate, this 100% varietal wine displays a subtle nuance of smoky leather, berry bramble and soft, integrated oak. It's rich, yet balanced with a peppery finish.
Name: Mauritson 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Stewed strawberries, blackberry jam, maple, brown sugar, black pepper, teriyaki and pork fat show on the lush nose of this bargain bottling. It's soft on the palate, with fruity strawberry and ripe plum flavors, as well as some more serious beef char elements. It's fun, easy and delicious.
Name: Maddalena 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is not aromatic at first, blossoming slowly into shy layers of red berry and subtle cinnamon before taking on a pleasant juiciness and medium weight. The tannins are non-agressive and integrated into the spicy finish.
Name: Kenwood 2013 Six Ridges Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From winemaker John Kane, who worked for years with Kent Rosenblum, this wine is dense and decadently rich and concentrated, a jammy, thick flavor explosion of soy sauce, black olive and Dr. Pepper cola. Smooth on the palate, it threatens to overpower in ripeness before pulling back just enough to show complexity.
Name: JCK Wine Company 2014 Jack Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a concentrated, dark and brooding wine from the producer's well-known property, sparkling in acidity despite its intensity of weight and length. Blackberry and nutmeg sit atop a soft integration of tannin and oak. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2013 Beatty Ranch Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Structured and soft, this wine is also delightfully juicy, bright and succulent in red berry with a side of crumble, topped in milk chocolate and brown sugar. Full bodied, it remains balanced on the palate.
Name: Corner 103 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made in robust style, then blended with 11% Petite Sirah and smaller amounts of Syrah and Petit Verdot, this old vines wine is a juicy core of brick, tar, blackberry and smoked meat, with an undeniable girth of oak and tannin. It's well-made in a bigger, bolder package.
Name: Ballentine 2013 Estate Grown Old Vines Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine offers most things one wants in the variety, from an opening hit of cinnamon spice and toasted oak with an overlaying of juicy blackberry, licorice and mocha. Undoubtedly ripe and bold, it was aged in American oak for 20 months, only one-quarter of it new.
Name: Ektimo Vineyards 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather elegant and well integrated aromas of stewed black cherries, clove, gingerbread and vanilla are reminiscent of a rich dessert. The palate is also full and flavorful with similar components as well as brown sugar, Vietnamese coffee, purple flowers and a lifting mint component. It's fruity but nuanced and fairly priced.
Name: Pear Valley 2013 Pear Valley Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A rich, ripe and concentrated wine that's approachable and likable, its highlights include baked raspberry and blackberry atop depths of cinnamon and mocha. This is a nice wine that will appeal to many.
Name: Folie à Deux 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked boysenberries, purple flowers, rose petals, night jasmine and cola combine for an elegant nose on this restrained Zin bottling. Tart and woody blackberries arise on the palate alongside touches of cedar, pine needle, black peppercorn and roasting herbs, proving more savory in style.
Name: Écluse 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From dry-farmed older vines, a field blend containing Petite Sirah, this affordable wine conjures memories of cherry-berry pie topped in vanilla, along with aromas of baked bread. A soft, grippy finish is seasoned in black pepper.
Name: Buehler 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark alpine strawberry and black plum notes converge on the nose of this wine, which also offers a tart element. Vivacious black raspberry, pencil lead, crushed vanilla, clove and a slight herbal edge show on the palate, proving to be a more savory rather than fruity take on Zin.
Name: Seven Oxen 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a bright, fresh and juicy version of the variety from a mountainous and indeed rocky appellation. A touch of leather rides over the proceedings, which consist mostly of red cherry, raspberry and cinnamon.
Name: Hobo 2013 Branham Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strawberry blossoms, candied cherries, cola and a touch of chipped slate make an appearance on the nose of this bottling. A cinnamon and clove spice component flavor the palate, where cooked black cherries, tart black plum peel, condensed lilac and cedar elements also show.
Name: Hunt Cellars 2011 Outlaw Ridge Destiny Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy strawberry jam and dried herb combine for a forceful attack of bold, concentrated flavor and robust body, the wine textured in dusty tannin.
Name: Matrix 2013 Reserve Matrix Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an affordable and refreshingly light-bodied Zin, bright and fresh in red berry and well-put together in terms of tannin and oak. Stock up for parties.
Name: Camp 2014 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens with a candied, grapy, almost baked plum kind of ripeness that's fruity, approachable and likable. It benefits from a bite of muscled tannin that is tamed on the finish. Oak aging took place for 22 months in French barrels.
Name: Rancho Maria 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bacon meat and blackberry pie jump from the glass in this full-bodied, ripely concentrated vineyard-designate, a strong and powerful wine. Smoky oak and a thickness of body weight round out the big, bold experience.
Name: Keating 2013 Buchignani Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine opens in a combination of herbal mint and brown sugar, ultimately smacking the palate with a big, bold presence that's hyper-ripe. The size is significant and in need of equally bold, brawny and spicy food.
Name: Ballentine 2013 Block 9 Reserve Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Toffee, black cherry and orange combine around a softened, yet tightly woven layer of leather and bitter espresso bean in this full-bodied, robust Zinfandel with an approachable palate.
Name: Trig Point 2013 The Railyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a big-boned and soft wine with pleasing characteristics of blackberry, vanilla wafer and upfront baking spice. The tannins are well-managed and integrated, with a touch of sweet heat on the finish.
Name: Kunde 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: New American oak cradled this wine, which includes 12% Petite Sirah. A strong aroma of root beer or Dr. Pepper wraps itself around smoky tar and toast, with a grippyness on the leathery finish that falls a touch flat.
Name: Saddleback 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Coconut macaroon and smoky leather stand out most in this burly, bombastic and beyond full-bodied wine, which drinks ripe and hot.
Name: Matrix 2013 Forchini Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A light-bodied wine that is blended with 8% Carignane and 4% Petite Sirah, the whole aged nearly two years in French and American oak. There's a thread of minty eucalyptus lurking in this wine, which is lean on the palate, with a suggestion of raspberry and blackberry.
Name: Spicy Vines 2013 Zin Master Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: From century-old vines, this is a high-octane, smooth, juicy and soft wine, medium- to full-bodied with flavors of dark cherry-berry baked pie and cola spice.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Notions of vanilla and grape Kool-Aid provide a perception of sweetness on the palate in this soft, nondescript wine from older vines.
Name: Forchini 2013 Proprietor's Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Oaky bacon and barbecue smoke make for a burly wine-drinking experience in this full-bodied, expressive and somewhat heavy offering from the Dry Creek winery's estate.
Name: Fritz 2013 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Raisin-baked plum defines this hearty, full-bodied and ultraripe wine, rich in red berry and robust on the finish.
Name: Buena Vista 2013 Arpad's Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a beautiful wine, fully expressive of the vineyard and vintage. It's showy in juicy red and black wild berries, with just-right additions of cinnamon and black pepper. Full bodied and concentrated, it remains approachable and an ideal companion to meaty fare.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the mountains above Lake Sonoma, this rocky, robust and ultimately rewarding wine is spicy in cinnamon and clove lined in savory layers of black pepper and leather. Brambly blackberry lies in wait to untangle in the glass, adding to the overall satisfaction of this full-bodied beauty.
Name: Mazzocco 2013 Rockpile Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine comes from a rare patch of old vines in the appellation, planted to Zin and mixed blacks no less. Belloni consistently impresses in its bringing together of smoky tar and leather around a core of tension and acidity. The finish is dusty and spicy, as it should be.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Belloni Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From Block 29 of the acclaimed vineyard, this wine is delightfully juicy and flirty in black cherry, leather, black pepper and tobacco. Full bodied and ripe, it never gets heavy, rather trafficking in enough acidity and sense of place to stay grounded on the palate.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Hendry Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this offers a juiciness of red fruit that's deliciously inviting, surrounded by plenty of cinnamon and black pepper. Grippy and full bodied, it reins in its ripeness well, remaining structured and complex through a mineral-driven finish.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Dickerson Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Opaque and thick in color, this bombastically powerful and concentrated wine has pruney sweetness lurking on the back palate, softened by sprinkles of vanilla and black pepper atop a sturdy helping of blackberry pie.
Name: Louis M. Martini 2013 Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Mouthfillingly juicy red fruit opens this well-crafted and impressive wine from a marquee location for the variety. Measured and welcome acidity balances the larger aspects of brambly black fruit and leathery cinnamon spice.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Westphall Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reduced and extracted, this old-vine wine is smooth and velvety, powerfully made to reflect rich, ripe red berry and a layering of brown sugar. The finish is lean and reminiscent of black licorice.
Name: V. Sattui 2013 Crow Ridge Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This blend of 75% Zinfandel and 25% mixed blacks has a lingering back beat of menthol and mint that interweaves with more tantalizing elements of white pepper and leather saddle. Made in a relatively restrained style, it stays softly layered throughout a long finish.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Old Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 14% Petite Sirah, this well-composed wine is thick and leathery with highlights of black currant and savory black pepper. An herbal backdrop belies its ripeness and keeps it from becoming overly jammy.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is thick, rich, ripe and full-throttled. Extremely opaque in color, it's intriguingly tasty in its waves of blackberry jam, spicy cinnamon and black pepper. Leathery on the palate, it imparts a faint hint of dried herb.
Name: Mazzocco 2013 Beasley Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A tang of black cherry and citrus elevates the palate of this light-bodied wine, which is soft and well integrated in terms of oak and tannin. With 10% Petite Sirah and 8% Carignane, it's strong in leather and black pepper, with a lean, juicy finish.
Name: Peterson 2012 Dry Creek Blend Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
