Description: This generously proportioned wine offers brambly red raspberry and almond paste, especially on the nose. Buoyant acidity saves it from becoming overblown on the palate, balancing the ripe fruit with a smooth, soft and crisp palate.
Name: Rancho Maria 2012 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: For a large-production wine meant to be widely distributed and enjoyed, this brawler hits it out of the park in savory leather and juicy tannin. Just the right dusting of cinnamon appears atop the full-bodied black fruit.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this Zin, which is bolstered by 20% Petite Sirah and 5% Grenache, is rich and deep, with black cherry, crushed clove, cinnamon and loam aromas. The palate packs flavors of gingerbread with wild-berry filling, also mixing in allspice and nutmeg with more black-cherry fruit.
Name: Proulx 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 10% Petite Sirah, the grapes from the Teldeschi family's own eastside benchlands vines, this wine is tannic in black cherry, leather and tobacco, the fruit becoming syrup-like in quality, like kirsch. Big-boned, it combines fruit and spice equally, with a bright finish of blackberry.
Designation: Teldeschi Vineyards Home Ranch Century Old Vine
Name: Del Carlo Winery 2012 Teldeschi Vineyards Home Ranch Century Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This old-vine wine contains 12% Carignane and 8% Petite Sirah, and is one of the larger of the producer's single-vineyard offerings. Feral black fruit and fig form a core of concentrated richness before red-berry pie and vanilla come into play, finishing with a blur of toasty oak.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Teldeschi Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opting to focus on the herbal side of California's historic grape, this wine shows dark cranberry on the nose but lets the chaparral, thyme and cola do the heavy lifting. The palate is dominated by shrub character, with wild mint, sage and oregano flavors seasoning the dried-berry fruit.
Name: Robert Hall 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grippy in big, dry tannin and a weight of oak, this is a plummy and rich red wine. The palate veers into dusty layers of vanilla and chocolate, finishing leathery and peppery.
Name: Rancho Maria 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From 80-some-year-old, dry-farmed vines, this wine is velvety smooth and just a hint dusty, revealing bright red fruit and subtle spice in equal measure. Medium bodied, it maintains a liveliness on the palate.
Name: Peterson 2012 Traditionale West Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made with 24% Petite Sirah, this dusty, bold and highly structured wine from an historic vineyard site is intensely concentrated and extracted, exuding rich red berry. Cinnamon and black pepper dot the lengthy finish.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Barricia Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from vines well over 100 years old on the Kunde Estate, this wine is tight and youthful in dry, dusty and grippy tannin, with thick, extracted flavors of red berry and cherry. A streak of pencil lead and fig provides further intrigue and complexity around a full-bodied elegance.
Name: Kunde 2013 Reserve Century Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blueberry, black plum, dark chocolate, coffee and a little asphalt show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is medium bodied and relatively straightforward, yet shows a depth of noticeable tannins and dark fruit flavors.
Name: Proulx 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich cherry blossoms and dried strawberry-cherry paste aromas make for a very fruit-forward bottling. The palate is grippy with tannins that long hold attention, with dark red fruit and cinnamon flavors.
Name: EOS 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brown sugar and chocolate make for a hedonistic experience in this brawny, powerful wine. It's well-composed in smoky char, juicy blackberry and a full-bodied finish of black pepper.
Name: Puccioni 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brambly in blackberry jam, this is a fairly elegant and restrained version of the variety for the area. The mountain-grown grapes provide substantial tannins and a dusty taste of wood. Coffee marks the abbreviated finish.
Name: Peterson 2012 Bradford Mountain Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich red cherry, anise and a bit of smoke show on the nose of this affordably priced bottling from Kevin Riley. The palate is quite grippy, with flavors of dried blueberry, dark chocolate and black coffee.
Name: Ryzin 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sweet, ripe tannins are embraced by a soft texture and touches of black pepper in this multiple appellation wine. Robust, if not bordering on crazy ripe, it needs food to find itself fully.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Three Valleys Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: A leathery texture gives this wine a rough, roguish edge, around flavors of baked plum and mocha. Medium bodied, it's approachable and ready to enjoy now.
Name: Summers 2013 Two Acre Villa Andriana Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A small percentage of Carignane figures into this wine, a hugely extracted and rustic expression of red fruit, cinnamon and black pepper that is somewhat dry and dusty on the palate.
Name: Manzanita Creek 2013 Harris Kratka Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though the listed alcohol pushes well past 15%, this wine does not show that much heat or concentration. Aggressive oak-treatment flavors of vanilla and tobacco mingle with mint, cola and black cherry.
Name: Valley View 2013 Anna Maria Zinfandel (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black plum and black-cherry flavors are prominent but not too deep on the nose of this bottling. There is noticeable grip on the palate with flavors of black cherry and sagebrush.
Name: Blackburn Wine Company 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is strongly scented with vanilla and clove. Those same flavors dominate the palate, more or less obliterating the light raspberry fruit. Oak, clove and cedar are all that's left.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2013 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aromas and flavors of fig, earth and mushroom characterize this wine, which is a little soft on the palate and grippy in a leathery texture. Full bodied and quite ripe, it has a juiciness of blackberry and depth of dark chocolate.
Name: Manzanita Creek 2013 Cloud Buster Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This hyper-ripe wine hits it hard in terms of power and sheer strength of fruit, making for a big, slightly sweet and one-dimensional experience bordering on Port. It's to be enjoyed carefully.
Name: Mazzocco 2013 Sullivan Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A reduced character of diesel and strong oak mark the entry of this vineyard-designated wine. It's ripe and powerful, veering on sweet.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Banti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from grapes grown in the Russian River, Alexander and Sonoma valleys, this yeasty, bread wine imparts flavors of dried plum and almost prune. It's ripe and full bodied with a taste of tar.
Name: Manzanita Creek 2013 Three Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Dark red in color, though fraying, like an older wine, this lacks in aroma. Otherwise it's a straightforward expression of blackberry, tar and leather.
Name: Benessere 2013 Black Glass Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A brambly and intense vineyard-designate rich in blackberry and brown sugar, this proffers just intense enough to provoke, but never gets extreme. Soft on the palate, it has a lively undercurrent of dark cherry grenadine and black pepper. This is one to remember, with a cool label to boot.
Name: Sequum 2012 Kidd Ranch Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A consistent standout for this winery, the new vintage does not disappoint. Jazzy and jammy red-fruit and spice aromas are followed by rich, plump, beautifully balanced fruit flavors followed by an extended finish. It only ramps up over time. It's a prototype of the variety and about as good as it gets from the state.
Name: Two Vintners 2013 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Intensely dense and feral, this wine opens with a thicket of tart cherry and strawberry, followed by leathery black pepper and lavender. Medium in body and acidity, it works for the table, finding balance as it goes, before a rich taste of toffee finishes things off.
Name: Gary Farrell 2013 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Antelope Valley of the California High Desert, South Coast, California, US
Description: From a newer, high-elevation appellation north of Los Angeles, this promising bottling shows fat blueberries, shaved milk chocolate, a sprig of thyme and a leaf of mint on the nose. The palate packs decent acidity and black gravel minerality atop oregano, thyme and dried sage, with cola and vanilla-laced blueberry fruit.
Name: Coruce 2012 Zinfandel (Antelope Valley of the California High Desert)
Subregion: Antelope Valley of the California High Desert

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rich and inviting nose of berry-laced pastries, dried strawberries, stewed cherries and sagebrush kick off this layered bottling. The palate shows savory cracked black pepper along with strawberry, plum and black-raspberry fruit. A dry sagebrush quality gives complexity to the whole sip.
Name: Four Sisters Ranch 2011 Limited-Edition Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: French and Hungarian oak cradle the dusty juice of old vines in this soft, integrated wine, brawny in strawberry, orange zest and cheese rind. Black pepper and a note of leather close out the lengthy, spicy finish.
Name: Mike and Molly Hendry 2013 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The famous growers branch out into their own wines with aplomb in this 100% varietal wine, tangoing with a much sought-after grape from their property. Sanguine and gamy, it's structured in good acidity and low oak, showing a succulence of blackberry.
Name: Bacigalupi 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A small-production blend of 86% Zinfandel with 14% Petite Sirah, this was aged over a year in a small percentage of new oak. Dry and structured, it's a celebration of chocolate, leather and blackberry, the fruit sizably ripe yet kept in check. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Fidelity 2013 Railyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty in red fruit, like crisp cassis and plum, this is a restrained, elegant and smooth wine from a great site. It shows a complexity of baking spices and cherry compote as it cruises into a lengthy finish.
Name: Ousterhout 2011 Bradford Mountain Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Structured despite its impermeable presence of power and alcohol, this wine also sings in crisp red fruit, some of it jammy, but self-possessed. An accompaniment of anise and baked bread play on the sturdy palate.
Name: Martin Ray 2013 Puccioni Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky and lined in restrained streaks of black pepper, this is a big-boned, robust and brawny wine, girded by a foundation of tobacco and big tannin. Drink now through 2020 with gigantic slabs of braised or barbecued meat.
Name: Quivira 2013 Quest Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an estate-grown, co-fermented field blend of Zin with Cabernet Franc, Alicante Bouschet, Petite Sirah, Grand Noir de Calmette, Peloursin, Lenoir, Merlot and Mourvèdre made in a small amount. Powerful tannin and leather are the stars, along with flavors of cigar, black pepper, cherry and orange.
Name: Lasseter 2013 L'Ame du Sage Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designated estate wine is restrained and elegant, allowing for a sparkle of raspberry and black cherry to speak. The oak is light and integrated, and the minerality well defined, with just the smallest traces of black licorice and pepper coming through on the finish.
Name: Ousterhout 2012 Nance's Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is a field blend of 80% Zinfandel, with 10% Petite Sirah, 6% Alicante Bouschet and 4% other mixed black grapes. High-toned in plum and dark cherry, it's bright while also being plush and juicy. This is a small-production offering from a fairly cool area for the grape.
Name: Parmeson 2013 Alegría Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from vines planted in 1890, this is a combination of mostly Zin, field-blended with 13% Alicante Bouschet and 7% Petite Sirah. Ripe in raspberry and blackberry, this also has sleek traces of vanilla and brown sugar. Soft and juicy on the palate, it ends in a dusting of cinnamon.
Name: Miro 2013 Alegria Vineyard Old Vines Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Mancini has 20% Carignane field-blended within, and shows burly, thick black fruit at its core. Integrated oak supports black cherry and pepper. A dustiness on the palate that finishes ripe.
Designation: Mancini Vineyard Reserve Century Old Vines
Name: Miro 2013 Mancini Vineyard Reserve Century Old Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry jam, cherry blossom and a touch of baking spice show on the nose of this wine from a Westside Paso property. Nicely tight and bright on the palate, it is structured with fine-grained tannins.It offers blueberries, clove spice and a rocky character throughout the sip, especially into the finish.
Name: HammerSky 2012 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and smoky with a taste of tar, this full-bodied wine is soft and integrated in terms of oak. Black cherry, blackberry and strawberry play on the palate against measured acidity and weight.
Name: Miro 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Coconut, chocolate and coffee make for sweet and savory companions in this mushy, grippy and satisfying wine. Big on power and concentration, it has an underlay of brown sugar.
Name: Phipps 2012 Sonoma County Ranches Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Vanilla, cherry and a crunch of barbecue chips greet the entry of this full-bodied, weighty wine that's soft in tannin. Baked plum and cinnamon make it inviting and satisfying on the palate, finishing with a zest of racy acidity.
Name: Cast 2013 Watson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is big, burly and complex, showing a preponderance of dark, ripe black fruit built around dusty tannins, leather and lavender. It's compelling and drinking well now.
Name: Noble Tree 2013 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged for more than two years in French, American and Hungarian oak, this vineyard-designate is bombastically broad-shouldered in cocoa powder and leather, Soft and velvety on the palate, it finishes with a spark of heat.
Name: Phipps 2012 Treborce Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Inviting aromatics of nutmeg and Asian spice give way to a silky, savory and light-bodied version of the variety, with a backbone of sizable tannin.
Name: Borrellie 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Carignane and Petite Sirah join the party in this stewy, big and juicy wine, from head-trained vines averaging 45 years old. Briary blackberry mixes leather and fig compote with a strong seasoning of black pepper. There's no shortage of heat on the finish.
Name: Mounts 2012 Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Piney sage and crisp sour cherry surround a bombastically brawny structure and outpouring of power in this 100% varietal wine. It should be enjoyed slowly and with plenty of food.
Name: Herencia 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich, thick, smoky and soft, this wine conjures all the adjectives that add up to brawny and big. This tastes akin to a Port with chocolate melted in.
Name: Pezzi King 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this wine is fairly shy with pencil shavings, danker herbs and a plum-fruit backbone, which predicts a very dry palate. However, the flavors are extremely ripe and sweet, with strawberry, black plum, mission fig and vanilla flavors.
Name: Minassian-Young 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 12% Petite Sirah, this is a hearty, ripe and stewy wine, baked in plum and blackberry. A puckering girth of tannin unwraps itself in the glass as it goes. Cinnamon and black pepper play on the finish, along with a hint of dried herb.
Name: Sivas-Sonoma 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A hearty, bombastically high-in-alcohol wine, this offers a combination of grape, plum and leather flavors around a syrupy sweetness of chocolate.
Name: Mazzocco 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A sweet smell like raisins and very ripe, grapy flavors ride a soft, broad texture and medium body. It's not too dry and it's not at all tannic. It's easy and gentle to drink.
Name: Bota Box 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Somewhat unstructured and overripe, this wine doesn't display much fruit, but has plenty of oak, particularly on the finish.
Name: Wellington 2011 Meeks Hilltop Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A new, bold, high-end offering from the producer, equally known for its prowess with Rhône varieties, Black Boar includes 12% Petite Sirah and 5% Carignan in the blend. Rich, round and expressive in juicy red berry with a punch of tannin, it offers integrated oak and spicy pepper in a fulsome, full-bodied and memorable way.
Name: Quivira 2013 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grippy in wound-up black fruit and black pepper, this is a ripe, bright and softly layered wine, completely in keeping with its old-vine status in dusty, complex notes. Spicy cinnamon and leathery pepper combine on the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Seghesio 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a two-acre block within the amazing Maple Vineyard planted in 1910, this wine also contains 10% Petite Sirah and 10% mixed blacks. Baked berry pie comes to mind first, conjuring up all things good and right in the world, topped in bourbon whipped cream and nutmeg. Good acidity buoys the proceedings. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Armida 2013 Tina's Block Maple Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is one of the best balanced and most elegant Zins around. Very fresh in aroma, it's slightly yeasty like freshly fermented wine, and with subtly gorgeous cherry and blackberry flavors layered with light cedar and cocoa spiciness. Not only is the finish lingering, but the wine still tasted great two days after pulling the cork.
Name: St. Amant 2013 Lodi Native Marian's Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Sourced for many years from the Nichelini family from a vineyard 600 to 800 higher than the valley floor, this Zin is blended with 15% Petite Sirah, the whole more than a sum of its parts in thick, soft layers of fig and blackberry. Nutmeg and black pepper dance on the finish, shadowed by traces of leather.
Name: Frank Family 2013 Reserve Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Zinfandel from old vines is rarely this light and refreshing, yet still exuberant in fruit. A mix of tart cherry and just-ripe blackberry comes with a lingering edge of citrus around the cinnamon and black pepper spice. Funky earth ripples through the middle, before a subtle take on leather finishes things out.
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2011 Mancini Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Complex, integrated and soft, this wine from fellow winemaker Mike Officer's historic site is lightly spiced in cinnamon and pepper. Dollops of vanilla and blackberry make themselves felt on the palate amid the zest.
Name: Novy 2013 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a high-acid, minerality-driven wine from the wilds of Rockpile. Soft and integrated in terms of oak and tannin, it also possesses a savage touch of grip, a nod to its mountainous heritage and the perils and pleasures of a warm year. Black cherry and a vibrant squeeze of citrus stand out on the palate, providing juiciness and balance.
Name: Bruliam 2013 Rocky Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A burly, robust wine from a 1930s planting containing 5% Petite Sirah, this offers lots of classic character. The mix of leather, herb, blackberry and blackberry gives a sense of completeness. Full bodied, it'll stand up well to further aging. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Armida 2013 Italo's Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Effusive aromas like raspberry and strawberry jam lead to more exotic chocolate and orange-zest flavors and a lush, ripe texture. The body is quite full but the generous and expressive flavors balance it well. This is a big, extravagant and delicious wine.
Name: McCay Cellars 2013 Lodi Native TruLux Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A huge, concentrated wine, this offers all the characteristic ripeness and big flavor in the variety, from brown sugar to baked plum to vanilla to tar. Almost reaching Port-like proportions in terms of alcohol and weight, it pulls back just enough to reveal spicy black pepper and cinnamon on the finish.
Name: Hanna 2014 Bismark Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The color is light, which is natural for the variety, while aromas are lightly fruity, earthy and tobacco-like. Bright raspberry and cranberry flavors come with cedar and dried-herb accents that add complexity. It's medium bodied, well balanced and light in tannins, with a very appetizing texture.
Name: Fields Family 2013 Lodi Native Stampede Vineyard Zinfandel (Clements Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A powerfully intense wine from an historic vineyard site, this has a surprisingly welcoming theme of tangy acidity behind the ripeness of the black and red fruit, the typical blackberry giving way to brighter notes of pomegranate and red cherry. The finish delivers a fistful of black pepper and back note of leather.
Name: Novy 2013 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Robust and brawny, this longtime estate wine offers a combination of red and black berry, rich and succulent as if in a crumble, topped in vanilla and pleasing sprinkles of nutmeg and cardamom. Complex and layered, it delivers in flavor and structure.
Name: Seghesio 2013 Home Ranch Estate Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plum and blackberry shout from the glass, wrapping around an oaky, leathery texture and hits of smoky char and vanilla. This full-bodied wine finds a groove of balance as it goes, adding a lengthy streak of pepper on the finish.
Name: Armida 2013 Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Meaty aromas of blueberry and dark strawberry pair nicely with roasting pork, violets and teriyaki on this wine's elegant and complex nose. The palate combines beef jerky with milk chocolate, blueberry and blackberry, simultaneously savory with smoky meat and juicy with lavish fruit.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2013 Zinfusion Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grippy and somewhat subdued and tightly wound, this wine black in color and profile. Blackberry and black licorice open the proceedings, before powerful hits of black pepper. Leather and game are in the mix, too, giving the wine a wild edge. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Novy 2013 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark in color and generously bodied, this wine exudes a taste and aroma of brown sugar and roasted plum, flavors that ride a wave of soft, velvety texture, blackberry compote and mocha chocolate. Richly rewarding, it's also a tremendous value.
Name: Novy 2013 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A savory nose on this quality bottling shows roasting herbs, oak smoke, pork fat, beef jerky, black pepper and black cherry. A medium-bodied palate reveals dried cherry notes with flavors of thyme, oregano, beef roast and graphite. Altogether, it's a well-balanced and layered Zin.
Name: Sextant 2013 Holystone Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Fruity, ripe and yummy, this wine offers aromas that are spicy and slightly oaky from 14 months in mostly American barrels. The flavors are packed with ripe cherry and blackberry. Despite very full body in terms of alcohol, the texture is smooth, tannins are light and the finish lingers.
Name: Big Smooth 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mocha, caramel and nutmeg lend complexity to a nose driven by blackberry and blueberry notes. The soft and dense palate shows lots of serious flavors, from fennel and asphalt to thick blueberry juice, with solid tannins that are chunky in a good way.
Name: Sextant 2013 Wheelhouse Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fruity in flavor, fresh and elegant in texture, this wine tastes pure and unmanipulated. The berry and candied-cherry flavors are delicious, and the mouthfeel is smooth. It finishes with a touch of black pepper.
Name: Maley Brothers Vineyards 2013 Lodi Native Wegat Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a pleasantly gamy nose to this dry-farmed Zin, with sour-plum fruit, hoisin sauce and dried purple flowers blending into a memorable scent. The palate packs lavender, cola, oregano, dried mint and black-pepper flavors that give character to the elegant purple-fruit backbone.
Name: Minassian-Young 2013 Old Oak Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A field blend with defined amounts of Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet, this wine is perfumed and light bodied, exhibiting soft, persistent waves of black pepper and crisp red fruit that give it a cool-climate edge of approachability and intrigue.
Name: Barber 2013 Mr. Beast Topolos Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Black fruit, leather pouch and a lightness of black pepper mark this block-designated wine. Integrated in terms of oak, it features a shot of gunpowder on the finish.
Name: Trentadue 2013 La Storia Block 303 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an estate vineyard, this is an impressive wine, fruity in plum and cherry with a plush juiciness and firm tannin structure. With aromas of baked bread along the way, it finishes as old vines should, full of leather and black pepper.
Name: J. Rickards 2012 1908 Brignole Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rustic aromas of leather, cola ,black cherry and black plum hit the nose on this bottling by longtime vintner Neil Roberts. The palate boasts hearty and rugged flavors of elk roast and wild-game jerky, which give a savory edge to the tart fruit flavors of boysenberry and elderberry.
Name: Clavo Cellars 2011 Desperado Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An unusual commingling of coconut and kirsch, this wine holds burly tannins at its core, which is full bodied and brawny, with a noticeable presence of oak around leathery blackberry pie. The vines are dry-farmed and date back to 1912.
Name: Armida 2013 Gold Mine Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A stellar deal for the price, this wine shows plum, strawberry and asphalt on the nose, with a touch of clove-nutmeg spice. It's tart and dry, with dusty elderberry flavors on the palate, boosted by a touch of mint and a decent structure.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Incredible Red Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dense tannins find their way to roundness amid a smattering of red and blue berries and an intense shock of dried herb. The finish is a mix of leather pouch and brine.
Name: Cambridge 2013 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright boysenberry and black-cherry scents are seasoned with clove and nutmeg, and enhanced with gravel and rose-bud aromas. The palate is spicy and juicy, with boisterous black pepper, plum, blueberry and tobacco flavors.
Name: Minassian-Young 2013 Beyond the Pale Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry, vanilla and liqueur notes show on the nose of this wine, which starts off with very dense aromas but shows zesty cherry skins too. It's juicy and spicy on the palate, with relatively light body and a boisterous acidity, proving quite appropriate for everyday drinking.
Name: Bianchi 2012 Heritage Selection Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in larger quantities than the producer's old-vine and Home Ranch wines, this is approachable and well crafted, delivering soft, dark elements of coffee, mocha and chocolate. Broodingly rich, it's able to appeal to a wide range of palates.
Name: Seghesio 2014 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Two fistfuls of Petite Sirah are added to the mix here, the wine a mix of black cherry and berry around soft, sinewy layers of black pepper and firm tannins. Never overbearing, this wine will do well at the table around plenty of meats.
Name: Piccolo 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a thick, rich and very ripe wine, with a charred back note making its way against higher-toned tastes of red raspberry and blackberry. The oak is integrated and the wine softly varietal, but it packs a punch on the palate.
Name: Buena Vista 2013 Attila's Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Leather saddle wafts from the glass atop ripe cherry, blackberry jam and brown sugar. Tightly wound in tannin and oak, this wine becomes pleasantly juicy on the finish.
Name: Rodney Strong 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavender and lilac are just part of the floral bouquet that emerges from this wine, which also shows a blackberry vinaigrette element on the nose. Once sipped, it's like sucking on a purple-flower candy, with more lavender as well as plum and a pencil-lead edge that cuts through the palate.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This has an aroma like charred wood, and meaty, smoky, steak-sauce flavors. It's not a style for everyone, but it does have a full body, bold flavors and the unique packaging and hands-off winemaking style of the Lodi Native wines.
Name: M2 2013 Lodi Native Soucie Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy and soft, this structured, medium-bodied wine is elusive in fruit, playing its hand with shy suggestions of cranberry and raspberry underneath integrated tannins and subtle oak.
Name: Jigar 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense and concentrated strawberries mix with black rocks and gravel on the nose of this stylishly labeled bottle. The palate is somewhat sweet with blueberry and blackberry jam flavors, as well as earthy notes.
Name: Chillhouse 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big, sweetened tannins reminiscent of tobacco and leather pouch sit atop cedar, herb and vanilla. The fruit is both red and black, true to the vineyard and this area of the Russian River.
Name: Paro 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This tasty wine has vivid cherry, strawberry, candylike aromas and flavors. Medium bodied, it offers a mouthfeel that's almost syrupy, a balance that's slightly sweet and an easy-drinking texture.
Name: Shooting Star 2012 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From another section of the Los Chamizal Vineyard, Morning Sun is taut in red cherry and raspberry, a citrusy component giving it lightness and zest. Leather and black pepper come to life on the finish.
Name: Haywood 2011 Morning Sun Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The ripest and strongest of the Lodi Native wines this year, this has raspberry and black pepper aromas tinged with dusty, earthy accents, and heavy flavors like stewed plums.
Name: Macchia 2013 Lodi Native Schmiedt Ranch Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 20% Syrah, then aged almost two years in nearly all-new American oak, this wine is a mouthful of leather and tannin, with a dash of black pepper on the finish.
Name: Spicy Vines 2012 Zin Master Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a particular block of the Los Chamizal Vineyard that is indeed rocky, this brambly, fruity wine shows off layers of blackberry and vanilla, swaddled in cinnamon toast. Somewhat thin on the palate despite the power of its ripeness, it devolves on the sour finish.
Name: Haywood 2011 Rocky Terrace Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Zin, which gets a boost from 20% Grenache and 5% Petite Sirah, shows a slightly sweet touch on the nose, where dark strawberry and baked cherries meet with a touch of asphalt. The palate is quite syrup and fruit-driven, with blueberry, blackberry, cola and root-beer flavors reminiscent of soda-pop concentrate.
Name: Minassian-Young 2013 Big Barrel Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the producer's Old Vineyard Block, and blended with 20% Petite Sirah and 5% Syrah, this wine has a rustic barnyardy quality. It offers a tightness of dried herb around broad, sweet tannins, strawberry jam and chocolate.
Name: Gustafson Family 2012 Mountain Cuvée Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pruney and somewhat reduced, this thick offering of chocolate and blackberry jam needs food to mellow it out, preferably meat covered thickly in sauce.
Name: Michael-Scott 2013 Zinfandel (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This somewhat indistinctive wine has a wealth of minty aroma on the nose, a characteristic that doesn't shake off on the palate, the body full and a touch hot.
Name: Buena Vista 2013 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine offers more power and heat on the palate than would be expected given the listed alcohol by volume, a hammering of huge tannins holding the fruit hostage. An unpleasant fish-sauce aroma mars the nose.
Name: Haywood 2011 Los Chamizal Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 10% Petite Sirah, this wine has a stewed quality that makes it seem overdone, with only the slightest suggestion of fruit and spice.
Name: Gustafson Family 2011 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made in a structured, traditional and dry style, this wine will be great at dinnertime. It has moderate and attractive spice and oak aromas, full body and ripe fruit flavors that don't go to extremes. The sense of balance, layered texture, reserved flavors and sophistication make it a winner.
Name: Monte Volpe 2012 Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Just plain delicious, this full-bodied wine starts with ripe blueberry and dark chocolate aromas. Next, generous, ripe, saturated fruit flavors flood the mouth, seeming to deepen with each sip. The mouthfeel stays smooth but is enhanced by moderate tannins and ample acidity for good balance.
Name: Klinker Brick 2013 Marisa Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The first Zin reviewed from Naggiar, this is a beauty. Power and grace combine in this concentrated and well-structured wine. It smells and tastes like black cherries and blackberries with hints of cocoa and black pepper. The velvety texture delivers smoothness with a nice grip from tannins, and conveys a wonderful sense of depth.
Name: Naggiar 2013 Della Casa Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This approachable wine from the Fetzer organization was aged in Bourbon barrels. It has good balance, wonderful fruit flavors, a polished texture and lingering finish. Dark in color, the aromas suggest ripe berries and cherries, and the flavors flow similarly rich and deep.
Name: 1000 Stories 2013 Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With a dry and full-bodied approach, this wine combines good fruit flavors, intriguing oak spiciness and appetizing acidity. The crisp character and high alcohol combine with fine-grained tannins for a liveliness that keeps the cherry and raspberry flavors dancing through the finish.
Name: Brooklyn West 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This spicy-smelling, dry wine is well balanced, generous in flavor and a pleasure to drink. Aromas of black pepper, clove and black cherries carry the nose, while on the palate, ripe and delicious flavors spread across the smooth and lightly tannic texture.
Name: Brazin 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel notes of sweet spices, vanilla and coconut are up front on this wine followed by lush, full-bodied cherry and raspberry flavors. Fruit and barrel flavors linger in harmony on the finish.
Name: Seven Falls 2013 GPS Jones Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine certainly packs in the flavor. It has lots of jammy, grapy aromas, and flavors that drip boysenberry and blackberry, followed by baking-spice accents. It has a full body, an almost thick texture and mild acidity and tannins.
Name: Klinker Brick 2013 Old Ghost Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: An especially tasty fruit character sets this full-bodied wine apart from the pack. It smells like black currants and tastes like raspberries and blueberries. Moderate tannins and acidity give it good texture and help the finish last.
Name: Cambridge & Sunset 2013 California Series Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine combines spicy aromas with deep fruit flavors like plum and blackberry. The fresh, juicy texture has just enough tannin to make it appetizing. The wine has enough heft to pair well with a lot of savory and meaty dishes.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Strong oaky, smoky, peppery aromas and flavors define this robust, assertive, high-alcohol wine. It will appeal to some consumers more than others, and those who like lots of seasoning on their steak will love it.
Name: LangeTwins 2011 Centennial Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has a deep color and smoke and charcoal aromas. The flavors are ripe, concentrated, grapy and berry-like. The texture has moderate tannins but is polished around the edges. It's a big and rowdy wine that doesn't lose control.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine demands attention for its deep, dark color, distinct smoke, bacon and maple syrup aromas, rich fruit flavors and a texture saturated with fine tannins. It will appeal to those who love boldness, lots of oak flavor and full body.
Name: Imagination Wines 2013 Zinderella Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas, generous fruit flavors and full body make this wine engaging and appealing. It has ripe fig and raspberry aromas, lush plum and berry flavors and a velvety texture that leads to to a long finish.
Name: Ripken 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Toffee, exotic spice, vanilla, raspberry and cranberry aromas are backed by full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. There's a lot of fruit in the bottle but the oak seems to get in the way.
Name: Maryhill 2012 Proprietor's Reserve Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Complex but mellow aromas, and ripe fruit, dark spice and earthy flavors ride a sleek texture in this full-bodied, ready-to-drink wine.
Designation: Pizazz Zin Old Vine Piazza Ranch
Name: Carol Shelton 2013 Pizazz Zin Old Vine Piazza Ranch Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Bright berry flavors and rich, chocolaty accents make an indulgent combination in this full-bodied and suave-textured wine. It tastes as if a good dose of new oak was used in the aging process, lending vanilla and nutmeg aromas and a sensation of sweetness. Fully ripe grapes give strawberry and blackberry notes.
Name: Ironstone 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This polished and well-behaved wine has light spicy, oaky aromas, plenty of good blackberry and cherry flavors and an easygoing texture. It will be a crowd pleaser as well as a host pleaser, with an affordable price.
Name: Gen5 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine smells more savory than fruity, and tastes smooth, moderately fruity and easy to enjoy. Medium bodied, it's well balanced between acidity and richness, and not too tannic, giving an appealing mouthfeel.
Name: Uvaggio 2012 Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This lively, medium-bodied and well-balanced wine smells of raspberries and dried herbs. It tastes invitingly fresh, combining bright fruit with earthy and savory accents. The color is relatively light, matching the overall tangy personality.
Name: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh and lively like a cherry soda, this medium-bodied wine has light, spicy, oaky aromas, lots of cherry and strawberry flavors and an easy-drinking texture.
Name: Plungerhead 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Spicy, smoky oak aromas dominate this dark-colored and full-bodied wine. Cherry and raspberry emerge as the flavors. The texture is plush but not quite soft, as firm tannins and moderate acidity give it good structure.
Name: McManis 2014 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of dried Marasca cherry and raspberry jam lead the nose on this smooth dessert wine. The soft, polished palate delivers fig, candied date and carob while a cocoa note backs up the lingering finish.
Name: Produttori Vini Manduria 2011 Madrigale Dolce Naturale  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smooth and well balanced, this medium-bodied wine combines light cinnamon and cherry aromas with rich plum flavors. It has a good harmony between bright acidity and ripe fruitiness.
Name: Steiner Family Vineyards 2012 Free Bird Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Candylike oak aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied and rather tannic wine. It smells and tastes like vanilla, fresh-sawn oak and maple syrup. Some ripe plum flavors in the background are nearly sweet.
Name: Klinker Brick 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a well-balanced wine. Peppery and earthy aromas lead to cherry and raspberry flavors, a smooth texture and medium body. Owner Sam Sebastiani uses 65% Zinfandel, 30% Primitivo (legally the same as Zinfandel) and 5% Barbera.
Name: La Chertosa 2013 Reserve Fra Paolo Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Deep fruit flavors and a soft texture make this wine easy to sip. Plenty of blackberry and boysenberry flavors blend with light acidity and very few tannins for a smooth mouthfeel.
Name: Grayson 2014 Lot 12 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Easygoing and medium bodied by Zin standards, this wine is pleasantly fruity in aroma and flavor. The mild texture is not tannic but does have some refreshing acidity.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2013 High Elevation Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A bright pinkish-orange color makes this light-bodied wine stand out from the beginning, Fresh watermelon and cherry flavors carry on the rounded palate, with a slight sweetness giving softness.
Name: Montevina 2014 Summit Ridge White Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Although it tastes a bit on the sweet side, there is no denying the simple freshness and drinkability of this supple, medium-bodied wine. It has light maple-syrup aromas and fresh strawberry flavors.
Name: Campus Oaks 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This may be the grapy-est, jammy-est wine on the market. Aromas are like Concord jam, while flavors recall Welch's juice. The body is full and the texture moderately tannic.
Name: Boeger 2013 Primitivo (El Dorado)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A sense of sweetness from aging with oak combines with bursting ripe fruit flavors to give a jammy, candied character to this medium-bodied wine. The texture is soft and easy, showing very little tannin.
Name: Leese-Fitch 2013 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This mellow, moderately fruity wine has berry and wet-earth aromas, mild strawberry and spice flavors and a soft texture.
Name: Zin 91 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Cedar and oak aromas lead to ripe blackberry and plum on the palate. A sweet-seeming layer of maple syrup and brown sugar flavors make this wine jammy in personality.
Name: Nanna's Short Cake 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine has aromas like strawberries and maple syrup, and flavors that taste almost sweet. It makes a tempting, light and airy drink that's good for casual occasions.
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: After 34 months in previously used French barrels, this wine has a brownish rim. It smells like pepper, clove and cinnamon and tastes like dried fruit. Considerable tannins contribute to an astringent mouthfeel.
Name: Spicy Vines 2011 Sacrlet's Flirtation Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Very ripe and full bodied, this wine has seemingly sweet flavors like cherry and strawberry jam. Low acidity and light tannins give it a soft, almost syrupy texture.
Name: Baron Cooper 2012 Old Vine Tamura Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a 1,400-foot-high site, this wine combines 86% Zinfandel with 14% Petite Sirah, which deliciously exude blackberry, blueberry, kirsch and leather. Smooth, soft and juicy, it adds nutmeg, chocolate and oak as it goes, finishing with structure and length. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Carol Shelton 2012 Florence Vineyard Rocky Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A vintage leader in this Zin house's series of site studies, this shows rose petals, violets, black tobacco, crushed anise and black sage on the delicately complex nose. Presenting great tension between the tannins and acidity, the palate offers candied blackberries and red cherries, cut by spearmint and green tea.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Clevenger Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry fruit makes friends with black earth, coffee syrup, dill and dried garden herbs on this nuanced bottling. The palate blends cherry cola with milk chocolate, and boisterous acidity with black rock minerality, finishing on a cream-soda spritz.
Name: Oso Libre 2012 Nativo Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The original vines date back almost a century, perched above the Columbia River on the Oregon side. This is ultraripe, with brambly fruit running from strawberry preserves right on through cherry pie. As the alcohol would suggest, it's full bodied and loaded with jammy fruit.
Name: Sineann 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From La Vista Vineyard in the Adelaida District, this strong bottling features cherry candy, anise seed and mace on the nose. The palate is wildly complex, blending vanilla, lavender and violet with boysenberry, blackberry and a kirsch character.
Name: Oso Libre 2012 Osezno Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This inviting wine smells sweet and jammy. It tastes spicy, lightly oaky and like ripe raspberries. Full bodied and high in alcohol, it's also smooth in texture, mouthfilling and rich. Flavors like chocolate and blackberry mark the finish.
Name: Perry Creek 2012 Altitude 2401 Fair Play Farms Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in a relatively restrained style, this is a dark, juicy and smoky wine from Dry Creek and Alexander Valley area vineyard sites. Lengthy and smooth, it takes a decidedly medium-bodied route, with traces of leather pouch on the nose and a soft layering of milk chocolate on the finish.
Name: Decoy 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blackberry and leather pouch jump from the glass from this full-bodied wine that stays light on its feet despite the generous ripeness. Cinnamon, black pepper and black licorice round out the flavors, finishing soft and with length.
Name: Papapietro Perry 2011 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A field blend of 85% Zinfandel, 11% Alicante Bouschet and 4% Petite Sirah, this juicy, spicy wine is robust and full bodied. Blackberry syrup and black cherry combine around cinnamon and black pepper, finishing in a wave of power.
Name: Carol Shelton 2011 Bastoni Vineyard Karma Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A twist of clove, fig and chocolate figure into this powerful, concentrated wine, with baked plum, tobacco and maple taking on secondary roles. It's full bodied and thick, so pair appropriately. It finishes in black pepper.
Name: Rock Wall 2012 Westphall Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: So easy to enjoy, this mild-tasting but full-bodied wine is fruity in flavor and soft in texture. It has an earthy, savory aroma, generous plum and berry flavors, a mineral influence, light tannins and a lingering finish.
Name: Ironstone 2013 Rous Vineyard Reserve Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A bright and relatively light expression of the variety, this wine imparts more red berry than black, with seasonings of cinnamon and nutmeg. Soft, smooth and unfussy, it retains solid acidity from start to finish, with a taste of vanilla custard on the finish.
Name: Balletto 2012 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite a solid deal from an expert Zin house, this wine shows aromas of candied cherry and pomegranate, with cinnamon, a hint of tar and a little crushed espresso bean. Dried blueberries enliven the palate, along with mineral tones and more cinnamon-based baking spice.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Westside Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Stewed plums and strawberries partner with lilacs, sagebrush and hard cinnamon candy on the nose of this bottling, which is boosted by 12% Grenache, 7% Syrah and 6% Petite Sirah. Juicy, rich cherry and blueberry flavors meet with a rocky, black-slate character on the palate.
Name: Proulx 2012 Willow Creek Farm Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Well made, well rounded and well balanced, this medium-bodied wine has tasty fruit aromas and flavors. Spicy accents accompany a firm, layered texture and lasting finish.
Name: Graziano 2012 Old Vine Kazmet Vineyard Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry blossoms, strawberries and wet asphalt elements show on the nose of this wine from a property along Vineyard Drive in West Paso. A nice cola zest starts the palate, which lands on cherries and ripe cranberries before fading away.
Name: Brophy Clark 2013 Whale Rock VIneyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong in alcohol aromas on the nose, this shows tobacco, cigar, pipe smoke and brandy-like notes. The palate is extremely sweet and treacly, with fig and prune flavors.
Name: Ascension Cellars 2012 Rapture-Frankel Vineyard Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: From a vineyard east of Napa first planted in 1905, Moore is densely structured and deceptively elegant, all while maintaining an intensity of tart cherry and wild blackberry. Spicy in black pepper and a dusting of cinnamon, it remains vibrant on the palate from start to lengthy finish, a knockout among the producer's consistently high-achieving Zinfandels that should stand the test of time. Cellar through 2023.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Velvety aromas of blackberry-spearmint chiffon greet the nose on this wondrous bottling from the Mainini Vineyard. The wine's mouthfeel is sexy, luxurious, soft and supple, with unctuous yet not overbearing flavors of dark chocolate, plum, black pepper, truffle and shaved licorice.
Name: Pulchella 2013 Mercenary Reserve 25 Zinfandel (Monterey)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A vineyard along the Silverado Trail in Napa, not far from the winery, Grande was planted in 1920 and is still farmed by the original farmer's family, Dorothy and Tony Rossi. Here, it offers structure and elegance despite a brooding weight and power, the flavors leaning toward blackberry and licorice.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Grande Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Quite full bodied and obviously powerful in flavor, this wine is piled deep and rich with fruit aromas and flavors like ripe blackberries and blueberries plus chocolate and espresso. An impressive, astringent texture adds structure and makes it appetizing to drink, while the tannins seem to help the opulent flavors linger during the aftertaste.
Name: Bella 2012 Big River Ranch Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Simply delicious, this Zin is well mannered and not too full bodied. Aromas of this dry and elegant wine are like cinnamon and cardamom, and flavors are a little smoky and full of cherries. The mouthfeel is good and gripping due to fine tannins and supportive acidity.
Name: Chacewater 2013 Made with Organically Grown Grapes Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: From the producer's dry-farmed estate vineyard, this elegantly powerful wine opens in cracked black pepper, dried herb and cedar, continuing the peppery theme on the palate. Black cherry and high-toned blackberry combine with the more savory elements, with an overall softness of texture and lengthy finish.
Name: Tres Sabores 2012 Zinfandel (Rutherford)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine's judiciously restrained nose shows black fruits and dried herbs, with asphalt and focused rather than exuberant fig and plum aromas. There is lots of minty lift at the tip of the palate, which opens toward Mission figs, fudge and mocha.
Name: Proulx 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: From a vineyard planted in 1924 in the northern reaches of the Napa Valley, Falleri is a tiny-production wine that's soft, supple and generously juicy and fruity. Boysenberry, blackberry and a trace of crisp red fruit combine around a core of earth, dotted by a floral bouquet. The finish is long and leathery.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Falleri Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intoxicating aromas of plum jelly, violets, blueberry, chocolate and cinnamon are cut with a pencil-lead focus on this bottling by a family in the Paso wine game since 1908. Flavors of blackberry jelly are lifted by lavender and anise spice.
Name: Rotta 2013 Osso Balenda Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Brilliant strawberry and raspberry aromas, bright and effusive fruit flavors, and a sense of freshness and purity make this wine from one of El Dorado County's oldest wineries a pleasure to drink. It's full bodied, has a smooth texture, mild tannins and a lingering finish.
Name: Boeger 2014 Walker Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright, distinctive fruit impressions pop through a layer of smoke and bacon aromas as this full-bodied but balanced wine opens up. Jazzy flavors like raspberry and cranberry meld with bass notes like blackberry as firm tannins and good acidity give it great structure, too.
Name: Bella 2012 Lily Hill Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A fascinating wine from one of the oldest wineries in the Sierra Foothills, this has deep boysenberry and blackberry aromas. Flavors include allspice, cardamom and black cherries, with a meaty nuance. Medium to full bodied, it's not a monster Zin but distinctive and clearly delicious.
Name: Sobon Estate 2012 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is polished in texture, sophisticated in flavor and a pleasure to sip. It exudes plum and blackberry aromas, adds rich plummy flavors and almost coats the mouth with richness. While full bodied, it has enough complexity and finesse for special occasions.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2013 Home Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: There is something special about this beautifully balanced wine. It has the ripe and fruity flavors that are expected, but they are attractively reserved, and the firm tannins don't overwhelm the creamy texture. It will be great for a special occasion now through 2019.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2012 Zinfandel (High Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The producer's most popular and widely made Zin has a loyal following, and this vintage merits further admiration, offering soft, plummy juiciness on the palate. Not over-oaked, it sparks with black pepper, finishing with elegance.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: From an historic site replanted and restored to new heights, this wine has good grip and high-octane fruit that plays on the palate, veering from jammy to juicy and back again. Anise and black pepper linger on the lengthy finish, with a touch of smoky oak and toffee.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Sonoma County-San Joaquin County, California Other, California, US
Description: A bright, focused fruitiness is the strength of this full-bodied, very ripe and enticing wine. It smells and tastes like fresh strawberries, raspberries and cherries, and feels ultrasmooth and polished in texture. With each sip a better sense of depth and concentration builds.
Name: Ghost Pines 2013 Winemaker's Blend Zinfandel (Sonoma County-San Joaquin County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: While full bodied and flavorful, this wine is not overdone. It has tempting oak aromas, and mellow fruit and spice flavors that are layered. It also offers a velvet texture that's soothing and saturated with fine tannins, and a lingering finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 Rezerve Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This delicious Zin has almost everything one could ask for. It offers aromas of spicy oak and enticing ripe fruit. Flavors of black cherry and blackberry layer over subtle baking spices and smoke, while a great texture combines fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. A velvety viscosity helps flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Manifesto! 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This offers a classic Zin nose, with dried strawberries, plums, white sage, black loam and a minty lift. The palate is juicy but restrained, with ripe olallieberries cut by licorice and tobacco, bound together with considerable grip.
Name: Midnight 2012 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Hailing from vines planted in 1918 when the Los Angeles area was the state's top vineyard zone, this bottling shows elegant blackberry meringue, lavender chiffon and hedonistic fudge on the nose. Purple flowers also show on the palate, as do Earl Grey tea, plum rinds and black-pepper notes.
Designation: Monga Zin Lopez Vineyard Old Vine
Name: Carol Shelton 2013 Monga Zin Lopez Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very well-built and elegant dinner wine, this smells like boysenberry and black pepper. It tastes nicely reserved and almost meaty, with moderate tannins to add grip to the texture. It should pair nicely with a roast or braise.
Name: Cedarville 2012 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lots of fruit power flows through this full-bodied wine, making it focused and delicious. A firm coating of tannin kicks in to add weight to the texture and help the flavors linger on the finish. Plum, smoke and black pepper are among the complex flavors. It's made from vines planted in 1910 at a nearly 2,000-foot elevation.
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Aromas like spiced apple and brown sugar lead to luscious fruit and spice flavors and a plush texture in this medium-bodied wine. It has the richness and near-sweetness that can pair well with slowly cooked meats and mildly spicy dishes, but sips well on its own as well.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2012 High Elevation Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Somehow this wine is bold, full bodied and superripe—yet balanced, sleek and structured. Tart, vibrant fruit aromas like raspberry and cranberry are followed by rich, almost sweet strawberry and red cherry flavors. A layer of fine tannins adds grip to the mouthfeel, and firm acidity keeps everything from being heavy.
Name: Graziano 2012 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine from San Ardo Ranch in the San Lucas appellation wins against Zins twice the price. Black cherry and blackberry aromas meet with sensuous lilacs and wet asphalt on the nose. The palate's cherry juice front quickly turns to tobacco, dried blueberry and a tarry, dried-berry finish.
Name: Sextant 2013 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Ben Lomond Mountain, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From an extremely coastal 13-acre vineyard in Bonny Doon that was replanted in 2005, this wine shows black-cherry jelly candies on the nose alongside wild mint, white sage and black olive. The palate is more asphalt and tar-laden, but with blueberry, violet and uncrushed peppercorn flavors that make it quite tasty.
Name: Beauregard 2012 Beauregard Ranch Zinfandel (Ben Lomond Mountain)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the marquee vineyard just down the road, known better for Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this ZInfandel has 5% Petite Sirah blended in. Combined, they offer earthy and floral elements on the nose before a juicy palate of red fruit enters. A touch of olive plays off the bittersweet finish.
Name: Gracianna 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This serious and concentrated wine has plenty of ripe fruit aromas and flavors, with a smooth texture, and lingering fruitiness on the finish. It resembles black plums and cloves in flavor, and has excellent balance and depth.
Name: Carol Shelton 2013 Wild Thing Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From century-old grapevines found on Santa Cruz Island, this bottling offers concentrated raspberry and a touch of strawberry, lifted by eucalyptus and lavender notes. The palate is enlivening, with tight cranberry fruit, elderflower and pencil-lead flavors.
Name: Rusack 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big-boned wine has smoke and brown-sugar aromas, ample and delicious raspberry and blackberry flavors, firm tannins, supportive acidity and a lingering finish. While full bodied, it's well balanced and will taste great with big proteins.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2013 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine has full aromas and flavors of rich, ripe strawberries and blackberries. The texture is both smooth and slightly gripping at the same time, with a medium to full body and a dry, lingering finish lingers.
Name: Ironstone 2013 Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine, combined with 10% Petite Sirah, impresses in grip and softness, offering big, rich waves of raspberry, cinnamon and allspice, before unveiling a leathery finish. An all-around likable wine, it's ready to enjoy now.
Name: Four Vines 2012 The Sophisticate Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made with just 10% new oak and in both American and Hungarian barrels, this wine celebrates both juicy red plum and raspberry, offering sizable power in an elegant package. Soft tannins and measured acidity maintain a freshness in the glass, with a nuanced, easygoing finish.
Name: Pellegrini 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumy, this lusty Zin is also structured and juicy, offering plenty of jammy blackberry and cherry to keep a palate coming back for more. Powerfully built, it'll stand up to chunks of meat very well.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2012 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Meaty, spicy accents enliven this full-bodied and ripe-tasting wine, adding a layer of interest and depth. The aromas and flavors show blackberries and black pepper, while the texture is smooth and a sense of richness on the lingering the finish.
Name: Montevina 2013 Skyland Ridge Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This showy wine has maple syrup aromas, extremely ripe and almost unctuous flavors, lots of spicy oak influence and full body. While it offers a lot of flash, it also has lots of substance underneath. A velvety, grippy texture owes a lot to layered tannins, and a base note of ripe berries carries through the finish.
Name: Michael David 2013 Earthquake Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Unapologetically sweet and luxuriously fruity, this wine is like a blackberry pie in a glass. It will be just the thing to serve as dessert, or to warm up a cold evening. It's full bodied, very thick and smooth in texture, and has a lingering finish like that of a Port.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Reserve Green Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine skirts the boundaries of ripeness, veering close to an extreme edge. Aged in American oak, 25% of it new, it's hedonistic and jammy in raspberry cobbler, brown sugar and baking spice, intense and tart, with a dry, peppery finish.
Name: Tin Barn 2012 Los Chamizal Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This ambitious, against-all-odds island project with ancient grapevines is showing promising results, in this case offering smoked meats, hard spice and very tight purple fruit on the nose. The palate is tart with cranberries and raspberries, with a pencil lead and earth character, proving quite interesting if not entirely Zin-like.
Name: Rusack 2013 Santa Catalina Island Vineyard Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine has more than the typical backbone and texture. Fresh raspberry and red cherry flavors get support from good acidity and a hefty layer of almost chewy tannins. It is dry, firm and well balanced, and is made to accompany food.
Name: Parducci 2012 Small Lot Blend Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black plums and Mission figs stewed with cinnamon, cloves and vanilla make for an intriguing nose on this bottling from a longtime Italian winemaking family. The palate shows cola, black cherry, coffee bean and dark chocolate, though proves quite grippy with a structure that will let down its guard with patience.
Name: Lusso Della Terra 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Let's call it a highly stylized but nonetheless attractive wine. A sweet, spicy oak character floods the taste impressions, the body is full, and the texture firm but smooth. Enticing notes of orange zest, cinnamon and vanilla—almost sweet—dominate the smells and flavors.
Name: Sobon Estate 2012 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Concentrated in toasted marshmallow and juicy blackberry, this is a large, full-bodied wine marked by puckering tannins that still need time to resolve. Powerfully built, it's big on flavor and intensity, with vanilla on the finish.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2012 Reserve Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Cherry-vanilla and boysenberry jam combine around a ripe, lush and full-bodied wine, ideal for smoky, grilled foods. Smooth tannins make it enjoyable now and accessible to many palates, though be mindful of its power and intensity.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2012 Snake Eyes Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Prunes, dark earth and vanilla-mocha spice show on this wine's nose. The palate is framed by richness, with purple fruit and blueberry flavors benefiting from a dusting of chocolate.
Name: EOS 2012 Wolcott Single VIneyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a vineyard planted in 1950, this wine is rich in ripe cherry and vanilla, with a full-bodied, jammy smoothness that makes it pleasant to drink. From the warmer side of the appellation, it is concentrated and structured through the meaty, peppery finish.
Name: Tin Barn 2013 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from a majority of Zinfandel with tiny amounts of Carignane and Petite Sirah, Gino's is big, rich and straightforward, with a touch of dried herb and dark plum surrounded by accents of oak. Powerfully robust, it'll need a rich meat dish to stand alongside.
Name: Sbragia 2012 Gino's Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Full bodied, yet polished and rather complex in flavor, this wine has a ight color with an auburn rim, with aromas like wild berries and underbrush. Flavors blend plum and prune with savory touches like tomato and herbs.
Name: Sol Rouge 2012 Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A very fruity, very well-behaved wine, this gushes raspberry and cherry flavors, has a fresh, clean and just slightly tangy texture and moderate tannins. It will be a crowd-pleaser and a good match with different dishes.
Name: Gravelly Ford 2012 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a big, oaky, brawny and tannic version of the variety, generous in brown sugar and blackberry and plum jam. A piquant seasoning of peppercorn dots the midpalate and finish.
Name: Peju 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
