Description: Ripe fruit aromas and flavors ooze from this full-bodied but silky-textured wine. It tastes like a late-harvest style, with cherry and blood orange flavors, and seems well-suited for kicking back by the fire after a meal, eating chunks of cheese.
Name: Oak Farm 2012 Wegat Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red fruits, barrel smoke and chipped slate make for an intriguing although not entirely integrated nose on this single-vineyard bottling. The palate shows red berries, wet clay and hints of anise.
Name: EOS 2012 Algunas Dias Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine tastes like a superripe, late-harvest and lavishly oaked version, so that all the aromas and flavors seem to be in overdrive. It smells like cinnamon and vanilla, tastes like strawberry jam, and has a little white pepper in the finish.
Name: Whiplash 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied and intensely fruity wine with jammy aromas and ripe cherry and raspberry flavors. It is smooth textured and has soft tannins, so the effect is easygoing in spite of high alcohol.
Name: Cosentino 2013 The Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full bodied and completely mature, this is saturated with ripe flavors. It has enough firm tannin for a gripping texture and brings a sense of completeness for something this bold. It tastes like sweet blackberries and boysenberries, yet is dry.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Reserve Goltz Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very fruity, ripe and extremely full bodied in terms of alcohol, this exuberant wine has abundant cherry and herbal flavors and a smooth, juicy texture. With very little tannin and all that fruitiness, it should be a crowd-pleaser.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2012 Muy Bueno Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An earthy, aged aroma, very dark color and flavors like raisins and Port add up to a good after-dinner wine to try with chocolate, cheese or a cigar. Sweetness is evident, concentration, too, and full body is a given in a late-harvest style like this.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Reserve Harde Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Dark berries and sweet baking-spice tones carry the nose. The medium-bodied palate brings juicy blackberry flavors showing mild concentration, supported by soft tannins.
Name: Messina Hof 2012 Paulo Limited Edition Primitivo (Texas)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: The aromas and flavors of this wine are ripe to overripe, like dried plums and raisins. An earthy vein runs through them, too. It is full bodied and rather soft in texture.
Name: Truscott 2012 Weibel Family Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Planted in 1999 specifically for the producer, this vineyard block provides power and structure, revealing shocks of blackberry jam, mocha and gunpowder amidst a streak of wild anise and black pepper. Robust and bold, it begs for another 10 to 15 years in the cellar before finding its complete composure.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard The Biale Block Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A multidimensional wine, this delicious example made from 130-year-old vines combines depth, breadth and length. It smells like ripe blackberries, tastes fruity and layered, feels luxurious and supple but at the same time firm in fine tannins and balanced by lively acidity. Medium to full bodied, it tastes great now and will improve through 2020.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2013 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This bodacious but balanced wine from a wild corner of Sonoma County has smoke and black pepper aromas, rich grape, boysenberry and roast beef flavors, very bracing tannins and full body. It's big, yes, but it also gives up nuances that make it complex and compelling. Best to drink after 2018.
Name: Bella 2012 Rocky Ridge Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Estate grown from an historic vineyard planted by the producer's father, this wine is velvety smooth and decked in chocolate, densely rich and delicious in caramel and blackberry pie. Enjoyable now, it has the legs and structure to age through 2025–2030.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Aldo's Vineyard Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: From a warm site in the heart of St. Helena's valley floor, this is a restrained, elegant version of a powerfully built wine, thick in tannin and yet nonetheless able to speak its mind. Mushroom aromas give it a Pinot Noir-esque personality at first, before layers of red and black berry provide sultry, juicy texture and flavor. The finish is chewy, asking for more time. Cellar through 2023.
Name: Robert Biale 2013 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A tightly wound ball of lush red fruit, this wine has some grip to it. The leathery tannins are smooth but need time to develop, a swath of black pepper running through. Cellar through 2020.
Name: DeLorimier 2012 Harris Kratka Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Complex and inviting, this artfully blends tart berry fruit with streaks of clove, pepper, sandalwood and hibiscus tea. Balanced and lingering, it shows the sexy, seductive side of the grape.
Name: Troon 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gobs of fruit flavor are supported by firm acidity and fine-grained tannins in this full-bodied but well-balanced wine. It has classic raspberry and blackberry flavors, attractive floral nuances and a high degree of likeability.
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A sparkling wine made from a majority Zinfandel with 4% Petite Sirah, this is a curious experiment that's dark red-purple in color and plummy sweet, with a minimum of effervescence and a dearth of acidity.
Name: Rock Wall 2012 Rockpile Zin Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This substantial wine will age beautifully through 2023, so structured and elegant it is behind its layers and layers of coconut fritter, vanilla and strawberry-raspberry jam. Beguiling in floral violets and lavender, it has streaks of black pepper too, ending in a dream-like trance of earthy dust.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in color, especially for the alcohol level, this wine offers dried red cherries, hibiscus, rose petals, pencil shavings and a touch of hot asphalt on the spicy and fun nose. Lots of lively red fruit energy comes forth once sipped, with nutmeg, clove spice, ginger snaps and molasses flavors rounding out a memorable pour.
Name: Felten Cellars 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Gorgeous fruit aromas, generous and deep fruit flavors and soft, chocolate accents add up to a very flavorful but relaxed wine. Touches of clove and cedar pop up with the second sip, while some welcome tannins clean the palate. The fruit flavors come back on the finish. It is full-bodied but very smooth.
Name: Easton 2012 Old Vine Rinaldi Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A tiny-production wine that is exuberantly brambly and wild, this has a bouquet of juicy black and red berries at its core. Balanced and elegant despite the generous palate, it has softened tannins and a thickness toward the finish. offering accents of black pepper and brown sugar.
Name: Sequum 2012 Riverwash Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This classic site provides a grippy, structured experience of juicy, leathery blackberry and black pepper. The wine also reveals a brighter, more vibrant underside of red berry, perhaps from the contribution of 5% Grenache into the mix, alongside 17% Petite Sirah. Firm, focused and full bodied, this is a delicious wine.
Name: Valdez 2012 St. Peter's Church Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Purely delicious, this has stunning and distinctive aromas and flavors that recall pomegranate juice and blueberries, plus a velvety-smooth texture. While very full bodied, this wine does not win with power but with grace. It has excellent balance and harmony, and stands above the crowd.
Name: Boeger 2013 Walker Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Ripe and juicy in red and black berries, this wine has a big presence and plenty of bold flavor, retaining all the elements so beloved in the variety, from black pepper to leather and cigar, while displaying a deftness of winemaking skill in the cellar. Mouthfilling, it has zinging acidity on the finish, making for a memorable wine.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: The third release from this vineyard, this wine is juicy in fruit, tar and leathery tannins, a mix of raspberry, cassis and dark chocolate. From a dry-farmed site, with a small percentage of Petite Sirah, it was given less than a year in American oak and offers a taste of sweet tobacco on the finish. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Elyse 2012 Korte Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Classy in cherry-berry crumble and vanilla, this wine then expands into sophisticated bursts of white pepper, cinnamon and violets. Elegant and intriguing, it offers balance amidst bold flavor, finishing smooth and velvety.
Name: Artezin 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has ripe black cherry flavors, great acidity and firm tannins that keep it lively enough to balance the fruity richness. Full bodied, broad in mouthfeel, but with a background tanginess, it is well balanced and keeps encouraging another sip.
Name: Saxon Brown 2011 Stonewall Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coming from a vineyard named after the patron saint of night watchmen, this wine offers luxurious purple aromas of blackberry-vanilla sauce and dark chocolate. The palate is sticky and singing with coffee, milk chocolate and dried cherries, showing plenty of deep tannins and boisterous acidity that will make this bottling last a while.
Name: Seven Angels 2012 St. Peter of Alcantara Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Inviting and complex, this is a juicy, spicy and structured Zin. It's big, bold and flavorful as one would expect, with unexpected balance and acidity. Dusty, leathery tannins wrap around black, brambly berries and black pepper, suggesting food pairings that do the same.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Rossi Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This lovely wine sings in rich red and black berries, a celebration of juicy, ripe fruit that's balanced by a firmness of acidity. Inviting wafts of clove and vanilla play backup with finesse, atop soft, well-behaved tannins.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Pauline's Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Smooth in tannins, this vineyard-designate is also sharp in crisp red cherry and strawberry, leaning into brighter, vibrant flavors that temper the underlying power. Visions of homemade berry cobbler with a side of bacon flit through its bouquet, ending velvety and alive.
Name: Carlisle 2013 DuPratt Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: One of the producer's smallest-production offerings, this wine displays depth and character, with a complementary tension between plum and cherry versus smoke and leather. Subtle in all its characteristics, it finishes with a burst of flavor and intensity.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Rockpile Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky red and black berry wrap themselves around a full-bodied expression of fruit and introverted oak, managing to provide texture and body through a foundation of well-managed acidity. With a grippiness on the finish, the wine offers velvety power and finesse.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Timber Crest Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A deep, dark color, ripe blackberry aromas and berry and spice flavors add up to a full-bodied, impressive wine from one of the oldest wineries in the Sierra Foothills. Smoky, oaky accents help shape the opulent fruit flavors, and enough firm tannins and lively acidity provide good balance.
Name: Boeger 2013 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This beautifully balanced wine is poised, a bit reserved, but has a distinctive personality. Aromas of red cherry, cedar and cinnamon precede tangy raspberry flavors that ride on a firm but light texture and linger on through the finish.
Name: Easton 2012 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A nicely structured wine with a sizable component of Petite Sirah and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers a density of oak and tannin on the entry, offset by a juicy backbone of blackberry and cherry. Full bodied, it has the elements to last, being completely drinkable now through 2020.
Name: Frank Family 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A touch of smoked pork meets with red cherries, cola and black licorice on the nose of this small-batch wine out of Templeton by Will Persall. Bacon fat and blackberry-maple syrup flavors make for a delicious palate, with lots of lively acidity that gives balance and keeps the tongue tingling.
Name: WCP 2013 The Zin Cripple Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a powerful vineyard comes this powerful wine, beautifully aromatic and succulent in coconut flakes and raspberry liqueur. With a crispness from the acidity, it remains balanced on the palate despite its size, finishing in spicy black pepper and leathery tobacco.
Name: Black Stallion 2012 Limited Release Monte Rosso Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Balanced for dinner time, and sophisticated in aromas and flavors, this wine stands apart from the pack. The boysenberry and cedar aromas are tempting, and the vivid cherry and berry flavors are satisfying. Enough tannins and acid are woven in to keep the wine refreshing.
Name: Brooklyn Winery 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a beloved vineyard source in the heart of the appellation, this classic Zin-Petite Sirah is perfumed from the start, aromatically memorable in dried cranberry and ripe plum. Elegant in style, it offers soft, integrated tannins around a juicy core of brambly blackberry and brown sugar.
Name: Armida 2013 Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and rich, with a menthol-like streak in the background, this 89% Zin is complemented by a wealth of mixed blacks, from Alicante Bouschet to Trousseau Noir. It opens with a bouquet of fresh, brambly blackberry, raspberry and sage, reaching a powerful conclusion of brown sugar and spice, staying structured atop soft, sizable tannins. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Carlisle 2013 Montafi Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick in chocolate and blackberry jam-like goodness, this is a smooth, lush dessert wine that just begs to be poured over vanilla ice cream, its mocha-like finish akin to having a flat white cup of coffee. Cabernet Sauvignon Brandy was added to up the alcohol to a Port-like wine.
Name: Cairdean Estate 2011 Dessert Wine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This soft, subdued wine is pervasive in barbecue smoke, black licorice and toasted marshmallow. It's made from mostly Zinfandel, with smaller pockets of Petite Sirah and Carignane. Intense, especially toward the finish, it finds a thread of acidity in the background to lift itself up.
Name: Valdez 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Powerful black cherry and blackberry aromas and flavors seem to infuse this full-bodied wine with lots of fruit energy. It tastes vivid and unique because of that deep vein of black fruit impressions, and stays balanced by firm acidity and fine-grained tannins in spite of its alcoholic strength.
Name: Saxon Brown 2010 Fighting Brothers Cuvée Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick in cherry-vanilla, big oak and tannin, this vineyard-designate contains handfuls of Petite Sirah and mixed blacks that are, as the producer puts it, too long to list. Given 10 months in American oak, it offers a balance of fruit and leathery power, from raspberry and blackberry to Sunday morning bacon. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Elyse 2012 Morisoli Vineyard Zinfandel (Rutherford)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This Zin also has 7% Petite Sirah and 6% Carignane, from both the Teldeschi and York Creek vineyards. The berry fruit is elegantly entangled with violet perfume and dusty tannins, a suggestion of brick on the nose. Succulent, it shows its strong tannins on the finish.
Name: Elyse 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry pie with cloves, black loam, dark tobacco leaf and maple-flavored bacon aromas make for an inviting nose on this edgy wine. It's surprisingly light and airy on the palate, with decent grip, showing boysenberry and graphite flavors.
Name: Four Vines 2012 Biker Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Sourced from vines that date back more than 100 years on the Beatty Ranch, this wine is appropriately robust, a big, syrupy concentration of baked blackberry and plum. Soft in tannins and structured, it finishes with a complexity of vanilla and black cherry.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy and refined in black and white pepper, this memorable red traffics in all the classic characteristics of leather and tobacco with dark, brooding red and black fruit. Medium in body and length, it finishes with a refreshing element of black cherry and cola, calling out for barbecued meat treated with the same care.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very concentrated and juicy aromas of strawberry extract, grape soda and fudge show on the nose of this wine by vineyard manager Neil Roberts. It's dense and red-fruit-forward once sipped, then levels with a bit of bitterness and a nice interplay of acid and tannins. This is heavy-duty Zin country.
Name: Clavo Cellars 2010 Desperado Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has a vivid, fresh raspberry aroma and deep blackberry flavors supported by firm tannins. It tastes like a cool-climate example because of the vivid fruit, layered tannins and good acidity, which make it well balanced in the style of classic dry reds.
Name: The Federalist 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: Faint aromatics hide an effusiveness on the palate of thick, dense blackberry jam and brown sugar, the ripe power of the wine kept in check by a balance of acidity. Fuller bodied in style, it remains dry and vibrant on the finish.
Name: August Briggs 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This high-toned wine, bright in acidity and red fruit, also offers textured notions of baked bread and brown sugar. Rich without becoming overbearing, it finishes in a spicy concoction of cinnamon and black pepper.
Name: Portalupi 2013 Dolinsek Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is fruit yumminess all the way through. It has wild berry aromas and flavors that feel pure and focused, and is soft and almost sweet in terms of mouthfeel. An essence of blackberry lingers on the finish.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2012 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A Port-like aroma, full body and rich, ripe fruit flavors create a big, hearty and delicious wine. Full of plump berry character from the aroma to the flavor to the finish, this is also backed by firm, lip-smacking tannins to counter all that richness.
Name: Saracina 2012 Pick and Shovel Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bing cherry, blackberry and hot black lava rock aromas arise on the nose of this expression of a dry-farmed vineyard. The palate is light compared to similar Zins, showing plum skins, tomato leaf and a heightened sense of minerality along with cherry-candy flavors.
Name: Lone Madrone 2012 Sheep Camp Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bold and ripe in taste, this full-bodied wine packs in plump blackberry and boysenberry flavors, a rich texture from firm tannins and lip-smacking acidity that keeps it lively. Slow-cooked ribs, anyone?
Name: Easton 2012 Estate Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine has aromas of currants and strawberries and tastes fruity but dry, with supportive tannins and acidity that make it appetizing. Full bodied but not overpowering, it is very versatile with food.
Name: LangeTwins 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Chocolate and dark cherry aromas lead to ripe plum, boysenberry and blackberry flavors that are almost sweet, very rich and full bodied. The thick texture melts in your mouth, having soft tannins. This drinks almost like a Port and should be great with chocolate or cheese.
Name: Concrete 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: If a wine can caress the taste buds, this absolutely fresh and fruity one does. It smells like blackberry jam, feels soft and silky while still having full body, and gives up delicious, ripe, full fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Sweet, delicious aromas of boysenberry and maple syrup, flavors like blackberry jam and a broad, generous texture turn this into a blockbuster wine. A touch of sweetness would make it great with something spicy and sweet like pork ribs.
Name: Criss Cross 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dedicated to the vineyard crews, this wine features a dynamic nose that blends dried black cherries, slightly sour plum fruit and a bit of tar. The palate also picks up the dried cherries and plums, along with blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors.
Name: Sculpterra 2013 Héroe Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Here's a spicy, brambly Oregon Zin, with forward fruit flavors of blackberry and cherry. There's some tang to the acids, and the wine has a sharp edge that additional bottle-age should soften.
Name: Delfino 2012 Zinfandel (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart cherry and high-toned acidity give this wine a tanginess around structured, well-heeled tannins. On the palate dense red and blue fruits combine to juicy effect, offering flavor without an overabundance of power.
Name: Pech Merle 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Coming from 100-year-old vines, this fascinating wine shows black cherry, spearmint, graphite and pencil lead on the restrained nose. The palate is all about dried cherries and the tart skins of plum and other red-purple fruits, keeping a nice sour tension throughout the sip.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2011 Lopez Ranch Old VIne Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smoky, meaty aromas and lush berry flavors combine for a showy, full-bodied wine. It smells like charred oak, minerals and blackberry, then tastes like chocolate and dark cherry, with soft tannins for texture and a lingering, almost sweet finish.
Name: Ivory and Burt 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This has rather light aromas of red cherries and raspberries, mildly rich fruit flavors and a texture that's half silky and half firmly tannic. Those traits add up to deliciousness and good balance.
Name: 3 Ball 2012 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's a stewy rustiness to this wine on the entry, an evocative recall of the old country, when grandfather made wine in his basement. From a high-elevation vineyard site, it takes time to open. Once it does, the full-bodied expression of juicy blackberry and leather combine to nice effect.
Name: Romililly 2012 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This thick, rich and dense wine may need time to overcome its wealth of leathery sinew and black pepper. The fruit is elusive, allowing the savory elements to dominate all around. This may need cellaring to come around, through 2020.
Name: Frank Family 2012 Reserve Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Spicy aromas like cinnamon and vanilla light up the aromas, and fresh strawberry and plum flavors gush forth on the palate. Medium bodied, this wine has a good balance of ripe fruit and appetizing texture.
Name: One Hope 2013 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied blockbuster strikes a good balance between very ripe, lavish fruit aromas and spicy oak and berry flavors and a sense of good structure. It has gobs of strawberry and mulberry, a light and lively texture despite the high alcohol, and lingering, almost sweet finish.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2012 Peacock Patch Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Viscous and heavy, this 100% Zinfandel made in a Port-like style is intense and chocolaty, a concentrated form of blackberry and blueberry that shows full-bodied richness.
Name: Summit Lake 2006 Claire Riley's Pirate Reserve Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bore wine smells like strawberries and cherries, and tastes jammy and chocolaty. The rich, almost thick texture hangs on to all that ripeness on the finish. This should pair well with salty cheeses or a chocolate dessert.
Name: Victor Vineyards 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Part of a series that features striking labels, this wine shows lots of lively boysenberry, crushed lilacs, black pepper and cola on the nose. Being young, it still has strong tannins despite a relatively light body, with olallieberry and dried violet flavors proving interestingly Rhône-like in style.
Name: Force of Nature 2013 Mossfire Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Like a blood orange in color and aroma, this effervescent expression of Zinfandel in rosé form is refreshing and vibrant in tangerine and pineapple personality, its edges smooth and refined.
Name: Pedroncelli 2014 Signature Selection Dry Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Pure, focused fruit flavors like raspberry and red cherry light up this medium-bodied wine. A lively texture of crisp acidity and light tannins adds great balance to the effusive fruitiness. For such a friendly price, what else could one ask for?
Name: Twisted 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick in black peppery cinnamon, this wine offers a zig-zag of fruit and power without falling over the edge of extremity. The mix includes 5% Petite Sirah. Full bodied and big, it finishes in a taste of sweet vanilla.
Name: Wilson 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The fresh, jammy and spicy aromas and ripe, maple syrupy, almost sweet fruit flavors are tasty and easy to swallow. A soft texture, full body and little tannin add to the smoothness and sweetness of its taste.
Name: Caricature 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: With aromas like sweet strawberries and red cherries, and flavors as ripe as the aromas, this medium- to full-bodied wine is tempting, smooth and polished. It tastes refined but still lets loose a lot of fruit power. The balance is on the soft side, with mild tannins and subdued acidity.
Name: Peirano 2012 The Immortal Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Subdued aromas and rather tight fruit flavors make a modest impression, while full body and very firm tannins due to 15% Petite Sirah give a lot of structure. With astringent grip in the texture, this will taste best with juicy meat dishes and other rich proteins.
Designation: Home Ranch Two Bud Block Single Vineyard Collection
Name: Shannon Ridge 2012 Home Ranch Two Bud Block Single Vineyard Collection Zinfandel (High Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Campfire smoke appears to be the signature of this producer and the old vines planted in 1920 from which it sources. The wine is thick, ripe and soft. Black plum is the star on the palate, taking on a baked, jammy quality on the finish, accented in vanilla.
Name: Gamba 2013 Starr Road Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Campfire smoke punctuates the opening of this intensely dense wine. It veers into jammy, syrupy territory, red and black berry fruit exploding at its juicy core.
Name: Gamba 2013 Gamba Estate Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Jam and vanilla aromas and ripe raspberry flavors make this plenty fruity, while crisp acidity lends just a touch of grip to the silky texture. It's medium bodied and easy to drink.
Name: Helwig 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: There's size and power to this generous, slightly tangy wine, the robustness of its fruit and tannin representative of a ripe year. Black cherry and vanilla highlight the proceedings, with leather on the finish.
Name: Madrigal 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A sweet, syrupy aroma and candied fruit flavors, sprinkled with baking-spice notes from oak aging, make this wine attractive in a bubble-gum way. It is fruity, medium bodied, fresh and frothy.
Name: Brazin 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This old-vine Zin contains a dash of Petite Sirah. It smells like bacon and wood smoke and tastes like smoked beef. It's an extreme version to say the least, and will not be for everyone.
Name: Oak Ridge 2012 Big Bad Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Pretty long in the bottle, this rich, soft, thick Zin offers a stewy taste of plums that veers sweet into molasses and jam. On the finish is an additional thickness of black pepper and leather.
Name: Summit Lake 2010 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The grapes for this old-vine wine come from various appellations within Sonoma, including Dry Creek and Sonoma Valley. The Zin is blended with mixed blacks and Mourvèdre, which combine for a sweet, thick and jammy experience of cherry-raspberry molasses. A spicy hit of pepper peaks on the finish.
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2012 Old Vines Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This intriguing wine shows aromas of tart fruits like rhubarb and tart cherry. The flavors add layers of richness to that impression, almost coating the tongue with black cherry and blackberry backed up with good, firm acidity and a welcome nip of tannin in the texture.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2011 Esola Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tart cherry, ripe plum and black cherry flavors and barely a trace of detectable oak character make this a lively, fruit-driven wine. The aroma has touches of clove and black pepper, the texture is not too rich but braced with firm acidity and tannins that keep the fruit flavors zooming along through the finish.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2012 Clockspring Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A well-made and full-bodied wine, this has generous helpings of succulent blackberry and boysenberry flavors, with a firm texture of tannins and acidity to balance out all that richness. It smells fresh and fruity, tastes juicy and crisp, and seems to gain depth and interest with repeated sips. The blend includes 10% Petite Sirah and 5% Carignan.
Name: Artezin 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: If there were such a thing as smoked blackberries, this tasty wine would resemble a light version of that. It's gushing with fresh-crushed cherry and berry flavors, great acidity and firm tannins, while accents of wood smoke and dried meat peek through, adding complexity. It's not sweet, it's not over-oaked, it's not too full bodied—it's just well-balanced and delicious.
Name: Gnarly Head 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A layered and spicy offering, this is mostly Zinfandel, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Primitivo and Carignan. Soft and inviting, it opens with smoky notes of blackberry cobbler and black cherry. Elegant on the palate, with a balance of power, it finishes in black licorice and cardamom.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2013 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark plum and cinnamon intermix on the nose and on the palate in this high-toned version of the variety from an appellation in which it grows well. Black licorice and mocha chocolate play off one another before a dusty finish.
Name: Pedroncelli 2012 Bushnell Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dry and refined in fine-grained tannin, this long-standing vineyard-designate dances in black leather and brambly blackberry, which expand gradually on the palate, peppered by baking spices. Soft and velvety, the finish lingers in spice.
Name: Seghesio 2012 Estate Home Ranch Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Here is a big, friendly wine with plenty of sweet, spicy oak in the aromas and flavors, and an easygoing texture that's not too tannic or acidic. It shows smoky, almost sweet, toasted oak aromas and basically melts in your mouth like milk chocolate, which would make a good pairing.
Name: Peirano 2012 The Heritage Collection Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A relatively light color and a cinnamon-sugar aroma might indicate a simply fruity wine, but this turns more serious and lean in flavor and texture, suggesting tart cherry and cranberry. It brings firm acidity and tannins to the mouthfeel, for a refreshing, dry and restrained character that will be very food-friendly.
Name: Scott Harvey 2012 Mountain Selection Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dense, juicy and spicy, this easygoing and easy-to-like wine will please a range of palates. Blackberry and black cherry dominate on the palate, softened by fine tannins and integrated oak.
Name: St. Francis 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no question of the variety of this wine with its notes of raspberry jam, plum and herbs. It's full bodied with a mixture of fruit and spice flavors, running hot on the finish.
Name: Angel Vine 2012 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Raspberry and vanilla introduce this wine, made from a selection of vines 21 to 130 years old, with some planted in 1882. Lusty and lush layers of cinnamon and cola accent the fruit and provide complexity, the tannins resolved and thick.
Name: Kunde 2012 Reserve Century Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruity and dense in brambly blackberry, with a waft of smoky oak, this wine offers a lean, balanced entry before taking on complexity and concentration on the finish, softly layered as it goes.
Name: Folie à Deux 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is rich and generously spiced, smelling and tasting like chocolate, vanilla, smoke and blackberries. Aging for 19 months in American and French oak certainly boosted the spices. It tastes full-bodied, very deep and almost sweet in flavor, with moderate tannins to lend some support.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2012 Epicenter Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of tire rubber mix with herbs, red fruit, plum and allspice. Candied red fruit flavors are plump in feel, trailing on the finish.
Name: Angel Vine 2012 Les Collines Vineyard Zinfandel (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: A tasty blend of almost-sweet fruit flavors and a supple texture makes this very user-friendly. It smells like raspberry syrup, tastes like some chocolate has been added to the syrup and it glides over the tongue like warm butter on pancakes. Some might like more tannin or acidity but others will love it.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2012 Zinfandel (High Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This has particularly ripe and concentrated fruit flavors and a feeling of alcoholic strength in the body and on the finish. Aromas and flavors resemble very ripe plums, dried cherries and blackberries. It's styled for fans of power and ripeness.
Name: Woodenhead 2012 Mariah Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Robust and brawny, this substantial offering features concentrated layers of smoke, leather and sage-inflected tannins. It finishes in a wrapping of bittersweet chocolate.
Name: Oakville Winery 2013 Estate Grown and Produced Zinfandel (Oakville)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Syrupy and dense, this is a burly wine, soft but powerful, that keeps coming back to the theme of blackberry syrup. Velvety tannins buoy the midpoint, before it finishes in a burst of intense ripeness.
Name: Truett Hurst 2012 Rattler Rock Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This has a deep, dense red-black color and quite smoky aromas. Herbal, almost thick flavors resemble plum juice, black pepper and roasted mild chipotle chilies. Plenty of tannin adds grip to the texture. Despite the bold flavors, this is light in body.
Name: Frey 2013 Estate Grown Biodynamic Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Forceful flavors of leather pouch, black pepper and blackberry throw their weight around an extracted, jammy core that's intensely powerful on the palate. The sizable tannins give the wine a chewiness, but become softer through the cinnamon conclusion.
Name: Rosenblum 2012 Rockpile Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Flavors of berry, vanilla and tar form around thick, rich tannins, giving this wine a puckering quality that may benefit from opening before enjoying. The finish is sturdy and robust in leathery black pepper.
Name: Rosenblum 2012 Winemaker Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine doesn't seem to have fully ripened, with green, reedy aromas along with notes of cranberry and cherry Jolly Rancher. The full-bodied palate delivers more but seems disconnected with tart, tangy cranberry flavors.
Name: Cana's Feast 2013 Northridge Vineyard Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Description: A burnt, reduced quality mars the fruit in this wine, made in a big style with full-bodied power and density.
Name: Sterling 2013 Cellar Club Zinfandel (Calistoga)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This superripe and supersmooth wine packs in extra layers of flavor of boysenberry and anise between stacks of blackberry and ripe strawberry, all while staying supported by fine but firm tannins and vibrant acidity. Very full in body, it is still appetizingly dry, balanced for serving at a special meal, and very rewarding to drink now through 2022.
Name: Renwood 2012 Grand Wren Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This sleek wine carries ripe, complex fruit aromas and delicious cherry and blackberry flavors on a silky-smooth texture, despite high alcohol. There is definitely an exotic touch to the fruit character, and it seems perfectly supported by fine-grained tannins, lip-smacking acidity and good length on the finish. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Renwood 2012 Flutist Sea of Grapes Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A striking and flavorful wine, this bottling shows a little more spicy oak than most of the Renwoods, giving a slightly sweet cinnamon accent to the vivid blackberry and strawberry syrup flavors. The fruit character is powerful and delicious, seemingly seeping out of the wine in all directions. It's dry, full bodied, firm textured and will drink nicely now through 2020.
Name: Renwood 2012 Musician's Jack Rabbit Flat Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this jet-black wine by vintner Carl Bowker is intoxicatingly appealing, with aromas of fresh blackberry jam, plum jelly, black pepper, black cardamom and allspice. It's rich and soft once sipped, unleashing an array of mission figs, black plums and black cherries, and gaining complexity thanks to graphite, black licorice, fudge and expresso.
Name: Caliza 2012 Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: While slightly reserved in aroma, this serious, special-occasion wine comes on steady and strong in flavor. Blueberry and black cherry notes pick up more raspberry and red cherry with each sip. In addition to fruit complexity, it has a full body, sleek texture and lingering finish. Best now through 2020.
Name: Scott Harvey 2012 Vineyard 1869 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: In this high-octane, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine, flavors have a lot of berry notes, but also range towards roasted almonds, black pepper and meaty accents. This distinctive bottling stands a bit apart from most of the Renwood line, perhaps more ripe in style. Best now through 2020.
Name: Renwood 2012 Fiddletown Special Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This has lots of fresh berry aromas, blending raspberry, strawberry and deeper blackberry. Full bodied, it features ripe flavors, velvety mouthfeel and firm tannins. Dry and well balanced, it will make a great dinner wine because of all the palate-cleansing texture. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Renwood 2012 Grandpere Special Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big red offers opulent fruit aromas, like ripe blackberries and strawberries, followed by concentrated fruit flavors interwoven with slightly herbal, meaty accents. Full bodied but not at all coarse, it has a very smooth texture, moderate tannins and mouth-filling richness.
Name: Renwood 2012 Merida Del Part Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This bold and full-bodied wine has fragrant fruit aromas and oodles of berry flavor, plus a firm texture created by ample fine-grained tannins and supportive acidity. What makes it special is how the grippy texture wraps around the opulent blackberry and boysenberry flavors for great balance and a sense that it will age well through 2022.
Name: Renwood 2012 Grandpère Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This sophisticated, dry and affordable wine will shine at mealtime due to its balance between generous fruit flavors and an appetizing, moderately tannic texture. Aromas resemble raspberries and red cherries, while flavors are a bit riper than that. The acidity is lively and the finish lingers.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Packed with juicy berry flavors, this outgoing wine blends great freshness and pure grape flavors with a lip-smacking texture of tannins and acidity that keep it well balanced. It resembles black berry, raspberry and boysenberry juices, has a tangy mouthfeel and lingering, tingly finish.
Name: Paul Dolan 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This has an unusually dark color. Aromas of blackberry jam and maple syrup are followed by equally rich, deep and expressive flavors. The remarkable concentration of ripe berry flavors layered densely with fine tannins is at least partly due to blending in Petite Sirah. It adds up to a full bodied and delicious wine.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is tasty in a ripe, extravagantly fruity way. Raspberry and strawberry aromas seem as sweet as syrup. The full body and alcoholic strength give it a strong texture, but without too much tannic grip. Barbecued ribs or a cheese plate could be great matches.
Name: Four Vines 2012 Maverick Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This pure, focused, fruity wine practically dances on the tongue. Fresh strawberry and ripe raspberry aromas lead to similar lively, fruity flavors that wake up the tastebuds. Brisk acidity and moderate tannins add lift for a balanced, refreshing taste experience.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2013 Scherrer Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This grabs attention quickly, with a dark color and potent jam and brown sugar aromas. Next come dazzling strawberry syrup flavors backed by thick tannins and good acidity. The texture is astringent and tight, but the flavors are so full that they meet the tannins half way. Best now through 2019.
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2012 Whiplash Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Temecula, South Coast, California, US
Description: This patiently aged wine delivers a dynamic and rich nose with aromas of plums, cassis, cola, Dr Pepper, chocolate syrup and well-spiced German chocolate cake. Those ripe elements are tamed on the tart and lively palate that shows sour plum skins alongside star anise, beef blood and dank herbs.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2009 Series Zinfandel (Temecula)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This extroverted wine brims with toasted oak, chocolate and smoke aromas, followed by ripe, jammy fruit flavors. With full body and a velvety texture of soft tannins, it's both smooth and tongue-gripping at the same time.
Name: Andis 2012 The Toy Vineyard Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a full-bodied but easy-drinking wine with ample ripe fruit flavors and attractive accents from oak aging, like vanilla, nutmeg and a touch of brown sugar. It coats the mouth with rich fruitiness and lingers on the finish in a compelling manner.
Name: Mikami Vineyards 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Attractive and easy-drinking, this smells like pomegranate juice and vanilla, and tastes like raspberry jam but without the sweetness. Soft and soothing on the palate, it finishes with a dash of spicy-sweet oak flavor that lingers.
Name: Straight Line 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried strawberries, wild berries, cloves cinnamon and cocoa powder power the nose on this bottling from a vineyard named after a famous composer who once owned the property. There's not much fruit on the palate, just a touch of dried black cherries, but plenty of dried herbs, milk and dark chocolate and mocha-cappuccino flavors. It's a touch hot.
Name: Epoch Estate Wines 2012 Paderewski Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Remarkably strong cinnamon characterizes the nose of this old-vine wine, which also shows red and black cherries, potpourri and gingerbread on the nose. Black raspberries, cranberry-pomegranate juice, dark chocolate, purple flowers, black pepper and cardamom entertain the palate, which also offers decent acidity and grip, but finishes quickly.
Name: Lone Madrone 2012 Martinelli Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The grapes for this wine from regional pioneer Gary Eberle are nearly equally sourced from three vineyards: Steinbeck, Wine-Bush and CoCaVin. The nose is herbal with sagebrush, oregano and thyme, offering just a bit of black plum fruit. The palate is also full of crushed, dried herbs, proving a touch sour and tarry, with cooked strawberry and dried raspberry fruit.
Name: Eberle 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh blackberry and cherry character is packed into this concentrated but rather soft and sweet wine. It has that signature wild berry aroma of the variety, then flavors are rich, the texture broad and the body full.
Name: Rubus 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Full flavored and full bodied, this big, expansive wine oozes ripe and dried fruit character from the aroma to the flavors and finish. It suggests blackberry and strawberry flavors, feels tannic on the palate rather than soft, and carries a bit of warmth.
Name: Philo Ridge 2012 Firebrick Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripeness and richness reign over this full-bodied, almost-sweet wine. Oaky, maple-syrup aromas and lots of black cherry and boysenberry flavors partner with a smooth, posh texture. Think of it almost like a Port, but drier and not quite so high in alcohol.
Name: Zinsane 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried cherries, black slate, brown spice and leather greet the nose on this affordable red from the esteemed regional producer that makes many Zinfandels each vintage. The palate shows black cherries and a plum skin acidity, with some rocky elements providing further intrigue.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Incredible Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Expressive, not expensive, this has an appetizing mixture of spice, herb and smoke aromas, plenty of blackberry and raspberry flavors, and a soothing texture. It smells like black pepper, dried thyme and wood smoke, then turns more fruity in the mouth. It is medium bodied and slightly soft in balance.
Name: Ravenswood 2013 Vintners Blend Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This has a lighter and more mature color than usual, along with lighter and more mature aromas and flavors. After adjusting for the apparent time warp, it's easy to enjoy the alluring aroma of cherries and black tea, and rather light cinnamon and pomegranate flavors.
Name: McFadden 2013 Blue Quail Zinfandel (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Touches of menthol and pine flavors set this wine apart from the crowd, dominating the fruit flavors from the aroma to the finish. It is medium to full bodied, tastes a little earthy and smoky, and is relatively lean in texture.
Name: Frey 2013 Organic Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Earthy, vegetal aromas and equally earthy, peppery flavors make this wine unusually rustic. It does have traces of good aged character, like leather and tea.
Name: Ripken 2011 Under the Sea Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Continuing to preserve this historic vineyard, a rare planting of the variety within the appellation, this is an elegant yet explosive bottling. Blackberry and stone fruit tones are framed by soft, gentle tannins, sprinkled liberally with cardamom. A floral aroma permeates gently refreshing acidity and a finish of dark chocolate.
Name: Williams Selyem 2013 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: At the cooler end of the Dry Creek Valley, this vineyard site provides juicy blackberry fruit accented in leather, tobacco and even black tea, giving it a savory edge. Juicy with soft tannins and mellowed oak, it finishes with a brightness of anise and nutmeg.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 Somers Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Only the second vintage of this vineyard-designate wine from an estate property, this bottling offers spicy cherry, black tea and dried herb, backed by oaky backbone and structure. Dark chocolate and leather play on the palate in subtle waves, hitting their strides on the finish. Cellar through 2020.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 DCV2 Estate Four Clones Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A Zin with 23% Petite Sirah, this wine is seamless. Full bodied and dark, it is complexly layered in tobacco, meaty bacon and game, with a touch of brown sugar. A floral bouquet lurks underneath. Sourced from a vineyard with 100-plus-year-old vines, it finishes dusty and dramatic.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 Beeson Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dry and delicious, this lightly colored rosé opens with a compelling waft of rose water and exudes copper-pink color. A refreshingly searing acidity maintains vibrancy from start to finish, accented in grapefruit. This quaff is great on its own or throughout a meal.
Name: Bodkin 2014 Hotspur Rosé of Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A ripe, brambly Zin with 25% Petite Sirah, this holds a richness of cinnamon, dark chocolate and leather at its core. Sprightly in acidity, it has an elegant sense of restraint, yet offers subtle tannic grip on the finish. Smooth, it'll take on additional nuance through 2020.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 Spencer's Hill Vineyard Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Piquant in allspice, this soft, single-vineyard designate from a property known for Pinot Noir conveys a sense of elegance and subdued tannins, offering plum and red cherry atop shy waves of cedar and sage. A smoky component on the robust finish makes it memorable.
Name: Cellars 33 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a 25-year-old vineyard planted to pre-Prohibition heritage budwood, this wine also holds less than a handful of Petite Sirah. Toasted, smoky and leathery, it offers bright raspberry and blackberry along a thoroughfare of structured, firm tannins and cardamom.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 DCV 7 Estate Wallace Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A generously ripe wine with 8% Petite Sirah, this has a softly layered entry that reveals strong aromas of black olive and plum, before delving headfirst into spicy blackberry cobbler. Complex and smooth, it offers heightened acidity and a richly chocolate finish.
Name: Matrix 2012 Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy in dusty berry cobbler flavor, layered with a touch of spicy dark chocolate, this is a medium-bodied, approachable wine with well-integrated oak and supple tannin. Blackberry and coffee mingle on the finish.
Name: Kunde 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a three-acre vineyard once home to two gold mines, this wine is spicy and brawny in tannin weight, yet also soft and refined. Bright raspberry plays off juicy flavors of brown sugar and vanilla, finishing in a hint of black pepper. The substantive nature of the wine suggests further time in bottle, through 2020.
Name: Armida 2012 Gold Mine Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy ripe blackberry and raspberry form the basis of this brambly, fruit-forward Zin that offers a low output of tannin and oak presence. Refined on the palate, it finishes with a swat of wild licorice and dried herb.
Name: The Federalist 2013 Visionary Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich, tannic and brambly, a juiciness of blackberry jam forms the substantive core of this wine, made in larger quantities for larger distribution. The finish is leathery and well integrated in oak.
Name: Frei Brothers 2013 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A bit dull on the nose, this wine offers smoky, toasty blackberry and bacon around a soft body and short finish, making it fine for casual gatherings and barbecues.
Name: Kunde 2012 Kinneybrook Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: America, US
Description: This wine is meant to capture the American spirit in grapes grown across America. The wine lacks distinct personality, with just a tease of blackberry and spice that's characteristic of the variety, yet in a somewhat reduced, generic way.
Name: Great American Wine Company 2012 Zinfandel (America)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This powerful, rich and complex wine comes from a low-yielding vineyard that produced just 2.5 tons per acre, and the meticulous label even shows the amount of fog days. Deep and jammy aromas of strawberry preserves, cherry pie, brown sugar, hot licorice and smoked meats give way to a sultry palate that shows nuanced layers of berries, black pepper, mace and baking spice.
Name: HammerSky 2010 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is tannic and leathery and yet at the same time austere, revealing its historic vineyard roots. A blend of 75% Zinfandel and 25% Mixed Blacks, the property is thought to have been planted around 1900. Blueberry, earth and cinnamon-cardamom spice combine to beautiful, layered effect, flavors that will meld nicely through 2020.
Name: Ravenswood 2012 Belloni Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Red plum and cherry surround soft, firm tannins, medium acidity and plenty of well-constructed structure, unimpeded by oak. A hint of leather, dried herb and bay leaf accent it well. Although the wine is powerful, it's not overdone, instead offering balance.
Name: Seghesio 2012 Cortina Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 13% Petite Sirah, this wine offers smoky leather and brambly black and red berry around soft, dusty tannins and plenty of structure. Rich and concentrated, it finishes in a blaze of dark chocolate and black pepper.
Name: Rosenblum 2011 Rockpile Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is co-fermented with 12% Petite Sirah, both varieties from one estate block planted to a century-old clone of Teldeschi, a nearby vineyard still in existence. Tart in cherry, red plum and cassis, it's refreshingly unusual and deliciously vibrant. Anise, cinnamon and black pepper round out the finish. The tannins and oak are well-managed and integrated.
Name: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2012 Rogers Schoolhouse Estate Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Exuberantly juicy blackberry and blueberry intermingle in this midweight wine, undeterred by oak. Well-integrated, the tannins make a play on the finish, competing with dusty chocolate and mocha, a dustiness that takes on rocky minerality, recalling this wine's terroir.
Name: Seghesio 2012 Rockpile Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Structured in tight red-fruit character, this wine—from a two-acre, dry-farmed vineyard—is floral and nicely adorned in acidity, making for an elegant take on the variety. It is also not overdone in oak, letting the vibrant black cherry and just-picked blackberry dominate.
Name: Keating 2012 Buchignani Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% Zin from a warm site planted in 1893 and currently owned by the folks behind nearby Bella Winery, this is a broad, bombastic expression of the variety. Near-syrupy in plum and dusty blackberry, it has wafts of rose and anise that give a floral edge, keeping it from going too far. Soft and linear, it'a a wine to be enjoyed slowly, with meaty, hearty food.
Name: Ravenswood 2012 Big River Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy, plummy and dusty, in well-integrated ways, this is a classically earthy old-vine Zin, with plush blueberry and blackberry on the palate that finishes rich in mocha and cinnamon. Medium in body and acidity, it's approachable and enjoyable now.
Name: Seghesio 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: There's a feral element to this vineyard-designate, the producer's only one from Napa Valley, from a vineyard planted originally in 1930. Extracted and thick, it offers plum, blackberry and raspberry around big, broad shoulders of mocha and oak. And as always, there's a hint of mint.
Name: Ravenswood 2012 Dickerson Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy, dusty and juicy, this wine is a mix of black plum and black cherry, supported by whips of anise and bay leaf that give it an herbal element, possibly reflective of the cooler vintage. Medium acidity and firm tannins round out the experience.
Name: Rosenblum 2011 Maggie's Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a magical place in the heart of Sonoma Valley, near several marquee spots for Zin, this estate-grown brawler is high-octane, yet drinkable, a yeasty, brambly expression of tar, leather, meat and black licorice. Only the second vintage from the producer, the wine's weight doesn't overpower its potential, which should develop further in time.
Name: Beltane Ranch 2013 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This Zin speaks to compelling red fruit, plum and vanilla, with light oak presence. It's balanced yet still plenty big, showing off its well-worn roots within an historic vineyard. Before veering into syrupy territory, it pulls back, letting leathery cinnamon and black pepper have their say.
Name: Rosenblum 2011 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the winery's upper-end bottlings, this shows strawberries, dried fennel stalks and an earthy minerality on the nose. The flavors prove a bit cooked, with stewed berries, char, dark tobacco, dark chocolate and black pepper.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Vortex Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Muted on the nose, this soft wine co-fermented with 9% Petite Sirah offers rich red cherry, blackberry and layers of clove and lavender. Lush, it finishes in firm tannins and oak.
Name: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2012 Estate Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A well-priced, higher production Zin with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Syrah, Malbec and Alicante Bouschet, this features plenty of ripe black and red berry fruit leveled by restrained, dusty tannins. Smooth and well crafted, it makes for a good house wine.
Name: Sebastiani 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in large quantities, this is juicy and complex, offering soft, leathery layers of mocha and blackberry, with plenty of oomph and body to please a variety of palates. Approachable and easy to enjoy, the tannins are firm and the finish brief.
Name: Seghesio 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A combination of 76% Zinfandel and 24% Petite Sirah, this vineyard's lineage traces back in stages. The core six acres of Zinfandel was planted before 1892, the other acreage much more recently. Still, the wine retains an old soul of leather, tobacco and baking spice, wrapped around a ham-fisted swath of toasted oak.
Name: Ravenswood 2012 Barricia Single Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Muted on the nose, this is a spicy, somewhat austere wine, shy in red berry fruit and soft tannins. From a 1,500-foot elevation vineyard, it lacks the power of some of its competitors, yet offers a balanced, less in-your-face take on the variety.
Name: Keating 2012 Montecillo Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The stylish label puts this in the “bro” wine category, yet it's quite a good get for the price. Light aromas of crushed cherry candies, charred wood and fresh chopped mint drop into a palate laden with cherries and menthol. It's a nice, easy and not overpowering wine.
Name: Chillhouse 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Leathery, brambly blackberry flavors and aromas arrive with a bang in this bold, generous wine. Mouthcoating in smooth, vanilla-tinged tannins and reasonable oak, it's slightly sweet in a berry cobbler way, with a hit of smoke on the finish. Small amounts of Syrah and Petite Sirah are included.
Name: Bradford Mountain 2012 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: American oak stands out on the nose, before this wine offers bright red raspberry, blackberry and an unexpected crispness. A follow-up of orange peel and clove confuses in pleasant ways, before the finish repeats the oak. Still young, this wine will benefit from airing.
Name: Ca' Momi 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of bloody meats mix with violets and purple berries on this wine from Paso's Zin masters. The flavors are a little watery at first, but show blackberry juice, tobacco and espresso. A little patience reveals a rather compelling wine.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Westside Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of blueberries, beef roast and fudge give way to a light, straightforward palate of purple fruit. It's a clean wine, but not very complex.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Especial Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Jammy and ripe, this is a concentrated, extracted wine rich in blackberry and plum. Approachable, it offers a kick of heat and black pepper on the finish.
Name: Truett Hurst 2012 Red Rooster Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy in a slightly overripe way, this sweet, plummy and jammy wine is soft and supple in broad tannins. On the finish, a combination of smoke and vanilla make their point.
Name: Deering 2011 Maus Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Medium in weight, acidity and tannin, this conveys juicy blackberry and plum, but not much else to mark it as varietal. Muddled, it ends bittersweet.
Name: Madrigal 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blackberry jam and blueberry cobbler find common ground in this ripe, extracted wine, with a leathery exterior and a taste of dark chocolate. Medium bodied and not terribly high in acidity, it's approachable and enjoyable now.
Name: WillowBrook Cellars 2012 Pagnano Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A rare, 100% Primitivo, this offers savory leather, cherry-berry cobbler and vanilla, with a yeasty nose of baked bread and graham cracker. Midway through, the wine falls apart, revealing the unmistakable heat of high alcohol.
Name: DeLorimier 2012 River Lane Primitivo (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Vanilla and marshmallow cream announced themselves on the nose before continuing their assault on the palate, along with a sweetness of blackberry jam. An addition of mint further upsets balance.
Name: Napa Cellars 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Interplanted to Carignane, Alicante Bouschet and Grand Noir, this Zin vineyard hails back to 1895, a grande dame in the region, and is farmed by Ulises Valdez. The meticulous farming and winemaking are in full view, the wine velvety in blueberry and boysenberry fruit, while well-honed tannins and a full body announce its presence. On the finish is a satisfying streak of black licorice and pepper. Cellar through 2022.
Name: Carlisle 2012 Saitone Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big and robust, it is full bodied but also has lots of personality. It smells like blackberries and ripe plums, and tastes rich, ripe and and a bit hot. Memorable wild sage and wood smoke notes linger on the finish. Firm tannins and acidity shape all the elements in an appetizing way.
Name: Bella 2012 Trot and Follow Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A classic of the genre, this combines a deep color with luscious fruit character and spicy accents on a velvety texture. Firm tannins lend an appetizing grip, while the fresh ripe blackberry, clove and cedar flavors seem to melt on the tongue and linger on the finish. It shows great complexity and balance in a traditional dry style.
Name: Rosenblum 2011 Carla's Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A deep, dark color, unusually ripe and exotic aromas, and intense flavors recalling boysenberry syrup make this a monster Zin. It's not very tannic or astringent, but the body is so rich and the alcohol relatively high that it oozes power and concentration. This will be great after a meal with cheese or chocolate.
Name: Bella 2012 Block 10 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a sophisticated and ultrasmooth wine. A spicy, almost sweet aroma of classy oak leads to rich strawberry and plum flavors that glide lightly on the supple texture, which has just enough tannin and acidity to keep the wine well balanced.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2012 Jack Rabbit Flat Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's hard to ignore the high alcohol listing, but the wine is so well balanced and cohesive that few would even notice. It's aromatic with notes of dried and fresh cranberries and raspberries. The palate is full bodied and rich with concentrated, pure fruit flavors.
Name: Two Vintners 2012 StoneTree Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a widely available and excellent wine for the price, with aromas of fresh strawberries, black rocks and gamy meats showing on the wondrously blended nose. Flavors are deep yet balanced, with black cherries, plum skins and licorice culminating in a spearmint, pine and eucalyptus finish.
Name: Sextant 2012 Wheelhouse Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a savory wine from the valley where California's wine industry started before housing developments took over. Aromas of roasted pork, black cherry, blackberry and wild mint lure the nose. The palate delivers welcoming, broad notes of violet, more dark purple fruit, some peppercorns and a gamy finish.
Name: Martin Ranch 2012 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Elegant and firm-textured, this tastes like it comes from a cool climate, bringing a nervy structure of acidity and tannins to support the dark fruit flavors, clove and black pepper. This will be great at dinner due to its balance and grip.
Name: Bella 2012 Barrel 32 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Velvety on the palate, this wine initially conveys a sense of restraint. A shy line of cool-climate raspberry and strawberry are made brighter on the palate by zesty acidity. Begging for grilled meats, it becomes more substantial over time, offering leather and savory spice.
Name: Armida 2012 Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This storied site was planted originally in 1895 to Zin, Alicante Bouschet, Grande Noir, Carignane and Petite Sirah. The wine offers an exotic spice element supported by blueberry, boysenberry, blackberry and an herbal, buoyant acidity. A wonderful mouthfeel keeps things sumptuous on the palate, and the wine will age through 2022–2025
Name: Carlisle 2012 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This comes from the producer's home vineyard site, planted originally in 1927 to a cacophony of varieties, most of which the winemaker himself is now able to identify. Subtle smoke and baked red berry and blackberry come to the fore on the nose and palate, muted at first, with an accent of orange, before building power and steam on the finish.
Name: Carlisle 2012 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is most notable—and worth seeking out to impress friends—because it hails from a Santa Cruz Mountain vineyard that was first planted in 1922. The old-vine aromas are remarkably fresh, with black cherry juice, anise, sage and a warm leather. There's a lot of zing on the palate, with flavors of blackberry, mint and black slate.
Name: Birichino 2013 Saint Georges Old Vines Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy in red berry and brown sugar, this is a leathery wine with large tannins that will benefit with time. It is medium bodied and savory-sweet, having spent 18 months in 50% new American oak. Give it a decant or let it lie in the cellar through 2020–2022.
Name: Mill Creek 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coming from one of the appellation's most consistent producers, this offers a tight, restrained nose of blackberry and licorice. It's also tight and bright on the palate, with refreshing flavors of black cherries and crushed rocks. An expert balance of tannins and acidity gives the mouth a clean wash.
Name: Lone Madrone 2011 Bailey Ranch Dry Farmed Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
