Description: This vineyard near the confluence of the Salinas and Carmel valleys is producing strong wines, in this case one offering aromas of roasted game, smoked blueberries and cracked slate. It's juicy but not jammy on the palate, showing a pleasant, bright blend of blackberry and cherry fruits.
Name: Mesa Del Sol 2010 Zinfandel (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There is an insane amount of power in this wine, sourced from the mighty Bedrock, where the Zin is interplanted with Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet. Blueberry, candied orange and rosemary complement one another, while a dustiness and minerality play tricks on the tongue, testifying about the vineyard's rocky soils.
Name: Carlisle 2012 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a famed old site planted to 75% Zinfandel and 25% mixed black-skinned varieties, this wine conveys a minty-eucalyptus quality that tunes the acidity high against a medium-weight body. Austere at first on the palate, it expands as it goes, offering robust, dry tannins and layers of cardamom and coffee with time and air.
Name: Ravenswood 2012 Old Hill Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rich sense of earth emerges on this Riboli family wine, with blueberry fruit, leather and roasted beef complementing the loamy character. The palate walks a balanced line between ripe olallieberry fruit and graphite minerality.
Name: Opaque 2013 Quarry Heights Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is quietly concentrated, complex, sleek in texture and inviting to drink. It smells like ripe boysenberries and cherries, and tastes generous and broad without being too full bodied. It finishes with more fruit notes and a hint of sunbaked earth.
Name: Ironstone 2012 Rous Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A new vineyard source for the producer, this was planted in 1910 to a mix of Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Peloursin and Trousseau. The wine shows a zestiness to the palate and fruit, a mix of pomegranate, raspberry and plum, side-kicked by dusty mocha. Bright in acidity with a chalky finish, the wine can be enjoyed now with a decant or cellared through 2022.
Name: Carlisle 2012 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Zin fans should pick up this winery's entire range of small-batch takes on the grape, as they are all fascinating. This one is lighter in color and offers fresh blackberry and chopped black-sage aromas. The palate is very easy to sip, with salt and cherry flavors creating a food-friendly version of an often overpowering grape.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Clevenger Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, this wine offers aromas of vanilla, cocoa, tobacco leaf, spice and red fruit. On the palate, it shows a pleasing mixture of fruit and barrel flavors.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2012 Howling Wolfe Reserve Zinfandel (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very fruity and fresh but also smooth and supple, this full-bodied wine smells like ripe raspberries. Likewise, tastes recall raspberries and red cherries. and feel firm and grippy enough to counterbalance the ripeness and body. It's a very sleek but very big mouthful.
Name: Renwood 2012 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The site was planted in 1934 to mostly Zinfandel, and not much in the way of Mixed Blacks, which was unusual for the time. This wine is somewhat sanguine, a concoction of red berries, baked strawberries and plum that's soft and weighty, with a streak of elegance. Almost ripped out for Pinot Noir, the vineyard holds on, thanks to this producer and a handful of others. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Carlisle 2012 Papera Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smooth and soft, this smells like raspberries and wild blackberries, feels plush on the palate and tastes true to type. It's on the verge of sweetness due presumably to very ripe grapes and maybe aging in new oak barrels.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a little dark red fruit on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, but the aromas are dominated by herbs, from chopped rosemary to clipped thyme. The palate shows blackberry at first, then comes licorice, gaminess and graphite, making for a nicely complex wine.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A spicy character suggesting white and black pepper ties in with a firm texture and gripping tannins that add welcome astringency to this medium-bodied, distinctive red. Dry and well balanced, it tastes like blackberries, black olives and a touch of sage.
Name: Drytown 2011 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep red fruit aromas lay across nicely rounded cedar, applewood and milk chocolate notes. The fairly tannic palate is more about texture than flavor, with tension linking blueberry ripeness to plum-skin tartness. Still very firm in structure, this will open up in 2017 or so.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Mustard Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Temptingly ripe aromas and flavors make this a very generous wine. It also has some complexity due to a slight earthy, savory accent in the aroma that returns on the finish. Medium to full bodied, it will pair well with robust, meaty dishes and will be perfect for sipping after a meal.
Name: Cameron Hughes 2012 Lot 464 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a lush and powerful wine from a vineyard in the recently designated Paso Highlands district. Aromas suggest gingerbread topped with kirsch-soaked, chocolate-covered cherries. The palate is thick and heavy, with mocha, stewed plums, mashed cherries and black earth, which gain complexity from tannins and pencil lead.
Name: Tobin James 2011 French Camp Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The grape's brooding character is intensified in this old-vine bottling, with deep, brandy-like aromas of kirsch, cocoa syrup and spearmint. Tannins frame the heavy-duty palate profile, with extracted cherry, cola and vanilla flavorings decorating a firm, balancing structure.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2010 Old VIne Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smooth, ripe and almost sweet, this is medium to full bodied, packed full of fruit flavors and other complexity that makes it interesting. It balances toward softness as the berry and cherry character seems to swell on the palate and linger on the finish.
Name: The Dancing Fox 2012 Rumpelstiltzin Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boosted with 4% Tempranillo, 3% Petite Sirah and 3% Tannat, this Zin comes from a 100-year-old Mendocino clone, and shows ripe strawberry syrup, campfire smoke and anise on the nose. The palate is dominated by smoke, with just touch of red fruits, tannins and tartness keeping it lively.
Name: Bridlewood 2012 Zinfandel (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hailing from the recently designated Paso Highlands subappellation, this hearty wine shows earthy aromas of nutmeg, iron, hot rocks, loam and cherry extract. It's lush and ripe with cassis and black cherry fruit, yet shows a more elegant chalkiness on the palate as well, rounded out by cocoa powder.
Name: Tobin James 2012 French Camp Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A field-inspired blend of 80% Zinfandel with 12% Carignane and 12% Petite Sirah, this wine holds red jammy fruit at its core. Medium to full-bodied in weight, it has fine tannins that give silkiness to offset the wine's sizable power.
Name: Ravenswood 2012 Teldeschi Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This rich, thick, concentrated wine offers big aromas, a velvety, tannic texture and ripe fruit flavors reminiscent of dried plums and blackberries. Full bodied, it shows a lot of oak influence in the strong vanilla and maple syrup aromas, as well as in the flavors.
Name: Boneshaker 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big in flavor and ripeness, this full-bodied wine tastes concentrated and feels lush, almost soft. It smells like boysenberry jam, tastes like dried cherries and dried plums and has a streak of raspberry that lifts it a bit.
Name: Chacewater 2012 Organically Grown Grapes Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Softly layered red and black berries belie this wine's concentration and force, which is substantial, a backing of powerful leathery tannins at its core. On the nose, there's black peppercorn and an herbal element.
Name: Graton Ridge 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This straightforward wine from the Riboli family portfolio goes down very easy, making it perfect for backyard barbecues. Cherries, dried rose petals and anise greet the nose. The palate isn't too complex, but delivers dark red fruits and pepper spices.
Name: Maddalena 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This smells oaky and tastes ripe and pure, like crushed blackberries and raspberries. It feels plush and smooth in the mouth, finishing on the soft side. While medium bodied, it has just a touch of tannin to balance the ripeness and make it appetizing to drink.
Name: Manifesto! 2012 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Oodles of black cherry and boysenberry fill the aromas and flavors of this bold but not-too-big wine. The rich, ripe fruit shows right away in the nose, and continues on the palate but gets reined in a bit (in a good way) by a firm texture created by good acidity and tannins.
Name: Drytown 2012 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With all of the fruit hailing from Zephyr Ridge Vineyard, this wine is lighter in color, with suggestions of ash, cigar box, vanilla, coffee and red fruit. It's soft in feel, flavorful yet still quite deft. Good acidity backs it all up, finishing warm.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2012 Howling Wolfe Zinfandel (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lighter in color than many other bottlings, this shows cherry and pepper spice on a somewhat reserved nose. But that light color unleashes a lush and ripe palate, with red berries, nutmeg and game flavors showing most prominently.
Name: League of Rogues 2012 Rapscallion Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This tastes honest, clean and direct, with a nice mixture of fruity, woody and savory herbal aromas and flavors. It's medium in body and offers just a touch of tannin to add a little grip to the texture. A tasty raspberry note gives it even more personality.
Name: McManis 2013 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this well-priced wine of mostly Paso Robles fruit is initially hidden, but patience reveals mossy forest-floor notes alongside charred, crushed herbs. The palate also leans more toward savory than ripe fruit, with oregano and thyme most prevalent, although quite restrained altogether.
Name: Coastline 2013 Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: IFragrant with sweet vanilla and nutmeg from new oak, this has a very full body and velvety texture. All that oak somewhat masks the fruit aromas and flavors, so this may be too extreme for purists.
Name: Klinker Brick 2012 Marisa Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas jump between ripe plum and a dark earthy character, from graphite to wet slate. There is a quite a lot of zing on the palate, perhaps even a touch of carbonation, with flavors of cola and sassafras settling on a blackberry-juice backbone.
Name: Alma Sol 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Even by past standards, this new vintage of Sineann's Old Vine Zin is spectacular, with ripe, jammy, concentrated fruit flavors of fig, black cherry and purple plum. The balance among the fruit, acidity, tannin and alcohol is spot-on, without blowing away the more subtle compexity of the old vine fruit.
Name: Sineann 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an exceptional Zinfandel from a renowned site, as famous for Pinot Noir and Chardonnay as it has now become for Zin. Heady aromas of raspberry, blackberry and boysenberry tease before coming to life on the palate, accented by a delightful complement of allspice and juicy acidity. Medium bodied, it's incredibly easy to enjoy and rich in all the right ways.
Name: Williams Selyem 2012 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This gorgeous Zinfandel comes from a vineyard on Bradford Mountain at 1,000 feet elevation, with the vines planted in red, volcanic soils. The palate explodes in juicy plum flavor, with a silky, velvety texture and satisfying cinnamon and pepper spice that plays off the fruit. It's a structured and fresh selection.
Name: Gary Farrell 2012 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sourced from a dry-farmed, 40-year-old vineyard, this Zin offers aromas of red brick, cherry syrup, licorice, black sage, shaved nutmeg and nose-tickling baking spices. The grippy palate is driven by sagebrush and chemise, with ample amounts of pepper and spice giving nuance to the ripe blackberry fruit.
Name: Lone Madrone 2011 Sheep Camp Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's something special about this Zin, given a handful of Petite Sirah for aromatic depth. It opens with supple, high-toned raspberry and cherry before delving into a layering of dusty, cinnamon spice. Juicy, alive and fresh, it delivers a cherry-vanilla finish.
Name: Kokomo 2012 Timber Crest Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Saitone is a supremely historic vineyard, planted originally in 1895 in the thick of the Russian River Valley's Olivet Bench, a coveted spot these days for Pinot Noir. The wine offers supple, soft tannins around a juicy intensity of grenadine and berry crumble. The structured backbone of minerality is remarkable.
Name: De Loach 2012 Saitone Vineyard Olivet Bench Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: From a recently planted site on the Oregon side of the Columbia Gorge, this combines tangy, raspberry fruit concentration with elegance. Spicy and vertically stacked with flavors, it moves from brambly, peppery fruits into a long finish with highlights of cinnamon and spice. The vine cuttings are from Lonnie Wright's original (1893) planting.
Name: Heart Catcher 2012 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a vineyard holding in the midst of prime Pinot Noir country, Maffei intrigues in ripe, hearty plum, black cherry and kir aromas and flavors. The tannins are soft and nicely managed, accented by notes of nutmeg and black pepper.
Name: Gary Farrell 2012 Maffei Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This big but well-behaved wine brings out the pure deliciousness of the grapes. It smells perfectly ripe without being sweet or jammy, feels very elegant and rich, and tastes like blackberry-boysenberry juice. It's just tannic enough for balance, and the polished fruitiness continues through the finish.
Name: Cline 2012 Big Break Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The winery's smaller Zin projects are fantastic, and this is a great example, with aromas of strawberry extract mingling with mint, anise and leather. The palate is even more savory, with mushrooms, olives and herb-crusted roast beef, benefiting from ripe plum fruit as well.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Snow Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Gamy and somewhat sanguine, this fleshy, soft and evolving Zinfandel from a Napa Cab producer shows off Napa's worthiness as a place for Zin, both in terms of grape growing and winemaking. Plum jam and cinnamon play off one another with ease, combining in full force on the finish.
Name: Hunnicutt 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, balanced wine opens elegantly in the glass, revealing red berry and spice around a core of soft, layered tannins and restrained oak. On the finish a remarkable sprinkling of black pepper lingers playfully on the tongue.
Name: De Loach 2012 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: This 100% estate-grown field blend of Zinfandel and Petite Sirah made in microscopic quantities impresses in every way. Smoky dust hits the nose first, before ushering in soft layers of juicy, lush blackberry, savory pepper and herb. Balanced and delicious, it's a worthwhile find from Rutherford, land of Cab.
Name: McGah Family 2012 McGah Family Vineyards Scarlett Zinfandel (Rutherford)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: This 100% estate-grown field blend of Zinfandel and Petite Sirah made in microscopic quantities impresses in every way. Smoky dust hits the nose first, before ushering in soft layers of juicy, lush blackberry, savory pepper and herb. Balanced and delicious, it's a worthwhile find from Rutherford, land of Cab.
Name: McGah Family 2012 McGah Family Vineyards Scarlett Zinfandel (Rutherford)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The producer does nice things with this 100% Primitivo, coaxing attractive, chewy liqueur-like red fruit from the grapes before aging them in French oak, just a third of the barrels new. The woody tones are well integrated, and the wine boasts a smooth texture and subtle power.
Name: Hendry 2012 Block 24 Primitivo (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With opulent ripe fruit flavors and plenty of tannin and acidity to back them, this is a complete, balanced and appetizing wine. It smells like blackberry with smoky, meaty accents, tastes rich and full of berries, and feels firm and tangy on the palate. It should improve through 2017.
Name: Easton 2013 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Coppola has swung for the fences and cleared them with this charming Zinfandel, blended with 20% Petite Sirah. Brown sugar, clove and nutmeg give warmth and depth to the juicy red and black berry flavors. Succulent and supple, the finish completes the picture, adding a sprinkling of black pepper to the mix.
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 2012 Director's Cut Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dusty soft tannins envelope mouthwatering flavors of grandmother's berry pie all within a brambly, brawny package of full-bodied weight and texture that manages to seem elegant on the palate. The juicy concentrated fruit-forward flavor lasts through the long finish.
Name: St. Francis 2012 My Father's Vineyard Old Vines Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This combines freshness with concentration and great structure. With a deep, dark color and aromas like cranberry and red cherry accented by hints of rosemary and thyme, it tastes deep, juicy and ripe, and feels vibrant and handsomely tannic.
Name: Bonterra 2012 Made With Organic Grapes Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Big, ripe and fruity, this high-concentration wine made from old vines went a year longer in barrel than most. It smells like dried cherries and rhubarb-strawberry pie, tastes equally ripe and feels full bodied and a bit hot. But it's so enthusiastic that it's a kick to drink.
Name: Graziano 2011 Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From two wonderful Zin vineyards in the Sonoma Valley, Bedrock and Casa Santinamaria, this producer coaxes out spicy, dusty cinnamon and structured blackberry, the oak subtle yet present. With  tannins managed and a firm structure holding things up, the finish shows a subtle hint of herb.
Name: Bridges 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Most of the grapes were sourced from the southwest-facing side of the Mayacamas, not far from Monte Rosso, where the variety has found a powerful, historic home. Bacon and maple syrup hit the nose and palate immediately, with a juicy undercurrent of blackberry and blueberry adorned in clove.  Full-bodied, the finish is smoky in espresso.
Name: B.R. Cohn 2011 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a characteristic funk on many unfiltered bottlings from this winery, and it works for this wine. Tangy, fermenting plum aromas give backbone to scents of purple fruit and black pepper. The intriguing flavors center on red cherry fruit, but carry oregano, parsley and Camembert cheese elements as well.
Name: Wild Coyote 2012 Red Tail Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This older wine displays an intriguing mix of baking spices, chocolate-covered cola cherry and menthol, combining nicely on the palate in juicy, fruit-forward waves. With a small amount of winery-identified Durif, it holds together through the peppery finish.
Name: Wellington 2009 Meeks Hilltop Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a different beast from most other Zins, shy and intriguing in tight, dusty, high-toned raspberry and cassis, the spicy components leaning toward exotic cardamom and nutmeg. From a vineyard originally planted in 1925, holding on for dear life in the Russian River Valley's sea of Pinot Noir, it's a rare and worthy find for the table.
Name: River Road 2012 Boschetti Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A smidgen of Petite Sirah is added to 98% Zinfandel from a coveted vineyard in the heart of Dry Creek Valley. It takes on perfumed red cherry and is finely hewn on the palate, soft and yet tense. Cinnamon and pepper swirl throughout, becoming more pronounced and integrated in the glass.
Name: Rock Wall 2012 Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This opens with herbaceous dollops of thyme and fresh-dug earth and evolves slowly in the glass, revealing juicy black plum and berry. Medium in weight and density, it's soft and leathery, with a lengthy, supple finish.
Name: Hendry 2012 Blocks 7 & 22 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This Zinfandel from the eastern section of Napa Valley is unexpectedly structured and bright in acidity, offering notes of strawberry and cinnamon. The acidity provides a kick to the finish, awash in memorable sprinkles of white pepper.
Name: Houdini 2011 Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A classic, old-style field blend best identified as Zinfandel, this heady red opens with perfumed baking spice and a tinge of black licorice. Soft, integrated tannins make it juicy and approachable in red and black berry, with robust but not distracting oaky tones.
Name: J. Rickards 2011 1908 Brignole Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: From a vineyard originally planted in 1922 to what is thought to be 100% Zinfandel, this wine brims with notes of yeasty baked bread, leather and high-toned raspberry and boysenberry. Layered and supported by oak, the medium-bodied weight supports a long finish.
Name: Benessere 2012 Collins Holystone Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is full of personality, with a vivid herbaceous aroma, and savory, herbal accents surrounding the raspberry and cranberry flavors. The balance is great, with firm tannins and fresh acidity. Flavors are tasty, unconventional and memorable.
Name: Fields Family 2012 Sherman Family Vineyards Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, strongly flavored and firmly structured wine can tackle the juiciest cuts of meat. It smells like blackberries, black pepper and a little wood smoke, tastes rich with ripe fruit and feels somewhat astringent, in a good way.
Name: Edmeades 2012 Shamrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A bright character comes through in this full-bodied wine. A distinctive fruit component reminiscent of strawberry and rhubarb comes with savory herbal accents that unfold on the palate and on the finish. Firm tannins and good acidity keep it balanced.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Tehama County, California Other, California, US
Description: Brawny and tasty at the same time, this combines oak, vanilla and cherry aromas with very full body, ripe and broad boysenberry flavors and firm tannins. A slightly hot finish echoes the spicy oak notes. The texture is firm and tannic, making it a good counterpoint to rich food.
Name: Cline 2012 Meadowbrook Ranch Zinfandel (Tehama County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh scents of clove-spiced cherries emerge from this wine by the label founded in 1994 by Joe (who died in 1998) and Shirlene Barton, whose son Joe Jr. now oversees operations. It's not particularly complicated on the palate, but that doesn't stop it from being quite tasty, with ripe red fruit and lush black licorice flavors.
Name: Grey Wolf Cellars 2012 The Jackal Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Balanced for dinner-time drinking, this lively and concentrated wine has fresh fruit flavors, moderate tannins and good acidity. Raspberry and blackberry notes blend with hints of smoke and black pepper to keep it interesting on the lingering finish.
Name: Paul Dolan 2012 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A soulful wine, this has an attractive leesy, earthy aroma that complements the mellow plum and raspberry flavors. It feels rounded and velvety, showing moderate tannins and good acidity. It makes a nice change from the all-fruit-all-the-time school of winemaking.
Name: Andis 2011 Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft, approachable tannins frame the red berry exuberance that marks this Zin, a medium-bodied expression of enjoyable vanilla and cinnamon swirls. The power in the wine is sizable yet well-managed.
Name: Buena Vista 2012 Arpad's Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This lively, medium-bodied red feels light on its feet due to deft oaky, smoky aromas, fresh acidity and vibrant tannins. Flavors recall raspberry and red cherry, and the texture is tangy and firm. Made like the Lodi Native wines but with 20% new oak.
Name: Fields Family 2012 Old Vine The Century Block Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With a touch of maple syrup in the fruity aromas, and rich, generous flavors, this full-bodied wine is lush, drenched with blackberry and boysenberry notes. Mild, oaky accents from the aroma linger on the finish.
Name: Edmeades 2012 Perli Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This producer always does a nice job with Zinfandel and this is no exception, a fairly-priced offering of fresh-picked blackberry, red berry and blueberry. Sanguine and leathery in the background, it's balanced, too, with a finish of black pepper.
Name: Quivira 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This big-bodied Zinfandel intrigues with a commingling of rustic charm and brawny California ripeness. The power and concentration of lush blackberry and plum are accessorized by dusty leather and dried herb, with a finishing touch of black pepper.
Name: Buena Vista 2012 Attila's Selection Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This value-priced wine is a steal of a deal, layered enthusiastically in smoky bacon and soft, lavender-wrapped tannins and oak. Medium bodied, it'll satisfy as both a quaffer and a food-friendly wine, matching smoky meat against its smoky profile.
Name: Plungerhead 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Powerfully brambly this gigantic wine hails from a monumental vineyard that consistently delivers fine-tuned tension between structure and intensity. Sizable tannins surround a soft mouthfeel of plum, leather and black pepper, the concentration suggesting aging through 2020.
Name: Louis M. Martini 2012 Gnarly Vine Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The size of this wine distracts slightly from its thick, concentrated dark plum and blackberry brambly quality, the tannins soft and the oak able to stand behind the fruit. A syrupy, leathery and mocha finish seals the deal.
Name: St. Francis 2012 Three Valleys Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: In need of a heaping plate of smokey, grilled meat, this Zin is generous in terms of ripeness, with 14% Petite Sirah adding color and depth. Stewy plum and a taste of raisin bread come to the fore amidst a background of leather and soft, robust blackberry.
Name: St. Francis 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This structured, bright 100% Zinfandel features heaps of high-toned red berry and baking cinnamon. Medium in weight, it's a food-friendly wine that offers the variety's classic juiciness without its sometimes overbearing hits of smoky oak.
Name: Pangloss Cellars 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With a light red color, tantalizing oak and raspberry aromas, bright cherry flavors and a firm texture, this wine discloses a lighter, leaner style than many. It could match with salmon as well as meat, pasta and poultry.
Name: Edmeades 2012 Piffero Vineyard Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Red dusty berry cobbler marks the entry to this estate wine co-fermented with 2% Petite Sirah. Milk chocolate, nutmeg and clove play supporting roles in this otherwise bright, food-friendly wine with measured oak impact.
Name: Grgich Hills 2011 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The producer sources from older plantings of both Zin and Petite Sirah, of which there is 5% in this wine. Given more than a year in American oak, it's velvety on the palate with brown sugar, oak and high-toned raspberry, easily enjoyable on its own or on the table.
Name: Markham 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Bold and ripe, this tastes almost sweet due to the aroma and flavor of cherries and vanilla. It is full-bodied, fat in texture and carries heat on the finish. It matured in 40% new oak barrels.
Name: Edmeades 2012 Gianoli Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from both Dry Creek and Alexander valleys, this 93% Zinfandel with 7% Petite Sirah shows a hearty and robust take on the grapes, minty and oaky with a strawberry-cherry edge to the fruit. Soft and approachable despite its size, it finishes with a hit of coffee mocha.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2011 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Weighty tannins amp up this Zin, a brawny brawler that's leathery and dense in concentrated red fruit. Puckering on the palate at first sip, the wine needs to open over time, throttling back to reveal allspice and smoke.
Name: Muscardini 2012 Los Chamizal Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A smaller-production offering from Gallo, this 100% Zinfandel sourced from four distinct ranches offers cranberry and campfire. Soft and leathery, it's a robust, brambly expression of the variety that's pleasing and well-crafted.
Name: Gallo Signature Series 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Uncomplicated yet tasty, this medium-bodied, mild-textured wine has a pure raspberry/strawberry character from the bright aroma to the ripe flavors to the lingering finish. The balance is on the soft side due to low acidity and little astringency from tannins.
Name: Navarro 2012 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is huge, brawny Zin, given some parameters through its 15 months in oak, the vast majority of which was French and new. Behind the power lies a slight elegance, with a taste of tar and bittersweet chocolate that lingers on.
Name: Hendry 2012 Block 28 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Herbaceous and earthy, this playfully ponders the juicy delights of soft, red raspberry and black cherry, the wine somewhat silky on the tongue. It finishes consistently and bright in acidity.
Name: Buena Vista 2012 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This has bright raspberry and almost-sweet blackberry flavors, full body, moderate tannins and a long warm finish. It tastes polished, soft and satiny smooth.
Name: Cline 2012 Live Oak Vineyards Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coming in an odd tear-drop-shaped bottle with a removable cork cap sealed in wax, this smells a bit hot, with blackberry and dark spice aromas. The palate is framed by big tannins and very strong acidity, offering elderberry flavors.
Name: Wild Coyote 2013 Little Fawn Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A deep, deep color, lots of spicy, smoky oak aromas and rich, almost sweet flavors add up to a bold barbecue sauce of a wine. Those who love lots of spice, loads of smooth tannins and very full body will be happy.
Name: Klinker Brick 2012 Old Ghost Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This robust Zin is meaty in Italian sausage aromas, with streaks of cedar and dark plum intertwined throughout. Balanced in terms of acidity and weight, it finishes in a generous helping of leathery tannins and oak.
Name: Rock Wall 2012 Julie's Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A healthy dose of Petite Sirah toughens this Zin, sourced from a benchland vineyard in the heart of the Dry Creek Valley. The wine opens with aromas of cinnamon bark and cranberry, a tugging mushroomy element standing by. Subtle notes of black pepper come into play on the finish.
Name: Sebastiani 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Easygoing and juicy, this features classic notes of wild blackberry, pepper and leathery oak that's medium- to full-bodied. Spicy nutmeg and pepper compete for attention on the finish.
Name: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2012 Redemption Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An assertive if not aggressive wine, it smells like smoke and charred wood, tastes like espresso dosed with raspberry syrup, and feels tannic, oaky and astringent. Full bodied and ripe at its core, the oak characteristics effectively take over.
Name: Andis 2012 Amador Zinfandel Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Soft, smooth and noticeably sweet, this is an easygoing, rich-textured wine with very light strawberry and raspberry flavors from the ripeness. It's very low in acidity and tannin.
Name: Renwood 2012 California Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Both tart and tannic, it's unusually tight in personality, with a mouth-puckering texture, sharp fruit flavors and astringent finish. While there are too many soft and overripe Zins, this one goes pretty far the other way.
Name: Witching Stick 2012 Fashauer Vineyard Zinfandel (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with bush-trained vines that give very low yields, this delivers concentrated flavors of spiced plum, ripe blackberry, nutmeg, orange peel and black pepper. It's vibrant, smooth and balanced with firm, velvety tannins. The lingering finish closes on a licorice note.
Name: Varvaglione Vigne & Vini 2012 Papale  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of blackberry jam, candied cherry, cake spice and graphite waft out of the glass. The thick palate delivers spicy plum, crushed black cherry, chocolate, clove and mint alongside velvety tannins. It's not very complex but it's seductively smooth and delicious.
Name: Produttori Vini Manduria 2011 Elegia Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from 40-year-old, bush-trained vines, this opens with earthy aromas of charred earth, smoke, grilled sage and black spice. The concentrated but elegant palate delivers mature blackberry, dried black cherry, allspice and pipe tobacco alongside velvety tannins.
Name: Cantine Paolo Leo 2012  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bold and full bodied, this offers aromas of steeped plum, prune, clove and blue flower. The concentrated, savory palate doles out mature blackberry, raisin, clove and licorice. Big but velvety tannins and just enough freshness give this a surprisingly drinkable quality that belies its heft.
Name: Amastuola 2011 Centosassi Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: The nose is rather shy but reveals ripe black fruit, plum cake and baking spice. The densely concentrated palate doles out mature blackberry, crushed raspberry, allspice and licorice alongside smooth, velvety tannins. There's also the heat of alcohol.
Name: Futura 14 2012 Raccontami  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of underbrush, leather, black-skinned fruit and tobacco lead the nose. The firm, structured palate offers mature blackberry, black cherry, coffee bean and licorice alongside a tannic backbone. It closes on a mineral note.
Name: Ognissole 2012 Essentia Loci  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tobacco, mature plum, espresso and toast aromas lead the nose. The round, full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, mature blackberry, licorice, black pepper and toasted oak alongside velvety tannins.
Name: Matané 2012 Matanè  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Robust and round, this opens with aromas of dark berry, espresso and ground black pepper. The ripe palate offers mature blackberry, spicy plum and mocha alongside firm, velvety tannins. A note of bitter prune signals the close. It's not very complex but it's savory and calls out for food. Drink through 2016.
Name: Varvaglione Vigne & Vini 2012 Papale Linea Oro  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Concentrated and dense, this has aromas of spicy black plum, game and a whiff of clove. The massive, monolithic palate delivers prune, dried black cherry, coffee, licorice and hints of grilled herb alongside velvety tannins. Searing alcohol dominates the finish.
Name: Gianfranco Fino 2012 Es  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This robust wine opens with aromas of spiced plum, clove and a balsamic note. The spicy palate offers prune, dried blackberry, red currant and ground pepper alongside hearty tannins. A marked licorice note signals the close.
Name: Torrevento 2011 Ghenos  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of dark plum, blue flower and dark cooking spice lead the nose and follow through to the robust, spicy palate along with notes of licorice, tobacco and mocha. Mouth-puckering tannins support the juicy fruit. There's noticeable warmth of alcohol.
Name: Leone de Castris 2013 Villa Santera  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spicy, and medium bodied, this has a smoky, spicy nose that recalls charred earth, graphite, black currant and cedar. The smoky quality carries to the palate, along with mature blackberry, allspice, licorice and clove. Firm but fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide an uplifting framework.
Name: Alberto Longo 2013 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: An elegant expression of this grape, this smooth, full-bodied wine delivers layers of spicy plum, juicy blackberry, graphite, clove and licorice. Firm but velvety tannins provide ample texture and support.
Name: Ognissole 2013  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of blue flower, ripe berry and allspice jump out of the glass of this full-bodied but elegant red. The fresh, juicy palate offers blueberry, blackberry, graphite and a hint of mocha. Firm, fine-grained tannins offer support and give it a smooth texture.
Name: Masseria Altemura 2012 Altemura  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This full-bodied red conveys aromas of tilled soil, underbrush, plum cake and pencil shaving. The ripe, dense palate offers prune, dried blackberry, clove, ground black pepper and graphite alongside velvety tannins.
Name: Castello Monaci 2012 Artas Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This warm, brawny wine opens with aromas of tilled soil, underbrush, plum and ripe, dark berry. The dense, spicy palate delivers prune, raisin, licorice and ground black pepper alongside velvety tannins. The heat of evident alcohol dominates the finish.
Name: Futura 14 2013 Il Rosso di Vespa Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo del Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of underbrush, tobacco leaf and spiced plum come together in the glass. The hearty palate delivers dried blackberry, crushed raspberry, coffee, tobacco and licorice alongside robust but velvety tannins.
Name: Jorche 2012 Soltema  (Primitivo del Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicious and straightforward, this vibrant wine conveys aromas of wild berry and a whiff of clove. The savory, easy-drinking palate doles out juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of black pepper alongside supple tannins. There's no complexity but it's perfect for everyday fare. Or chill it down for a refreshing summer red.
Name: Tormaresca 2012 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of coconut, plum and a balsamic note open this densely concentrated wine. The compacted palate offers blackberry, prune, nutmeg and graphite alongside robust, velvety tannins and the warmth of alcohol. A licorice note marks the close.
Name: Produttori Vini Manduria 2010 Sonetto Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of blackberry, blueberry and blue flower come together in the glass. The straightforward palate offers black currant, dried plum, licorice and a tobacco note alongside firm tannins.
Name: Tormaresca 2012 Torcicoda Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatically appealing, this suggests black raspberries, tart cherries and herbs, with light citrus and barrel accents. It's tart and quite restrained for the variety with plumy fruit flavors and a slightly chalky feel to the tannins that may resolve with some additional time in the bottle.
Name: Wind Rose 2012 Stone Tree Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe black fruit, spicy plum, graphite and a whiff of brine lead the nose of this robust wine. The round, savory palate doles out juicy blackberry, blueberry, licorice and ground black pepper alongside brawny tannins. It ends on a bitter prune note.
Name: Cantine Menhir 2011 Quota 31 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of mature black berries, prune toast and tilled earth lead the nose on this savory wine. The succulent, easygoing palate doles out crushed blackberry, Morello cherry, dried plum and clove alongside supple tannins. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
Name: Amastuola 2011 Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of crushed blue flower, plum cake and ripe wild berry lead the nose. The palate offers prune, mature blackberry, vanilla, clove and a confectionary note alongside bracing tannins. It ends on a note of bitter cocoa.
Name: Castel di Salve 2012 Cento su Cento Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This savory red features aromas and flavors of violet, juicy blueberry, blackberry, plum and a whiff of cake spice. Firm but fine-grained tannins give support. While it's full-bodied, it's also easy to drink. A licorice note signals the close.
Name: Masseria Altemura 2012 Sasseo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of underbrush, toast, black plum and cooking spice lead the nose. The dense, extracted palate offers blackberry, prune, licorice, mocha and grilled sage alongside velvety but rather fleeting tannins.
Name: Tenute Rubino 2012 Visellio Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of this robust wine recall resin, raisin, vanilla and plum cake. The warm, thick palate offers prune, licorice and ground black pepper alongside robust tannins. There's not much fruit richness and the heat of alcohol throws this off balance.
Name: Jorche 2010 Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas recall ripe, black-skinned fruit, clove, thyme and a whiff of barnyard. The palate offers mature black currant, black pepper and savory herb alongside firm tannins.
Name: Rivera 2012 Triusco Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Full-bodied, this conveys aromas of toast, scorched earth, espresso, plum and allspice. The hearty palate offers prune, blackberry extract and licorice alongside firm tannins.
Name: Tenute Rubino 2012 Punta Aquila Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This starts off with aromas of mature black fruit, allspice and toast. The full-bodied palate offers prune, mature blackberry, toasted oak and ground black pepper alongside hearty tannins.
Name: Castello Monaci 2013 Piluna Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tilled earth, leather, game and spicy plum carry over to the palate with dried blueberry, ground pepper and a hint of licorice. Round but fleeting tannins provide easygoing support.
Name: Palamà 2012 Arcangelo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Thick and concentrated, this robust wine doles out stewed prune, cherry marinated in spirits, chocolate and a confectionary note alongside the burn of evident alcohol. There's a lot heft here but not much vibrancy or balance.
Name: Mottura 2012 Le Pitre Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This earthy wine opens with aromas of ripe plum, tilled earth, game and a whiff of barnyard. The rustic but juicy palate doles out black cherry, spicy blueberry and ground pepper framed by hearty tannins.
Name: Mocavero 2011 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, coconut and plum cake lead the nose on this dense wine. The extracted palate offers prune, oak, espresso, dried black fruit and licorice alongside astringent tannins that leave a bitter finish. There's not enough fruit richness to stand up to the oak.
Name: Varvaglione Vigne & Vini 2012 Cardinale Linea Oro  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo del Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe plum, espresso, sawdust, cocoa and allspice lead the nose. The palate offers mature blackberry, black pepper, oak extract and roasted coffee bean alongside raspy, astringent tannins.
Name: Varvaglione Vigne & Vini 2013 12 e Mezzo  (Primitivo del Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of leather, game, meat juices and mature black-skinned fruit lead the nose on this hefty wine. The palate offers sawdust, licorice, prune and espresso but not enough fruit richness to support the oak. Fleeting but astringent tannins leave a bitter finish.
Name: Jorche 2011  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: It's a no-apologies, heavily oaked wine. Even the guy on the label is wearing wooden kegs for pants. The smoked bacon and juicy, grapy aromas lead to very oaky, smoky and jammy flavors on a smooth texture with a touch of sweetness that rounds the edges.
Name: Plungerhead 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This accessible wine features aromas of spiced plum, leather and a whiff of violet. The easy-drinking palate offers juicy black cherry and a note of ground pepper alongside sleek tannins.
Name: Cantele 2012 Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas suggest pencil shavings, resin and mature black fruit. The palate offers prune, dried blackberry and black pepper alongside grippy tannins.
Name: Tommasi 2012 Masseria Surani Heracles Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of mature plum, sage and clove lead the nose. The warm, mature palate offers dried blackberry, prune, black pepper and licorice alongside round tannins and evident alcohol. It's already reached its ideal drinking window so enjoy soon.
Name: Teanum 2012 Otre Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smells like toasted bread and hickory smoke and tastes even more charred and smoky. Like a good barbecue sauce it has a sweet touch to balance the smoky, jammy fruit flavors. This is an extreme taste experience that will be a big hit with some.
Name: Ironstone 2013 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Primitivo del Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of wood shop, toast, blue flower and spearmint. The lean palate offers toasted oak, dried blackberry and a whiff of clove alongside angular, astringent tannins that dry out the finish. It lacks the fruit richness to stand up to the oak.
Name: Cantine De Falco 2011 Bocca della Verità  (Primitivo del Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of coconut, spicy plum cake, mocha and vanilla waft out of the glass. The warm palate doles out stewed plum, blackberry, espresso, licorice and a confectionary note alongside bracing, astringent tannins that dry the mouth. The intense oak sensations throw this off balance.
Name: Apollonio 2011 Terragnolo Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild flower, black fruit and toast lead the nose on this dense wine. The one-dimensional palate offers mature black cherry, dried plum, coffee and a hint of licorice alongside chewy but fleeting tannins.
Name: Cantine Due Palme 2012 San Gaetano  (Primitivo di Manduria)

Appellation: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This funky wine opens with rustic aromas of animal fur, game, tilled earth and a whiff of barnyard. These carry over to the palate along with mature blackberry and robust tannins.
Name: Villa Mottura 2012  Primitivo di Manduria

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Hearty and rustic, this opens with a nose of crushed blue flower, ripe blackberry, mature plum, allspice and a whiff of barnyard. The aromas carry over to the palate along with ripe, chewy tannins.
Name: Mocavero 2013 Sjre Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Puglia, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas recall cellar floor, dried black fruit and a hint of black pepper. The palate tastes old, offering prune and clove alongside angular tannins but without much fruit richness.
Name: Torrevento 2012 Matervitae Primitivo (Puglia)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of charred earth, tire rubber, allspice and oak lead the nose. The palate seems older than it is, showing toasted oak and tertiary flavors of flint, mineral and black pepper along with steeped prune. The fruit is already dried up leaving only evident alcohol and oak sensations.
Name: Mocavero 2008 Santufili Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Salento, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Funky aromas of game, leather, mature black fruit and a whiff of barnyard carry over to the rustic palate. Raspy, astringent tannins and prune sensations give it a bitter, mouth-puckering finish. Tried twice with consistent results.
Name: Tenute Mater Domini 2013 Marangi Primitivo (Salento)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a unique and exciting take on California's historic grape from one of the region's pioneering wineries. Aromas recall sour cranberry, orange peel, strawberry and sagebrush. It's savory and herbal on the palate, with baking and Indian spices of cardamom and chai as well as mocha.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2012 Bailey Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A blend of five vineyards, some of which go into single-vineyard designates, this is a well made, structured wine, offering layers of black cherry and subtle earth around soft, velvety tannins. The finish highlights black pepper spice with dark chocolate chaser.
Name: Dashe Cellars 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pleasantly dank nose of black tobacco, cedar and deep purple fruit like elderberry combine for a strong wine from the Willow Creek District. It's elegantly brooding, redolent of stewed plums, leaving the tongue gripped with tannins and refreshed with acid.
Name: Midnight 2011 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though blackberry sauce wafts down the middle of the nose, this wine picks up more serious gunmetal and pine aromas as well. Though a bit tight once sipped, the wine's Italian herbs and tar elements impress already and will continue to emerge. Drink 2016–2019.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2012 Zinfusion Estate Grown Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this wine from veteran vintner Eric Ogorsolka is reminiscent of an old-time closet, with pipe smoke, cedar and plum perfume. It's quite woody and elegant on the palate, with well-integrated fruit, spice and herb characters suggesting savory plum jelly and prune reduction sauce.
Name: Zenaida Cellars 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky aromas give this wine allure, its layers of flavor soft and flowery, accented by red berry fruit. On the elegant spectrum of the variety, the wine is fairly subtle, with an evolving cinnamon spiciness to the finish.
Name: Kokomo 2012 Pauline's Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Deliciously ripe and generous, this full-bodied Zin has plenty to like: ripe blackberry, black cherry and baking spice aromas. Deep flavors echo the fruit and layer it with hints of vanilla and nutmeg. While full-bodied and nicely thick in texture, it's not over the top and remains balanced by firm acidity and welcome tannins.
Name: Ridge 2012 East Bench Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A smooth, supple version of Zinfandel, this is full-bodied and rich but not overly showy or oaky. Blended from 90% Zinfandel plus Petite Sirah and Malbec, it has enticing wild blackberry aromas and flavors, touches of cinnamon and cedar and a lingering finish.
Name: Ironstone 2012 Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose is both luscious with cherry pie and melting vanilla ice cream yet herbally enhanced with roasting pine wood. Similar flavors carry the easily likable yet through-provoking palate, which is ripe and well oaked.
Name: Pomar Junction 2012 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine delivers on richness of flavor without being overwhelming or overdone. Refined in soft tannins and a core of expressive, juicy blue and black berry fruit, it is seductive and smoky on the finish, sourced mainly from vineyards in the Dry Creek Valley.
Name: Rancho Zabaco 2012 Sonoma Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: What a treat to find a truly dry, balanced table wine among a sea of sweet and overoaked Zins. Plenty of blackberry, clove, sage and cherry flavors are supported by just firm-enough tannins and medium body. The blend is 79% Zinfandel, 12% Carignane, 8% Petite Sirah and 1% Alicante Bouschet.
Name: Ridge 2012 Three Valleys Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of anise-laced blackberry candies emerge from this easy-drinking wine. Light and airy on the palate for such a rich-looking wine, it's redolent with flavors of cherries and fennel with a decent tannic backbone.
Name: Adelaida 2012 Michael's Vineyard Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very bright fruit aromas like fresh strawberries make this hearty wine especially appetizing. Firm, almost chewy tannins and vibrant acidity are strong enough to support the rich fruit flavors and bring the wine a great balance.
Name: Woodenhead 2011 Guido Venturi Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a monster Zin, and a very good one. It has an inky black color tinged with red, strong dried-fruit flavors like fig, prune and dried cherry. Along with a smoky, roasted quality on the palate, it has sandy tannins with lots of grip. Powerful and almost sweet.
Name: McCay Cellars 2011 Trulux Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is the strong, silent type, not a showy wine but one that will drink well with a dinner full of grilled and roasted meats and vegetables. It feels well structured with tannins and acidity, and tastes restrained in flavor, with subtle cassis and blueberry notes.
Name: Uphill Vineyards 2010 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An exotic, cedar and eucalyptus aroma blends seamlessly into lavish sun-kissed boysenberry and strawberry flavors. It's a big wine, full-bodied, firmly tannic, giving an oak-aged texture and spicy finish, too.
Name: Sierra Starr 2010 Phil's Selection Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A core of bright red cherry fruit, blackberry and licorice dance around soft, medium-bodied layers of cocoa and spice. The winery's larger production Zinfandel (although still under 1,500 cases), this provides a fantastic entry into both the winery and Dry Creek Valley Zin.
Name: Kokomo 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Description: Smoke, tobacco and tar are most prominent in this weighty wine that's soft in big blackberry flavor and pungent earth. Velvety on the palate, it finishes full and ripe, a perfect companion to barbecue or a sizable cigar.
Name: Oakville Winery 2012 Estate Grown and Produced Zinfandel (Oakville)

Appellation: Clear Lake, Lake County, California, US
Description: Zinfandel by another name, this appealing wine has cola and cherry aromas, plus snappy cherry-candy and sweet prune flavors. It's full-bodied and has lively acidity, a silky texture and lingering finish.
Name: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Primitivo (Clear Lake)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Tasty, generous and easy to enjoy, this full-bodied Zin smells like blackberries and tastes like strawberry jam. It gains a little sweet spiciness from oak and glides through the finish.
Name: Criss Cross 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tobacco and boysenberry scents make for a pleasing if not complex nose on this wine from the Santa Margarita Ranch area on the southern part of the appellation. There are a lot of tannins, with expected flavors of blackberry and cedar.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich, ripe red cherry and blackberry fruits mix with black earth on the nose. The tannins and acidity are quite present on the palate, where flavors of strawberry leather dissipate quickly. It's better than overly jammy Zins, but may be too austere.
Name: Robert Hall 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Northern Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From estate vineyards in Russian River, Alexander and Dry Creek valleys, this Zin is fruity and smoky in equal measure. The fruit is slightly jammy in blackberry fruit, followed by toasty oak and pepper spice.
Name: Rodney Strong 2012 Knotty Vines Zinfandel (Northern Sonoma)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This tastes full-bore, full-bodied and extra ripe: one of those monster Zins that needs plenty of animal protein, preferably cooked over a wood fire, to match the intensity. The aromas and flavors are raisiny, the high alcohol and tannins are powerful, and the finish carries heat.
Name: Perry Creek 2012 ZinMan Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A distinct late-harvest character pervades this full-bodied Zin, which has very ripe aromas of raisins and prunes, and bold, dried-fruit flavors, too. The texture is smooth and the wine is soft and not very tannic.
Name: Ironstone 2010 Reserve Rous Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a new, small producer devoted to 100% Zinfandel, this soft, grippy wine offers a hint of menthol on the nose and muted aromatics. The finish is ripe though tempered by good acidity.
Name: David Clinton 2011 Unti Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A dense, rich, chocolaty flavor and smooth, thick texture make this old-school Zinfandel very tempting despite an earthy, leathery vein of flavor that lasts on the finish.
Name: McCay Cellars 2011 Faith Lot 13 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light and linear, this Zin offers muted red fruit and spice, with a modest finish.
Name: Bruliam 2012 Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big and brawny wine is definitely different, smelling sun-baked and tasting of cherry and menthol.There is a sawdust quality in the nose, and a rowdy texture full of tannin and alcohol.
Name: McCay Cellars 2011 Jupiter Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Not your average Zinfandel, this one could almost be a Syrah with all its peppery, meaty and smoky aromas and flavors. They are wild and different but puzzling. The wine is full-bodied, tannic and almost thick in texture.
Name: McCay Cellars 2011 Equity Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smells earthy and berrylike and tastes like fresh carrots. It feels slightly sweet, coating the mouth with sweet-sour flavors. It's soft in tannins but full-bodied.
Name: Rubus 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Varozza is planted to 50-year-old Zin vines, an unexpected patch of refined goodness in the middle of valley floor land near the Napa River in St. Helena. It expresses waves of complexity and spicy red berry fruit, the different components of which evolve in the glass and should evolve even more in the bottle.
Name: Robert Biale 2012 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky in dark clove and black pepper, this is a smooth, bright Zinfandel from head-trained, dry-farmed vines planted in the 19th century. After skipping the 2011 vintage, the winery returns with this stunner, brambly in succulent blackberry with plenty of intriguing spice.
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2012 Dutton Ranch Morelli Lane Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: The winery's proprietary block of Zin grapes (planted in 1999) from the coveted Stagecoach Vineyards contributes to an intense wine. Juicy and oaky, it's dense in cherry and plum, a note of lavender and sage complementing the whole. A thick liqueur sense characterizes the texture, but the palate stays alive through the site's rocky minerality. This one'll age.
Name: Robert Biale 2012 Stagecoach Vineyards The Biale Block Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There is earthy darkness and a hint of the forest in this Zin, grown at high elevation in the rocky soils of the Rockpile appellation, these vines planted in 2001. The wine is magnificently structured with complex, ripe blackberry and cherry compote coming to the fore slowly and seductively.
Name: Robert Biale 2012 Rocky Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A smoky oak fire meets cooked meats and plum sauce on the nose of this wine, which retains great balance even at 16% alcohol. The mouthfeel is luxurious, complementing the cherry, red currant, licorice and black pepper flavors, wrapped around orange peel bitterness and well-integrated oak.
Name: Summerwood 2011 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Spicy in black plum and berry fruit, Black Chicken is a consistent blockbuster for Biale, alive and fresh in waves of exotic cinnamon and clove. Built to age 2020–2022, it'll satisfy in complex black tea and savory toasty oak, an easy wine to love. The grapes are sourced from the winery's estate sites within the Oak Knoll District, where it's based.
Name: Robert Biale 2012 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A brand new vineyard designation for the winery, Bedrock dates to the 1800s and is being made famous by proprietor Joel Peterson of Ravenswood and his son, Morgan Twain Peterson. This wine does the site justice, a smooth concoction of cherry pit and allspice, elegant and yet plenty generous in fruit and structure, measured by natural acidity.
Name: Robert Biale 2012 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made from a mix of vineyards across the Napa Valley, this pays tribute to the early days of grape growing in the region and is a wine equally worthy of recognition. Exhibiting dark cherry stone and wild strawberry aromas, the palate is complex, tannic and round, a subtle suggestion of smoke on the finish balanced by bright acidity.
Name: Robert Biale 2012 Founding Farmers Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Zesty in black pepper and luscious in blackberry, blueberry and raspberry, the grapes are from 90-plus-year-old hillside vines. Complex and structured, it offers a balanced point of view and plenty of intrigue, simultaneously fresh and brooding.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The grapes are Demeter-certified Biodynamic in this 100% Zin, grown on a ridge-top vineyard overlooking the Dry Creek Valley. A fully realized, satisfying wine, it offers cherry vanilla, tar and toasty bacon among warm tones of complementary spicy cinnamon.
Name: Quivira 2012 Flight Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Description: Soft, subdued, savory and subtle, Old Kraft dates back originally to the 1860s, much of its plantings traceable to the 1890s. Zinfandel and Petite Sirah populate the gorgeous pocket of a site, a stone's throw from Spottswoode. Blackberries and raspberries figure prominently, alongside intrigues of cinnamon and clove, a forested note not far behind.
Name: Robert Biale 2012 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from head-trained vines planted where California winemaking pioneer Agoston Haraszthy first grew the variety 150 years ago, this lush wine offers intense aromatics of tar, brick and smoke, with briary blackberry secondary on the nose. The finish is topped by flavors of cocoa and a sprinkling of black pepper.
Name: Bartholomew Park 2011 Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A zippy sense of freshness characterizes this wine that's otherwise soft and bright in red raspberry and plum fruit. Subtle and understated black pepper builds up on the finish and stays on the palate a long time, just the slightest suggestion of savory herb peeking through.
Name: Brown Estate 2012 Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Full-bodied and lush on the palate, this exuberant wine offers a brightness of red raspberry fruit followed by acres of lively clove and ginger spice. High in acidity, it has years to go before it sleeps, the finish savory in leather.
Name: Brown Estate 2012 Rosemary's Block Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This offers excellent refinement, with high-toned red-berry fruit and sarsaparilla that are on the edge of jammy—in a good way. Noticeable yet balanced acidity and generous tannins provide a solid structure.
Name: Miro 2012 Piccetti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Lush in brambly blackberry, this classic Zinfandel comes from a cooler area than usual, the Russian River Valley, which manages to retain small plantings of the variety amid the larger seas of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Spicy, the wine is balanced and fairly elegant, medium in body and weight while still packing a punch.
Name: Portalupi 2012 Old Vine Dolinsek Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: An 85% Zinfandel with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Syrah, this red offers sanguine, rustic plum, cinnamon spice and a concentration of bright red fruit, a lingering grip on the finish.
Name: Girard 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 8% Petite Sirah and then aged almost a year in American oak, 30% of it new, this is fruity and smoky in equal measure. Its tones of blackberry, leather and black pepper are harmonious. Round and soft, it's easy to drink and will be approachable to a variety of palates.
Name: Pedroncelli 2012 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With brawny tannins and a taste of tar and oak, this wine is predominantly about dark, black fruit, the spicy finish measured and complementary to the rest of the components. It's a classic barbecue wine.
Name: Ballentine 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This approachable Zinfandel comes from a modern-day vineyard planted with cuttings from pre-Prohibition-era vines and exhibits the complexity these heritage grapes can offer. Smoky and exuberant in cherry and blackberry fruit, the wine has soft tannins and a rounded feel to the palate, its long finish smooth and meaty.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2012 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Meaty, dry and balanced yet big, this is a substantial mouthful of Rosé. Made from Dry Creek Zinfandel with 12% Syrah, it's brooding in dark berry and peach fruit and can be paired much as a full-bodied red wine would be.
Name: Truett Hurst 2013 Salmon Run Rosé Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A lighter style of Zinfandel, with 23% Petite Sirah and 1% Carignane, this is soft in raspberry layers and earthy in pastoral ways. The finish exhibits the Petite's tendency toward tannic muscle.
Name: Frog's Leap 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry juice, wet clay, nutmeg and chamise make for an intriguing nose on this well-priced Zinfandel. The easy-drinking palate leans toward fruit punch, making for good summer drinking at a barbecue or the beach.
Name: Eight Sides 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This soft Zinfandel offers fruity blackberry notes and pings of cinnamon spice, making it an easygoing wine that's ripe and round. The colorful label carries original artwork of one of the winery owners.
Name: Wines Gone Wild 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A curious streak of sarsaparilla marks this wine aromatically, followed by sparse, soft layers of black fruit and hidden black pepper.
Name: Portalupi 2012 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A quite remarkable mauve-pink in color, this offers faint cherry aromas. It's nearly sweet on the palate, with strawberries and hard red berry candy flavors.
Name: Joullian 2013 Estate Rosé of Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This expressive wine has notes of vanilla, whiskey barrel and dried red fruit. It's ripe and full but without all of the alcoholic weight that this variety sometimes brings. Some grit to the tannins provides a bit of distraction.
Name: Troon 2012 Estate Zinfandel (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is Zinfandel at its richest. Boysenberry, vanilla and maple syrup aromas meet up with jammy fruit flavors that coat the mouth and linger on the finish. For all its fullness, it stays balanced and dry. It does not feel heavy in texture nor heavily oaked.
Name: Earthquake 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bold and beautiful, this powerful Zin has a deep, dark color that's practically black but with a brilliant ruby rim. Brooding aromas suggest wood smoke, black pepper and boysenberry. There is an impressive density in texture, as firm tannins and acidity support the rich array of flavors.
Name: Michael David 2012 Rage Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lush and tasty, this is strikingly affordable for the alluring layers of aromas and flavors present. It begins with cherry pie on the nose alongside black licorice, bay leaf, roasting meats and mushrooms, and continues on the palate with soft and jammy berries. Yet it has a serious side too, with flavors of menthol and stewed tomatoes delivering the umami factor.
Name: Sextant 2011 Wheelhouse Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From Paso Robles's warmer eastside, this wine begins with an elegant nose of raspberry, deep red rose and lavender. It's immediately delicious once sipped, with lush plum and sour cherry fruit, followed by a long-lingering finish of violets, rose and dried lavender.
Name: Still Waters 2011 Estate Grown Primitivo (Paso Robles)
