Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Delicious, almost sweet fruit flavors are wrapped in firm, velvety tannins for a seriously enjoyable experience. There's a feeling of polish in the texture, and careful balance between full body, good tannin structure and lively acidity.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2012 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Description: Fruity and juicy in blackberry and black cherry, this mountain-grown Zin has soft, integrated tannins and a backbone of spiciness, white pepper mostly, and dark black licorice, that winds its way through the finish.
Name: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full of delicious dark-fruit flavors, this is smooth and deep, comforting but sophisticated. The fruit flavors are ripe and satisfying, the texture is velvety and broad, the body is full but not heavy.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2012 Hawk Creek Zinfandel (Fair Play)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tasty and traditional, it has that brambly aroma and raspberry flavor profile typical of Foothills Zin, making it appetizing and delicious. It tastes full-bodied, firm with tannins but not rough, well-balanced and mouthwatering.
Name: Perry Creek 2010 Altitude 2401 Reserve Fair Play Farms Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Great balance in this fruit-forward yet well-structured wine. It's not a monster, but firmly in the lunch and dinner wine category because of appetizingly fresh raspberry and strawberry flavors and good acidity. It's medium-bodied, firm-textured and dry.
Name: Graziano 2011 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Showy and rich, it features lots of tasty oak influence and ripe, generous fruit flavors, but it doesn't go over the top. This is full-bodied, broad in texture and not too tannic. Made from mature, hillside vines, it's especially impressive in this challenging vintage.
Name: Wildhurst 2011 Home Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From 50-year-old vines planted on a rocky hillside, this is leathery and zesty in cedar and black pepper. Balanced and structured it builds as it goes, finishing with a heavier presence of tannins and black olive.
Name: Dashe Cellars 2011 Todd Brothers Ranch Old Vines Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Phantom Rivers, which runs one of the few tasting rooms in Arroyo Grande, delivers a delicious-smelling Zinfandel, with fresh Coca-Cola and root beer aromas, richer chocolate-covered strawberries and a violet lift. It's very soft and shows some age on the palate, with macerated strawberries, cloves and orange peel, revealing a more sour than jammy side of the grape.
Name: Phantom Rivers 2010 La Vista Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich cherry and spicy black pepper introduce the nose to this wine from the Adelaida district. The flavors explore the more nuanced, not overly jammy side of the grape, with tart acidity and a good tannic backbone ensuring a long life. Decent now, but better to drink 2018–2022.
Name: Daou 2012 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh, gushing fruit flavors such as raspberry, red cherry and boysenberry fill out this expressive and well-balanced wine. It is sweetly fruity in aroma, full-flavored, full-bodied, firm and dry in texture but not heavy. It craves ribs or wood-fired pizza.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2011 California Series Zinfandel (Yolo County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a 90-year-old vineyard, this begins with a lean blackberry nose and other pointed dark-red to deep-purple fruits, all nicely laced with minerality and herbs. The flavors are dynamic, slipping from cranberry to pomegranate to cherry juice. A black tea finish framed by strong tannins ensures long cellar life. Drink 2018–2022.
Name: Ridge 2012 Bento Dusi Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sanguine and leathery, this is a full-bodied Zin from a sought-after, historic vineyard high atop Sonoma Valley. Juicy in brambly blackberry and tar, it offers coffee and chocolate on the finish, both dark roasted.
Name: Muscardini 2011 Monte Rosso Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This features notes of cranberry, raspberry, clove and jammy red fruit. It's medium-plus bodied—far from over the top as this grape often is—with tart acidity and a vanilla and toffee-filled finish.
Name: Milbrandt 2011 Vineyard Series Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This tastes like a cool-climate Zin because of the deep plum and black cherry flavors and light earthy, herbal accents, with touches of cedar and toast in the bouquet. It has moderate tannins and medium-to-full body.
Name: Longevity 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: From Sam Sebastiani comes a satisfying and rich Zinfandel that smells like chocolate, nutmeg, grilled bread and blackberries. It tastes full and fruity, is smooth textured and not very tannic. The spicy oak influence complements the  grape flavors and makes a complete package.
Name: La Chertosa 2012 Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This offers a pleasing intermix of fruit and spice, from blackberry and plum to Cab-like cassis. Juicy, mouthfilling and structured, it has a finish all about cinnamon and peppercorns.
Name: Ancient Oak Cellars 2011 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This has what we're looking for in a good, dry red for dinner time, namely fruit aromas, tasty fruit flavors, full body and a firm texture of tannins and acidity. It makes a nice candidate for house red.
Name: Edmeades 2012 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a great wine for fans of the flashy, almost sweet, dark colored and fully oaked style of Zin. It has a tasty sense of maple syrup on waffles, boysenberries and vanilla. Full-bodied and concentrated, it's firm in texture and slightly sweet on the finish.
Name: Klinker Brick 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Mostly rich and broad in mouthfeel, this offers light, savory aromas of dried herb and sunbaked earth plus solid plum and red berry flavors. It features a full body, firm texture and flavor complexity.
Name: Sol Rouge 2011 Estate Zinfandel (Red Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A blockbuster style of Zin from three vineyard sites, all relatively old vine, this is zesty on the palate, a mix of berry compote and cinnamon and black pepper spice. Not too dense, it is hearty and big-shouldered.
Name: St. Francis 2011 Tres Viejos Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Don't let the rather light red color fool you. This is an assertive Zinfandel with an edgy, oaky, smoky character in the aroma and the flavor. It blends powerful, sweet-seeming oak notes with attractive cherry and raspberry flavors, and is very full-bodied.
Name: JC Van Staden 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This delves into the more sanguine side of California's historic yet stylistically versatile grape, with rare meat and red earth aromas. On the tart palate is pomegranate and cranberry, with bay leaf and kalamata olives giving an herbal lift.
Name: Joullian 2011 Estate Sias Cuvee Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Here is a tasty, light-bodied Zin with its own style and a great price. It has a minty, eucalyptus aroma and vivid raspberry flavors, almost sweet in balance. Medium-bodied, it delivers a lingering fruity finish.
Name: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and apparently sweet Zinfandel drinks more like a Port than a dry wine. It smells like boysenberry syrup on waffles, has a juicy, soft texture, and raisin and prune flavors.
Name: Noceto 2010 OGP Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Having spent considerable time in bottle, this 2009 Zin is midweight and full of sweet plum, raspberry and strawberry tones, accented by a smoky finish.
Name: Taj 2009 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the cool 2011 vintage, this vineyard-designated wine doesn't seem entirely ripe, displaying notes of herbs, cranberry and red fruit. It's screamingly tart with moderate fruit flavors and abundant oak accents that lead to a warm finish.
Name: Maryhill 2011 Northridge Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: One of six Lodi Native wines from 2012, this Zin is very dark and deep in color and has attractively smoky, spicy aromas. It packs in tremendously rich fruit flavors, full body and a generous, broad texture.  Concentrated boysenberry, blueberry and blackberry essences seem bursting to get out as you sip. Delicious but not over the top.
Name: Maley Brothers Vineyards 2012 Lodi Native Wegat Vineyards Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Very full-bodied it carries a gorgeous ripe blackberry character from the first whiff to the long, lingering finish. Deep, dark ruby in color, it discloses aromas of berries with hints of cedar. The pure fruit essence in the flavor makes it delicious, compelling and memorable.
Name: Macchia 2012 Lodi Native Noma Ranch Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: It's crafted by one of the six Lodi Native wineries using native yeast and neutral barrels. Savory and distinctive, it offers smoky, peppery, meaty complexity and mellow fruit flavors. Full-bodied but not tannic, it has a velvety texture and finishes soft but long. It seems made for mealtime.
Name: Fields Family 2012 Lodi Native The Century Block Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Not a fruit bomb, it's suave and complex. Aged in neutral oak, this limited-production wine shows baking spices in aroma, a smooth, lush texture and good concentration. Plum and blackberry flavors are layered, sophisticated and linger on the finish. It's full-bodied, but has enough tannin and acidity to balance out the richness.
Name: St. Amant 2012 Lodi Native Marian's Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Lots of fruit character, tannin and oak sensations all blend together in this layered, balanced and yet full-bodied wine. It smells like dark cherries and cinnamon, while flavors suggest ripe raspberries with a dash of maple syrup. Very rich and velvety in texture, it has ample tannin and a lingering finish.
Name: LangeTwins 2010 Centennial Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A solid, middleweight Zinfandel, this emphasizes sophisticated, toasty, spicy oak aromas. The oak doesn't overwhelm, however, but enhances the ripe boysenberry flavors, juicy acidity and lingering finish. Enjoyably tannic, this will pair well with grilled lamb, steak and chicken.
Name: Sobon Estate 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied but nicely balanced and dry Zin has cedar and nutmeg aromas that waft over earthy, wild blackberry and cedar flavors. The texture is smooth and slightly tannic, and the finish lingers.
Name: Sobon Estate 2012 Lubenko Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: It captures the Sierra Foothills balance of power and seems to have everything in the right proportions, including the price. Deep, nearly opaque garnet in color, it offers cedar and clove aromas that lead to rich fruit flavors like blackberry and boysenberry, firm tannins and full body.
Name: Perry Creek 2011 Zinman Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An attractive, dry, lighter style of Zinfandel, it has fresh raspberry aromas and a rich enough texture to make it appetizing. Medium-bodied, it offers lively fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2012 Indian Hills Vineyard Zinfandel (Fair Play)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: One of a limited release set of Zinfandels fermented with native yeast and aged in neutral barrels. It's deep garnet colored, nearly black to the rim. Barrel-aged complexity shows in the lightly spicy aromas like cinnamon and toast, along with faintly herbal but largely plummy aromas and flavors. It's full-bodied, smooth and rounded.
Name: McCay Cellars 2012 Lodi Native Trulux Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Good flavor concentration and a sense of power help this stand out. A dark red color goes almost to the rim, with aromas that suggest blackberries and raisins. Flavors go deep into sweet oak and dark fruit. The tannins support the wine's overall richness, adding a little grip to the texture.
Name: Ehrenberg 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine is smooth and complete, from the jammy fruit aromas to the slightly oak-accented flavors to the lingering, seemingly sweet finish. This limited bottling fermented with native yeast picks up attractive toast, vanilla and nutmeg flavors that enhance the ripe, pure raspberry and blackberry notes that fill out the full body.
Name: M2 2012 Lodi Native Soucie Vineyard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The somewhat light red-purple color does not mean that this medium-bodied wine lacks flavor. Toasty, smoky, caramel aromas from oak carry over to the bold and almost sweet flavors, powering over moderate raspberry and plum undertones.
Name: Castle Rock 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Balanced toward the bold side, it's full-bodied and shows aromas of ripe grapes and sage, accompanied by flavors of cherry and plum. Layers of fine tannin give it grip without bitterness. Tasty cherry and baking spice flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Watts 2012 Upstream Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: It has a vivid ruby color, cherry and raspberry aromas and flavors, and good balance. It's not too fat, but medium bodied, with firm tannins that help frame the ripe fruit. It adds up to an elegant style.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Easy-drinking and dry, it starts with pleasant strawberry and raspberry aromas that lead to moderately rich fruit flavors accented with white pepper. It doesn't feel as full-bodied as one might expect from Amador, and has an almost soft, silky finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2011 Rezerve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well-balanced, this medium- to full-bodied Zin offers spice and berry aromas and plummy flavors. The noticeable, firm tannins are a good thing in Zinfandel, which can sometimes be too soft.
Name: Winery by the Creek 2012 Lyman Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A sense of sweetness from oak smooths out this medium- to full-bodied wine and complements the moderate tannins and smooth texture. A pleasant plummy thread winds through the aromas and flavors, lingering on the finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2012 Rezerve Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is a dark garnet color, dense to the rim, with potent blackberry and dark cherry aromas. Delicious and pure blackberry and boysenberry flavors linger through the finish. It's big and bold but the power is in the magnificent fruit flavors rather than tannin, oak or alcohol.
Name: Deaver 2010 Signature Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The power and richness of Port fill this extreme—and extremely delicious—Zinfandel. It is very deep in color and vivid in aroma, like the scent of ripe grapes at the crusher on harvest day. It fills the mouth with apparent sweetness that lingers long on the finish. Perfect match for after dinner with blue cheese and toasted walnuts, or a cigar.
Name: Deaver 2010 Signature Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant on the nose, it offers aromas settling between violet, white pepper and chai tea. The 5% Petite Sirah adds a nice touch of viscosity to the palate. The flavors range from cinnamon to licorice with nice bitterness and acidity, making the fruits of plum and prune almost an afterthought.
Name: Proulx 2011 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: One of the “12 Zins of Lodi 2014,” it was chosen in a judging by the Lodi Winegrape Commission to represent the region's finest. The deep red-black color is saturated to the rim. Deep, evocative aromas lead to ripe cherry, boysenberry, chocolate and nutmeg flavors that echo on the finish. The texture is full and smooth.
Name: Za Zin 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Not overly full-bodied, not overly ripe, not overly wild, but just right for dinner time. It's well balanced, velvet textured and multilayered. Brambly, bright raspberry and blackberry flavors fill the mouth, supported by smooth tannins and good acidity that keep it lively and appetizing through the long finish.
Name: Carol Shelton 2012 Wild Thing Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This complex wine pops with notes of dried cranberries and cherries, anise, vanilla, cocoa, pipe tobacco and barrel spices. It's ripe, rounded and soft in feel with a lingering, spice-filled finish.
Name: Forgeron 2011 Stonetree Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Here's an excellent example of a dry Zinfandel that doesn't need to drink like a Port in terms of its balance. The aromas are subtle, suggesting blackberries, but the flavors go deep into more blackberries, ripe red cherries and Santa Rosa plums accented with just a dash of cinnamon-like oak. This is full-bodied yet deceptively smooth and elegant in texture.
Name: Jessie's Grove 2011 Westwind Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A ripe and tasty style of Zinfandel from a grand old name in the Sierra Foothills. The maple and brown sugar tones from new oak integrate well with ripe but not overripe fruit flavors. Touches of clove and black pepper come out as you sip, adding welcome nuances.
Name: Renwood 2011 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The wildness and heat of Zinfandel are restrained to good effect in this elegant, supple but concentrated version. Aromas and flavors of raspberry and black cherry lead to cinnamon and clove on the tasty finish, which lasts a long time. Should pair well with most meats and with tomato-based sauces.
Name: Ironstone 2010 Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A lighter style Zinfandel, it's also lighter in color. Aromas align more with fresh minerality than deep fruit, though there is tobacco, plum jam and some pepper on the nose. Once sipped, cranberry and pomegranate compete for the fruit side, while cedar and pepper form the spice element. It's great for sipping on the porch and shows how Zinfandel can be impressively lean, even with 14.7% alcohol.
Name: Pessagno Winery 2011 Zinfandel (San Benito County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This family-owned winery comes out swinging with this blend of 81% Zinfandel backed by bits of Grenache, Petite Sirah and Syrah, casting aromas of boysenberry, cola and freshly cut grilled rib eye. On the palate, it's smooth and evenly balanced with blackberry pie, vanilla and milk chocolate, offering the perfect partner for barbecued ribs and flame-broiled steak.
Name: Proulx 2011 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoothly seductive in bright red-berry and pomegranate fruit, this young Zinfandel comes from mostly Dry Creek Valley vineyards. Rippling in baking spice and subtle vanilla oak, it's a complete wine, with balanced acidity and mellowed tannins. Clean and long on the finish, it will complement rather than overpower a meal.
Name: Decoy 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very fruity and nearly dry, this full-bodied red wine expresses pure Zinfandel character in a memorable way without intrusive oak. An aroma of just-crushed grapes leads to a fresh raspberry-like flavor that is just wild enough to transcend the ordinary and just tannic enough to clean your taste buds and bring you back for more sips.
Name: Navarro 2011 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: You'd never guess that this was rocking it so hard with 16.3% alcohol, as this wine achieves balance in the face of such boozy contents. The nose holds a blackberry core with rusty, spicier edges of star anise. These are followed by a palate of black cherry and cedar, with enough tannins to ensure evolving drinking until at least 2018.
Name: Adelaida 2011 Michael's Estate Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: At first, all you sense is a heavy, operatic costume of chocolaty, smoky, coffee-like oak flavors. Underneath these, a ripe and slightly sweet boysenberry soul keeps the drama going. Like a sturdy stage set, the richly laced tannins support the fruit and oak until the curtain falls.
Name: Zinhead 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A full-bodied but not over-the-top Zin that is deliciously fruity, tasting like raspberry jam and fresh blueberries. No overt oak flavors mask the pure enjoyment of well-ripened and carefully fermented grapes. It's extremely smooth, ever so slightly sweet and has a rich, lingering finish.
Name: Deaver 2010 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Exuberant in red fruit, this is a softly textured Zinfandel, high in acidity with evolved tannins. Layered, complex and food-friendly, the imprint of red berry and brambly blackberry juiciness is joined by swirls of nuanced vanilla and a touch of oak. There's a sprinkling of black pepper on the palate, too.
Name: Ousterhout 2011 Nance's Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a field blend of Zinfandel, Alicante Bouschet and Petite Sirah, this wine is brick-red and earthy, inviting in dark, brambly fruit and just-right spice. With soft tannins and a long finish, it's classic Sonoma County Zin, fruity and in balance.
Name: Carol Shelton 2010 Karma Zin Bastoni Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Medium- to full-bodied, it's very smooth, well polished and easy to enjoy. Not too ripe or too sweet, but sophisticated in style, it delivers moderately ripe raspberry and blueberry flavors, soft tannins and a lingering fruity finish.
Name: Deaver 2010 Ten Zin Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Imagine coffee ice cream drizzled with boysenberry syrup and you get the gist of the flavors of this full-bodied, rather sweet Zinfandel. Aromas of toasted oak barrels and fresh roasted coffee beans leap out of the glass as you sniff, then rich cherry and boysenberry flavors coat your tongue.  The alcohol is noticeable, but it carries so much flavor along with it that it comes off as decently balanced.
Name: Harney Lane 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Lots of fun to sip this showy, overt, no-holds-barred Zin. Lavish use of new oak gives aromas of toasted bread, maple syrup and smoked bacon. The flavors say ripe strawberries and sweet blackberry jam, and the finish is sweet and spicy at the same time.
Name: Ironstone 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Concentrated in bright red fruit, it has a straight line of peppery spice that's intriguing. The structure is big-boned and powerful, yet the finish refreshing and balanced. At 1,000-feet in elevation, the vineyard has rocky soils, and there's a hint of rockiness in the taste.
Name: Joseph Jewell 2010 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite its relative youth, it seems somewhat dried out with notes of Craisins, dried currant, fruit leather and spice. Still, there's plenty of enjoyment to be had on this unapologetically luscious, full-bodied wine.
Name: Two Vintners 2011 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Here is a generous, full-throttle, high-octane Zin, with lots of rich oak accents and a touch of sweetness. Aromas of strawberry jam, maple syrup and hickory-smoked bacon are followed by rich fruit flavors, full body, light tannins and a jammy finish.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2011 Epicenter Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tasty from start to finish, this medium- to full-bodied Zinfandel offers a velvety texture, finely integrated tannins that give grip but not bitterness, and ripe cherry and strawberry flavors. A moderate dose of maple and cinnamon flavor come from aging with oak.
Name: Helwig 2011 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's an intriguing tension to this wine, shiny in plum and a taste of cherry pie. Soft and structured, it should develop more nuance and complexity in the bottle, but serves exceptionally well right now as a companion to risotto or artisan pizza.
Name: Kobler 2012 Unti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied Zinfandel has a lighter color than many, but plenty of aroma and flavor. It smells like a wild blackberry patch in summer, tastes like strawberry jam and goes down smooth due to its light tannins and a touch of sweetness.
Name: Girasole 2010 Made With Organic Grapes Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Wrapped in layers of red berries and licorice, it's thick and rich, offering mouthfuls of accessible fruitiness amid an interior core of leather and high heat. Pull it out for grilled meats slathered in sweet barbecue sauce.
Name: Carol Shelton 2010 Rocky Reserve Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This all-out Zin makes no bones about its sweetness, heavy oak spiciness and full body. Maple syrup, brown sugar and cherry jam are the dominant notes that crowd the aromas and flavors and linger on the finish. Very rich and full-bodied, it has prominent caramelized oak notes that keep the tannins from biting.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Silky in black and red berry fruit, this young Zin from a great, dry-farmed eastside Dry Creek vineyard offers notable acidity amidst a still-grippy mouthfeel. Layered, it would make a luxurious pairing for grilled ribs in an Asian-spiced glaze.
Name: Armida 2012 Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Looming in huge black fruit, this is a dark, heavy Zin intense in toasty oak and brambly, dusty amounts of ripe blackberry and strawberry jam. Dark chocolate hammers in hard on the finish, with black pepper and raisins.
Name: Matrix 2011 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark in color, this soft, leathery Zin offers tangents of blackberry, chocolate and espresso within a heavy-handed package of serious fruit and weight.
Name: Wilson 2011 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: It tastes lush, slightly sweet and full-on fruity, but has a lavish oak overlay. The aromas are sweet cherries and maple syrup, the fruit flavors come out as just-crushed grapes and cherries sprinkled with the brown sugar of new oak. Not heavy in texture and not as full-bodied as the flavors would make you think.
Name: Campus Oaks 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grippy, it has power and loads of chocolaty pepper, jammy blackberry and strawberry fruit, and a dull, toasty finish.
Name: Pezzi King 2011 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rusticity goes a smidge too far here, without fruit that can handle the harsh tannins. It opens nicely, with pretty berry and cherry highlights, but in the mouth it gets chewy and finishes rough.
Name: Jacob Williams 2010 Gunkel Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This intense, slightly sour Zinfandel combines herbal/menthol aromas with a taste of vanilla-toasted marshmallow, the fruit jammy and minty.
Name: Mazzocco 2011 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Darker and more brooding than many of Newsome-Harlow's other single-vineyard bottlings in the 2011 vintage, the Shake Ridge is mighty in black pepper and dark chocolate, silky and voluptuous with mellowed tannins. Blended with 8% Petite Sirah, the ranch's Zin clones include Monte Rosso.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2011 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A consistent standout among Newsome-Harlow's stellar lineup of single-vineyard Zins, The Donner Party is rich in blackberry liqueur and licorice, finely structured and soft in tannins, with a dusty, mocha-lined finish and just the right seasoning of leather. Blended with 12% Petite Sirah.
Designation: The Donner Party The Dalton Ranch
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2011 The Donner Party The Dalton Ranch Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Winemaker Scott Klann combines with friend and fellow winemaker Marco Cappelli, the owner of Herbert Vineyard, to craft this celebration of elegant blackberry, jammy fruit, black pepper and licorice. Fine-tuned and elegant, it's also brawny, with substantial mouthfeel and texture.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2011 Herbert Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With 4% Petite Sirah blended in, the Big John Zin is bright in dusty red fruit, briary and brambly, with a hint of spice and nutty almond. Focused and textured, the finish is fully satisfying, the spice piquing interest again.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2011 Big John Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Newsome-Harlow's largest bottling, the Calaveras County is a delicious deal at $24, steeped in ebullient cherry and raspberry high tones, juicy yet entirely elegant. A classic California Zin in all the best senses, it offers black pepper, muted chocolate and softly layered structure.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2011 Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A beautiful bottling that will prosper with time, easily until 2024, this grippy, earthy Zin offers soft plum and brambly blackberry amid a pretty, floral nose and plenty of peppery anise and earth. Aged in French oak from low-yielding vines originally planted in 1865, this is a premier example of Fiddletown Zin made with precision and care.
Name: Easton 2011 Old Vine Rinaldi Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Juicy in blueberry and explosive blackberry fruit, this offers the right succulent mix of dusty spice and well-mannered fruitiness. For pairings, aim for the usual barbecue but perhaps also a risotto or finely made pizza.
Name: Stellina 2011 Selvaggio Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Description: Another Fiddletown beauty, this one is pungent in blackberry and exhilarating pepper and clove. Aromatic, structured and electric with equal parts acidity and stony minerality, this wine has a long-lingering finish of gorgeous brambly fruit.
Name: Easton 2011 E Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A robust Zin, this wine's lusty, cinnamon-spice aromas carry through on the tongue, while the texture is refined and rich. With balanced alcohol and acidity, its full-figured body is still juicy and bright. Cellar it for a few more years or let it breathe before serving.
Name: Easton 2011 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: From old head-trained vines, Contention is McCay's top-of-the-line Westside Lodi Zin, a study in tight, dusty tannins and earthy acidity backed by a substantial layering of baking spices. Let this wine open a while to express itself fully.
Name: McCay Cellars 2010 Contention Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Shyly aromatic at first, this beautiful Primitivo blended with 8% Barbera offers smooth layers of raspberry and just-ripe cherry, a seasoning of kitchen herbs and spice sprinkled in between. Not aged in barrels, it's all about the fruit and spice and the interplay in between, with no oak to interfere.
Name: Uvaggio 2012 acciaio Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Juicy and soft, this Zin is all about exuberant red fruit and restrained tannins. Full-bodied it also offers elegance with complex highlights of leather, cedar and peppery spice. Enjoy with plenty of pizza and pasta on hand.
Name: Artezin 2012 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an amazing price for such quality, the wine resplendent in accessible red cherry and blackberry fruit and leathery tannins. Elegant and fairly restrained, it's soft, structured and young, with room to develop further. Juicy and creamy, it delivers minty spice on the finish.
Name: Easton 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Made from dry-farmed, low-yield vines planted in 1918 in what was a leading growing area at the time of Prohibition, this brings aromas of burnt orange, mint and black cherry to the nose. It's a smooth sipper, with menthol, toasted oak and cigar smoke emerging on the palate.
Name: Carol Shelton 2012 Monga Zin Lopez VIneyard Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Softly textured, this pretty Zin is subdued in black cherry and brambly, earthy spice with a grip of leather on the finish. From the magical Shake Ridge, farmed by Ann Kraemer, this is her own brand, driven by a philosophy to release wines after they've been in bottle awhile.
Name: Yorba 2008 Shake Ridge Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opening with competing scents of menthol and fruit preserves, this hits the palate with peppery spice, ample minerality and nicely restrained jamminess. It's more evidence that, even with such high alcohol levels, Zinfandel-makers are keeping an eye on balance, with enough acidity to ensure food-friendly sipping.
Name: Bianchi 2011 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a Captain America-sized Zin, muscular and strong in walls of huge, dusty dark fruit. Firm in tannins, juicy and swirling in vanilla and cinnamon toast flavors, it spent 22 months swaddled in French oak, an imprint that lets itself be known in the wine. Lay this baby down until 2015 or so, or let it breathe before enjoying with racks of ribs.
Name: Harney Lane 2011 Lizzy James Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Boysenberry, cherry and a touch of minerality take over the nose on this wine from Mike Rennie and Gary Winder, who are pioneering grape growers of the Temecula Valley. Tar and tobacco pair up with bright acidity and smooth oakiness on the palate, making for easy drinking.
Name: Leoness 2011 Lopez Ranch Vineyard Selection Zinfandel (South Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Soft, spicy and jammy, this is rich in clove and big-hearted blackberry fruit. Easy to like and pleasantly affordable, it'll pour well for parties and other occasions where a bold, crowd-pleasing red wine is in order.
Name: Gnarly Head 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromatically rich in red cherry and black currant fruit, this is a lean Zin despite its 15% alcohol. Tar, cedar and chocolate dominate the palate.
Name: Brazin 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This soft Zin bursts with blackberry and cherry fruit. Grippy, it's savory in coffee and leather with a slight astringency to the finish. It tends to be among Sobon's better bottlings every year.
Name: Sobon Estate 2011 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Not quite as showy as its cousin Zinfandel, this Primitivo takes more time to emerge from its shell, eventually revealing scents of white pepper and graphite. There is absolutely no show of Zin's traditional hamminess either; instead, mouth-watering minerality and a vibrant acid structure lingers on the palate.
Name: Oso Libre 2011 Nativo Estate Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: It's hard to break through this syrupy late-harvest wine's heavy hand. Intense, tannic and full-bodied, it's made in a semidry style.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2012 Late-Harvest Piccolo Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Offering a more traditional California Zinfandel style than some of the other 2011s, this takes off with scents of a warm, butter-crusted cherry pie, unfolding on the palate with cranberry jelly. There's a slight herbal character and quite of bit of tannic grip, so expect this one to improve in the years to come.
Name: Oso Libre 2011 Osezno Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A Zin with notes of cedar, leather and sour red fruit, this offers tannic grip from start to finish. Slightly savory, it shows hints of toasty vanilla on the finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2010 ReZerve Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Generous in aromas of leather and chocolate-covered fig, this wine gets mushy in the middle. Thin with an earthy edge and a finish that's slightly herbal.
Name: Spenker 2011 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A pronounced jolt of backyard compost jumps out first in this wine, followed by thin layers of cranberry, quickly wrapped up before there's much to say about a finish.
Name: Zinfandelic 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A pink wine that's quite sweet and straightforward, in the style of the White Zinfandel that became popular in the 1980s. It shows a bit of strawberry aroma, and the flavors are sugary and slightly plummy.
Name: Campus Oaks 2013 Single Vineyard Reserve White Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A pop style of pink wine that the Peter Mondavi family makes from Zinfandel with minor portions of Chenin Blanc and Muscat. It has a light coral color, mild fruit aromas and semisweet red Popsicle flavors.
Name: CK Mondavi 2013 Willow Springs White Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This offers allspice aromas around a thin core of hard-to-decipher fruit and a finish that veers into burnt-rubber territory.
Name: Moss Roxx 2011 Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Zinfandel is sourced from Alder Ridge; the 22% Primitivo component from Stonetree. Fresh and lightly spicy, it features bright berry fruit with good focus and medium depth. Despite the relatively high alcohol, it seems sleek and moderate.
Name: Forgeron 2011 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Single vineyard Zinfandel from a young vineyard on the Columbia River, this is pretty rather than powerful, smooth and chocolaty, with bright, tight raspberry fruit.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2008 Hells Gate Canyon Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Intensely aromatic in spicy black cherry and earthy leather, the Devious Primitivo is more structured than some of Macchia's Zinfandels, more savory than sweet, with tannic grip. Smooth and velvety, it'll impress alongside salumi and other charcuterie.
Name: Macchia 2012 Devious Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Clear Lake, Lake County, California, US
Description: De Loach continues to impress with this Lake County vineyard-designate, a well-balanced Zin with plenty of density amid its brick tar and brambly blackberry fruit. With leveled acidity along with plenty of power, it'll both age and be pleasing to drink now, with smoky meats.
Name: De Loach 2011 Nova Vineyard Zinfandel (Clear Lake)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Technically a Zin blend labeled as Old Vine Wine, Serious is velvety in texture with supple tannins and a complex taste of blueberry compote and cinnamon spice. With a brightness on the finish, it'll age and be interesting with food like venison or other game.
Name: Macchia 2012 Serious Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fields Family aims for balance from 60-year-old vines, aiming to produce refined Zins with subtle power. They've achieved that here, offering velvety texture and a taste of raspberry liqueur and nuanced vanilla amid an elegant core of chocolate-laced tannin.
Name: Fields Family 2011 Sherman Family Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: From old Lodi vines, V. Sattui's annual heartland Zin is minty and herbal, high-toned and tannic, able to find a nice equilibrium between opposing personalities. Leathery and akin to pipe tobacco, it offers a more savory side of Zin, and is worthy of cellaring until 2019 or so.
Name: V. Sattui 2011 Pilgrim Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Restrained and tannic, this Zin needs time to resolve and mellow its fine layers of blackberry and tar. Complex and structured, from 95-year-old vines, it should do that with aplomb, the wine more savory than sweet, a refreshing alternative to super-sized Zins.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2012 Scherrer Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Velvety smooth and structured, with layers of blackberry and raspberry fruit, this Zin is made from old Lodi vines and encased in a coating of soft vanilla oak, its voluptuousness tempered by spice.
Name: Macchia 2012 Mischievous Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Supple and alive in spice this is a softly rendered Zinfandel with plenty of density that's balanced by tastes of bright berry. It's well priced and from good land, a hearty accompaniment to meaty meals, laced with enough acidity to offset its big flavor.
Name: Sobon Estate 2011 Lubenko Vineyards Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Soft and structured, this wine has an opening aroma of fruit roll-up and spicy leather. With a deep concentration of blackberry and tar flavors, it's an old-school Lodi wine from old vines that showcase the region's prowess with such grapes.
Name: Van Ruiten 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: RIch in baked bread aromas and dark, black licorice color and flavor, this robust Zin from the famed Mohr-Fry Vineyard exudes crushed blackberries and is soft and round, overtaken only slightly by its generous alcohol. Its structure may allow it to enjoy a mellowness after aging until 2017–2019.
Name: Macchia 2012 Generous Mohr-Fry Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Buena Vista continues to honor its heritage by offering better wines that pay homage to the winery's past. This is another example, a voluptuous Zin with dark blackberry and tar, just the right spread of spiciness on the finish.
Name: Buena Vista 2011 Karoly's Selection Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A 60-some-year-old vineyard, untrellised and low yielding, Esola is a longtime source of this 100% Zinfandel made by Amador Foothill for some time. Still young, it offers a taste of raspberry cordial amid smooth, ripe tannins and cinnamon spice. Lay it down until 2017–2019 and it'll soften some more.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2010 Esola Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Perhaps it's the bottle age but this Zin is plush and voluptuous, bright in red raspberry and blackberry fruit with a smoky undertone. Layered, the texture is dense and the finish long. A good pizza wine.
Name: Herman Walters 2008 Family Vine Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This Zin contains percentages of Petite Sirah, Sangiovese and Grenache, offering powerfully dusty tannins and layers of blackberry. Chewy, the finish is all leathery saddle.
Name: Bonterra 2011 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dull and dusty on the nose, this burly Zin opens up in the glass, offering a slight sweetness of blackberry and vanilla amid its soft texture and structure.
Name: Lava Cap 2010 Rocky Draw Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This jammy, crowd-pleasing Zin is well put-together, soft in blackberry spice and has just a trace of wintergreen on the nose. Widely distributed and value-priced, it's a steal worth stocking up on.
Name: Gnarly Head 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This Livermore Valley producer travels to Lodi to make this Zin, a smattering of 4% Petite Sirah blended in. Intense in cherry-watermelon candy aromas, its flavors develop into tart cherry, blueberry and spice. With soft tannins this wine is straightforward, with the finish all about dusty cigars.
Name: Longevity 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Beneath the come-hither packaging and name, this Zin offers velvety tannins and smoky fruit and spice, finishing with a powerful hit of alcohol and leathery cedar.
Name: ZinPhomaniac 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Plush and perfumed in smoky leather, this Zin offers more savory flavors and aromas than sweet. A bit of cedar with just the suggestion of crushed blackberry plays most prominently. Given the robust nature of the wine, the finish is surprisingly quick.
Name: Assembly 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This Zin, sourced from a blend of old and new vines, has inviting aromas of plum and blackberry that expand into a meaty, smoky, full-figured and slightly sanguine melting pot of flavor. With a soft texture and long finish, it's good value, too.
Name: LangeTwins 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine offers rich red fruit, oak and smoke around a soft texture and fading finish. A pronounced sweetness hits mid-palate after the smoky oak that makes it seem higher in alcohol than is stated.
Name: Mad Duck 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This smoky Zinfandel is aromatically closed off and still tight in tannic formation. Give it time to open and it'll share meaty black-fruit and tar.
Name: Stama 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy and dusty, this 16.2% Zin tastes every bit of that heat, marked by a vanilla-cola sweetness and ripe blackberry jam.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2009 Estate Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This new Zin from Livermore Valley-based Dante Robere is from two vineyards, one in Livermore and the other in Brentwood. The fruit is mostly plum, with a trace of wintergreen on the mid-palate but even for Zin the fruit flavors are masked somewhat by the high alcohol; it's for those who like a heavy-hitting wine.
Name: Dante Robere 2010 Zinfandel (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big-flavored Zin is wrapped in layers of brick and tar, smoke and oak, amidst its wild blackberry aromas. It's simple and priced accordingly.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2011 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Planky and a bit tart, this Zin hails from 45-year-old vines and is soft and suggestively herbal.
Name: Rock Lobster 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brownish in color and texturally soft, this Zin starts with a thread of plum that slowly devolves to prune and perhaps spent too long in the bottle.
Name: Cedar Mountain 2009 Zealous Girls Two Girl Zin Zinfandel (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This Zin tastes of smoke, oak and grilled meats, but has an odd acidity to it. It would be good paired with something off the barbecue.
Name: Peltier 2010 Peltier Station Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine opens with a stemmy aromas and remains basic in the glass, with a sweet ending.
Name: Castle Rock 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As the vines grow older, the Alder Ridge Zins gain complexity and gravitas with each new vintage. Tart and brambly, this is a berry-fest, with racy flavors of cranberry, strawberry, raspberry and hints of baking spice. The acidity and overall balance suggest that this can prosper through 2020.
Name: Angel Vine 2011 Alder Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Among the four vineyards used by Angel Vine, the Avery stands apart for its detail, grip and length. Blue fruits take center stage—plums and berries—along with a tasty lick of coffee and chocolate. You may pick up a hint of the tack room and a streak of fennel in the finish.
Name: Angel Vine 2011 Avery Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Primitivo is a close relation to Zinfandel, and it slides easily into the Angel Vine lineup which includes four other Zins. This carries a touch more earthiness than the others, with darker fruits and a distinctive streak of espresso. Good grip and density mark this as the most muscular wine among the 2011's.
Name: Angel Vine 2011 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The entry-level Zin from Angel Vine combines fruit from the three single vineyard cuvées, along with a splash of Petite Sirah. Rich, plush berry scents and grapey berry fruit flavors abound—boysenberry, blackberry and more, buoyed with natural acidity. There is no sense that the alcohol is intrusive, and the wine fades gently with hints of red licorice and cocoa.
Name: Angel Vine 2011 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite its high alcohol, this high-toned Zin does not have the crushing weight and overall power you'd anticipate. Cranberry and raspberry juice fruit flavors carry balancing acidity, and there's a suggestion of refreshing minerality. Although at first the wine seems disjointed, it smoothes out nicely with aeration.
Name: Angel Vine 2011 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This excellent, fruity young red is smooth and ripe, with brambly flavors of red currant and cherry. There are no obvious signs of new oak, just pure, delicious fruit and focused, proportionate tannins.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2012 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A soft, well-integrated mountain Zin gifted in sweet raspberry and leather, balanced completely between juicy and savory. The finish lingers for a long time, and the wine's acidity accommodates a range of foods, from the expected barbecue and other grilled meats to risotto or gourmet pizza.
Name: Miraflores 2010 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This relatively low-alcohol Zinfandel offers dusty blue fruit and piles of earthiness around a core of juicy texture. Straightforward on the finish, with a hit of herb and fresh farm.
Name: Witching Stick 2010 Fashauer Vineyard Zinfandel (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dusty in cocoa powder and leather, this is a dusty mountain of a Zin, from old Foothills vines. Soft and racy, enjoy with pizza or creamy lasagna.
Name: Bella Piazza 2010 Rio Volpe Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Rich in leather and oak, with swirls of ripe red raspberry and blackberry cobbler, this is a big-boy Zinfandel with hair on its chest, a taste of vanilla on the finish.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Thin and smoky, this Zin has a pronounced barrel presence amid layers of black licorice, leather and blackberry.
Name: Zinsane 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This old-vine Zin has washed-out aromas and a savory, leathery character, tannic grip and a hit of smoke on the finish.
Name: Milliaire 2010 Ghirardelli Heritage Old Vine Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Restrained in aromatics, this is a ripe, round and soft ZIn with a Port-like personality, streaks of cedar through the mid-palate and a touch of heat on the finish.
Name: Villa Toscano 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The aromatics are faint on this wine, and the taste puckeringly tannic and raisiny with a strong taste of toffee on the finish.
Name: Milliaire 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: With a touch of red currant and cedar, this straightforward, inexpensive Zin otherwise offers smoke, especially on the finish.
Name: McManis 2012 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A curious combination of smoky and herbaceous, Predator is from old vines but tastes slightly thin and nondescript.
Name: Predator 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: There's little going on aromatically or texturally in this thin, fairly nondescript wine.
Name: Zinsane 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sweet with a burnt aftertaste, this wine cannot be highly recommended.
Name: Villa Toscano 2010 Erika's Reserve Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This Sierra Foothills producer offers an estate-bottled and produced Zin with 15% Petite Sirah that's wanting in fruit and texture. A bit thin, there's not much in the way of aromatics or texture to hold on to.
Name: Wise Villa 2011 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Made in a completely different style from Uvaggio's typical Primitivo, this is meant to be a reserve-tier bottling, with seven months in new and once-used oak. Crisp berry flavor, along with a hint of cranberry, makes this juicy and balanced. It finishes softly on a slightly nutty note.
Name: Uvaggio 2011 Barile Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Brick red in color, this toasty, oaky Zin is grippy and satisfying. Thick on the palate with sweet, ripe tannins and a dusty texture, it's nicely balanced with a long finish that's inviting with meaty foods.
Name: Hovey 2011 Dragone Vineyard Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 10% Barbera and aged in a mixture of French and American oak (45% new), it brings notes of garden herbs, vanilla, jammy red fruit and chocolate. The feel is pillowy soft with tart, cranberry-like acidity brightening it up.
Name: Wind Rose 2011 StoneTree Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A dusty, brambly Zinfandel nuanced in blueberries and plums, this is smooth and soft on the palate with an earthy quality throughout. On the finish this medium-bodied wine offers leathery tobacco and smoke.
Name: Edmeades 2011 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine plays tricks on the palate, tasting much lighter in body than its alcohol suggests. Layered with red fruit along with a lift of herb, it is structured and composed, with a long, lingering finish. This is a good one to stock up on if you love big Zin with a smaller footprint.
Name: Hullabaloo 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Intensely spicy and rich on the nose with notes of cinnamon, dark plum and black cherry, this Zin has an aromatic intensity that fades somewhat on the palate. It's structured and textured with dusty tannins and finishes with a touch of prune.
Name: Black Sheep 2010 Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The Rocky Top Zin has a backbone of cinnamon and ripe plum amidst puckering tannins and a hint of barnyard.
Name: Sobon Estate 2011 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Ripe with cherry-berry juiciness, this is a value-priced Zin that's straightforward all around, with a bitter taste to the finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2011 Vicious Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: While juicy and ripe with red fruit, this Zin lays a little flat on the palate. A handful of Sangiovese is blended in.
Name: Lapis Luna 2012 Romanza Moon Shoup Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dusty Zinfandel has ripe tannins and ripe fruit, along with a puckering sourness on the finish.
Name: Black Sheep 2010 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from The Pines vineyard on the Oregon side of the Columbia Valley, this is a wonderful anomaly for Zin lovers. Loaded with ripe, sweet fruits and accented with a wash of bourbon barrel, this is a riot of blackberry, boysenberry, black cherry and cassis flavors. Just a dash of milk chocolate seeps into the finish. It's too yummy not to drink this up while it's in the first flush of youth.
Name: Sineann 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An Eastside Lodi Zin classic with its retention of high acidity and tight tannins, this is a complex wine with spicy leather, black tea and bright raspberry flavors. Elegant, soft and extremely drinkable, it has a smooth mid-palate that lingers to the finish—a parting gift of cherry and vanilla that'll keep you coming back for more.
Name: McCay Cellars 2010 Equity Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This soft, stewy Zin tastes as if it were steeped in black tea and leather, giving it depth and concentration. As it opens, layers of black pepper pierce through, exploding on the finish amidst earthy cedar and sandalwood. It's a fine food wine that'll impress and improve as the meal goes on.
Name: Turley 2011 Judge Bell Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Brick red in color, this wine is pungent with scents of blackberry, blueberry and leather. The palate is thick and concentrated with a Port-like finish. Layers of acidity streak through the midpalate, adding balance and making the wine quite enjoyable with food.
Name: Renwood 2010 Merida Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: McCay's Westside Zin, Trulux, opens with a strong bouquet of red and black fruit along with a suggestion of anise. Inviting, it's structured and smooth in tannins, with a bite of oak on the finish. Earthy and with great acidity throughout, it makes for a great food wine.
Name: McCay Cellars 2010 Trulux Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Mike McCay is one of the more exciting Zinfandel producers in Lodi right now. The wine is smoky with dark, roasted notes and joyful raspberry and blackberry flavors. There's a light, subtle elegance to its cola and tobacco backbone.
Name: McCay Cellars 2010 Jupiter Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Chewy on the palate with red and black fruit, this Zin has an earthiness reminscent of tobacco pipes. Oaky on the finish, it's self-contained and smooth with its peppery spirit riding shotgun. Impressive and readily drinkable.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A medley of black fruit and black tea dominate here, with dusty tannins and smooth, concentrated red currants playing second bench. This 100% Zin is marked by its high acidity and a purity of fruit from stainless steel fermentation. Enjoy it on pizza or pasta night.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2011 Jack Rabbit Flat Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich, peppery and smooth, this is a nicely developed, elegant Zin. It's leathery on the palate with a finish of rose petals and bittersweet chocolate.
Name: Renwood 2011 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: While thick and viscous with ripe blackberry and blueberry fruit, Musician's Zin is smooth in tannins and texture. Fruit dominates to the finish with a hit of characteristic pepper on the finish.
Name: Renwood 2010 Musician's Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This powerful wine is sourced from 100-year-old vines in the famous Deaver vineyard. There's a touch of pepper behind the thick tannins and oak. It's a long lasting wine with leathery blackberry fruit that should come to the fore over time.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2011 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Encapsulated in a big, beautifully etched bottle with black wax closure, Grand Wren is a grand statement—an explosion of smoke, leather and ripe fruit. It's smooth in texture, but with streaks of bright acidity throughout. The finish is big and bold with a Port-like intensity.
Name: Renwood 2010 Grand Wren Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Layered with oak, leather and cigar box, this is a smooth, structured Zin. The palate retains some perfume of red raspberry and dark cherry, but it's quite masculine in its approach and taste.
Name: Renwood 2010 Flutist Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Spicy with cola and black tea, this Livermore Zin has an earthy touch amid its ripe raspberry and oak. It would pair well with the usual suspects of barbecue and other grilled meats.
Name: Fenestra 2010 Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This crowd-pleasing Zin is deeply aromatic, with cedar notes, and boasts a palate that's smooth, leathery and layered with tones of earth and black tea. Fairly priced and with a cleverly designed label, it's a great bottle to take to your next biker party or gathering for the Day of the Dead.
Name: Boneshaker 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Zin is rich with flavors of liqueur and spice with a suggestion of Dr. Pepper. Let this Zin open a bit in the glass. It's softly textured on the finish with a taste of raspberry and vanilla.
Name: Borjón 2010 Reposado Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Spicy with leather undertones, this softly textured wine is dusty on the palate and laced with red fruit.
Name: Mellowood 2009 Zinfandel (Fair Play)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Perfumed with rose petal and leather notes, this is a classic Zin—smooth, rich with red fruit and cocoa, and with a smoky, oak finish. Fairly priced and ready to drink now.
Name: Cycles Gladiator 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: There's a streak of rose petal amidst soft red and blue fruit in this Zinfandel. The tannins are soft, and there's not much to offer in terms of spice or concentrated flavors.
Name: Claudia Springs NV Blend 5 Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Clear Lake, Lake County, California, US
Description: A zesty, warm dark plum Primitivo rich in leathery coffee and jam and nestled in a wall of finely structured tannins. This is the kind of wine one can describe as having nice legs.
Name: Rosa d'Oro 2011 Estate Bottled Primitivo (Clear Lake)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hearty in toasty vanilla, this softly textured Primitivo has a wealth of blackberry fruit and weighty texture that veers dangerously close to overpowering before pulling back and finding its balance. The finish keeps you coming back for more.
Name: Borjón 2010 Clockspring Vineyard Primitivo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This Primitivo opens with inviting peppery aromas, followed by bright fruit and spice overtones, along with a nice bead of acidity throughout. A good pizza and lasagna wine.
Name: Brutocao 2010 Contento Vineyard Primitivo (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With a core of vanilla-black fruit, this is a soft and approachable Primitivo with drying tannins and a lengthy leathery finish.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2011 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A fragrantly floral Primitivo laced with pepper and a depth of wild raspberry flavor, this is plenty structured and easy to like. Pair with standard Italian fare and most definitely, pizza.
Name: Narrow Gate 2009 Estate Reserve Primitivo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy in blackberry and dark plum, this is a fruity Primitivo with a backbone of leather, coffee and spice. The finish veers into overripe flavors.
Name: Wattle Creek 2010 Primitivo (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a broad, leafy, late harvest Zinfandel, augmented with a splash of brandy. Mellow cherry tobacco flavors saturate the palate, smooth and lingering, with a lick of vanilla and butterscotch as they weave through the finish.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2010 Port Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Fresh in zingy, ripe blackberry flavor, this well-made Zin has firm tannins and a dollop of peppery spice on the finish.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2011 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A soft, moderately jammy old-vine Zinfandel—the vines at Mohr-Fry Ranch go back to 1901 and 1944—that's heady in spicy ripe blackberry with an impressive backbone of structure and mouthwatering texture.
Name: St. Amant 2011 Mohr-Fry Ranch Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Perfumed in cinnamon-flowery aromatics, this well-valued Zin is softly spiced, lush and smooth, drinkable with black cherry flavor and plenty of personality.
Name: Cline 2012 Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A mid-weight Zin, with a tannic backbone and a soft mouthfeel plus, rich and interesting blackberry and coffee. Encrust some ribs, chops or tenderloin in coffee grounds to pair with this wine for explosive results.
Name: Brutocao 2010 Hopland Ranches Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine just steps over the line to get its' varietal label with the rest Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Tempranillo. It has notes of chocolate, pencil lead and dried herbs with plump, ripe tannins. An enjoyable easy drinker.
Name: Hyatt 2010 Zillah Gorilla Zinfandel (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Brazin's old-vine Zin has bright, soft plum and blackberry flavors that will appeal widely. With broad swaths of coffee and leather weaving within the fruit, it's not overpowering or subtle, but just right and will pair broadly too.
Name: Brazin 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A Zin of high-toned red raspberry and blackberry fruit and dark plum that segues quickly into oaky toast tastes.
Name: Rail2Rail 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Cline makes a lot of this wine and they do a good job with it. Soft and leathery in spicy baked plum and blackberry, this is a perfet wine to pair with a myriad of midweek meals and outdoor parties.
Name: Cline 2012 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A mouthful of ripe, fruity jam and baking spice from a vineyard also sourced by the producer for Cabernet Sauvignon.
Name: McConnell Estates Winery 2008 Wackman Ranch Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Inexpensive, this Zin is quite ripe and quite oaky, a big mouthful of wine ready to enjoy now.
Name: Damas 2010 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This rustic red has some high-toned berry and cherry fruit, cloaked in dusty tannins and brown spices. It falls apart quickly, as if heading over the hill. Drink up.
Name: Pheasant Valley Winery 2010 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Sobon's Old Vines Zinfandel is seamless in bright red fruit and soft tannins, with a tempered spiciness on the finish. A great value and go-to wine for a crowd, this is ideal to stock up on for outdoor gatherings, or just to get through the winter.
Name: Sobon Estate 2011 Old Vines Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Opening with aromas of baked blackberry compote, this Fiddletown Zin is thick in tannin and savory leather, oak and smoke, but delivers fully on its Zinfully hedonistic promise. On the finish, a bite of licorice.
Name: Sobon Estate 2010 Lubenko Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Paul Dolan Zin remains big with savory flavors beef jerky, roast meat and black pepper. Not overdone in alcohol or tannin, its a perfect go-to for nights around the grill and will please a crowd.
Name: Paul Dolan 2010 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fully developed in red fruit and mountainous tannins, the highlight of Sobon's Cougar Hill is its long, spicy finish, succulent and mouthwateringly ready for a hunk of barbecued meat to follow.
Name: Sobon Estate 2010 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From old Contra Costa County vines, the Three wines are made by Matthew Cline of Cline Cellars, whose family has long plowed these dry-farmed fields (and where he was the winemaker for almost two decades). This wine is chock a block in dense black cherry, coffee and cinnamon spice. Though its tannins are reserved, its overall presence is not. This peppery wine is big.
Name: Three 2010 Old Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The Southern Exposure wines come from the original Grandpere Vineyard planted well over a hundred years ago. In this expression the wine shows olive, tar brick and leather qualities and is juicy if not a touch disheveled, with a long spicy finish.
Name: C.G. di Arie 2007 Southern Exposure Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A burly Primitivo with spicy blackberry fruit, this is an intense wine with layers of smoke and oak to offer those who like a wine that not only pairs with a slab of meat but almost tastes like one.
Name: Sobon Estate 2010 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An unusual Zinfandel, with 10% Cabernet Franc mixed in, American Legend is from Frank Gunther's Vineyard in California's Shenandoah Valley (the Zin is anyway; the Cab Franc is estate). Smooth with a background of smoky berry flavor, it suggests sweet tarts mid-palate, and a taste of chocolatey vanilla on the finish.
Name: Di Arie 2009 American Legend Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A value-priced California Zin from the folks at Sobon in Amador County, this wine is jammy in blackberry flavor, meaty with traces of tobacco. While the finish is long it's also piqued with a taste of high alcohol.
Name: Shenandoah 2011 Special Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the old fields of Oakley, this Zinfandel, made by Matt Cline, is big in black fruit and a touch of smoke, particularly vibrant on the finish.
Name: Three 2011 Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This old-vine Zinfandel also has Carignane and Petite Sirah and is full of red fruit and decent spice but it falls flat under the weight of alcohol on the finish.
Name: Dogwood 2010 Sargentini Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A dusty Amador County-dominant old-vine Zinfandel with plenty of spicy berry, mocha and licorice flavor. Packaged in a psychedelically inspired label, it'll go down easy on those late-night when listening to music is the best thing to do and plenty of barbecued meat is lying around.
Name: Zinfandelic 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a big, smoky Lodi Zinfandel, explosively jammy and thick with bacon flavor.
Name: Delta Landing 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This Primitivo gives off both ripe and green characteristics with a finish of vanilla, but it also comes off as slightly burnt.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2011 Sorriso Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: In possibly the world's heaviest bottle comes this heavy Ancient Vine Zinfandel, greasy in bacon fat flavor, plus-sized in every way with a taste of sweet cigar smoke from beginning to end.
Name: Moss Roxx 2010 Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
