Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With a heady bouquet of berry and peppery spice, new Edmeades winemaker Ben Salazar is showing great talent with Mendocino Zinfandel, producing a fairly large-scale bottling full of intense spice and soft tannins. Graham crackers and oak play gingerly in the background. This is a wonderful wine and a new beginning for Edmeades.
Name: Edmeades 2010 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Woodenhead does Pinot Noir well, too, but here it shows its skill with Zinfandel, producing a structured, peppery and leathery version bright in briary blackberry and plum. With fierce minerality at its core, this is a distinctive Zin for those who prefer their wines savory and earthy.
Name: Woodenhead 2009 Guido Venturi Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's lots to like about this wine, from its soft tannins and floral opening aromas to its spicy layers and integrated tannins. But at 16.5% alcohol, it's a crazy big wine, which makes it a difficult wine to pair with food or enjoy over a night without regrets in the morning.
Name: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a dark, brooding and earthy Zin, that's high in alcohol, intensely oaky, and with a huge black pepper character that dives head first towards the finish into slightly pruny land.
Name: Sobon Estate 2009 ReZerve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Though De Loach's Lake County Zinfandel—a regular in the producer's line-up of prominent wines—is a departure of form in its big-boned nature, it is entirely in keeping with its sister wines in terms of balance. Fragrant and spicy, with a depth of blackberry fruit, the finish is long and satisfying. This is a fine food-pairing wine.
Name: De Loach 2010 Nova Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Juicy and dark with layers of boysenberry and blackberry fruit, with high tones of tar and brick, Cedarville's estate-grown Zin comes to life in decomposed granite soils, giving the wine a satisfying and sultry profile. Enjoy this Zin in good time (3–5 years) and pair with dark, smoky meats.
Name: Cedarville 2010 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A solid Amador County Primitivo from a consistently good producer that is subtle with bright red and blue fruit with a layer of mint and earthy cedar. Well crafted, it tastes light and soft from start to finish.
Name: Andis 2011 Indian Creek Vineyard Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With a dollop of Carignane, also from old vines grown organically in Mendocino County, Carol Shelton's Wild Thing ZIn is a fun ride, rich, robust in juicy raspberry fruit, fragrant in vanilla, balanced and approachable. In screwcap, it's a good bottle to grab on the way to a picnic or barbecue.
Name: Carol Shelton 2009 Wild Thing Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A great price for this well-made Primitivo, Uvaggio opens with juicy, bright red raspberry and dark cherry flavor, stays light through the mid palate and finishes with a long lingering streak of vanilla. Dry and fresh, it'll pair perfectly with thin-crust pizza topped with basil out of the garden.
Name: Uvaggio 2011 Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a satisfyingly yummy Zinfandel that's chock block with raspberry and boysenberry flavor, and a tannic structure that's still in full force. There's softness in the mouthfeel and an easygoing finish that's touched with cinnamon spice and chocolate. A good wine to pair with a range of food from barbecue ribs to pizza.
Name: Artezin 2011 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Sourced from one of the older vineyards in the region, Mettler has stayed true to Lodi's larger Zinfandel style with Epicenter, a wine that's black as night with notes of dark berry, plum, tar and brick, as well as a hint of tobacco and dark chocolate. Layered and complex, it's full bodied, but retains enough acidity to taste balanced despite its oak and ample alcohol. Enjoy with hearty fare.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2010 Epicenter Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Sourced from dry farmed, organic vines planted in 1918, Carol Shelton's Monga is a mouthful of a wine, layered with cinnamon spice, blueberry, chocolate and oak, and still very concentrated and dry, with room to grow and mellow.
Name: Carol Shelton 2009 Monga Zin, Lopez Vineyard Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: A complex blend of 76% Zinfandel, 13% Petite Sirah, 6% Mourvèdre and 5% Syrah, this opens with hints of raisins and Ruby Port, a reflection of the near-16% alcohol. But the wine is neither jammy nor hot, and the flavors bring concentrated raspberry and cherry compote, surprising acidity, and some intense herbal and stem highlights. All in all a big, chunky, potent wine that captures the distinctive style of this unique mini-micro winery.
Name: Animale 2010 Zinfandel (Washington)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Peppery and tasting of freshly picked blackberries, Haraszthy's old-vine Lodi Zinfandel has a gamy, austere, dusty quality, and is more restrained than in some years past. Pair with anything grilled.
Name: Haraszthy 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: No shrinking violet at 15.9% abv, La Folia's Zin is exuberant in juicy red and black fruit, cinnamon spice and a taste of cola. Inviting, full and round with a softness in the mouth, the finish slips away ever so quickly. It's otherwise a swell example of Sierra Foothills fruit.
Name: La Folia Winery 2010 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For its bold footprint (and the amount of wood aging it went through) this rich Zinfandel offers a depth of pleasant berry flavor and a measured texture, with a savory edge on the finish.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2010 Big Wood Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Amador Foothill's Clockspring Zin is aromatically reminiscent of its Rosato, with wafts of watermelon and pomegranate and a back splash of black pepper. Young still, enjoy with light barbecue fare, such as grilled chicken with salsa.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2011 Clockspring Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Made from old vines, this Zin is still super tight with mouth-drying tannins, and peppery with a base of black fruit and leather.
Name: Trinitas 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tasting quite sweet and soft, like a raspberry liqueur, this high-alcohol Zinfandel is wrapped in vanilla and cinnamon tones and would be difficult to pair with anything beyond barbecue.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2010 Muy Bueno Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Earthy and very tight after aging 20 months in barrel and another two years in bottle prior to release, this wine's fruit is slipping away, leaving behind only a pruney sourness.
Name: Amador Cellars 2006 Westside Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Edgy with mountainous berry flavor, Easton's 2010 Shenandoah Valley Zin is full-bodied, generous in savory spices and blackberry flavor and intoxicatingly aromatic with a peppery, leathery finish. It's structurally able to withstand many more years in bottle, so enjoy it now or give it some time. Either way, it'll shine poured alongside peppery meat.
Name: Easton 2010 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Delicious in cola spice and earthy tannins, this medium-bodied Zinfandel remains tightly wound but obvious in its promise of years of enjoyably structured blackberry fruit, leather and spice. A fine choice among all of Easton's 2010 Zinfandels.
Name: Easton 2010 Rinaldi Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Easton's largest-production Zinfandel, and earliest release, exhibits mushroomy earth tones around a core of baked plum and leathery spice. Soft and round, very accessible and ready to drink, the finish underlines those leathery jolts—the wine would be perfect with barbecue.
Name: Easton 2011 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rock Wall's Jesse, from 120-year-old grapes, is no shy wine, and it'll hit you first with a black peppery intensity that verges on insane. From there, its soft, round shoulders surround blackberry, leathery and tea streaks accented on the finish by dark chocolate flavors that linger around a while.
Name: Rock Wall 2010 Jesse's Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This engaging Primitivo retains a very youthful, grapy fruit profile, almost like a lightly foxy vitis labrusco. But then the tannins kick in, and it becomes something like a cross between a Washington Lemberger and a Zinfandel. In any event, it's got plenty of fruit, distinction, balance and flavor interest.
Name: Wine o'Clock 2009 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A smooth and silky Zinfandel with a great nose of subtle spice, its fruit hiding in the background, Oakland-based Mikami coaxes good things out of its Lodi grapes, from structure and jam to a vanilla-laced finish.
Name: Mikami Vineyards 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: From 62-year-old, dry-farmed vines, the Esola Zinfandel is leathery, full of tobacco and dust surrounded by spicy red fruit. With great structure and savoriness, it's soft with a light, lingering finish and will develop further with grace another 5–7 years.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2009 Esola Vineyard-Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: While super light in color and texture, this old-vine Zinfandel is undaunting, with a subtle intermingling of jammy cherry and mint flavors. Made to commemorate McFadden's 40 years of farming, it's a throwback in color and personality to a different time and place in Zinfandel.
Name: McFadden 2010 Old Vine-40th Anniversary Edition Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Description: A satisfying Zinfandel that's ready to drink, accessible and softly textured. Easton's “E” has a lot of earthy fruit to offer and is a good value given its provenance.
Name: Easton 2010 E Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though quite young this wine seems a bit desiccated with notes of dried cranberries and raspberries followed by orange peel and Twizzlers. The palate is ripe and sweet with the alcohol showing on the finish.
Name: Two Vintners 2010 Stone Tree Vineyard Zinfandel (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a good value Zinfandel. Its label was modeled after the Fillmore's better days of poster art, meant to appeal to Baby Boomer rock lovers everywhere. Spicy and not overbearing, it'll work for casual jam sessions and/or barbecues.
Name: Deep Purple 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A wine called Earthquake is never going to be shy and retiring, especially from Lodi-grown fruit, so consider this truth in advertising. Big and unquestionably bold, this is a smoky, oaky, huge hit-you-in-the-face-with-fruit wine, full of blackberry and tobacco flavor.
Name: Earthquake 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Juicy, jammy, tasting of red licorice and bright blackberry fruit, with dusty undertones and a bite of coffee on the finish, this is a good-value Zinfandel from old Lodi vines.
Name: Campus Oaks 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This wine calls itself “a bit slutty” in its marketing materials and yes, like a high-priced call girl, it's long on perfume and smoke. From there, this gigantic, mind-stopping wine is mouth-filling in vanilla, blackberry, oak and chocolate. You'll need a cigarette after you're done.
Name: Michael David 2010 Lust Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich and full bodied, Phil's Selection Zin is a statement on blackberry jam layered in leathery goodness with slight accents of spice and tobacco. A big bold wine that'll need big bold flavors to match.
Name: Sierra Starr 2009 Phil's Selection Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Sourced from old vines, this is classically huge Lodi Zin, rich and thick in bright red jammy red fruit and brick tar. Well made, it'll please Zin aficionados in every way, from texture to muscularity to oaky vanilla finish.
Name: Macchia 2010 Mischievous Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A dark, savory Zinfandel with hearty expressions of bacon, oak and tar. Classic to Lodi's reputation for plus-size Zins from old vines, d'Art's has easygoing tannins throughout and a poke of vanilla in its finish.
Name: d'Art Wines 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Nevada County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tight, savory and austere, this mountain-grown Zin needs time to show its very peppery nature and sly red fruit, but will pair expertly with pizza or other pasta.
Name: Sierra Starr 2009 Old Clone Zinfandel (Nevada County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a balanced Zinfandel, and it offers elegant acids and burly red and black fruits. It's a structured effort, and it emits a subtle spice character. This will pair well with foods like pizza and pasta.
Name: Navarro 2010 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Thick, rich and almost cordial-like, this has generous fruit and oak components. It's ready to be paired with a peppered steak.
Name: Weibel Family 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A new wine from Hahn Family, Boneshaker is appropriately named: It's a big-boned, hearty swath of velvety milk chocolate and jammy fruit flavors. With just the right amount of Zinfandel spice and oak influence, it will please a barbecue-loving crowd.
Name: Boneshaker 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Loaded with vibrant jammy fruit, this is a bright Zinfandel that has a smoky grilled-meat note on the finish. Pair this with meaty dishes.
Name: Zynthesis 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A fairly tannic Zinfandel, this is made from organic grapes. Enjoy with pizza or hamburgers.
Name: Girasole 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: In this cool year, the Old Vine Zinfandel from Sineann demonstrates considerable elegance. Nicely balanced, it offers pretty raspberry and cherry fruit, with old vine touches of spice and a certain brambly character. Tangy, tart and long lasting, this would be a good one to cellar.
Name: Sineann 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This intoxicates with berry pie and coffee notes. It's a soft, elegant and restrained Zinfandel, with savory curves from beginning to end.
Name: Lang 2010 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Direct and easygoing, this Zinfandel tastes of blackberry, bacon, clove and pepper. The oak is tame, and the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Plungerhead 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Even with Merlot and Cabernet Franc in the mix, there's no mistaking this is a Zinfandel. It has pepper and jam flavors, with straightjacketlike tannins and plenty of body.
Name: Lava Cap 2010 Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This bottling is classic in its ample, smoky marshmallow, campfire and jam sandwich flavors. The palate is laced with notes of red licorice and vanilla.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Soft, round and textured, this is a minty Zinfandel with a pronounced jolt of smoke on the long finish.
Name: Lapis Luna 2011 Romanzo Moon, Shoup Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Deep and delicious with inviting layers of raspberry and berry cobbler, Big John is a brambly, structured Zin, with bright zaps of black pepper and clove, plus a long, satisfying finish. This is perhaps the best Zin in all of Calaveras County right now.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2010 Big John Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's a shame that just 100 cases of this wine were made, as this bright, fresh, exciting Zinfandel belongs with the best of California, not just Washington. The fresh-picked strawberry and raspberry flavors are concentrated and vibrating with juicy acidity. They lead into a sappy, lengthy midpalate, with an underpinning of rock.
Name: Angel Vine 2010 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a savory Zin with a leathery coffee tone that's also delightfully fresh and marked by red fruit notes. Cerebral, with noticeable acidity and a long finish, the wine is reminiscent of a fine bottle of crème de violette, flowery—yet rich.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2010 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dripping with notes of juicy black fruit, sweet tobacco and clove, this is layered and full-bodied, with soft tannins and an intensity that should grow more intriguing with age. From the gorgeous Calaveras County Dalton Vineyard, this is blended with 11% Petite Sirah, also from Dalton.
Designation: The Donner Party The Dalton Ranch
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2010 The Donner Party The Dalton Ranch Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tight and concentrated at first, this opens up with air, exuding an array of blue and red fruit aromas and flavors, most prominently raspberry, with a chocolate chaser on the finish. A blend of Zin from four different vineyards—plus 14% Petite Sirah—aged mostly in new American oak, this is a crowd-pleasing wine that is a great representation of the region.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2010 Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a dense, chewy Zin with lush berry flavors. It has notes of blackberry juice and tar, with hints of tobacco and vanilla on the back palate. Made from old vines and blended with 6% Barbera and 4% Alicante Bouschet.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sweet and jammy fruit flavors suggest canned cherry and plum. That sweetness is offset by the drying, earthy tannins and flavor of dried herb.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Dark as Petite Sirah, this is a huge, dark old-vine Zinfandel that's dominated by berry and oak flavors. It's smooth and soft, finishing with rivers of milk chocolate and caramel.
Name: Klinker Brick 2010 Marisa Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Renwood is slowly coming back to life in Amador after having been bought by a group of international investors with interests in Argentina and Uruguay. Premier is a good first step, undoubtedly a powerhouse, bearing smoky, tannic mountain fruit and layers of toffee, blackberry and dark raspberry, with a bass line of spice.
Name: Renwood 2010 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is called Old Ghost because the fruit used to make the wine is sourced from old vines. It's big, thick and dense, with layers of ripe blackberry, tar and smoky oak. A cigar smoker's kind of wine, this is a grand old Lodi Zin.
Name: Klinker Brick 2010 Old Ghost Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Planted in the 1970s, the Frank Herbert Vineyard is owned by winemaker Marco Cappelli. Newsome-Harlow winemaker Scott Klann made a great Zin from this vineyard in 2009, but the 2010 seems sweeter, dialed up on a lot of levels, with more intensity of fruit and alcohol and less of the savory spice that was so attractive last vintage. Still, it's worth tasting for the sake of understanding the vicissitudes of vineyard, vintage and vintner.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2010 Frank Herbert Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A classically bombastic Lodi Zin, this is sweet and soft, direct in its embrace of American oak. A note of vanilla marks the finish, plus a healthy dollop of alcohol.
Name: Klinker Brick 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This has very dark fruit swirling around in serious concentrations. Dense and brooding, it's dominated by leather and tobacco flavors, finishing with sticky, dusty tannins.
Name: Renwood 2010 Timberline Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: According to its bottle, this has 15.5% alcohol, and yet the raspberry flavor lacks weight and depth. Instead, flavors of stem and earth seem to dominate.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is full of sweet-tasting blackberry, raspberry and vanilla flavors, with a backbeat of dusty tannins. It's medium bodied with decent structure, and the finish features with notes of smoke and tar.
Name: Chacewater 2010 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart to the point of being flat-out sour, this might appeal to lovers of rhubarb pie. Rhubarb and sour plum flavors are matched with sharp acidity. The fruit seems underripe.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Northridge Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a simple Lodi Zinfandel made using fruit from old vines. It tastes of juicy, brambly blackberry.
Name: Bargetto 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: At first, this smells unexpectedly of almonds. But overall, this is a viscous bottle of raisin, blackberry and tar flavors.
Name: Peirano 2011 The Immortal Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Zinfandel has been a Forgeron specialty for the past decade. Done in a ripe, though not too Porty style, it's more like a Dry Creek wine. Flavors of red and blue berries are annotated with a note of sweet grain, giving it a California twist, with Washington verve and acidity.
Name: Forgeron 2010 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: American and Hungarian oak barrels were used, adding a rustic, powerful base to this pure Primitivo. Think Zinfandel crossed with Lemberger and you're in the ballpark of its style. Its raw, big-boned flavors of fruit and barrel are ready for a juicy steak.
Name: Forgeron 2009 Stonetree Vineyards Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blackberry and cassis flavors, which are accented by a red licorice candy note, turn slightly bitter as the tannins kick in, leaving the impression of an artificial, chemical aftertaste.
Name: Michael Florentino 2010 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Deliciously round and spicy, this has attractive berry flavors wrapped around a hint of roasted coffee bean. A masculine, intense and layered wine, it has balanced acidity that makes its flavors pop.
Name: McCay Cellars 2009 Jupiter Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Decadently jammed with aromas and flavors of dark plum, blackberry and chocolate, this has subtle layers of black licorice and brawny leather. With small amounts of Syrah and Petit Verdot, this powerhouse gets better in the glass. Chef-turned-vintner Tyler Florence suggests pairing it with osso bucco.
Name: Tyler Florence 2008 TF Zin Hoodoo Creek VIneyard Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This robust and classically rustic Primitivo tastes of dark cherry and just-picked brambly blackberry. A balanced mountain-grown wine, it has a wall of spice around its core, with elements of cinnamon and pepper, finished off by a refreshing twist of mint.
Name: Andis 2010 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Winemaker Michael McCay is an expert at coaxing fine texture out of a big wine. This is a round, soft Zinfandel with bright, vibrant raspberry and blackberry flavors. It may need more time in bottle to reveal its entire personality. In the meantime, enjoy its leather and licorice streaks.
Name: McCay Cellars 2009 Truluck's Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a Claret-like Zinfandel, mellow and simply rendered, with layers of dark cherry, blackberry and lilting spiciness. This would be spectacular with lighter fare like barbecued chicken or grilled turkey burgers.
Name: Graziano 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Super dusty, leathery and big shouldered, this is also quite bright and drinkable. Made using grapes sourced from old vines planted within the Esola Vineyard.
Name: Bella Piazza 2008 Esola Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dense, layered and juicy, this has a good concentration of bright blackberry flavor. The small amounts of Primitivo and Barbera are subtly apparent. With a snap of chocolate on the finish, it's well rounded.
Name: Di Arie 2009 Break Away Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This big, blackberry-infused Zinfandel has plenty of leather, roasted coffee, licorice and tobacco notes coming through. It's medium-bodied and complex, with an herbal hint on the finish.
Name: V. Sattui 2009 Pilgrim Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This intoxicatingly interesting wine is full of rich dark-berry flavors, with streaks of leather and roasted coffee.
Name: Lava Cap 2009 Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Rustic and full bodied, this Oregon Primitivo is plenty ripe, yet it retains nuances of olive and herb, along with thick red fruit. A whisper of smoke weaves through the finish.
Name: Pheasant Valley Winery 2009 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Zinfandel takes time to unlayer, but once it does, the combination of leather and blackberry is tasty, and the finish is pleasantly spicy.
Name: Zinfandelic 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich and ripe, this is an intense and decadent Zinfandel, with highlights of blackberry jam and milk chocolate.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2008 Estate Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Austere and tannic, this savory Primitivo tastes of black cherry and blackberry, with leather overtones.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2010 Sorriso Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Estate-grown from one of the family's oldest Zin blocks, this wine is hugely toasty and oaky, with hits of bacon and dark coffee overshadowing an underlying layer of blackberry flavor.
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2009 Epicenter, Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This thick, dusty and leathery Foothills Zinfandel is ready to drink now with bold, meaty foods.
Name: Bella Piazza 2009 Sleeper Vineyard, Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This tastes of brash dark fruit, sage and coffee. It will appeal to lovers of big wine and pair expertly with pizza—especially with meaty toppings.
Name: Jacuzzi 2010 Primitivo (Lake County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With its dusty, leathery components that are wrapped in sweet tannins this tastes typical. However, it's a little austere in terms of fruit.
Name: Villa Toscano 2009 Centurion, Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This straightforward mountain Zinfandel has big dark-fruit notes and a cherry-­syrup finish, with textures of leather and tobacco.
Name: Four Vines 2010 Maverick Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Thick and heavy, this is Port-like in its toffee and raisin aromas, with a trace of licorice in the background. Its syrupy consistency almost expresses an air of oxidation.
Name: Domenico 2007 Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This old-vine Zinfandel with a dusting of Petite Sirah and Tannat in the blend is stewy, soft and fairly simple.
Name: Gen5 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The berry flavors in this wine are fighting to emerge, but they are overwhelmed by dusty tannins and a lack of texture.
Name: Baron Herzog 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: American oak is the barrel choice, 100% new, and it shows strongly in the nose of this young Zinfandel. The citrusy acids help to balance out the alcohol, and with additional bottle age the score could certainly rise. If you plan to drink this soon, give it plenty of breathing time.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2010 Reserve Zinfandel (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is a complex Lodi old-vine Zinfandel with boysenberry and blackberry notes poking through layers of complexity and a touch of dusty plum. It has a strata of black licorice throughout the midpalate, with a peppery, wild herb flavor keeping it interesting. Notes of espresso and leather mark the finish, and a controlled amount of acidity keeps in balance.
Name: Fields Family 2010 Sherman Family Vineyards Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This potent wine brings the snap and vivid acidity of Washington-grown grapes to the spicy red- and black-berry flavors of this fully ripened Zinfandel. It has cut and verve along with dense fruit, and a finish with smoke, espresso, anise and mineral streaks.
Name: Two Vintners 2009 Stone Tree Vineyard Zinfandel (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A Zin brimming with berry deliciousness, this is lushly fruit forward with a dusty coat and hints of cracked black pepper for good measure. It has a great, long, cocoa-kissed finish.
Name: Red Table Cellars 2009 Corvino Bosco Vineyard Zinfandel (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This has notes of black cherry and smoky tar. It's tannins can barely be wrapped around one's lips on first sip, but let the wine open (and/or age) and its black cherry, berry, coffee and mint components swirl together in exciting ways.
Name: Andis 2010 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an austere, very structured, leathery Zin, with notes of briary black pepper and dark, ripe fruit from start to finish.
Name: Scott Harvey 2009 Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A super bang for the buck, this is brimming with intense mountain blackberry fruit. It's soft, with supple tannins and a long, cocoa-laced finish. Stock up on this for your next outdoor barbecue.
Name: Sobon Estate 2010 Hillside Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Amador Foothill does a nice job with Esola's 67-year-old, dry-farmed Zin, making a wine that has dusty strawberry and cherry goodness interwoven around a toasty, oaky base.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2008 Esola Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rocky Top is one of Sobon's top bottlings, and this one delivers nicely. It has a big, fruity structure, with blackberry and cocoa flavors, particularly on the long finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2009 Rocky Top Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A full-bodied, full-flavored Zin, this is packed with baking spice, classic blackberry and leather notes. It has great length and a spicy finish, and it should please many California Zin fans.
Name: Precedent 2010 Evangelho Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a toasty Zinfandel bursting with aromas and flavors of smoked meat and blackberry jam. Soft, round and easy to drink, this should pair well with barbecue or similarly smoked meats.
Name: Sobon Estate 2009 Fiddletown Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a briary, low-priced Zinfandel that has notes of smoky toast and clove, with dry, mountainous tannins. It's perfumed with aromas of raspberry and violet.
Name: Sobon Estate 2010 Old Vines Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has soft tannins, with heaps of vanilla-cherry and raspberry notes and a herbal hit on the finish that leans green. A blend of 88% Zinfandel, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Teroldego and Barbera from one of Amador's historic producers.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2009 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This opens with an aroma of cola syrup, and it seems devoid of a tannic structure and a finish.
Name: 3 Steves Winery 2009 Zinfandel (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Soft, round and very ripe, this is simple and straightforward, with big, chewy tannins and flavors of cola and cinnamon. Bright on the nose, it is full-bodied and heavy in the mouth, and it screams out for hearty heaps of grilled food.
Name: Windmill 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a simple Zinfandel that tastes of wild-raspberry syrup. It's made from organic grapes.
Name: Green Truck 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A pleasing, complex Zin from the oldest documented Zin vineyard in California, which has belonged to Scott Harvey since 1984. Dusty, with a hint of mint, this structured, berry-flavored wine is medium in weight, with a licorice undertone.
Name: Scott Harvey 2008 1869 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: The art is in the blend here—a commingling of vintages and vineyards. The wine is fruity, fleshy and briary, with a spicy cardamom note on the midpalate and a finely honed texture.
Name: Claudia Springs NV Blend 4 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a big, full Zinfandel that's blended with 19% Petite Sirah and 1% Chardonnay. With the right balance between fruit and spice, the wine is a liquid version of blackberry jam on toast.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2010 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A full, fruity Zinfandel, with dusty tannins and structure. Its lingering finish is laced with notes of chocolate and vanilla. With 7% Petite Sirah mixed in, this would pair nicely with barbecue and other meaty dishes.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2009 Ranch Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from grapes sourced from an inland Mendocino County appellation, this is at first forceful, tannic and dusty, with strong red-berry and blueberry flavors. A tad decadent, it settles down nicely in the glass.
Name: Claudia Springs 2008 Nate's Vineyard Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This smells of subdued strawberry and raspberry, with a twist of violet. It is tightly structured, tasting of brick and tar, and its finish is ripe, brambly and bittersweet.
Name: Claudia Springs 2009 Valenti Ranch Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Amador County's mighty Zin producer Montevina has made a White Zin for White Zin aficionados. This is a pink, simple and slightly sweet wine that many will find refreshing.
Name: Montevina 2011 White Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: From a new Lake County producer, this Zin isn't very aromatic and it shows its alcohol, with an earthy finish.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2009 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A smoky, oaky Zinfandel that's well-endowed, with a fuller-than-full body and a taste of bacon on the finish.
Name: LangeTwins 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: From old vines dating to 1865, this is a hugely fragrant mountainous Zinfandel, with an abundance of raspberry and blackberry flavors. A wine with a huge presence and soft, rounded tannins, it's extremely yummy with a ton of peppery spice on the long finish.
Name: Easton 2009 Rinaldi Vineyard Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An excellent Zin—this has an invitingly soft floral nose, mountainous black-fruit flavors and structure and plenty of depth. This should age nicely over the next 3–5 years, but it is delicious to drink now, too.
Name: Easton 2010 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a proper El Dorado Zin. It's still tight and tannic, but air and time reveal a lovely bouquet of lavender and crushed herbs that's layered, soft and spicy on the finish. Miraflores is making some lovely wines and this is one worth seeking out.
Name: Miraflores 2009 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine won't be available until 2013/2014, but for the moment it is a mouthful of extremely ripe blackberry and blueberry jam, with layers of tar and dirt. Big and ripe, the additional time in bottle will help smooth out its edges.
Name: Easton 2009 Estate Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Made from Sierra Foothills Zinfandel, this smells of grapes dried in the sun. This is delicately balanced, with just the right level of thickness and sweetness. Enjoy with plummy desserts or dark chocolate.
Name: Easton 2009 Late-Harvest Obscura Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This approachable, easy-drinking wine will please a range of different palates. Made by Napa-based winemaker Jamey Whetstone, it has soft red-fruit flavor and a big finish.
Name: Manifesto! 2009 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A rustic, earthy and soft Zinfandel that's priced attractively. It has the right amount of blackberry fruit and fistfuls of bacon and toasty oak.
Name: Chessman 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cherries and chocolate are the hallmark of the Zins at Maryhill. The fruit is pretty and the chocolate smooth, certainly a crowd-pleasing style. The finish is clean and supple.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Fiddletown Zin has a sweet graham cracker and marshmallow quality about it, soft and round in the middle, and a finish that's long and a touch green.
Name: Easton 2009 E Estate Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This sleek and herbal Zinfandel shows good balance, matching tart red fruits against suggestions of dried leaves and spices. There is a smooth, chocolate and vanilla coating that masks the bitter edge on the finish.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A young Zin still in need of time to develop, there's an intensity of raspberry and blackberry fruit in this wine, and a softness throughout. It's full bodied, and its finish falls flat.
Name: Artezin 2010 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A hit-you-upside-the-head, floral Zin, with mountain tannins, and big blackberry and savory leather flavors. Over time, the alcohol takes over.
Name: Chatom Vineyards 2008 Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe and fruity, this forward, candied wine is for those who love ultraripe Zinfandel berry flavors, set in rich baking spices. It's full, forward and powerful, but carries a whiff of burnt rubber and some serious heat in the finish.
Name: Sineann 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Yorba is doing the world of Zin lovers a huge favor by holding its wines in bottle for longer than most producers, and what you get for all that waiting is a wine ready to drink that's still got plenty of structure and ageability. This Zin shows great depth, with subdued fruit and darker flavors of plum and coffee allowed to shine, rounded out by an intensity of spice.
Name: Yorba 2007 Shake Ridge Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: If only more California Primitivo could be made in this style - soft, lower in alcohol, modestly showing its fruit - there would be more converts among Zin fanatics, who would be wowed by the subtle black cherry and licorice flavors and dry finish, minimally aged in oak.
Name: Uvaggio 2010 Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Cedarville is loved for its Syrah and Grenache but it can expertly handle its estate Zinfandel too—grown at 2,500-foot elevation—This smoky, raspberry-wrapped, silky wine is full of big, round mountain tannins yet somehow manages to be light on its feet on the finish. Have it with sticky ribs.
Name: Cedarville 2009 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromatically, this wine takes some time to open, but in taste it's structured, pretty and very floral, with smooth lines of cherry and red raspberry that defy its high alcohol level. Made by Renwood Winery in Amador County, it's a very good value.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2009 Grandmere Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A big Zin with juicy dark cherry and blackberry jammy-ness and a slight hint of cedar and clove. This wine is a chance to open but is a nice showpiece for Ruby Hill's love of and prowess with big, ripe Zins.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2009 Peacock Patch Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Clements Hills is an up and coming subregion within Lodi and the grapes for this wine have been sourced from three Clements Hills vineyards. The wine has its rustic side but is also savory, with dark plum and berry fruit flavors and a toasty note at the end. The Chelonian Research Foundation, for which this wine is named, is devoted to the conservation of turtles and tortoises, and portions of the wine's proceeds will be donated.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2010 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Perry Creek's popular, well-priced Zinman shows off leathery, cola spice and blackberry flavors and fruit that's just at the precipice between ripe and overripe nice structure.
Name: Perry Creek 2009 Zinman Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This majority Zin with 18% Petite Sirah is a popular, widely available choice for many Zin loves. Its concentrated fists of sweetness—vanilla and cherry-based mostly—are hits with many consumers.
Name: Gnarly Head 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: No doubt Michael-David is going for a certain style with Earthquake, describing it as “over the top and shattering to the veins.” Indeed. This Lodi Zin will knock your socks and several other pieces of clothing off with its smoky, greasy, hot and sweet berry pie flavors, with a side of bacon to boot. True to its style, this is one very big boy.
Name: Earthquake 2010 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This old-vine Lodi Zin features caramel, vanilla and cherry notes. Most unusually, it's blended with tiny amounts of Viognier and Sauvignon Blanc and is fairly light bodied and sweet on the finish.
Name: Campus Oaks 2008 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A field blend from the DeMayo Vineyard, believed to be mostly Zin and Petite Sirah. The resulting wine doesn't show much of its provenance or history, just a smidgen of spice but only fruit and modest of flavor.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2009 DeMayo Vineyard Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A young, plummy Zin that's lightly sweet, with blackberry jam, vanilla and caramel notes.
Name: Salvatore Principe 2010 Blue Groove Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy cranberry fruit leads, sharp-edged and tight. This remains a tightly-focused Zinfandel, clearly Washington in style rather than California, with bright acidity and hints of herb and stem in the finish.
Name: Trio Vintners 2009 Far Away Vineyard Zinfandel (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright and concentrated raspberry fruit is the hallmark of this Washington Zinfandel, with the acidity it needs to support almost 16% alcohol. High-toned and juicy, the fruit shines, though the finish turns chalky.
Name: Animale 2009 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: That this small-lot Lodi producer has ventured out to the Russian River Valley for Zinfandel says something here and it says it with finesse, this being austere for Zin, not jammy, with enviable structure and a nice lift of black cherry, spicy cola and earth at the end.
Name: McCay Cellars 2008 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Why yes this is mountain Zin with a lot of Dr. Pepper, sarsaparilla happening aromatically and then a mouthful of thick, savory, herbal, raspberry jam with soft tannins and a just-right note of earthiness too.
Name: Deaver 2008 Old Vine 1867 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Beaver Creek's Lake County Zin is juicy and spicy, full of stewy red fruit and rough-hewn tannins that are thick and fragrant of oak and molasses. Definitely big though well made for its style. Time and air are its friends.
Name: Beaver Creek 2008 Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Juicy with brambly raspberry fruit with a slight herbal note, Deaver's Henry House is full and fleshy with soft tannins and ready to drink now.
Name: Deaver 2008 Henry's House Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very ripe Zin with dry, dusty tannins and a taste of cherry liqueur, its alcohol ever-present. It's got good bones for its style.
Name: Deaver 2008 Signature Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The Lake County producer travels to Dry Creek for this Zin with good results. The wine has a lot of cherry cola and a hint of oaky smoke, its tannins well integrated into flavors of nuts and mint and an herbal finish.
Name: Beaver Creek 2008 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Michael David is going outside of Lodi to make this, for them, small-production wine, sourced from vineyards near Hopland owned and run by the Nelson family. It remains true to the MD style having spent 15 months in American oak with blackberry pie, a handful of earth and spicy cinnamon on the finish. Fleshy and full and thick as syrup.
Name: Michael David 2009 Sloth Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Amador Zin has Lodi producer Michael David's signature bacon and oak, its 17 months in American oak having no place to hide. The wine's blackberry fruit tastes full, its tannins chewy. High-alcohol California mountain Zin at its most intense concentration.
Name: Michael David 2009 Gluttony Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Nothing small about this wine. A super-dark, ripe, juicy Zin full of oak and bacon flavors, lusty in every imaginable way, but not for everyone. Aged 18 months in American oak and edging into Port territory, drink this in moderation or have a nap spot picked out nearby.
Name: Michael David 2009 Lust Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The label will appeal to anyone interested in peace, love and understanding. The wine, with its bright fruit notes of raspberry and cherry, medium in weight, could have used a little more magic.
Name: Zinfandelic 2008 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A very minty old vine Zin from organically farmed grapes that tastes of not-quite-ripe strawberry jam and is otherwise smooth and peppery.
Name: McFadden 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An okay, light- to medium-weight Zinfandel that veers into stewy flavors and aromas before falling a tad flat on the finish.
Name: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2009 Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nana was probably a wonderful woman but this Zin is a little musky, closed off and chewy with a taste of cherry cordial and baked plum jam.
Name: Deaver 2008 Nana's Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This high-alcohol mountain Zin seems to have already lost its zip, dominated by a raisiny overripeness that skirts dangerously into syrup land.
Name: Deaver 2008 Ten Zin Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Angel Vine sources excellent fruit, and makes what is arguably the most hedonistic, California-style Zinfandel in the Northwest. Here blended with 13% Primitivo, the sweet and liquorous berry fruit flavors are deep and luxurious. Buttressed with juicy natural acidity, this wine does not show its 14.8% alcohol.
Name: Angel Vine 2009 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Yes this is a big boy but its chocolate and espresso mixed with dark caramel are so well defined, so bold that anyone looking for a serious example of mountain Primitivo need look no farther. The wine's cherry flavors are vibrantly balanced between an intensity of layered darkness and complexity.
Name: Sobon Estate 2009 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Full of red fruit, light and bright at first, then denser in flavor with savory notes amidst Zin's cherry-berry deliciousness. Grown on the Talmage Bench east of Hopland in Mendocino County, where a number of great Zins are born.
Name: Martella 2010 Mattern Ranch Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Significantly lighter than its companion Zins, this stylish effort shows the strawberry side of the versatile grape. Textural and nicely balanced, it is substantial enough to still be drinking quite well a full 24 hours after first being opened.
Name: Angel Vine 2009 Les Collines Vineyard Zinfandel (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Soft and dense with dark fruit, almost baked fruit flavors, that veer into nuts and vanilla, an easy-drinking Zin blended with a smidge of Zin from the 2009 and 2010 vintages as well as 7% Petite Sirah crafted by a Lodi producer to watch.
Name: McCay Cellars 2008 Equity Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: No doubt this is mountain grown Zin, still tight but revealing nice aromatics of cherry and spicy licorice on the finish, accompanied by a healthy helping of espresso, wrapped in smooth tannins all around. Should only get better over the next year or two.
Name: Andis 2009 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: From this Temecula producer, a barrel selection of plum and black cherry Zinfandel with good depth and structure that's still got some tannins to work out but is ready to drink now.
Name: Lorenzi Estate 2008 Barrel Select Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A still-closed, tannic, mountainous Zinfandel giant from the great grower, Deaver. It's marked deliciously by tobacco and dark plum.
Name: Deaver 2008 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: From the land of the old vine Zinfandel grapes comes Bacio, a Port-in-color dessert Zinfandel that's got some nice baked fruit flavors and a taste of dust; its sweetness lingers and a little goes a long way.
Name: Lorenzi Estate NV Bacio Zinfandel Dessert Wine Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A rough-and-tumble style, full throttle, with throat-burning cherry fruit, chocolate and plenty of alcohol.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2009 Howling Wolfe Zinfandel (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Clear Lake, Lake County, California, US
Description: Either this producer is one of the most honest when it comes to listing alcohol levels or this is as close to Port as it gets, a Primitivo that's got some cherry brightness to it, but gets bogged down by its own bigness.
Name: Rosa d'Oro 2009 Estate Primitivo (Clear Lake)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: In a giant-sized 750 ml bottle, this Zin is flat and tastes higher in alcohol than it is.
Name: Moss Roxx 2006 Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A great value Zin from Amador. It's a briary, meaty, mountain version of America's grape with plenty of pepper to please. Grab a slab of ribs for this one.
Name: Four Vines 2009 Maverick Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very herbal Zin from a five-acre Oakley plot, funky and stewy at first, then rich, full-bodied with a lot of caramel and toffee going on. A great deal at $16 for big Zin lovers.
Name: Rock Wall 2009 Live Oak Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A gigantic, tannic monster of a Zin with full fruit flavors of cranberry, ripe plum and plenty of oak. Well-made for certain, with cigar and licorice.
Name: Sobon Estate 2008 ReZerve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: No mistaking the American oak that's been wrapped around this wine, lending a fennel sweetness to its otherwise juicy red fruit. The 15.8% alcohol is also quite, shall we say, present.
Name: Klinker Brick 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: True to Amador's brawnier style, this Zin is still tightly tannic but shows ripe black cherry and blackberry flavor with plenty of dark chocolate and cocoa powder. Made from old-vine, sustainably grown grapes, it's priced fairly and should open with age. Pair with a thick piece of meat.
Name: Sobon Estate 2008 Rocky Top Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A strongly briary old vine Zin from Lodi that's strangely restrained, with a taste of just-ripe blackberries that delves into bacon fat and mocha before falling off a tad at the finish. Decent volume and body on this wine, which is priced fairly and probably fairly easy to find.
Name: OZV 2008 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An attractive price for a straightforward, Amador County Zin, full-bodied and tasting of ripe blackberries and cocoa.
Name: Shenandoah 2010 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Chiles Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A brawny, cherry flavored Zinfandel, big shouldered all around with dense, leathery spicy aromas and flavors, with hints of licorice and bittersweet chocolate. Estate bottled and grown in Napa's Chiles Valley.
Name: RustRidge 2007 Estate Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: There are brambly, wild cherry aromas and flavors in this wine, as well as a little cocoa, but this Sierra Foothills Zin is still fairly tight and hard to tell which direction it will go from here. A majority (80%) Zin, there's also 20% Syrah that was cofermented with Viognier in the blend.
Name: Verde Sole 2009 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: There's no hiding the 24 months in French oak this Zin spent after growing up in an organic and dry-farmed vineyard. Medium to heavyweight it's all about ripe strawberry and blackberry, sweet to the point of being in a pie, rounded out by graham cracker and a fine fruit liqueur.
Name: Simaine Cellars 2008 Larry Venturi Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: At 15.9% alcohol, aged 14 months in American oak, this Zin is for those who like a mouthful of hardcore meaty, gamy, oaky intensity. From old vines grown near the Mokelumne River.
Name: Klinker Brick 2009 Old Ghost Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With vanilla, red fruit and sassafras showing up at first in this wine, this Mendocino Zin, moderate in alcohol and tannin, doesn't taste quite finished, its ending bland and a bit sweet.
Name: Castle Rock 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: El Dorado County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A new vineyard source for Newsome-Harlow and arguably its best single-vineyard designated Zin out of a lineup of superbly delicious Zins. With a heady raspberry and blackberry nose, this Zin is classically lush and intense yet silky smooth in the mouth, tinged by hints of black pepper and licorice. Altogether so, so good.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2009 Herbert Vineyard, Old Vine Zinfandel (El Dorado County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The Dalton Vineyard is a beloved and prized source for winemaker Scott Klann. A cellar-worthy Zin with a floral nose of violets and earthy, blue fruit that segues slowly into structured tannins, bleedingly ripe plum notes and a spicy, almost leathery finish. The enological equivalent of Kurt Cobain acoustic in a thrift-store sweater, its raw power just waiting for a chance to surge.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2009 The Donner Party, Dalton Vineyard Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big John is as big and strong as its name, with bacony, briary flavors and yet magically very refined and subtle in a way, like Nina Simone singing a sultry ballad full of melancholy and mirth. A pleasantly pronounced kiss of vanilla finishes things off. Pair with spicy sausage and other meats.
Designation: Big John, Big John's Vineyard Zin
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2009 Big John, Big John's Vineyard Zin Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Chuck Hovey is the longtime winemaker for Stevenot Winery and this is his own small label based out of Murphys. His Barbera has been a standout up to now but this, his first Hovey Zinfandel, should turn heads as well. Cofermented with 15% Petite Sirah, its aromas of strawberry, blackberry and vanilla will sweep you off your feet and its clean, rich flavors of mocha with just a trace of pepper will do you in for good. This wine'll age, its tannins tight and chewy still.
Name: Hovey 2009 Dragone Ranch Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Winemaker Scott Klann does Calaveras County proud with this Zin from several area vineyards, its fruit slightly more subdued at first than in his single-vineyard efforts but still buzzing with raspberry and blueberry goodness, plenty of Zinny spice and a rocking, savory finish.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2009 Zinfandel (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Newsome-Harlow's Shake Ridge is true to its famous Foothills vineyard source year after year and 2009 is no exception. The wine is a little muted at first, gamey even, with looming, site-specific, tarry structure. Give it a rest and it should open up in beautiful ways, its big, blueberry bones impeccably tamed.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2009 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A subdued Mountain Zin at first, surprising given its power. It hits you first with nice licorice flavors, its tannins mellow and tight, and just the right amount of jammy fruit. A mouthful that sometimes doesn't hit too hard.
Name: Lava Cap 2008 Spring House Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: For $9 a nice wine in a nice package, made from old-vine Zinfandel from Lodi. The red fruit on the nose pops out pleasantly followed by smooth tannins and a fruity, chocolaty mix of flavors.
Designation: Take Flight, Artists Collection Limited Edition
Name: Salvatore Principe 2009 Take Flight, Artists Collection Limited Edition Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is Michael David's flagship Zin, a mighty production that's popular and well-priced at $16. Full of big, ripe flavors of bacon, black fruit and toasty oak, it's plummy, juicy, full-octane-flavored, peppery, all you want in a Zin of this style.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Although the blend includes 20% Primitivo and 5% Petite Sirah, which might be expected to add some tannic muscle to the wine, this is a simple red quaffer, with light raspberry fruit and a hint of milk chocolate.
Name: Troon 2009 Kubli Bench Zinfandel (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A big bottle of uber-sweet strawberry pie and blackberries right before they get mushy. The aromas are not terribly inviting from the outset. Fairly neutral in taste, then veers sweet.
Name: Glen Ellen 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This old-vine Zin tastes of tar and overripe fruit and is blandly sweet.
Name: Sharabella Wines 2009 Artistica Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very spicy, thick mountain-fruit Zin that shows a fantastic balance between blackberry fruit and peppery, briary-ness with dark chocolate showing up on the finish. An elegant Zin from a producer striving to do good things in its little pocket of the Sierra Foothills' world. It's priced well.
Name: C.G. di Arie 2008 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine from the hills above Anderson Valley needed time to open but once it did it revealed itself to be a very good, cool-climate version of the variety. This is full of blackberry and peppery spice, its high acidity perfect for a range of food.
Name: Philo Ridge 2007 Bliss Ranch Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An inviting old-vine Zin with classically big, dry tannins and an overwhelming nose of alcohol at first that blows off into a dense, chewy, black-fruit wine that'll appeal to Zin lovers, its two years in French oak giving it some lift and complexity in texture. Lingering finish, too.
Name: Scott Harvey 2007 Old Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Sierra Foothills Primitivo smells good, lively and of dark, berries, which carry into the taste of the wine. Well-integrated and the alcohol reined in, this effort finishes with a lasting note of cocoa.
Name: C.G. di Arie 2008 Estate Grown, Block 4 Primitivo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Daryl Groom is making these wines from Livermore Valley vineyards mostly and the wine is no doubt big in every way—15.6% alcohol with big tannins and big black, spicy fruit flavors hiding in there at first. It definitely needs time to open. And a giant, slathered-in-sauce kind of steak or other red meat.
Name: Foggy Bridge 2009 GEO Zinfandel (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very nicely priced Zin from 66-year-old, dry-farmed Sierra Foothills vines that has an intense spiciness right from the get-go and is appropriately tannic and meaty, big and classic for its historical roots. Plum, blackberry and tobacco predominate and already with four years of age, this one could age more.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2007 Esola Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Noceto is a Sangiovese specialist in the Sierra Foothills but does a nice job with Zinfandel here, sourcing from the "original" Grandpere Vineyard, which dates back to the 1860s and which the winery says may be the oldest producing Zin vineyard in the world. The wine is classic old-vine, good and juicy with blackberry predominant, but also tannic and brambly, dusty even, with a hint of mint.
Name: Noceto 2007 OGP - The Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Jelly Jar's Lake County old-vine Zin is jam-packed with dusty tannins and briary black fruit but the finish is slightly uneven. Love the package though.
Name: Jelly Jar 2009 Nova Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A big, full yet nicely balanced old-vine Zin with the variety's spiciness front and center and fine notes of cherry and plum.
Name: Rubus 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: KJ's Mendocino County Zin has both red and black berry fruit flavor and the spiciness one expects from dry-farmed Mendocino County vineyards, though the tannins stick around a bit longer than one might like. Cedar definitely shows up on the finish.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2009 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An austere, savory Zin from Amador, one of the smaller-production Zinfandels from Renwood and it shows. Firm tannins, dusty black fruit and spice—a good option for Sierra Foothills Zin fans.
Name: Renwood 2008 Jack Rabbit Flat Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Haraszthy's old-vine wine has a good Zin nose and great mouthfeel and just the right balance of spice and plumminess. Medium in weight it's not heavy-handed the way old-vine Zin can often be, tasting of just-ripe blackberries, but the spice that's so nice throughout doesn't stick around for the finish.
Name: Haraszthy 2008 Lodi Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Paul Dolan has been making some great wines from his patch of biodynamic Mendocino farmland but this Zin didn't deliver the wealth of flavors many of his others have, muted aromatically and the tannins a touch stewy. Best with boldly flavored foods around the barbecue or campfire.
Name: Paul Dolan 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Yeasty at first, this Lodi Zin from Napa's Cosentino Winery is dense and on the clove and ultraripe blackberry side of the Zin spectrum, decently simple in its intensity.
Name: M. Cosentino 2008 The Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This estate-grown inland Mendocino Zin has an inviting spiciness and is plenty briary with a full body of flavor but its high-alcohol level masks any other nuances.
Name: Nelson Family Vineyards 2007 Estate Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A big and intense Zin with a pucker that holds on, this Livermore red is heavy and a bit dull aromatically, opening up to show spice, black fruit and cedar but overall it finishes short.
Name: Cedar Mountain 2009 Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Something is lacking in this, which has a dominant aroma of baked bread and savory mushrooms. Tannic and oaky, its year spent in American oak, 30% of that new, hasn't done it many favors.
Name: Jacuzzi 2009 Primitivo (Lake County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Tight and tannic, like red brick, bread and caramel, this Lodi Primitivo has 5% Barbera mixed in but the entire effort tastes of not-quite-ripe blackberries.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2009 Sorriso Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: One must strain to smell the ripe plum at first in this wine that is otherwise more tannic than juicy or flavorful. Buoyed by American oak and a dash or two of Syrah and Petite Sirah it's rightly priced.
Name: Zynthesis 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Funky with prune and tobacco overwhelming any fresher fruit, this Livermore Zin is high in alcohol (15.8%), which coats the tongue for a long time after the wine goes down.
Name: Cedar Mountain 2007 Hansen Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Fiddletown Zin, a yearly offering from Renwood, has a slight burnt smell of strong coffee and a burn on its finish, perhaps due to the high alcohol.
Name: Renwood 2008 Fiddletown Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This mountain Zin is aromatically akin to flat cola and alcohol, its tannins towering over the fruit like fortress bullies.
Name: Scott Harvey 2008 Mountain Selection Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: The back of the label on this heavy bottle says about the wine that it is, “intentionally hostile” and they are not kidding. At 16% alcohol it's huge, alcoholic, juicy and fleshy with bacon fat and bologna aromas. A bit dull to many, hostile and full of flavor to others.
Name: Earthquake 2009 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This usually solid producer hasn't made anything special here, this Lodi zin's aromas veering into questionable metallic areas, though on the palate the wine has some fruit.
Name: Joel Gott 2007 Mohr-Fry Ranches Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Low in price, high in quantity, low in quality. Dry and tannic with an off taste, the wine doesn't get better with time.
Name: Renwood 2007 Red Label Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a tremendously inviting price for a wine of this caliber, super structured and tight at first with chewy tannins and savory plum and chocolate on the palate. Concentrated, this Zin could stand a little time in the cellar, 3–5 years, or let it breathe awhile if you just have to drink it now.
Name: Easton 2009 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Plenty of dark plum and blackberry going on here, from a Zin sourced from two organically farmed vineyards. Low berry weights from the dry vintage have contributed to a concentrated wine here, with soft tannins and some spiciness, an overall balanced wine.
Name: Saracina 2009 Pick and Shovel Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Bonterra continues to make great wines at affordable prices, all from organically grown grapes. With blueberry pie and clove predominating, the wine is tannic, super-structured, with a spicy finish. A good deal for sure.
Name: Bonterra 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Impressive for a $12 Old Vine Zin, this wine is spicy and full of pepper, much more savory than sweet with plenty of texture midpalate and decent length. Definitely full-bodied, it'll stand up to a plethora of rich foods and even age another couple of years.
Name: Sobon Estate 2009 Old Vines Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Classic in style with raspberry and spice dominating, the wine overall is supple and lush.
Name: Artezin 2009 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A sweet Lodi Zin with much chocolate and mint from beginning to end.
Name: Grands Amis Winery 2008 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Horse & Plow turns out so many lovely wines it's heartbreaking not to include this one in the mix. It was sourced from one of the great organic Mendocino vineyards, old vines no less, but there just wasn't much there, the wine tasting tight without much fruit.
Name: Horse & Plow 2009 Testa Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A little too sweet on the finish to recommend it as a balanced wine, this Gnarly Head from Lodi's old vines has about 16% Petite Sirah in it, too.
Name: Gnarly Head 2009 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Yes, there are notes of sweet plum and pepper, but otherwise the wine is soft, with wafts of bacon and meat, the smooth tannins a tad dull.
Name: Seven Deadly Zins 2008 Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: John Chiarito is making Italian varieties like Nero d'Avola and Negro Amaro––as well as estate-grown Petite Sirah and Zinfandel––on the outskirts of Ukiah, from his basement winery. There he combines an Old-World sensibility with New World techniques. He's nailing it here with a rustic, tannic but intensely delicious Zin full of berry aromas and a spicy finish. Big and hearty, this wine has soul.
Name: Chiarito 2007 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A bigger, chewier, deliciously made version of Miraflores estate bottling, the Herbert Vineyard is dry and smooth, a Zin of blackberry and pepper notes throughout with a finish that could go on for days. Made by Marco Cappelli, who bought the Frank Herbert Vineyard in the town of Fair Play in 2002.
