Description: Forward, fruity and clean, with a jokey label showing a moose, an elk and a sheep playing pool. This wine would make a great house Zin if the price were just a tad lower.
Name: Meeker 1997 Eighth Rack Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Tannic, alcoholic nose, with a softer, rosier color tending toward brick. Old vines, soft, sweet, ancient flavors. The wine feels a little bit pushed — the alcohol is too high, and the finish is harsh, tannic and hot.
Name: Edmeades 1998 Zeni Zinfandel (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Cortina refers to the soil type. The wine shows forward, pretty fruit, mixing berries and cherries, and follows up with bright, clean, mouth-friendly flavors. Falls off in the finish, with some dry tannins.
Name: Seghesio 1998 Cortina Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, from a newly acquired property, is tart and young, grapy almost, with the fruit a little reduced. The wine seems to be in hiding. It falls off in the middle and finishes with tannin and little else. This may just need more time in bottle to blossom.
Name: Peachy Canyon 1998 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smooth style, with lots of vanilla cream and ripe berry fruit. Forward, inviting style of wine, with light tannins and a clean, focused finish. It's well balanced and professionally made, but ultimately unexciting.
Name: La Crema 1998 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Firm, tannic and fruity, with some nice tropical fruit flavors, wrapped around stiff tannins and some green, slightly stemmy flavors. The finish is hard and rough.
Name: Castle 1998 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smells very ripe, almost stewed, and it lives up to its name (The Monster) with big, rustic, extracted, alcoholic flavors. For those who like old-style Zin, with no-holds-barred power.
Name: Norman 1998 Monster Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is the first wine from this new winery. Clean, light berry fruit is the whole show, and it's a forward, fruity Zin with friendly, simple flavors.
Name: Venus 1998 Cervina Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This gets the award for the most confusing label of the month. It says Vigil “Tradicion” and also names the vineyard, then writes Mokelumne River Old Vines, and finishes with Lodi. Talk about information overload! Bottom line: it's a fruity, oaky, simple and straightforward bottle of Zin. 'Nuff said.
Name: Vigil 1998 Marissa Vineyard Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Cranberries and watermelon in the nose, leading into a soft, light, pleasant wine. Smooth and simple flavors; the wine needs to be chilled to show its best. This is made for near-term enjoyment.
Name: Brutocao 1998 Brutocao Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Firm, fruity wine, with good clean varietal flavors. Simple and ripe, with a big, tannic finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 1998 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Thick, chewy, cherry fruit, with lots of wood behind it. Simple, forward and quite pleasant, without pretension.
Name: Boeger 1997 Walker Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Alcoholic, volatile nose, with some pickley edges to it. The wine is smooth and fruity, with a quick, hot, alcoholic finish and very dry tannins.
Name: Sobon Estate 1998 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Some earthy elements mingle with the fruit, which has a ripe tomato edge. Good structure, without the harshness or heat that affects so many '97s. If anything, it's a little underripe, with bell pepper, beet and earthy flavors.
Name: Martin & Weyrich 1997 Dante Dusi Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Plenty of herbal, mushroomy notes in the nose. The wine is light, soft and fruity. The mushroom flavors could be a real asset with the right food. Finishes true to form, with nothing off.
Name: Talus 1998 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A very oaky nose leads into a tough, tannic wine. There's good fruit under all the wood and tannin, and the tight, rugged finish should smooth out in time.
Name: Windsor 1997 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A dense purple color, with jammy, grapy fruit. Plenty of extraction, yielding a grapy, fruity wine with a little bit of fizz to it. The wine promises more depth than it delivers; the finish falls off quickly and feels flat.
Name: Sonora 1998 Story Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Beaucoup d'oak. Delicious, toasty, roasty, mocha-flavored oak. But the fruit is missing in action. The color suggests that there is some light, plummy fruit underlying all the oak, but it's hiding.
Name: Saviez 1998 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Gamy flavors distinguish this wine, giving it a Rhônish flair. There's a good, meaty mouthfeel, red berries and cherries, with lots of tang. The finish falls off quickly though, making for a fairly light impression overall.
Name: Foppiano 1998 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dark and deep purple/black, with a Port-like nose. There's a little fizz on the palate, which seems odd in a wine this big, and the flavors are locked in tight. Flat, dry, tannic finish.
Name: Sonora 1998 TC Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Nonvintage juice at an amazing price. It's not going to knock your favorite Zin off the shelf, but as a house pour for spaghetti and meatballs-style cooking, it would do just fine. It has some sweet, tomato-juice flavors and a fair bit of concentration in the finish.
Name: Barefoot Cellars NV Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A peppery nose, tart wine, with plenty of acid, perhaps too much acid. The mouthfeel is awkward, unbalanced, and the finish is odd. It tastes over-manipulated.
Name: Perry Creek 1998 Zin Man Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Starts out nice, with a good, fruity raspberry nose, but on the palate are tastes of tomatoes, with a dry, astringent, tannic finish.
Name: Newlan 1997 Wallstrum Family Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft, plum and cherry fruit scents, augmented with hints of rose petal and cranberry. In the mouth it's lean and insubstantial, with a hard, tannic finish.
Name: Mill Creek 1998 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very interesting wine from a rarely-seen appellation. The fruit is distinctly wild berry—huckleberry maybe—with spice and good acid. But the finish has a bitter, metallic note that lingers unpleasantly.
Name: Joullian 1997 Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Simple and fruity and forward, though still unbalanced from extreme youth. It's more like a Beaujolais nouveau, with an odd, disjointed, watery finish. The price seems way out of line for what's in the bottle.
Name: Alexander Valley Vineyards 1999 Sin Zin Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Smells like a shootout in a tomato factory. It's a strong whiff of tomatoes on the vine, followed by tannin and a little sweet, grapy fruit.
Name: Bella Vigna 1998 Costa Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Dark, brick colored wine, heavily oxidized, with nutty, smoky, Madeira-like flavors, and thick, dry tannins. An odd, raisiny approach to Zin.
Name: Maison Basque 1997 Black Zinfandel Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Simple fruit and a sweet, almost candied flavor. This wine seems unbalanced. There's an odd hole in the middle, and very little weight or tannin in the finish. It's all forward, sweet fruit, more like candy than berries.
Name: Buffalo Ridge 1998 French Camp Zinfandel (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plummy, ripe, beginning to oxidize. Ready to drink right now, it's got a leafy, tomato flavor to it. Unusual.
Name: Meeker 1997 Gold Leaf Cuvee Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Spicy black fruit, with bell pepper, black pepper and toast adding complexity. Partial whole-berry fermentation brings an element of spicy, forward fruitiness to the wine. Lively mouthfeel, with some heat and lift to the finish. If there were more depth and punch to the fruit, this would warrant an even higher rating.
Name: Green & Red 1998 Chiles Mill Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Ripe, muscular wine, with a full throttle nose rich with jammy black fruits. Firm structure, smooth tannins, and a chocolaty finish make this an appealing, consumer-friendly style.
Name: Stonehedge 1997 Reserve Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 80% Zinfandel and 20% Petite Sirah. The nose is forward, with rich, ripe scents of plummy fruit and zingy spice. This is a lively, tart, zippy wine with attractive flavors. The fruit mingles plums, apples and berries; it's distinctive-very spicy and fairly lightweight, but still quite flavorful.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 1998 Burgess Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Right from the start it's a tad different. There's a light apple-skin color similar to Pinot Noir, and brambly, cedar-like aromatics. Just the opposite of a rich, jammy Zin, this is a cruiserweight with spice galore—it actually borders on being a bit too piquant and sharp. An untamed Zin with a lot going on.
Name: Tarius 1998 Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Funky and spicy; clearly shows the influence of the old field blend of the Pagani Ranch. Earthy berry and cranberry notes show higher acidity than Ridge's or St. Francis's Pagani bottlings. A bit lean and tannic, which seem to be common elements with other Topolos Zins.
Name: Topolos 1997 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Copious red raspberry fruit is backed up nicely by toasty, pencilly oak. Bright, with higher acidity than many Zins, making it very food-friendly. Yum.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 1997 Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Like an English breakfast, with toast, black tea, and berry jam commingling in a pleasant whole. Fruity, clean and solid all the way through. Best Buy.
Name: Edgewood 1996 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Starts off soft and round, with good blackberry—almost plummy—fruit. Shows more structure on the finish as some mild, but dry, tannins assert themselves. Should drink well for up to five years.
Name: Pedroncelli 1997 Mother Clone Special Vyd. Sele Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Some toast and vanilla flavors blend nicely with tart berries to make a pleasant everyday Zin. Finishes with some of the spice notes you expect in quality Zinfandel. Nicely balanced and easy to drink.
Name: Lolonis 1997 Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Jammy and grapey, there's enough friendly fruit to fill your mouth and draw a smile. Mild oak spice and a Zin-typical brambly quality. Not a thriller, but steady and sturdy. A good Zinfandel for neophytes—after a couple of sips they'll know what Zin is about.
Name: Armida 1998 Maple Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Don't let the relatively light color deceive you—this Zin packs in a lot of flavor. Starts with plenty of cedary, pencilly oak aromas, then folds in tart cranberry fruit on the palate. A lighter, oaky style that brings a sense of elegance to a varietal known more for being a bruiser.
Name: Brutocao 1996 Bliss Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Shows distinctive ripe berry and tomato aromas. Intense and flavorful, but the tomato-herb components come on strong, making it something of a love-it-or-hate-it wine.
Name: Tobin James 1997 James Gang Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Like most Souverain wines, this one is lavishly oaked—the nose emphasizes chocolate and toast aromas. But there's enough raspberry fruit to back up the oak treatment, and it finishes well.
Name: Château Souverain 1997 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard, planted in 1910, has yielded a moderately concentrated wine full of cranberry and earth flavors. Has crisp acidity in keeping with the Topolos house style, yet tastes fuller than their other bottlings.
Name: Topolos 1997 Rossi Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A deep, rich berry-and-earth nose with some tomato notes segues into a rather tart cherry-and-herb palate. Odd, but not unpleasant. Drink now, in case it turns more herbal and strange with age.
Name: Tobin James 1997 Commemorative Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's a slight gaminess to this wine that makes it more interesting than your average Zin. Also some black-pepper and licorice notes that add complexity. A solid effort at a fair price. Best Buy.
Name: Sausal 1997 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Some may call it personal prejudice, but I've yet to taste a Monte Rosso Zin that excited me (and yes, this was tasted and rated blind). This one is full of jammy berry fruit and features a tomato-leaf component. Verges on being too sweetly fruity.
Name: Villa Mt. Eden 1997 Monte Rosso Vineyard Grand Res Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Sharp, tightly wound raspberry fruit on a clean but dry frame. A little lean and leathery; the tannins grab hold and don't let go. Simple, straight-ahead California red wine blended from grapes grown in Napa, El Dorado and San Joaquin counties.
Name: Clos du Val 1997 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Bright red-berry fruit is light and appealing; only a green-hay note impinges on what is otherwise a clean, pleasant quaff.
Name: Mountain View 1996 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Strawberry jam, with a slightly overcooked quality and a hint of stewed prunes. It's a bit light, lean and finishes short, but still provides acceptable flavor interest.
Name: Il Cuore 1996 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A fine example of the Rosenblum style, showing ripe, jammy red-raspberry and chocolate aromas and flavors. A fair amount of drying French oak pops up on the finish, along with surprisingly high acidity.
Name: Rosenblum 1997 Samsel Vyd Maggie's Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Almost two years in French oak has left a strong imprint on this wine—a menthol and chocolate edge that plays an almost equal role to the strong red-raspberry fruit. Some oak tannins on the finish indicate short-term aging. Try in 2001.
Name: Rosenblum 1997 Hendry Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: A tight and tannic mountain Zin, wrapped in plenty of toasty, mentholly French oak. Determined swirling reveals nuances of chocolate and blackberry, but this is one Zin that needs aging. Try in 2002.
Name: Château Potelle 1997 V.G.S. Zinfandel (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe blackberry and raspberry fruit is tinged with vanilla oak. A straightforward, easy-drinking wine, best paired with burgers or other simple fare.
Name: Wild Horse 1997 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Sweet-sour cherry aromas are an interesting introduction. On the light side, with substantial tartness, it still offers varietally correct fruit and constitutes a good quaff at a realistic price.
Name: Rosenblum NV Vintners Cuvée Millenium Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hot and spicy, with only a modicum of berry fruit and some chocolate shadings. Nice creamy mouthfeel.
Name: Rosenblum 1997 Alegria Vyd Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Pleasant, light cherry-berry aromas are joined on the palate by a touch of creamy vanilla oak. A touch of cranberry-like acidity brings some tartness to the finish.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 1997 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: The promising nose offers up plenty of jammy red-berry fruit and cinnamon spice. On the palate, it turns a bit flat and one-dimensional, ending with a cranberryish tinge.
Designation: Francis Coppola Diamond Series Red Label
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 1997 Francis Coppola Diamond Series Red Label Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A touch of Viognier ignites a pretty, seductive nose with spicy fruit and cocoa, as well as raspberry and mineral notes. As it unfolds the wine displays enormous complexity, with tart currant and cranberry fruit leading into a tight, sharp, brightly etched finish. It's one of the rare Zins that can stake a legitimate claim to tasting of terroir.
Name: Storybook Mountain 1997 Eastern Exposures Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A briary, full-throttle wine with a ripe, appealing nose. Plenty of bright, forward fruit; strawberry preserves and raspberry jam pleasantly mingled with cocoa and toast. Wonderful spicy highlights of cinnamon and allspice. This one is really something, with exceptionally jammy fruit, great balance, and alcohol (13.8%) right where it should be.
Name: M. Cosentino 1997 The Zin Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A really solid Zin with plenty of individuality, but also superb varietal correctness. Supple and intense, it's the full ride. Fabulous layered fruit, clean oak and a sublime finish give this the versatility to augment anything from pizza to filet mignon. An unexpected find and really an excellent wine from this Napa label, which almost always succeeds.
Name: Grgich Hills 1996 Zinfandel (Sonoma)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: De Loach really nailed it in '97. It's hard to pick a favorite from among the five “Ranch” Zins, but this big (15.5% alcohol), effusive wine is as good as any. Blackberry fruit explodes from the glass, with lots of vanilla from the American oak. Ripe, round, plummy and aromatic, with fine balance through the finish, which registers just slightly hot.
Name: De Loach 1997 Pelletti Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Young, forward and fruity, with the expensive smell of toasty oak. The nose seduces you with cedar- box (hence the name?), spice and lead-pencil aromas, and the bright, intense raspberry fruit underneath more than supports the heavy barrel treatment.
Name: M. Cosentino 1998 Cigar Zin Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: One of the best of the single-ranch wines from De Loach, the Saitone's nose exhibits a lot of coffee and smoke aromas. The mouthfeel is fat, meaty and rich. Bright and edgy, with good acids and a long, sharp finish. A well-made and complex wine.
Name: De Loach 1997 Saitone Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Bogle blends grapes from 30-year-old Amador vines, 60-year-old Lodi vines, and 80-year-old Oakley vineyards to produce a truly great wine for the price. A briary, raisiny nose leads into succulent flavors of plum, allspice, cocoa and   coffee. It's a brawny, rustic wine that is immensely likeable despite some rough tannins.
Name: Bogle 1997 Old Vine Cuvée Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This just flat-out smells like Dry Creek fruit, with lots of bold raspberry scents. Bright fruit, tart, lipsmacking berry flavors, good color and extraction. Tight, young and lovely.
Name: Deux Amis 1997 Rued Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a new wine for Dry Creek, the product of an ambitious program that aims to re-create the classic flavors of old-vine Zin by grafting traditional old clones onto new rootstock. The hoped-for flavors are all there: dried fruits, tobacco, coffee, plums, cinnamon and toast. A real knock-out for the price.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 1997 Heritage Clone Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This perennial winner features 16.1% alcohol and showcases ripe, rich black-cherry and plum fruit, with lots of smoky oak. Its appealing open, round structure leads into a big finish with gobs of fat, flavorful oak that carries on for a long, long time. This one can handle the alcohol.
Name: St. Francis 1997 Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a field blend that includes about 5% Petite Sirah. Classic flavors of black cherry, pie cherry and blackberry, balanced acids, soft tannins, and some peppery spice. There's a whiff of earth or barnyard, just enough to add interest.
Name: Buehler 1997 Estate Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Here is a beautifully focused wine with compact, complex fruit, accented with spice and pepper. Plums and tobacco commingle in a balanced palate that improves right through the finish without falling prey to late-harvest, overripe flavors.
Name: Peachy Canyon 1997 Dusi Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This always seems to be one of Kent Rosenblum's successes. Soft, round, full, fleshy and fat, it's a fabulous blend of blueberry and blackberry spiced up with cracked pepper. The beautifully balanced blend includes 15% Carignane and 7% Petite Sirah.
Name: Rosenblum 1997 Annette's Reserve Rhodes Viney Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spice, cherries, fat, coffee and toast fill the nose. Beautiful depth and balance. Fat and fleshy on the palate, rich and full through the finish, with plenty of cherry, coffee and toast flavors. Has the depth and power to improve over time.
Name: Sebastiani 1997 Old Vines Domenici Vyd Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A lot of pepper and a whiff of the barnyard accent a good, spicy wine with firm structure and tart acids. The tannins are still a little on the rough side, and the finish is a tad short.
Name: De Loach 1997 Gambogi Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A spicy, zinny nose showing lots of delicious fruit. Fermented with wild yeasts and aged in 100% American oak, it's an appealing, delicious wine for this price. The flavors linger through a satisfying finish, and it doesn't hit that tannic wall that stops so many of the '97s.
Name: Windsor 1997 Old Vines Wild Thing Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Gary Farrell continues his masterful touch with Zinfandel. Rich, ripe red-raspberry and dark-chocolate aromas dance an elegant duet. Turns the pretty trick of being ultraflavorful without being heavy or overextracted.
Name: Gary Farrell 1997 Old Vine Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spice, cherries, fat, coffee and toast fill the nose. Beautiful depth and balance. Fat and fleshy on the palate, rich and full through the finish, with plenty of cherry, coffee and toast flavors. Has the depth and power to improve over time.
Name: Sebastiani 1997 Domenici Vyd Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Twelve percent Petite Sirah adds weight and black-fruit flavors to this forward, juicy, tart wine. The tannic finish should soften with a little more time in bottle.
Name: Preston 1997 Old Vines/Old Clones Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A rich, ripe, lip-smacking, classically flavored Zin with gobs of fruit—all berries, cherries and plums. Full, ripe and round, and perfectly set off against soft tannins. It seduces you into sip after sip.
Name: Kenwood 1997 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is the first vintage of this exciting, racy wine. Focused, very spicy, with intense strawberry/raspberry fruit accented with vanilla and toast from American oak. Hints of stone and mineral open into rich, earthy accents. Concentrated through the long finish, it's not too tannic and just tart enough to balance the heat.
Name: Karly 1997 Buck's Ten Point Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Mountain-grown grapes bring elements of mineral and earth into play, neatly laced into the precise, black-cherry fruit. Really a lovely nose; seductive and textured. Lively and spicy on the palate, with a chalky, tannic finish.
Name: Storybook Mountain 1997 Mayacamas Range Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The high alcohol (16.1%) indicates ripe, port-like fruit. Raisins and plums fill out a gamy, fat, seriously oaky monster. This is not food-friendly; it's really more of an after-dinner, Friday-night kind of wine. But if you like your Zinfandel over the top in all respects, this is your bottle.
Name: St. Francis 1997 Pagani Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: The nose promises raspberry fruit and a hint of spice. The wine tastes of strawberry preserves and fresh-ground pepper. Soft tannins, moderate acids and refreshingly low alcohol keep it in perfect proportion through a surprisingly long and concentrated finish.
Name: Beaulieu Vineyard 1997 Coastal Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Soft, spicy, cherry-berry fruit. Lots of pretty fruits and earth. Good acidity keeps it in focus. Finished with a light touch.
Name: De Loach 1997 Barbieri Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Spicy, sweet fruit with nice vanilla accents and an underlying tannic, leafy flavor. Whole-cluster fermentation in part gives it a flavor boost upfront. This is marred only by a hot finish, which is a problem with many of the '97s.
Name: Rosenblum 1997 Richard Sauret Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Here's an appealing, youthful, bright, effusive nose, with a mix of red and black and even tropical fruits. Nice toasty coffee notes frame it, and the acids and tannins balance out the high (15.4%) alcohol.
Name: Geyser Peak 1997 Winemaker's Selection Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big, nicely focused wine with a roasty-toasty nose that sends up scents of smoke, coffee and roasted nuts. Lots of chocolate, cherries, preserves and ripe raspberry jam fill out the palate.
Name: Pezzi King 1997 SLR Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a lesser-known bottling from this superstar producer. Dark purple/black with classic spicy, intense fruit. Not too jammy; winemaker Joel Peterson gets the essence of the fruit without turning it into raspberry/blackberry preserves. It sits on the palate and sings for a long time.
Name: Ravenswood 1997 Lodi Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Forward raspberry fruit highlights an immediately likable, quaffable Zin. There's a little too much heat (alcohol) in the finish, which comes off feeling a bit thin.
Name: Rosenblum 1997 Rust Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full-throttle Zinfandel, with spicy fruit, soft tannins, toasty, smoky flavors, and a soft finish filled with cherries.
Name: Renwood 1997 D'Agostini Bros Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Mushroom scents, tight, briary fruit; compact and a bit closed. Good juice, with solid core of fruit across the middle and a balanced, even finish. Opens up nicely with air time.
Name: RustRidge 1997 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Almost black, with dark-cherry and spicy-berry fruit. Briary, brambly and medium-bodied. The blend includes 8% Petite Sirah. It's made from riper blocks of the five vineyard designates.
Name: De Loach 1997 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Gorgeous, iridescent, purple-black wine. Black-cherry fruit, smooth and satiny, with ripe-not overripe-fruit.
Name: Kunde 1997 Shaw Vineyard Century Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Starts off with a complex nose of brush, berries and some chocolaty oak notes. Medium-bodied on the palate, it turns slightly bitter on the finish. May improve with a year or two of age.
Name: Gary Farrell 1997 Bradford Mountain Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Milk chocolate and berries mingle in a smooth, very appealing wine. A little whiff of vinegar in the nose. Lightweight finish and slightly hot.
Name: Pezzi King 1997 Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Black-currant fruit (from the 20% Petite Sirah in the blend) highlights a meaty, toasty nose. Roasted walnuts, coffee and slightly burnt (but delicious) flavors in a balanced, lingering wine that begs for grilled meats.
Name: Karly 1997 Warrior Fires Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Time's Fun When You're Having Flies! says the label on this easy-to-like Zin. Roasty, smoky, earthy nose, with nice ripe fruit in the center. Ready to rock right now.
Name: Frog's Leap 1997 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The flavors are almost moving into late-harvest; raisiny, superripe, hot and tannic. On the plus side is the finish, with sweet, juicy, jammy fruit that is really tasty. From 77-year-old vines.
Name: Sonora 1997 Story Vyd Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Clean raspberry fruit, licorice and violets. It's light and elegant in style, but tasty, especially at this price. Lovely Zinfandel to serve with food.
Name: Stevenot 1997 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Well priced, with cherry/ raspberry fruit, hints of chocolate, white pepper and spice. A soft, round, cocoa-tinged Zinfandel that provides pleasant drinking with no rough edges. Very approachable and smooth.
Name: Van Asperen 1996 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Here are big flavors showcasing lots of spicy, peppery, berry and cherry fruit. Enhanced by the saignée process, which drew off 15% of the free-run juice prior to fermentation. As a result it comes out of the bottle ready to rock 'n' roll.
Name: Montevina 1997 Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blend of Zinfandel (89%), Petite Sirah (7%) and Grenache (4%), with blueberry, blackberry, black-cherry and plum flavors, good structure, moderate tannins, balance across the palate and a generous middle. Short finish.
Name: Kunde 1997 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: True to its terroir, this is filled with bright red-raspberry fruit. Quite tart, and a bit light and simple for a single-vineyard offering from this producer.
Name: Gary Farrell 1997 Maple Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A smooth, tannic, spicy, sharp, alcoholic wine, with lean cranberry fruit.
Name: Sobon Estate 1997 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A fine, full-throttle front fails to follow through in the middle and finish. Spicy berry fruit lacks complexity. Good to quaff.
Name: Peachy Canyon 1997 Especial Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: 95-year-old vines produced this dark, inky, tannic wine made in the old style. Blueberries, vanilla and spice, with lots of depth and power. Good juice unimpeded by oak.
Name: Sonora 1997 TC Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Good, full-flavored, round, fruity and very appealing. This wine shows real touch and polish. Easy to drink, with a lot of immediate appeal. Not a big wine, but a very drinkable and flavorful Zinfandel with true-blue berry flavors and some hay in the nose.
Name: Kenwood 1997 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Zinny and briary, with some nice dark, tarry streaks. A bit hot, but flavorful.
Name: Louis M. Martini 1996 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hot and alcoholic in the nose, with ripe fruit flavors, it's thick and jammy through the middle. The elevated alcohol level obliterates any subtleties that might have been there.
Name: Peachy Canyon 1997 Eastside Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Good grapey, cherry-flavored fruit. The fleshy middle gives way to a hot, briary finish.
Name: Summit Lake 1996 Howell Mountain Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is all middle. Nice enough, but it would work best as part of a complete blend. On its own it's fruity and simple.
Name: Peachy Canyon 1997 Lakeview Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Jammy and pumped to the brim with black-cherry fruit, it starts out kind of clunky but then straightens itself out. Fairly rich and fun to drink, it's a little on the hefty side, but with personality. Plenty of sweet oak on the finish, perhaps too much.
Name: Pedroncelli 1997 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's a pleasingly sweet and toasty nose, but rough, chalky tannins kill the finish.
Name: Pedroncelli 1996 Pedroni-Bushnell Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Blueberry, blackberry, straw, hay and pepper. A nice full-bodied attack leads into a tight, green, rough finish. Needs a lot of time to soften up.
Name: Renwood 1996 Grandmere Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A ripe, alcoholic nose, with port-like, raisiny fruit. It seems a little sharp and thin on the palate at this point of its development, with alcohol and tannins overriding the fruit.
Name: Kenwood 1997 Jack London Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Soft, with pleasing vanilla scents. It's easy-going and fruity, with a peppery finish that is fairly short and a little on the tough side. The wine isn't big enough to support this much tannin.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 1997 Clockspring Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is tough, chewy Zinfandel; fruity and one-dimensional, with overripe, port-like flavors.
Name: Norman 1997 The Monster Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A simple, fruity wine with some spritzy, plummy fruit.
Name: Taft Street 1997 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A toasty nose overwhelms you with coffee and chocolate, but the fruit can't keep up with the oak. Tart, tannic, bitter and leafy.
Name: Murphy-Goode 1997 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A forward, fruity nose and a spritziness in the mouth. It's light and fresh-tasting, but the grapes could be anything.
Name: Parducci 1997 Vineyard Select Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A tart, spicy, very dry, tannic, slightly grapey wine.
Name: Kempton Clark 1997 Lopez Ranch Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Fine complex nose mixes spice, briar, pie cherry, coffee and barnyard. Flavors are pleasant, with plummy fruit, but overall the wine doesn't have much depth or power. Finishes tannic and a little bitter.
Name: Hendry 1997 Block 7 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plum, pepper, cinnamon and clove on the nose make for an interesting spicy start. But the fruit flavors are candied.
Name: Peterson 1997 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Light raspberry fruit leads into a simple and clean wine without much character.
Name: Ballentine 1997 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Raisiny, overripe nose, with some earthy, dirty scents. Sour cherry and cranberry flavors and chalky tannins; a sour, not very pleasant finish.
Name: Kempton Clark 1997 Mad Zin Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A light, simple, fruity wine with a bit of white pepper to liven it up.
Name: Elizabeth 1997 Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: Raisiny, caramelized, burnt-sugar scents. Flavors are short, tannic and burnt.
Name: Clos du Val 1997 Palisade Vyd Zinfandel (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A rich, low-acid mouthfeel is accompanied by bland, unfocused flavors. Hard to believe claims that Primitivo and Zinfandel are identical based on this wine.
Name: Sobon Estate 1997 Primitivo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This hand-punched Zin is a real treat. Packed with lush brambly flavor, it's a wine to enjoy now. Aging in some American oak barrels has imparted an obvious sweet vanilla note, one that works well with the hefty body of the wine. With 14% Petite Sirah, this is a classy but rustic wine; unfined and unfiltered.
Name: Keegan 1996 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Paul Draper continues to label this bottling without a varietal designation—as he has since 1993—despite this vintage's 80% Zinfandel. A dark, briary wine, this has plenty of everything you want in a Zin: berry fruit, mild acidity and a decent lashing of oak. Purely delicious, and Ridge's best Lytton Springs of the past five years.
Name: Ridge 1997 Lytton Springs Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine explodes on the palate with big berry fruit, peppery spices, chocolate-vanilla oak, and some warmth from the elevated alcohol level (labeled at 15.5%). The finish goes on and on, with layers of flavors steadily unfolding on the tongue. Could well be the best Eberle Zin to date.
Name: Eberle 1997 Sauret Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Raspberry-blackberry jam with a kick. The high glycerine and alcohol levels in this wine, combined with the massive fruit extract, make it seem almost sweet, despite its modest 0.5% residual sugar. Drink now and over the next couple of years.
Name: Ridge 1997 Dusi Ranch-Late Picked Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich and deep, with layers of fruit and spice complexity. Finishes long, unfolding all the while. There are some dusty tannins, but they're fine-grained and easy to warm up to. From vines planted in 1878.
Name: Rosenblum 1996 Continente Vineyard Old Old Vi Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite high-toned raspberry fruit, with enough volatile acidity to give the nose a lift without being considered a flaw. Explosive fruit, with spice shadings. The finish could be longer, but we're quibbling here. A good value, too.
Name: Rosenblum 1997 Continente Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: There's plenty of bright raspberry fruit here, and a creamy-vanilla-oak mouthfeel that shows the care and effort put into the vinification of this wine. The finish is smooth and supple, showing off some nice cinnamon notes.
Name: Lolonis 1996 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: There's plenty of bright raspberry fruit here, and a creamy-vanilla-oak mouthfeel that shows the care and effort put into the vinification of this wine. The finish is smooth and supple, showing off some nice cinnamon notes.
Name: Lolonis 1996 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: With all the heavy hitting going on in the land of Zin, you might not expect much out of a $13 bottle from a big producer. But this is Beringer. Here's a light and elegant red that spent 16 months in oak. It's a really good everyday wine; very soft and pleasant with clean, spicy fruit. Easy-going and supple. Great for light pasta dishes or grilled tuna steaks. Best Buy.
Name: Beringer 1996 Zinfandel (North Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An easy-drinking Zin that provides a good introduction to the Paul Draper style. There's a dollop of toasty oak that somehow resembles maple syrup, plenty of berry fruit, and just enough structure to prevent the whole package from being fat or heavy. Although it lacks the complexity or concentration of Ridge's single-vineyard bottlings, it's very good in its own right.
Name: Ridge 1997 Sonoma Station Zinfandel (Sonoma)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Less layered and complex than Gary Eberle's effort from the Sauret Vineyard, this offering shows plenty of jammy raspberry aromas and a fair amount of chocolaty oak. The oak becomes more apparent in the mouth and on the finish.
Name: Eberle 1997 Steinbeck Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: There's plenty of smoky, toasty oak here, coupled with some nice berryish fruit. Full and glycerin-laden, creamy and rich in the mouth with chocolate nuances, but it's as if the extract is as much from the oak as the fruit.
Name: Gallo of Sonoma 1996 Chiotti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earth and smoke cover the solid nose on this full, tannic, well-oaked wine that bears similarities in body and mouthfeel to a Cabernet. Spicy and peppery, the core of fruit is very much there. May actually soften over time, but most won't age it. Very competent mainstream wine, but a suggestion: lose the plastic cork seal. Best Buy.
Name: Gallo of Sonoma 1996 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Tight, reticent aromas are a hallmark of this claret-style Zin. Eventually, some raspberry and minty/stemmy aromas poke through. Some dried spices appear on the palate and finish. A restrained, reined-in expression of Zinfandel.
Name: Steele 1997 Pacini Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Despite only a moderately saturated color, there are plenty of bright "zinberry"aromas. The mouthfeel, though, is relatively light. Still, a pretty, almost Pinot-like, Zin for early drinking.
Name: Armida 1996 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Quite a bit of wet autumn in the nose as well as some chocolate and toasted marshmallow. Fairly closed, acidic and one-dimensional. Rough going down because of the amped-up acidity. Some raspberry fruit, but overall not terribly pleasing.
Name: Topolos 1997 Piner Heights Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
